text: I did a guest drop in class because I am visiting and my home studio is in Texas.  The staff (front desk) and trainers were very friendly and I had a great workout on my vacation!  I definitely recommend this location! They made me feel welcomed!

The location of this gym gets 5 stars. The dirty locker rooms that never have paper towels, or even toilet paper, are disgusting. It is hotter than heck in here all of the time. Treadmills have salt on them from people wearing their shoes in. I love to people watch here, but while I love to lift weights, those are a mess too! Either we need to require members to pick up after themselves, or get a cleaning crew on staff. Come on, planet fitness does better than this!

Pros: 24 hours entry, new equipment, dumbbells up to 150lbs, and plenty of parking. 

Cons: 
-Waaaay too overcrowded at peak times. I'm not one to take group classes, but the rooms always seem overpacked with people 
-The place is run by children. They're all very young, and professionalism is minimal at best. I don't even scan in when I go because nobody is paying attention, and I am rarely greeted upon entry. Usually the kids are huddled around joking with one another, playing on their cell phones, or playing on the computer. 
-Next to the gym is a pizza place, a donut shop, etc. I worry that the temptation of the junk food is a lot to handle for some people, and I feel bad that they have to walk in/out of the gym with temptation surrounding them. 
-Not enough mirrors. The power racks are facing blank walls, so I can't watch my form effectively or efficiently. 
-High pressure sales for PT. Signing up for a membership was easy enough, but their PT salesmen are very aggressive. I went in for an assessment, and it was nothing more than an hour-long sales pitch. I wasn't impressed with the training staff. I'd watch them take people through sessions while I did cardio, and it seemed like everyone was getting the same workouts: TRX squats, ball slams, and ropes. I'm not paying for that, and I pity anyone who fell prey to their high-pressure sales tactics.

This place is awesome for a beginner gym. Tons of machines for every part of your body and tons of cardio equipment ranging from ellipticals, treadmills, arc trainers and stair masters. They have rooms designed for specific workouts and access to free trainers to show you workouts to do. All of that for 10 bucks?! How could you beat that? And it's opened 24 hours. And for 20 bucks a month you can get the black card which will let you bring a friend anytime and also use massages beds and tanning beds. It's an awesome deal. The place is clean and the bathrooms and locker rooms are maintained. 

Now the staff is amazing and is what kept me coming back. They are all extremely inviting and welcoming every time I come in and actually care about you and your fitness. If you live in the area and need a gym, I would definitely recommend.  This place is managed very well and has everything a beginner needs to get in shape.
Best workout ever. I see a noticeable difference on my body. Great trainers, awesome music, plenty of classes. ...worth every penny

I am really excited about this place! I had my intro meeting on Monday 4/1 with Wes where he spend about 45 minutes showing me around, explaining how their classes work, etc. He broke it down and made it less intimidating to go to a new gym. I signed up for the 1 month trial membership and have already used it 2x! These work outs are HARD. Especially for a newbie, but I love the pace, it is new everyday, they have two options lean and cross fit. This is nice because it always gives options. The people are not rude, always help you out, the others that go there are welcoming as you're in and out in ONE HOUR!! They have a beautifully designed yoga room, clean bathrooms, showers, and an area for your kiddos to hang out while you work out. I hope this becomes a new lifestyle for me. So far so good!

Vacations are a time of decadence. That is, until you can't zip up your pants anymore.

During my time in New Orleans I ate (in no particular order) tater tots, veggie burgers, spicy tofu, multiple bowls of pho, cookies, vegan s'mores, a box of mini Nutter Butters, pizza, multiple Chinese food episodes and HALF A BAG OF VEGAN MARSHMALLOWS. This does not include the 20,000+ caloriies in booze I poured down my  gullet, and any drunk food binges that I do not remember.

The point is without Anytime Fitness I would have really, really not been able to zip up my pants; vs. the actual situation where I was just uncomfortable in them. 

You get a free 2 week guest pass if you pay the $30 for the FOB, which may seem a little steep, but they make up for it with their convenience and the fact that it is clean and un-crowded. Thanks for helping be a little less gluttonous!

Love this gym! This location has Great staff, it's a friendly environment, and the property is always clean and tidy. A very welcoming place, and plays great music. If you're looking for a gym, this is the place to go!

Why 4 stars?  Because this gym is awesome!!

   ---   ---   ---

Powerhouse was already a pretty good sized gym when I started there, but after its recent expansion, it is now ENORMOUS!  

I had no complaints about Powerhouse, but I did recently leave the gym after over 2 years of being a member.  I went to Harbour Island Athletic Club because of a group discount program that I was offered.  I have a feeling I will return to Powerhouse one day though, because I thoroughly enjoyed my time there.

All of the equipment is in great shape and mostly kept up nicely.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  There is a kitchen/smoothie shop inside to make it impossible to avoid eating healthy.  There is a giant staircase in the middle of the gym, representing the famous Santa Monica stairs in California.  There are many other features that you can check out on their website, but I never did the group workouts or classes so I can't say much about them.

Jeff Trager aka The Knot Doctor has an office located in the back of the gym, which a huge bonus for me because I have been going to him for years now.  Jeff is the man for any kind of injury that could possibly require a standard or deep tissue massage.  He is ART (Active Release Technique) certified and is the team therapist for the Yankees when they are in town for spring training or playing the Rays.  I recommend him to everyone that has any physical ailment, because he has fixed several problems for me over the years.

If you live or work in the Downtown/Channelside/Ybor/South Tampa area, I highly recommend Powerhouse Gym.

SPLASH!!!!

Who wants to go swimming?  This place is super-duper fun!  

I visited the Monon Center for a friend's birthday celebration and found myself pleasantly surprised.  The center has several large pools, water slides, a lazy river, climbing wall, and more.  There is also a concession stand with reasonably priced snacks and treats available.  

My friend rented one of the on-site cabanas which run around $49 on weekdays and $79 on weekends for the 8x8 size.  Trust me when I say that it's a worthwhile investment.  The cabanas offer shaded seating, locked storage, and allow you to bring in your own food.  

I'm not a huge swimming pool fan (am I the only one who HATES swimsuit shopping?), but I will definitely be back at the Monon Center soon.  The water slides and lazy river are fun for kids and adults alike.  The lazy river offers some much needed relaxation, and the more adventurous members of your party are sure to enjoy the wave rider.  Just don't wipe out.  I WILL laugh at you, LOL.  This is a great outing for families or for an adult-only fun day.  There's truly something for everyone.  

Surf's up!

I love this club!  It has indoor and outdoor weights, and a plethora of cardio machines with individual monitors. There are cross-training small group classes, yoga, pilates, dance and even boxing. I like using the cross-training rooms when they aren't having class.

The Gym itself is fine, but the managers are horrible.  I was disrespected by the manager who basically scolded me like a child for walking into the womens locker room to lock my stuff.  but since he was cleaning, it was a huge problem and spoke down to me in a way that did not sit well with me.  His energy is horrible and cocky.  then, i cancelled my membership because I moved away.  I called and cancelled it in early august.  then I was wrongly charged not once but twice.  once in august and another time in september.  I called, they told me to have my stepfather come in august to sign for me and that I wouldnt ever be charged again, which was a complete lie because as I stated above, they charged me again in late sept.  I called, and the manager literally tried to yell at me and school me on "how cancellations work".   I have worked in gyms for years, im a yoga teacher for Equinox so i dont need to be schooled on gym memberships.  He proceeded to yell and call me by a nickname that isnt even my name.  once again, he is disrespectful, ignorant, and doesnt know how to speak to members or customers.  How does this guy even have a job? the customer service is horrible. All to not give a member $10.70 back? so ridiculous.

We went to the spa for a couples package. We were in separate rooms but that was fine. We both had the 50 minute massage with hand and foot rejuvenation. It was heaven and well worth the price. Make a reservation.

I'm officially obsessed. I joined this gym a few weeks ago after trying them out during Yelp's In It to Thin It. My old gym (Weston Fitness, see review update) had lost it's luster and began charging extra for my favourite class, so we parted ways after 2 years of having a really good thing going. It felt serious.

Anyways, I never think about Weston anymore because Unite has totally swept me off my feet. The class format keeps things moving and helps you challenge yourself in manageable increments. I'm still sore after every class and constantly looking for more time in my schedule where I can squeeze in another class here and there. I can't get enough. I've done classes with Bill and Juliet and they are both incredible. I always end up dripping sweat and I'm not much of a sweaty person so that really takes a lot of effort for me. They are positive and motivational and great teachers.

Can't speak to the locker facilities much because I always go home beforehand to change and then go back home afterward, but they have lockers available with locks so I don't have to schlep my padlock anymore. Love that.

Beautiful, clean facilities. Full size baseball court. 25m pool. Racquetball and squash. Heck there are places to this gym that I'm still discovering.  If you don't mind the cost and enjoy all of the amenities, this place is definitely worth it!

I do love this gym for being affordable and also catering to all the various worlds of fitness. Some days you want to lift like Arnold, other days you want to hit the heavy bag like Tyson. You can do that here. World's truly collide, with the power lifting curl bros, with their Beats by Dre headphones and muscle tanks, standing across the Crossfit bros, hitting deadlifts in yoga pants and Reebok trainers. Interesting sight to behold for agnostics like me that don't subscribe to one Bible of fitness.  My only issues are the overall cleanliness and the lack of space.  Again, this is a very affordable gym, but just remember, you get what you pay for.

Very friendly and helpful staff that keeps machines and equipment clean. It's quiet here and I enjoy going. I get in and get out with ease. Malfunctioning machines are fixed fairly quickly. There are tons of treadmills and a variety of equipment and it's never been crowded when I go.

My favorite spa in NOLA. I followed Debbie here a few years ago and have never looked back. Cathy usually does my facials and I love every minute of it. I leave feeling amazing. My skin loves this place as much as I do!!!

I booked a private party at this studio as a birthday celebration and it was so much fun. Beverly, the studio manager, helped me to coordinate an afrobeat/hip dance class as the theme for the evening, and everything turned out great! Lehla, one of their dance instructors, taught the class and incorporated some zumba moves as well as some African popular and traditional dance steps. Plus, the music was poppin! They were able to incorporate my song requests too! 

It was a workout (and pretty much nonstop), but it looked like my friends enjoyed themselves, and of course, I loved it! The moves were a good balance of challenging and basic, and I really felt liked I burned calories. It was quite a lot for over an hour of class, and we got there a little late (parking, ugh), which wound up cutting off about 15 minutes of dance instruction. Even still, it was a full, high-intensity class. That said, my dance theme was customized. I don't know if anyone else is as crazy as me to do the same kind of dance for a party, but just a word of warning, if you do, that it was intense. It wasn't a situation where breaks weren't allowed though and the atmosphere was relaxed.

A tip to be sure to bring water. I unfortunately did not bring enough for me and my friends, and there was no access to any there. Also, the studio is one floor, and this location wasn't very large. We had about 8 people and it was a good amount of space for us to spread out, but I'm sure it'd be a wee bit tight for larger groups. We also brought a little spread of fruit, cheeses and drinks (you can bring wine or champagne). It worked out great. I would just make sure if you bring snacks for a party that they are compact, since there isn't much space. We used the studio close to closing time, which meant we had to pack all the food up quickly.

This is a pretty good outdoor event space. They have a covered pavilion, basketball courts, pool, playground and much more. 

We were hosting a bbq/party for our organization and this space was ideal. The PSC assigned us two employees, Evan and Rick to assist us and see to anything we might need. 

We brought our own food, drinks, music and grilles and they provided the space.
Friendly staff, well appointed facility, and a very good value for the money. Recommend.

I'm obsessed with this workout. I am certain that sticking to this plan will allow me to see results that I would not get if I just went to the gym on my own. 
I am also impressed with the staff at the Ironworks location because they have been extremely responsive to my questions or concerns. They are very prompt in returning phone calls, texts, or emails and always have a reasonable answer. 
Some of the pros with this workout include: 
- the heart monitor tracking board allows you to see how you are doing in realtime and track your heart rate and "splat" points
- every day is completely different and it is very well organized 
- I feel that this is really a total body workout
- You personalize and run your workout depending on your effort level
A few cons:
- It can be a little crowded in there with about 30 people. I wish the space were just a teensy bit larger.
- The treadmills go FAST, so get there early if you want to get your run done first.
- I would not classify it as "personal training" as it is advertised. I feel that all the trainers I have been trained and I trust their instruction. They are also always there if I have a question or concern. But, it is more group fitness than personal training.
- It also has a fairy hefty cost, but I feel that it is worth it considering the type of workout.

So, overall I'm a happy OTF'er and hope you enjoy it too! There are also decent locker rooms for post-workout shower, which is important to me since I try to do the early classes before work. Just make sure you bring your own towel!

I do not enjoy any aspect of going to the gym. I don't feel a sense of accomplishment after sweating from a jog on the tread mill. That's not me, and that's okay because Planet Fitness has members of all shapes and sizes and fitness levels. My favorite part is that there isn't that weird, musky gym smell. The place is clean, and super organized. There's tons of thread mills, and ellipticals, and strange machines I have no idea how to use. Not to mention tanning booths. 

I joined while they had their promo going which only cost me $1 to join and the monthly fee is $10. If you're home visiting from college or are even here for a couple weeks it's totally worth joining since it's considerably cheaper than most gym's guest passes. If you live you're life on a crazy schedule, this place is for you. It's open 24/7 Monday-Friday and has decent hours on the weekends. 

There's a strict no grunting policy which I love. I just don't understand how grunting "rawwrwww" or "uuuhhhhg" will help anyone lift more weight but what do I know, I hate going to the gym! The best part is the lunk alarm. Every so often someone drops a weight which in itself can be embarrassing. At Planet Fitness an alarm sounds. So if you find yourself dropping a weight, just take a bow because you'll have a whole audience gawking at you.

As far as gyms go, it's all right with a lot more cardio machines than weights but I think that's the with a lot of places and I'm a visitor but my friend said the price he pays here are very easy on the wallet. I got a pretty good sweat in the weight area and am surprised to see all the amenities here: childcare, a lot of fitness class rooms, pool, lots of lockers and even a coffee station. With all they have going on and available it's an unpleasant surprise that their showers had nothing but ICE COLD water. 

I left soggy, cold and unwashed, definitely not something I want to be for too long after a workout.

This location has a great workout area, but the men's locker room and restroom smell so bad I'm surprised it isn't deemed a health hazard.  Carpet in a locker room?  That is completely stupid.  Worse since this location doesn't seem to shampoo often.  I normally go to the Southport location.  They may have carpet, but it never smells like the Greenwood gym.  Today, the stench was so bad it made its way into the workout area.  I hate to drive the extra distance, but I need to be able to breathe when I workout.  My rating is based on comparing to other LA Fitness locations around Indy and in Waukegan, IL.  This one is the only bad one I have experienced.

I haven't used the gym but I did tour it. It seems like a "health club" type of place where you pay for the amenitities. Being that I work for the hospital you would think we would get a decent monthly rate, well, you'd be wrong. I can pretty much go to any other gym in the area for less...I mean do you real care if there is a tv in the mirror? No thanks. 

However, the smoothie bar is awesome!

I started here in September and during much of the time the pool and sauna had been under renovation with no discounts given to members. 
But what really leaves a sour taste in your mouth is if you sign up for a physical trainer, let's say for six months or a year, which is what their contracts run. Your suppose to remember to cancel your membership in five months so as not to incur an xtra mont of fee, because at the end they don't remind you, your contracts up, rather the extend it month to month automatically, without any notification to remind you of this consequence. There for you always pay for that xtra month, just sucks.

I was a multi-site member of Idaho Athletic Club from 2008 to January 2017, when the clubs were sold to Crunch Fitness.  There are promises of new equipment and renovations.  Currently, has the appearance of a club in rapid decline. Each day, there are fewer pieces of "working" equipment available.  For years, the Eagle club was pristine under Jody's care, but Jody is gone. The women's locker room is closed for 45 minutes daily for cleaning, but after the "cleaning" time trash cans are overflowing and the bathroom are remains trashed.  I plan to load before and after "cleaning" pictures of a toilet area.  The management provides toilet tissue that shreds as it leaves the dispenser, thus the TP pieces on the floor. There is no sanitary disposal bin in this stall.
Why do I continue with Crunch?  I have an excellent Personal Trainer who I work with twice a week for many years.
I used to attend and recommend the Water Aerobics classes to clients with weight, orthopedic, and arthritis issues, but it appears Crunch has abandoned this program.
I am not giving up yet, but am progressively losing my optimism. 
So my advise: buyer beware.

This place is fantastic! I've always been a lifter and more into bodybuilding exercises but this has been a game changer for my endurance and my overall physique. It's making cardio fun and is actually extremely challenging when it comes to the weight training. I am very impressed!

I wanted to take swimming lessons in a friendly, adult-supported atmosphere without break I ng the bank. The ymca was a good choice. The staff has been friendly and professional and the swimming instructors have been not short of stellar! 
This has been one of the best choices and wisest money spent!

I'm disappointed that I had to pay $10 for a guest pass to work out with a friend (since I live out of state) who is a member. This gym is huge and has great equipment. I would love to come back while I'm in town over holidays but it's not worth $10 for an hour workout when a monthly membership is only $10/$20ish.

You can have no dominion greater or less than that over yourself."
- Leonardo da Vinci

Confession 1: I woke up one day with "back tits" and "clapping thighs!!!Sshhhh don't you dare judge! Not every girl has discovered Victoria's Secret for a the perfect body with a pretty face you know! So stop rolling your eye unless you got that magic brush to give me that PERFECT BODY!

Confeesion 2: It is NOT "All About That Bass"! 

Solution:  I decided to take responsibility for my own fitness, and It wasn't hard to find out that Unite Fitness is the way to go. I went there yesterday and it only took few minutes to know about the center, few minutes and I purchased a 10 pack package as a start. Liz was very helpful and friendly, she is one of the coachs as well. She explained how this awesome guided cross-training works:
- The workout is not too complicated, a combination of cardio( 30 min), strength(30 min) and stretching(15 min). 75 minutes  and your( and my) guts to get the job done.
- Classes has limited spots and reservations are required via an app and subject to availability.
- $10 fee for no show or late cancellations, as you are taking somebody's else spot. 
- Personal coaching & an intense boot camp are available. 
- Towels are available for $1.

As a first time client, I was eligible for one free trial workout in the group cross-training program, and I took it with Evan, even though I already bought my package yesterday. 
Here is my brief observations:
- Evan was awesome, and very patient with my newly discovered "workout dyslexia!"
- The space is clean and well-maintained.
- Yoga mats and weights ( of course) are provided.
- ALL coaches are HOT! I mean REALLY REALLY HOT! 


- I want to give a shoutout to Kelsey for being very very friendly and wonderful.

I think I'm going to start an obsession here. 

Five Yelps and I better get those back tits down or else!

This is without a doubt the gyms I've tried. It's a small, down-to-earth place with a friendly staff, and the clientele are women of all shapes, sizes, ages and fitness levels. The windows are tinted, which eliminates the feeling of being on display. The prices are the best I've seen, and the hours are way more convenient than Curves. I almost hate to recommend the place because I'd hate for it to get crowded, but seriously, this is a great gym.

This gym has almost anything you'll need - a whole section of cardio machines like the stairmasters, skiing machine, treadmills, etc, pull ups bar, tons of weights machine and dumbbells. The swimming pool looks great, and the restaurant has amazing sandwiches. Oh, and it's open 24/7. Steal. 

Though I must say that the peak hours at the gym is pretty frustrating, which happens in every gym I'm sure. Weekdays 5pm-7pm is usually pretty busy with the younger crowds, Fridays is not bad at all after 5pm most of the time, and for weekends, late morning is busy with most elderly members.

They have finally increased the size of the parking lot, kudos to that! Overall it is a decent gym, not modern or brand new like LA Fitness etc, the price of the membership is decent for the facilities they offer. 

The only bad thing I'd comment would be the certain crowd of people that may be annoying and loud at times, there are still people under the age of 18 using the gym, which is very inconvenient (staffs need to keep an eye for these people) and the weights machines are not being maintained sometimes.

Dropped in during the week of thanksgiving 17' and felt right at home with the 7a. Olivia, Jay and Tony are all knowledgeable personable and easy to jive with coaches. Coming from Colorado, even a "cooler" week the box was humid and warm with the garage doors open but makes for a true CF experience. 
The training floor itself is very open with plenty of areas to do various movements without bumping into another mate. The equipment was in rougher shape compared to other boxes but the humidity and weather take a toll on metal equipment. 
Overall, this box has an awesome community feel with a wide variety of class offerings throughout the day. Plus the location is easy to reach from all over St. Pete 
Thanks for a fun drop-in week and the Burg Crossfit tee to rep in Colorado!!
Great place to bring kids to. Has a splash pad, playground, eating area, nature trail and fishing grounds. Definitely recommend this place to parents.
Great staff, clean facility and great price. Even if you just want a break from the outside world, this place will do it if you are a gay or bisexual man. The jacuzzi is relaxing

The gym space is large and nice looking.  At first the locker room seems nice.  But once you step in to the sauna, toilet or shower area, you are in for a disgusting experience.  

The sauna floor is uneven and there is a hole that is covered by a rubber mat.  There are slats missing on the seats such that you can see the absolute filth that is on the floor under the seats.  Exposed nail heads add to the appearance.  It often smells in there so badly.  

The toilet and sink area is always gross.  It smells from lack of ventilation and there seems to always be toilet paper and paper towels strewn all about the floor.  The sinks are often clogged and the sink counter is always wet.  

Then we have the showers.  Drain flies.   There are dead flies stuck to the ceiling and often a few live ones around.  The filth that these pigs leave in the shower area is sometimes there for a few days- empty soap wrappers, paper towels, etc. 

It's rare to be in the sauna when there is not some self-centered, ill-mannered fool blasting his music, doing exercises in your face or, believe it or not, talking on his phone at the top of his lungs.  No class.  And, of course, no rules are enforced by stuff because the staff doesn't seem to care about the experience.  

Seriously there are a few a-holes who answer their phones while in the shower and talk at the top of their lungs.   Call me crazy, but I think the sauna and the shower should be pretty relaxing places and not places where I am subject to the idiotic conversations of self-centered low class guys.

Please join me in calling the Montgomery County Board of Health if you experience filth.  The staff there is aware and does not respond.

Regarding 2945 W Ina Rd Tucson/AZ
The assistant SHELLY is the RUDEST aggressive talker you can ever meet .. I dont know how Banner hired her !!! she's unprofessional person that deserves to be FIRED. 

Shes really lucky to be the assistant of Dr.Andrea Badilla as shes an AMAZING Doctor !!!

I went in to this gym to find out more about memberships and prices. The girl who was at the counter seemed aloof.  I asked her about pricing and she rambled off a monthly fee but did not explain if there are contracts or anything.  I ended up asking a few questions and leaving.  She did not offer a tour or explain anything...pretty disappointed.

For college students this place is for you. Im 22 and i have the $20 a month membership. This place has lots of equipment. You can get a full workout in, and its never over crowded. Better than a lot of the gyms I've been to and the price is right. plenty of Tv's so you can have something to focus on while you run. If you are on a budget I would recommend this place. I used to be a member at the JCC, but they only cater to the needs of families and Seniors. This place caters to all. So give it a try for a couple months and see how you like it.
P.S. They have free pizza on the first of every month. how could you pass that up. lol

I am losing the love here for sure! 5 treadmills have been out of service for over a month so now, all the cardio equipment is over crowded from people using the other stuff since treadmills are down! Ridiculous that it is taking so long to fix this! Also, I am getting bored with all the steroid kings screwing up all the weight machines. They take all the pieces off the machines to use them for purposes they were not intended for and when I want to use the circuit machines, I have to go searching for the handles and clips!! Annoying!! It would be nice if the employees could do this throughout their shift, but they are too busy eating or playing on their phones to notice! This place needs an overhaul!!!!

I've been a member of Club Fitness since November and the great prices left me questioning the quality of this gym. I have to say I am very impressed!

This location is indeed a bit hidden away but can still be fairly packed during the after-work rush on weekdays. But I've never had to wait for a treadmill. The staff is great, especially Jenni - I've done my free once-a-month training sessions with her and can't complain. 

It's a small location but the equipment is all brand new, in great shape and the facilities are excellent. The locker room is always clean and odor free, the showers are nice and large with closing doors - not curtains - which is great. The clientele is a good mix of age, race, fitness ability and size. I never feel out of place here.

My only complaints are that they don't provide towels and they use some high-pressure sales techniques in getting you to join the first time you step in the gym. Sure, they offer a free x-amount-of-days trial but the prices are higher if you wait to join after that trial.

Went to many classes at this facility and it is super dependent on your instructor. However I've only had a positive experience and good class with one instructor (Shannon) who is no longer there. Went to hot yoga with Jocelyn which was supposed to be an all levels class but was definitely for intermediate and above. BEWARE of all levels classes- that's not true at this studio- opt for community yoga If you're a nubie. Moving studios after friends I referred has terrible experiences. I expect much better from a teaching environment. Will be trying out the new place in fountain square, fingers crossed its better than city yoga. I think we should be encouraging our fellow yogis, not making them feel stupid for taking an all levels class that's actually intermediate level.

If you're looking for an all-out rock-out sweat-it-out workout on Wednesday nights, you have to check out Eric and Corrie's Zumba class at either 4:15 or 6:45 pm. Great energy! Bring LOTS of water, coz you're gonna need it!!!!

7 months later, still coming back for more! Jeff has become my favorite trainer. He has awesome music and he adds some humor into the workouts to keep it entertaining. Ryan is awesome too but I find it a little harder to keep up in his classes; probably not a bad thing though because he's always pushing everyone to the next level!

This gym will nickel and dime you every chance they get. I was a member for a year but had to cancel once I moved away and even though I cancelled well before my last month, I was still billed for an additional month, another annual price lock fee as well as a cancellation fee. I was also randomly billed another $100 for which they was "a glitch". It doesn't help that the billing manager Taylor is unfriendly. She claims these we're all things that were told to us when we signed up.

They also sold us in getting a certain membership in which we could bring unlimited guests all year, well they stopped the guest policy a few weeks Into our membership and no longer honored the terms of their contact. 

Unfortunately it's a nice clean gym despite how they take advantage of their customers with dishonest ads and contracts. If you can find a different place to go I would avoid this place.
Worst communication and waiting two months for promises to be fulfilled by management. Billing nightmare.

I couldn't even get as far as the sales pitch. 
Any business that isn't up front about pricing isn't worth my time. I shouldn't have to fill out a questionnaire and talk to a salesperson before being able to see pricing. 
I need to know 3 things. What's the initiation fee?
What's the per month price? How much will it cost to cancel if I'm not enjoying my experience?

I don't need the used car/timeshare sales pitch. 
It's a gym. I can see the equipment from the door. 
It looks clean enough. Your hours are convenient. 
Let's cut to the chase.
Thankful for Planet Fitness. Generally enough machines where I don't have to wait to get on one... except the Smith Machines. Need more of them. Like the price and proximity to my work.

Horrible, overcrowded gym run by a bunch of kids who have no idea what their doing. Manager, Theo?, is never in and doesn't solve problems in a timely, professional manner. Don't be fooled by their predatory business practices.

Still upset about the overall ridiculous experience with the personal trainer there. So unprofessional and over a year later the knee I injured following the exercises he assigned still gives me problems.

I Love this place!  It is the cleanest water park I have ever been to.  The lounge chairs are very nice and very comfortable.  Life jackets are provided.  There is a gated water area for toddlers.  Having this area blocked off is a great idea.  There is a snack bar on the property but I saw others with small coolers.  Admission is $8 for adults and $5 for children.  You can stay all day.  I am not sure about passes out.  The lazy river and water slides were alot of fun.  It's a great place for parents to interact with their children.  Can't wait to go again!

Been a long time member. The place was nice when I started, but has gone downhill. The machines are showing their age and the electronics frequently do not work. (Can't get parts is the standard reply).
I originally wanted to join because of the pool. They had good "open swim" times that worked for my schedule. About 1 1/2 years ago they started a Master Swim program that locked out the regulars 4 mornings a week. They also do not enforce the "no children" rule when the pool is open to members. 
Top that off with their extremely high dues and the place is no longer for me.

FILTHY!!! In the extreme. Shower stalls slimy from mold/mildew, floors slick, dark stains between grout. Looks as if it has NEVER been cleaned with anything other than a dirty mop. 
Whirlpool constantly full of dirty dark foam and the area surrounding it is very dirty. I have to keep up on my personal hygiene after visiting so as not to catch skin diseases. 
A dirty hole of a place. 
AVOID at all costs!!!

Good clean gym but the staff is not as friendly 
I have been a few times in the last couple of weeks and can honestly say I have never felt welcomed. Now maybe there were having a bad day. 
I feel they need some work on customer service

Love this place. We originally went her to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary 5 years ago & it was wonderful then. Unfortunately we haven't made it back to NOLA until now. It was the first place we went to. The steaks were cooked to perfection. I had the ribeye & my husband had the NY strip. We shared garlic mashed potatoes, they were yummy. At the end we shared the gooey chocolate cake. My husband doesn't really eat sweets, but he had his fair share.

Attending this place as a man is quite an experience. I was humbled by the workout, it's like Pilates on steroids. I thought since the class was only 40min it was blow by, I was so wrong. It's a little pricey for me, but I recommend it to anyone who can afford a luxury kick butt workout!

Why come here?

1) $16 dollars a month ($10 to start IRC)
Most gyms have monthly plans from $40-60. Other than an extra fee a few months into it, this is the most economical gym membership you can get. Technically, the USF gym is cheaper but I m not enrolling in class again there just for the gym lol.

I''ll be honest. I've tried other gyms close by like the old Gold Gym in City Plaza or Lifestyle Gym on Amberly (That one changes identities more than most folks change clothes. IIRC it's Captain Crunch now?). The problem with those places was lack of cardiovascular  machines. A lot of people would socialize there and hog the machines. Lame. (Also my wallet was stolen there many years ago and they were very apathetic and unhelpful in retrieving it)

2) Youfit has a boatload of treadmills,stationary bikes,ellipticals, and steppers. It's rare that one would ever have to wait for one. 
As you enter , there are cardiovascular machines on the left , weight machines in the middle, and "free weights" on the right. There is a group exercise room towards the left side that has been added in the time that I've joined(I haven't taken any classes there so I cant comment on them. Melony R's review goes into detail)

3) Another thing I like is that there are multiple hand towels/sanitizer stations around. I've only used the bathrooms a handful of times but they were mostly clean when I did. 

4) This is purely subjective, but as a comic book fan, I love the purple/green motif inside. Joker, Green Goblin, and Devastator would LOVE it here!
5) They are open during many national holidays (at reduced hours) 

Since this branch is close to USF, its mostly populated by a diverse crowd. . Regular or bigger folks attend without worry about feeling out of place with stylish soccer moms like those aforementioned gyms. 

The only negatives would probably be the parking lot. It is shared with a Hertz rental place and MD oriental market. I have had a hubcap stolen while working out once (Jokes on them. It was a plastic Walmart one)
While its not dangerous, I would use caution at night.

Overall, whether youre hardcore or softcore, its a great place to work out.
Terrible customer service. No compromise even when I'm only asking them to meet me halfway based on the front desk not communicating. I would encourage users to seek another gym.

Out of all the different trampoline parks I've been to, this is definitely in the lower half. It's really small, there are not very many different types of trampolines, your tricks are limited the basics (ie no double flips, gainers, or triples) they closed the main trampoline while I was there to vacuum it, so I paid to sit there because there no other open trampolines. Really disappoint and not worth the $11 for 1 hour.

I've been a client of Alaris Fitness off and on for a few years. Kristiana has consistently delivered great workouts, whether in a group class or one-on-one personal training, and I've also been impressed with the quality of coaches she hires to work with her at Alaris.  Workouts are always tough but safe, and she can roll with whatever physical limitations or injuries you bring in the door ... she's a stickler for good form, especially with the kettlebells, and you can please leave your ego at the door. This is a welcoming environment where you'll get a GREAT workout, alone or in a group ... lots of smiling and laughing, but also grunting and sweating, and sore muscles the following day to let you know you really did some solid work !! Alaris has all the friendly good vibes and community spirit of a great CrossFit style gym, with much smaller classes and individual attention, and really solid common-sense smart programming. I love it here.

I have tried many types of workouts- Bootcamp, Cross Fit, you name it, I've done it but Fit Buddha is by far my favorite workout!  If you want results quickly, this is the place for you. I tried out an Axxess special for unlimited mega former classes and after just one class, I was hooked! I was so surprised by how quickly I saw results. The studio is beautifully decorated and clean. I took a class with almost every instructor and they're all outstanding. The music is upbeat and fun. The classes are challenging and fast paced and the instructors are always able to assist clients of all fitness levels. The environment is extremely positive and inspiring. I highly recommend Fit Buddha to anyone looking to improve their fitness and transform their body. Fit Buddha is the best!

The Pivirotto Wellness Center is my favorite break in the middle of a work day. I go there to row, ride a stationary bike, fight osteoporosis by lifting weights, and in general take a breather from my day by breaking a sweat. Membership is very reasonable ($18/month) but is limited to UA Health Network/north UA campus employees and family members. However, the cool thing is that family members of inpatients staying at the hospital are eligible to purchase a temporary membership. In addition to the exercise equipment, the staff offers personal training and body composition analysis, among other services. I always appreciate it when a staff member gives me a tip on my form or on a new exercise they think I may enjoy or benefit from.
Dropped in for class while visiting from CA. Such a welcoming crew and fantastic facility. Will be back!

This is a big, well-equipped place, never seems to be crowded, with a lot of classes. I've taken the spin classes from most of their instructors and I like them all.

Workout area seems very clean.  Staff is friendly but the fingerprint identification check-in procedure is a pain since it only works about half the time, at least for me.

I like the club.  No frills but all you need to stay in shape.

Its a great gym, for a great price. Management is very responsive to suggestions. Clean. Great workouts. The classes are excellent as people have previously mentioned. However, they are so excellent that they are difficult to get into. There is an online sign up system that makes it easy, but sign up opens 24 hours before and the class is usually full 30 min after sign up starts. Then a dance occurs where you are constantly checking the website waiting for a spot to open up. Usually I can get a spot, but it is just a little annoying. I can't think of a better system though, other than to add more classes. Which they have been doing. 

Furthermore, another suggestion I have is to bring the billing in-house. It is frustrating to go into the gym with a question about the billing on your account, only to be directed to call Arizona and wait on hold. The management says that they are working on it, but it is understandably difficult.

This is probably the review I am most excited about to date. OTF has sincerely changed my life for the better. I have been a member of so many gyms, and unfortunately I never utilized them the way I should have. It has always been hard for me to stick with it because I wouldn't see results. I decided to give this a chance and it was the best decision I have ever made! The classes are 45 minutes to an hour long and with the absolute most supportive coaches you can imagine. They will show you what to do, correct you if need be, and help you get the results you want! You wear a monitor that breaks down your workout and what you did so you are never left questioning it. The proof is RIGHT there. I have never felt out of place, if anything I feel like I belong here more than any other establishment I have been. Coach Nina, Sherilyn, Foley, Micayla, Murphy.... All of them are so supportive and push you in the best way. I cant say how many times I have cried after class so happy that they believed in me and pushed me in the best way possible. The business is so clean, and even the front desk ladies are wonderful. (Especially Abby.) I couldn't be happier. Thank you, OTF!

Brand spanking new gym (opened less than a year), lots of machines, clean and no judgment - what's there not to like about this gym?  There's also ample parking right outside and high ceilings, which I love!  The ladies' room is clean and there are showers and freeing areas, as well as a TV monitor for entertainment.  The Black Card Soa is wonderful, especially the hydro massage chairs - so soothing for my tired muscles after workouts.  It's a great gym and meets my needs. 

Ok, it's not perfect but this is a much better option for a newbie like me!  (I am still ruminating about my review for another gym, a "local" gym, that I did not care for, but that's another post)

Started going to the gym to help and motivate my son, and we were at another gym.  This is important because I did not know how to work any of the typical gym equipment, other than the treadmill.  But I wanted so much to try out the other machines!  Unfortunately, the gym goers at that other gym were, in my opinion, gym regulars and hard core gym goers who would give me funny looks when I fumbled with the equipment.  Then my husband started going here, shortly after it opened, and he told me I should try it.  One of the best suggestions he's ever given me!  :) 

So my son and I started coming here and after a couple visits, I got memberships for both of us and haven't looked back!  There are so many machines to choose from and if you don't know how to use a certain machine, no one is staring at you while you try to figure it out or someone will help you out!  By the way, the PF app can help with this.  As a side note - if I really can't figure out how to use a certain machine, I ask for help or wait until my husband can show me.  This is important because this is how machines break!  So if you can't figure it out, please walk away and leave the machine alone.  While there are lots of treadmills, stair climbers, etc., there area some machines of which there is just one of its kind, and once it's broken, there isn't another one available. 

Then there are the people who never wipe down the machines they use!  With flu season upon us, and the sweat and germs that others leave on the machines, one would think that people would want to wipe down the machines after they use it.  But no, that is not the case at all.  The majority of people just walk away without a second thought.  Absolutely disgusting! 

Last thing I'll mention is this - why would there be empty paper towel dispensers ever?  I've gone to the gym all hours - early morning, afternoon, night and late night - and many of those times, the paper towel dispensers are empty.  And it's not just in one area, it would be empty in at least two stations.  Perhaps the staff should make it a point to walk around during and after busy times to check?  Just a  suggestion, but the lack of paper towels just encourages people not to wipe the equipment down.  

Despite the little things that annoy me, I still give this place 5 stars because besides it being new and clean, I am also comfortable here and that makes a world of a difference!

I used to go to this gym but discontinued my membership for another gym. At $10 a month, this is definitely the lowest priced gym I have ever heard of. If you plan on using just the basics, and are not looking for extra frills, this gym is a good choice for you. During the week, this gym is 24/7 which is a major bonus.

PF has rows of cardio equippment facing a row of TVs which is nice to view while running or cycling. They have some weight circuits and the typical run-of-the mill gym equipment. I have heard a lot of guys complain that they do not carry enough weights ( I wouldnt know). They do not offer any classes, which I did not like. I've heard many stories about people having their belongings stolen from the locker rooms, so keep all your valuables in the car.

If youre looking for a quick workout without any extra perks, I would recommend PF to you.

Love this place so much ! Did toddler time on Thursdays and it is such a deal ! Staff is amazing, mature young people. Especially like Hunter, Calvin, Dylan and Rachåel the manager ! You will love it !

This is exactly the gym I was looking for. I've tried both Spectrum and 24 Hour Fitness. Neither have the right equipment for someone that knows their way around a gym and wants to do more than just stand on an elliptical for 20 minutes a day. 

I've been powerlifting and advanced lifting for years, and finally I've found a gym in downtown Santa Barbara that has all the right equipment. Plus, the facility is clean and organized. Memberships are fairly reasonably priced and there is no commitment or cancellation fee (big plus!).

My first time playing " Escape the room" and it was so fun. However, I feel like you have to go with the right people because if you go with people who are easily distracted, I don't know if you will ever make it out of the room. 

Friday evening, some friends invited me to go and have some fun. We were a group of 6 so we did not have to join  another group. For all of us it was a new experience and to be honest we did not know what to expect.

As soon as we arrived they put us together and explain to us the rules. Rules that we have to follow in order not to "cheat". They also explained to us where can we look for clues but they are very careful to not give any clues away. The room we got into was called "Christmas room". I googled this room and I fount out that 95% of the people can get out of this room in 15 min. Well we were the other 5% because even that we got out just on time (almost an hour) we couldn't find any clues on time. 

The hardest part is basically finding the first clue, after that you kind of have to follow the instructions in order to escape the room. It was an awesome experiences and I will definitely be back maybe with my fiancé and friends.
My daughter is so happy and looks forward to coming every Wednesday. Very clean but no where to sit and be comfortable while you wait. The staff is very friendly.

Gabriela, Alyssa and General Manager Savannah all failed to follow policy. I came in with the request of a 5 day trial pass as I had read online and the manager was only willing to provide me as an exception a one day pass and charge the additional days.

I loved this YMCA. It is the best in Nashville! I use to be one of the early birds that got there when the doors first open and it's still dark outside. That's the perfect time. The place isn't crowded, I always find a machine, the parking is great AND the people are super friendly (staff and other people working out). This place definitely gets me motivated!

My favorite gym in Tampa and I have sampled several!  The classes are well structured, fun, and a good mix of people to laugh with.  Thank you Chris Gonzalez, for your continued energy and wit.  New York in the house!

I love that I never know what's coming next- it's so easy to do something for 90 seconds and then switch it up as opposed to knowing you have 30 minutes of the same old thing! No way would I ever use my treadmill at home the way I use them at OTF.

We come here to self-maintain!! We come by weeknights and weekend afternoons.

It's awesome seeing other members so pumped and focused on their own thing throughout  the sections of the gym. We see families mainly in pairs cheering each other on. Even though there are less equipment than other locations everything is spaced out and it feels more homey in general. 

Members are polite in asking if you are done with equipment and some will even be friendly enough to let you know how much beefier you are getting.

The staff is great with communication. From day 1 we emailed back and forth about location specifics and promotions. The trainer that we signed up with was great and was not aggressive in trying to sell personal training sessions and things of that nature. We have even asked about other nearby gyms that specialized in other types of training, and the manager was nice enough to give ideas. The office area has the local homeopathic magazines which I like to take home for reading. 

The gym is also well ventilated, fairly clean, and all emergency necessities are easily spotted. There has been recent renovations made to better accommodate floor based workouts. 

We appreciate the convenience of the location and how relieved we are to unwind here after a hard workday!

This location is pretty cool. Lots of space and machines. Cardio is all upstairs which is nice. The locker room could be a little bigger considering the gym size. Typical LA FITNESS gym with a pool sauna and hot tub, the things I care about most. I'll be using this location while I'm in town for the holidays.

Idiots. They told me they would call transport but didn't and the rude guard asked me to leave. Talk about wanting to change hospitals bad now. Why one days take him up then he guard jump on me was uncalled for. Avoid this joke of a hospital.

Just like everybody else says the cancellation process is difficult in order for afc to leech as much money out of you as possible. You have to give them 60 DAYS NOTICE if you want to cancel. You can't call them up and cancel they need a certified letter so you have to go to the post office to cancel. They are the comcast of gyms. You've been warned.

Best gym I have found in Idaho. Started with Idaho athletic club and all they do is screw you in every which way possible. Staff here is super friendly and there when you need them. Just like any other gym they have there challenges but this gym is super clean always kept nice and tidy. Showers were recently re done and the locker room doesn't smell horrible, the weights and machines and all up to date and nothing to old.  Pool is nice as well as the sauna and spa. 

I can see why you pay a little more here cause of the equipment and cleanness that this place offers. I come late in the evenings after work, it's rare that I have to wait for a machine or a bench to use.

Since the second I Stepped into this gym on a guest pass with a friend I was hooked.  I immediately quit my former gym and joined the sporting club.

The staff here are cool, the office people are chill, the desk girls are nice and helpful, the cafe people are nice, and the cleaning ladies are sweet to me always saying hello and asking how I am.  I've never used the personal trainers here as I've been scarred by my past trainer but they seem nice and not intimidating.  

The locker rooms are great there are always plenty of free lockers and plenty of clean towels.  One thing that irritates me is that women here often leave their wet towels all over the place and leave the locker doors just wide open after they've left.  If you're a grown woman you know how to just put your towel in the bin and close your door do you really not have the extra two seconds?

Anyways the locker room connects to dressing rooms where they have deodorant, hairspray, and hair styling tools with big mirrors and individual vanities.  Then there are showers and bathrooms, they really think of everything here with disposable razors, shampoo, shaving Creme, shower caps, and body wash.  They also have a bathing suit dryer and little bags for your swimsuits.  

There is a jacuzzi but I don't use it since I've seen ladies go in there naked and I have a thing about germs.  Then there are sauna and steam rooms.  Then there is a lap pool that is coed in the back.

The second floor they have racquetball courts And a basketball court which I don't use.  The third floor is the fitness floor where they have the class rooms and the fitness floor.  There are always plenty of Cardio machines they have everything you could want.  The weight stuff looks like there is alot I don't use that stuff because i don't have a trainer anymore but it looks new?

Then there is a track above that which i have run on and it doesn't get crowded so it's cool.

I love this gym so much I'm gonna be sad to leave it when I move away.

Worst customer service ever! I called to speak to a lady named Dana about transfering my membership from Sparks to Reno. She said she'd get back to me and never did......it's been almost 2 months.....and because they haven't changed it I can't workout, so I'm paying a monthly fee when I cant even use the gym I'm paying for. I've called corporate and emailed them and they don't get back to you as well. I called the sparks gym where I originally signed up to get them to transfer it and they "don't know how"... how hard is it to go in a computer and change the city of your membership. If it wasnt for the $10 price I'd go else where but even the cheap price isn't worth the poor customer service they give. I wouldn't refer them to anyone
Great gym if you're looking to straight workout with a variety of top equipment. This isn't the group class spot or the eye candy spot.  It's a solid local gym with everything you need.

I am new to CrossFit, and have been doing it now for about 3 months.  My experience has been fantastic.  My wife has done CrossFit on and off for several years as we have moved around.  Upon moving to STL, my wife looked at the CrossFit gyms near us and joined CrossFit Ballwin.

I had been hesitant to join CrossFit for a number of reasons.  Among them, I have a back injury.  The idea of lifting weights or using barbells did not appeal to me whatsoever.  Also, I cannot stand the meathead/Bro environment.  After 5 or 6 months of my wife going to CrossFit Ballwin, and talking to me about it at home, I decided that I'd give it a try.  Also, my existing workout program seemed to be losing its effectiveness.  I'm over 40.  My body is changing, my metabolism is changing, my joints are aging, and so on.  So, I decided to try a change.

From the very start, what they tell us is "Listen to your body" and "Focus on your form first".  This is exactly the thing I wanted to hear.  They spend a lot of time focusing on your form, with little or no weight, which is the intelligent thing to do.  

The facility itself is clean, well appointed, and in a convenient part of town.

The coaches are excellent.  Trent, the owner, is very experienced, extremely knowledgeable, and encouraging.  And he has a great staff of coaches with a diverse set of backgrounds and education.  The value is in the variety.  People learn differently, and they all have different approaches, analogies, demonstrations, and motivational and educational techniques.

The results I have seen in myself, even after just 3 months, are extremely motivating.  I am not "an athlete" per se.  My objective is to live a long, healthy life.  I want to have a strong core that helps with my back problems.  I want to have good cardiovascular health.  I want to have the flexibility and mobility to keep up with my kids.  I am getting more than my money's worth in this area.

The thing that probably keeps me going back as much as anything, however, are the other people who attend.  We range in ages and sizes and ability levels from one end of the spectrum to the other.  But there are ZERO egos. There is nothing but encouragement, and good energy.  People smile at each other.  People want to see each other succeed.  And everyone knows, when you start CrossFit, it doesn't matter who you are, you start at the beginning.  The level of support and positivity I have experienced have truly been exceptional.  

If you are looking to improve your health, improve your quality of life, and have a good time doing it, you should come.  Joining CrossFit Ballwin has been one of the best things I have done for myself and my family in a long, long time.

(to the tune of T. Swift's classic, "22")

It feels like the perfect place to don some leggings
and destroy our hamstrings (uh uh, uh uh)
It feels like the perfect place to wake up with the sun
and to get our spin on (uh uh, uh uh)

Yeah.... we're sweaty, drenched, and energized at the same time 
It's miserable and magical
oh yeah.... BodyCycle's the place where we forget about the outside
It's time

Uh oh.
I don't know about you
But I'm feeling sweaty, WOO
Everything will be alright 
If you just stay on your bike! 
You don't know about me
And isn't that the best thing
Everything will be alright 
If we just stay on our bikes getting
Sweaty WOO (ooh ooh)
Sweaty WOO! (ooh ooh)

So, I'll go ahead and say that this is NOT my number one favorite spin studio, but it is a fairly close second. Super convenient location (for me), love their generosity with the towels, and the space is pretty fantastic. Sometimes during the daytime hours (read: suns out, guns out) the lighting is a little brighter than is ideal for my "perfect" spin class (I love a dark studio, music bumping). They've got a skylight that allows a lotta natural light (but hey, some folks are into that!) ClassPass gives me three classes a month, and while I rarely use them all, I feel super lucky that I've got em! Lots of class times, and hype instructors.

The people are great. It is always very clean and the equipment is alway in good repair. I've never found anything to complain about  with the only exception being that the weight area is to small and sometimes in the morning it seems crowded. However they are expanding so I will be excited to see if they make more room for weights
This gym is legit. I struggle with back problems so the pool is a plus! The staff is very supportive and understanding as well as accommodating.

After going back to flywheel from trying other spinning studios i can definitely upgrade this to 5 stars. It is a little bit too commercial but you get an INTENSE work out and the instructors really do push you to your max. They have parts during the class where they rank you against others in the class and for me that made me push harder because i was trying to beat the person infront of me. Seeing your name up on the scoreboard is pretty cool and gives you a sense of achievement at the end especially if you beat your personal best. They also keep track of your performance online after each class which is neat! If you want to sweat it out and have an amazing work out definitely go here. Love the upper body workouts they have incorporated in the routine! Yes i will be back!!

Definitely not my favorite LA Fitness location, but it's the closest location to my office and on my way home. I don't feel super great about my vehicle being left in the parking lot and like to be aware of my surroundings when I'm walking in & out. I've also had some issues with male gym-goers wanting to be a little chattier than I'd like, which I haven't experienced at other locations around Indy.

In regards to the facility itself, the equipment is in decent shape and there's plenty to choose from. I like that there's plenty of room around the machines so you don't feel crammed in next to your neighbor (ahem, I'm looking at YOU, Glendale). I can't speak to the classes, as I haven't taken any at this location yet.

I prefer the Fishers LA Fitness, but this location is convenient. It's not horrible, just...meh.
Awesome atmosphere, great coaches,  and a community of people who are like an extended family. The variety of workouts are always challenging but able to be scaled for any fitness level.

I have lived a pretty sedentary lifestyle during law school, so I was very nervous about attending a HIIT class (full body workout), but I was very impressed with Shred 415. The staff, particularly the manager Sara(h), was incredibly welcoming and helpful. Lydia, our trainer, had a ton of energy and enthusiasm and helped push me without being pushy. The facilities are excellent and very clean. The class is pretty intense - similar to a brief experience I had with Orange Theory. You do multiple rounds of running on the treadmill and strength/core workouts. You can go at your own pace and no one judges you, which I really appreciated. The energy of the class helped push me through, even when I was certain I was going to pass out or throw up. Definitely will come back.

This location is great.   It seems to be kept up and maintained.  This is a bigger LA Fitness and can handle the larger crowds.  It gets too busy around 5 to get most stuff done during Mondays and Tuesdays, but later or earlier times are not  a problem.

Lots of classes and a very clean locker room.

My only complaint would be for LA Fitness to enforce members to wipe off machines and benches like other gyms I have joined.  They have antibacterial cleaner and paper towels for everyone to use, but I never see anyone using them.  In fact, when you do go to wipe down machines prior to another person using it, people often look at you weird.  Anyway, that is the only complaint to what is a great gym in the neighborhood.

I have started taking the cardio kickboxing classes taught by the co-owner heather. She, her husband Rick, and their daughter are all always so nice and helpful. Heather also teaches Zumba classes with a $5 drop in! You can't beat that price! But the cardio kickboxing is by far my favorite. Its 45 minutes and every class I feel stronger. Every 2 weeks you weigh in and get measured, and they also help with nutrition advice. The only reason I give 4 stars is for no late or Saturday classes. But who knows maybe more people find out how amazing this place is and that will change!

This review is for Providence Town Center location and mistakenly entered here.
The place is all you really would expect from a  mega conglomerate big box store. Clean, well organized.  My big complaint is the lousy music. All they ever play is girly dance garbage. Anyone here ever heard of rock and roll???? I know most members come in all wired on their own music and oblivious to their surroundings, but give the rest of us a break and play some decent music!

I've just completed my 6 week challenge and I feel AMAZING!!!!! If you are ready to make a lifestyle change, this is the place for you. 
The coaches are friendly and helpful. They help you do everything correct. They also modify moves to help you. Shot out to Justin!!! He's the best one!!!! Though I love the rest of you guys. 
There is a meal plan that will get you where you want to be. Yes, you may get tired of eating the same foods, I know that I did. If you work the plan, you will see results!!! I promise that. 
I lost 8 pounds and gained muscle. I feel comfortable with lifting weights. I love going to the gym now. The routines are fun. And time moves fast there. My self confidence is high. I feel better about myself. My stomach is getting flatter. My thighs are getting firmer. My arms are getting toned. 
That being said. I participated in a challenge. You will have to put money up front. This is to show you're serious about the change. Yes, the gym membership is expensive, but worth it. The personalized attention from the coaches is worth the price. Most of all, we are a family there. You don't have to feel like you don't belong or feel intimidated at the gym. It's a loving and open place. I made friends there. If you need a sign to change your life, this is your sign. Sign up. What's the worse thing that can happen???

The only thing bad about this place I can say is that they don't have a sauna and every afternoon it is packed in here. Other than that the staff is wonderful everything is always clean. The temperature is always turn down in the gym area. I love coming here because it's close to my home and I can bring my kids. As far as I know this is the only YMCA within the Indianapolis area that has a special program for veterans.

I absolutely love this sh!t. Going to the gym sounds like a total nightmare to me, but I actually enjoy going here. While it costs more than I want to pay, I am willing to happily pay because of how much I enjoy the classes. I usually feel absolutely wrecked after, but that's what I need. 

I'd recommend this to any of my friends. The team is so friendly and nice. I usually sign up for classes with Coach Oscar or Coach Andy and I really enjoy them. I'll continue going here for a long time!

This gym has become my home away from home. The trainer, Matt Haley, is seriously the best in Reno. He knows how to put you on the right track for achieving your goals, no matter what they may be, but be prepared to work! You get every penny of what you pay for with him as a trainer.  You will leave knowing that every time you workout with Matt you are one step closer to being in the best shape you can possibly be in. The gym itself is clean and really well taken care of.  Andrew Pointer, the owner, takes pride in the state of the art equipment and maintaining a fun, safe environment for members to work out in.  All of the members wipe down the machines when they are done using them and, if you are in there every day like I am, you get to know the other members and can feel free to ask anyone for advice on how to use something if you don't know how.  Sarah has recently started hosting a live Zumba class on Thursday nights and it is a great way to make some new friends and have so much fun that it doesn't even feel like you are burning the major calories that you are. This is a judgement-free gym that offers encouragement and motivation to members.  You never have to wait to use equipment and being able to come anytime makes it easy to fit into any schedule.
I've been calling for months to cancel my membership,still no luck.. next step is to switch my bank account

This is a nice gym and I come here mostly for convenience because it is close to my home. The staff is all extremely friendly and the classes are great. There is plenty of equipment as well. The only downside is this gym is in an older building so it can get a bit warm but overall it has everything I'm looking for. You can check out the Irsay YMCA if you're looking for something a bit more modern.

Love this place. The staff is friendly and the cyclestars (instructors) are great. I love the energy that each cyclestar brings to the classes. The energy and the music keeps you going and wanting to come back!!!  I also like that this place provides shoes and water bottles and has special activities after class, like iced coffee, beer, etc. I'm hooked!!

This gym is big but it's incredibly hot inside. I start sweating as soon as I walk in. There is a sign claiming the temp is at 68 but it honestly feels like 80. They even cover it so you can't see what the actual temperature is. Huge red flag for lack of transparency. It's so hot that going in the winter, you can't even see inside. There is so much steam and perspiration on the windows. The fans are for cardio only and there is no air circulation in the weight room. It's so hot in there I always feel I'm on the verge of passing out. The water machine are also luke warm to hot. I was reading through reviews and I don't appreciate the manager's snarky replies to them. It's a serious concern how hot it gets in the gym, especially because right now it is winter. I can't imagine the temperature it could get to in the summer. Aside from this, there should really be more racks in the weight room. It's the only gym I know of with one rack. I won't be coming back to this one until they get their priorities straight and lower the temperature and put WORKING fans in all areas. The gym in 1st is much nicer.

I came back to increase the rating. This gym is ok but the air situation needs to be resolved before someone has a serious health situation.

I just joined over the weekend. My first two class I noticed my abs got tighter and I felt I had energy the next day. It's a motivating class you work all your body parts. Never worked  arms it fells great to feel the burn. Your body will get results and you feel great.

Horrible place. The facilities are okay, but they try their best to lock you into contracts. They advertise "no contracts," then once you get there, they sell you a contract that they say you can cancel at any time. Then to top things off, they start billing your credit card every two weeks and when you try to cancel, they tell you that you have to give them 90 days notice before the billing stops.  Horrible place.

Trent is an amazing trainer that concentrates heavily on proper form because the last thing he wants are his clients to be injured. His workouts are above and beyond and will leave you feeling like you can do anything!
Orange Theory at Liberty Place is an awesome workout. Classes are challenging but fun and addictive. Highly recommended.

One stop shop for me and it's only five minutes down the road. I have a personal trainer and my chiropractor both on premises! Very, very professional. The owners are great people as are the staff. And they're constantly having fun events to attend. Never seen a fitness facility like this. It's a joy!

One of the selling points to coming to Chuze is the cleanliness of the gym, but there is no hand sanitizers like other gyms and they are ALWAYS out of paper towels to wipe down the equipment before and after every use. Sounds a Public Health issue with the bodily fluids on the equipment and unable to sanitize. I asked the front for a hand towel and she said they don't have any. I left because I can't workout not thinking about what bodily fluids were left on the equipment or how many people used it before they do their cleaning sweep.

I can't quite get a handle on this SWEAT location... Having initially visited the Fitler Square spot, and gradually started adding in trips to the Center City location, I finally head over to Old City a few times for some group classes. I felt a little unsure of which door to enter, having gone to Brazen Boxing (which is on the THIRD floor of the same set of stairs) a few times, but didn't take long to figure it out. 

The set up of bottom floor for weights, second floor for cardio is similar to the CC spot, and I don't hate it. Keeps things compartmentalized, though the cardio area doesn't really look out onto anything entertaining, there's never been a line for the equipment that I've seen upstairs. The weight area looks smallish, but again, I've never witnessed any issues here. Maybe it's less crowded regularly than the other locations I've been, though I tend to go during "off-peak" times. I don't love the tiny locker rooms.... tough for a long lady when there are a few other gals getting changed and cleaned up at the same time.

The group fitness room is large, but the pillars scattered throughout, as well as the cycles pushed against one wall, make it feel smaller. As a tall woman, I had to be careful when lifting my arms as there are a few beams that I would've knocked into had I not been careful. Good acoustics, enthusiastic teachers, and I imagine it might be nice to be in a spin class with a little better lighting than most.... but I don't think it's my favorite space for group fitness, I felt a little choked.

I feel like I'm getting my money's worth with this membership, but there's always room for improvement. That room's not in the locker-room, though.... trust me.

On the surface, the Upper Main Line YMCA is a class act - lots of tennis, pools, exercise options, and activities.  It is also more expensive than other Ys, but worth it for individuals and families.

However, it has been poorly managed and inadequately maintained.  Recent leadership and staff changes may lead to improvements, but it's too early to tell.

This LA Fitness opened up down the street from Westfield Countryside, presumably to replace the one that used to be on the mall's property.

This gym is brand new, and very clean. I have actually never been to another LA Fitness location as clean as this one. The weight rooms, locker rooms, and cardio areas are always clean. The staff is also friendly.

Unfortunately this location also seems to be a scaled down version of the LA Fitness on Gulf-to-Bay. There is hardly any redundancy in the equipment and the floor feels a little claustrophobic. You really have to be mindful of where you're using free weights here as it is quite easy to step into someone else's space. I also found myself waiting a lot between sets due to the lack of redundancy in equipment. Definitely avoid going during peak hours. I also noticed that there wasn't a sauna, definitely lacking  for an LA Fitness.

All in all, a 5/5 for cleanliness and pleasantness but a 3/5 for completeness of the gym...so we land at a 4/5.

It's not as fancy as a lot of the newer gyms in Indy. No vast expanses of shiny wood floors or gleamingly silver machines here. It is, in fact, pretty utilitarian, but that's probably why it's also cheap. And it does the job. They have all the fitness center standards: free weight room, heated swimming pool, basketball and volleyball court, spinning studio, etc. I never use any of the machines, so I can't really speak to those, but the facility is in good condition. 

I've had good experiences with the staff, too. They will try to get you to buy a membership, like most gym staff, but they're not too terribly pushy about it. One really nice feature of this gym is the number of classes they offer--in addition to personal training, you can participate in a wide range of fitness classes, include water classes, spinning, cardio, yoga, etc. It's worth checking out their website, because they really do offer a lot. Even if you're not looking to become a member, many of the activities are available to the general public for a good price. 

Extra points for offering some unusual classes that a lot of gyms don't, like bellydancing. I took bellydancing here for several months last year, and had a good time, although it wasn't nearly as fun as Celeste at Aiki Concepts!

Ok for a basic gym, my issue is with their financial policies: no reminders for yearly renewals...and wth are there yearly renewals? Jst billed my acct without heads up they were gonna restart, i mean pandemic is still here, right?! Tried to cancel and get  recent amount billed to be refunded...had to pay $10 for the privilege of quitting (wtaf), and wouldnt refund monies..smh.

Great gym! I love the Fitlinxx program, I feel like I have a personal trainer with me on every machine! Everything is very clean, machines are newer, and I like the size. Not to mention the fitness classes-- these are awesome. Amber's Total Body Conditioning on Wednesdays kicks my butt and I'm sore for days. If I ever move downtown I can see myself still coming up to work out at the Monon Center. I'm proud to be a member!

Love this gym! Phils awesome and his mother is a pleasure to chat with. I've been a member from their previous location and this new one is even better. New equipment, not always crazy packed, individual changing rooms and he sells clothes and sneakers if you wish to treat yourself to something nice for a great workout. 

If you're looking for a gym in Northern Liberties this is the spot! 

You'll love it. Guaranteed!
