Starting with Brandon and Connor, everyone here has made me feel so welcome, and for someone that was very apprehensive about working out PERIOD, much less anywhere, I feel so comfortable coming here and starting my journey to getting the body of my dreams, and I can't thank the guys enough. The quality of the equipment and the facilities is top notch. Spend the reasonable price of $29 per month and change your life!!! This has become my home away from home, as well as my new happy place.

As the honey badger narrator would say, "This place is totally bad-ass." I have watched this gym evolve and grow over the years into it's current exceptional form. My daughter recently discovered a love for climbing and the "Kids Climb" on Saturday and Sunday are a perfect way for her to begin honing her fledgling climbing skills while being easy on my wallet. 

The staff is super friendly, helpful, and respectful of beginners. They show their passion for the sport by welcoming newcomers and making them feel comfortable and confident about climbing. The volunteer belayers on the weekends are also usually very friendly and helpful to the kids. My daughter has been getting some great tips on technique and form and I have watched her go from routes rated a four, to sixes in about four weeks. Happy dad.

If you are in it for the classes and pool the price is worth it, but there are better offers out there if you are just looking for cardio and weights. Also the hours were inconvenient for my schedule...especially the early closings on weekends.

Love Elite! I've been going to this gym for over a year and have never been disappointed. Cardio Kickboxing, MMA Fitness, strength and alternative strength classes -- I get everything I need here. Monthly membership costs are in-line (or cheaper) than other similar style gyms and I love the instructors AND the other folks that work out here. Nothing like seeing familiar faces every day to keep your motivation up. Another favorite: the instructors are diverse in their tactics. I can take 3 cardio kickboxing classes in one week and not feel like I'm doing the same thing each class. Plus they just upped their classes adding noon classes Mon-Fri. Phil does some great combat type classes, Luis' cardio kickboxing will kick your booty and Ericka makes you work....hard! (In the best possible way)

Try it out! You won't be disappointed!!

Gym is nice and never need to wait on the equipment or weights when I go in AM.  Enjoy the spin class - found that Cecelia is a very motivated instructor.  Bring a towel as you will always work up a sweat.  Ariel is a great pilate instructor and this location  always found has room and enough equipment which is better than Park Place

Had a training session with Aaron and it was very helpful and could really feel it the next day

Read the other reviews about over crowdedness - no idea on what they are talking about

I love the staff at this gym. They are super friendly and attentive. I was running on the treadmill and forgot to get a towel and a staff member brought me one without me even having to ask. They are always conversing with you, making sure everything is okay, and when it's time to close they do not mind staying a few more minutes so you can complete your workout. 

The gym is brand new and you can tell. The reason I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because they don't have a separate weights area for women like most gyms do and I tend to be the only girl there, get creepy stares on occasion. Other then that setback it's a great gym although some say it's a bit pricey, I think it's reasonably priced.

Just joined this gym after moving to old city last month. I used to go I optimal sport on walnut & juniper in center city, when I used to work nearby that location. Sweat a a huge step up from optimal, and I'm loving it! 

Pros:
-Close to home (hey, it makes a difference) 
-Big with lots of space for equipment, upstairs back room great for abs/stretching
-Lots of character 
-Great classes
-so far friendly staff
-haven't had to wait for a machine yet
-good price 

Cons:
-it gets so hot upstairs! Others have commented on this as well. Someone should make moves to fix.....At least it gives the illusion that I'm working out harder. 
-weird elliptical machines. Maybe personal preference but they feel awkward to me.
They have an enormous heated  pool a baskeball court  and numerous weight machines i just perfer the old machines the sprint and the circuit weight But i dont now if any club is going back to that

I have been going to Double Edge - South for three months.  Initially, I was leery of DE's price and was intimidated to say the least.  I firmly believed that I was not enough for crossfit; not strong enough, not fit enough, not thin enough.  I thought I was the type of person who didn't want to "live" at the gym and didn't think I would commit to attending often enough to make the membership cost worthwhile for me.  Well, I was wrong.  DE has changed my life, as corny and cliché as it sounds.
  
Upon walking through the doors of DE - South it is obvious why it is set above the rest.  It's clean, it's spacious, and dare I say...sexy.  The equipment is plentiful and impeccably maintained.  I have never once had to lift lighter or heavier than desired due to lack of equipment.  Everything I need to modify a workout to accommodate my fitness level and previous injuries is available. The location is convenient with lots of parking and safe areas to run outside.  The bathroom is the nicest gym bathroom that I have ever seen.  There are beautiful and clean toilets and showers and plenty of room and counter space for getting cleaned up after your workout.

 I received a one -on-one consultation with Joel, where he and I talked at length about my current situation, my goals, my strengths and my weaknesses.  Joel also took the time to really explain to me what crossfit is about and what specifically DE is about, which no other gym had taken the time to do.  Throughout our discussion, Joel started mapping out a game plan tailored specifically to me.  I could tell right away that he was genuine and truly listened.  Once we had our game plan laid out, he walked me through a quick crossfit style work out.  I liked the fact that I was able to do this privately and felt less intimidated than if I had just walked in off the street not knowing anything about the gym or crossfit.

While I have had the pleasure of working with many of the coaches, I mostly train with Joaquin, Kris, and Jacob.  They are all properly certified and are continuously educating themselves to achieve higher qualifications. The coaches are also diversifying their backgrounds to include nutrition among other aspects.  Class sizes are often small and usually include two coaches to ensure that you are getting the attention and instruction you need to avoid injury and get the best possible workout.  I never feel that the classes are overcrowded and really appreciate that the coaches take the time to properly explain and demonstrate each move.  The coaches take the time to get to know you personally and are very receptive and helpful when it comes to any adjustments you may need to make.
One of the best things about DE is that I never feel judged - not by the coaches nor the members.  Every single person is encouraging and friendly.  We are all from different fitness levels, ages, shapes and sizes.  Everyone is incredibly supportive.

If you are wanting to change your life and step up your game in a fun and encouraging environment, then DE - South is the place for you! I promise that you won't regret the time, effort and money you will invest in yourself at Double Edge.

My son signed about a month ago and loves it! The workout is intense and painful for me to watch!  He got free gloves, wraps and a personal trading session! I highly recommend this place, but it's not for wimps!!!

Wow, I came to this gym as my girlfriend's guest to take a zumba class.  All I can say is that this is the creme de la creme of gyms!  Of course the price reflects the amenities of this gym so there's that.  But my girlfriend works with one of the partnering Elmwood groups so she gets a discount.  Plus, if she works out a certain number of times during the month then she gets an additional discount!  Too bad my job doesn't have that relationship otherwise I would seriously consider switching!

This seems to be a very family friendly gym with kid rooms, indoor swimming kid classes, families in the pool together etc.  I didn't even go upstairs but seriously this gym has everything.  There is a lounge area where you can get coffee or food, there is a gym shop in the front, they let you use nice fluffy towels as soon as you walk in, there is a HUGE weight/cardio room, a nice size indoor pool, the women's locker room is posh with lockers made of wood, showering facilities.  It's frigging amazing!  
If I had a family I would definitely sign up for this gym because there is so much for the kids to do.  

As for the zumba class, it was awesome!  We went on a Wednesday night and the instructor was on a platform so it was easy to see her.  Plus there were other instructors in the front on both sides so you could follow them as well.  It was an awesome workout and the people in the class were very nice in helping us pick up the steps for the routine!

Happy Working Out!

This place just felt really dirty to me. I'm actually surprised there are so many great reviews because I'm typically a less particular person than others when it comes to gyms. I think it just depends on what you are looking for in a gym. It's a huge facility with lots of options, but anytime I went upstairs to use the equipment I got sick from all the dust. The entire place just felt dirty. That was my only complaint, but caused me to cancel my membership after a month.

The gym is filthy, I never see anyone cleaning it including the members. I tried cancelling 6 times and I was dismissed and continued being charged for 8 months after. After the shut down, I was charged YET AGAIN when the gym opened up. $730 and I don't think the battle is over. Save your time, money, and overall hygiene and go somewhere else. They charge you out of the a** for personal training but then pay their employees $10/hr. Absolutely disgusting. Can't wait to watch them run their business into the ground.

Just like all the other LA Fitness locations that have been open for awhile. It is dirty and the staff sucks. They have switched management several times. I have told the front desk that the bathrooms need to be cleaned better and stocked with more supplies such as soap and paper towels so you can wash your hands, but still no change. I know it is a gym and is used by hundreds of people each day, but at least you could have staff on hand that clean throughout the day and not just in the early in the morning and at closing time.

Walked in and was greeted by Taylor..Very friendly and helpful. It was late in the evening but he was happy to give a quick tour..I'm usually not a fan of Club Fitness due to the crowd but this location seems small and not over crowded. All of the equipment looked new and Taylor informed me it is and they recently underwent remodeling. As I walked thru the center seemed clean and that's always a plus!

This is solid gym if you're looking to get a good workout. I go here when I'm seriously trying to workout. The staff members are all pretty friendly and will help you if needed. I like the fact that they offer full body scans which give them the ability to break down your body composition letting you know how much of your body is lean body mass, how much is fat, body fat percentage etc..
Sauna is included and they have an area upstairs with boxing bags which I use occasionally for some rigorous cardio. They also have a carpeted area downstairs occasionally used for personal training but when not being used they have a sled that you can use,Tire flip with a sledgehammer, and box jump platforms.I would definitely recommend this gym it's in a good area and it's located in a plaza with a grocery store nearby just in case you needed to grab something for dinner.

I have been reading other reviews and can't believe it! I have been with la fitness for about six months. I am recovering from a major back injury! EVERYDAY I go in Ben or Lindsey greet me with a big smile and say hello. Ben has helped me numerous times with questions and always immediately looked into and gotten me answers! My trainer Damien is beyond great! He has helped me go from walking 0.02 miles now up to two miles a day! He is motivating and one of the most pleasant people I have ever met! I can only say great things about this place. Always and I mean always there are one if not two people cleaning cleaning and cleaning around the entire place. The entire staff always smile say hello and ask if ur ok! I will continue to go to la fitness and am so happy I am a member where the people truly care about you achieving your goals and helping you achieve them like Ben Damien and Lindsey!

My favorite thing about 9-Round is what a PHENOMENAL total body workout I get in THIRTY MINUTES. The first visit was really hard - I could tell it was working muscles I just can't get to on my own. After the 2nd visit - my legs and butt hurt so bad I had to take a day off. The 3rd visit I told Rich - legs and butt hurt, upper body and arms are fine. I'll fix that he says. Enter the kickboxing side kicks! OMG!! My sides and love handle muscles are alive. This workout is it! I have no intention of stopping - I'm in. After a month of this I'm going to be ripped. Thank you Richard and 9-Round Kickboxing for such a smart, effective workout. 5 STARS.

Pure Barre is an awesome workout for any level. The instructors are very well trained and know how to help you get the most out of your burn! They offer up two types of class both being 50 minutes in length. This class is a challenge no matter how good your technique is! The owner, Barretenders, and instructors are very professional while also being friendly as well as knowledgeable about all things barre and fitness related! I look forward to working out and seeing the other women in my classes as well. The studio is always kept very clean and Jessica (the owner) always has cute decorative details that give it a warm, inviting feeling.
They finally got internet (otherwise rating would be 2/5).   Clean, good equipment, nice staff and liberal guest policy.    It's not Equinox, but. It's one of the nicer 'xxSC' I've been to.

I love the powerhouse gym, and am sad I moved away. 

1. The price can't be beat. It's 150/year which is cheaper than any other gym I've seen, but yes, you do have to pay upfront. 

2. The spinning classes are awesome. Some of the sweetest people are in the spinning classes, and they make you feel at home. The instructors can be a little demanding, but, that's kind of their job. You burn tons of calories, and that's what you're there for. Yoga with Denise is awesome, too, but get there early. It fills up. 

3. The amenities are sub-par, which is why I gave it 3 stars. The place is a little out of date, and the locker room is a spa by no means, but they do have showers, restrooms, towels, and lockers. 

4. It's huge. There are tons of machines, most of which have TVs on them, a separate are for free weights, and a pretty big stretching area as well, where you can do sit ups or push ups.

In San Francisco, I pay 15 bucks a class, so I'm going to reiterate, this place is a STEAL.

I love Orange Theory Fitness it's the best workout I have ever had   The staff is super supportive and knowledgeable.    They host all types of fun engaging activities to keep you motivated. There's a different workout every day.  If you have never found "your gym". Try OTF

If you want a HARD and SWEATY workout, this is for you!  I think I may have wanted to pass out every 15 minutes or so! But that's mainly because I am pretty out of shape lately and jumped into one of the hardest workouts I've had. The staff was extremely nice and helpful as I am total newbie.  Free first class, you just have to try it!

I agree with other yelpers that I would be more inclined to go back if they offered class packages instead of monthly contracts.  If they offered a package for 5 classes, etc, I would totally go back and see if it's for me long term.  

Also, my knuckles got pretty bruised, I may have over exerted myself, or the glove just didn't fit me right.  But the instructor said that should go away with time as you get used to it.  Again... maybe offer a 5 class package so I can see for myself...

I took survey and didn't have nice things to say and they got a 4 out of 5!  Rigged. Equipment needs to be upgraded. Bicycles don't work. Locker room is pretty disgusting. Members keep lockers daily. Gym appearance minimal. Membership cost was raised when it wasn't supposed to be from 24 hour. No response from "customer service ". Ha. No front office is friendly Trainers  main reason I got there it's 1 mile from home.

I love this gym- it is always clean, everyone is super friendly, and I have never had trouble getting a machine. I do notice that it tends to get crowded in the early evening; however, there are a lot of machines to use. The lay-out of the equipment is by muscle group which is very helpful for me! I went into this gym mainly for the pool, as I love to swim, and I was pleasantly surprised to find that a chain fitness center was so well- run. I admit that the initial push for personal training was a bit much and I was not thrilled with the exercises they introduced into a workout, so I passed on training. I would have liked to have a trainer in the beginning to re-introduce some of the machines to me as I worked with weight training in a couple of years. Otherwise, I am very happy with this La Fitness.
You do not want to join this gym. They have no cancellation policy. So if you join you have to pay no matter what.

Judgement Free Zone!  This is not a meat head gym.  It is cheap ($10 bucks a month), clean, and convenient (open 24 hours).  For the price PF is unbeatable.  Plenty of big screen tvs in front of the elliptical, bikes, and treadmills.  
   I have also experienced an inattentive staff at check in but I just walk in and don't bother waiting.  No big deal. 
   You get what you pay for with gyms i suppose but PF is the best value in the market.

I've been a member at this location for almost 10 years, from it's former franchise days, and am surprised to see lower ratings.
I've never experienced situations that would cause me to abandon the incredible value I receive for my dollars.  For a very low monthly rate, this place is packed with amenities.  Group classes, a pool and childcare for less that I've paid as a drop in rate at other gyms!
Yes, it a "big box" gym, and some grunting and general d'baggery comes with that territory, but for the most part...go and do your own thing and don't let that take away from your workout!
Most fitness establishments have a steady turnover, but I've seen many of the same faces here for years. It's always been clean, and fairly well maintained. My kids enjoy the care they receive in the Kids Club, and quite honestly, that's a defining factor for me being able to get in workouts without worry. No excuses!
They're always participating in community events like food, toy and clothing drives too!
Bonus for customer service: when I recently left behind by 4 day old cell phone, I was able to call and a front desk staffer grabbed it for me and kept it at the desk until I could return! Woohoo! 
How does your overpriced gym compare?  I'm happy to be a long-time Fitness Connection member, and so is my wallet!

*** Note: the experience with the masseurs would get 5-stars automatically, but it was the initial encounter that landed this experience with a 3-star rating. This review does not reflect the service of the masseurs. *** 

This was my first time coming here today. I decided to treat my cousin to a spa day to relieve some pre-final test as well as to unwind from the daily stresses of life. we had a Groupon and we wanted to use it before it expired. I originally dealt with Debbie when I was booking the appointment and she was the epitome of rude. She made me feel like I was inadequate because I was using a Groupon. She also made me feel rushed so I ended up calling back and confirming everything with Lauren, who was extremely pleasant. Fast forward to today: the day of the appointment. I called and spoke with Andrea (who was very nice) to let her know that we would be a little late due to the fact that there was a Saints home game. She completely understood and told us to arrive when we could. When we got there, she showed us to the area where we would chance and she let us go. Now, Debbie comes in and she's talking to me in a condescending tone because my Groupon said redeemed and that it wasn't supposed to say that. It stated redeemed on the day of the appointment at the time we checked it. I told her I didn't know why it said that because I had never used the Groupon prior to this visit. She then tells me she would need to verify the Groupon code, which at this point I didn't care what she did. When she came back she then proceeds to remind us that "we are late" and we need to "hurry because our masseurs are waiting." My whole experience with her was rude and very unprofessional. She made me and my cousin feel very uncomfortable. She would be the main reason while I'd never return. The only way I would return would be if she either retires or ended up getting fired for being a total b****. 

Fast forward to our massages: we had the 50-minute Swedish massage with coconut oil. My cousin had Pia and I had Jacob. They were both amazing. They turned a rough experience into something pleasurable. They were very attentive and my massage was simply amazing. 

For anyone interested in going to Balance, please AVOID DEBBIE AT ALL COSTS! If you can, please speak with Andrea and ask for Pia and Jacob! You won't be disappointed!!! 

*please excuse all typos...sent from my iPhone*
I have bouldered here quite a few times and it's been great. It is a little pricey but the gym is well maintained. I'm planning on buying a monthly pass.

This place is wonderful and always clean and always full of staff. But the problem is that on the most part it's always too crowded in the gym area. Trying to work out will have to wait in line for the other person to finish.

Really inexpensive gym for the area. I am concerned about the size, the mirrors make it look much larger than it is but the gym is still under constitution so we will see. Hopefully they stop letting people bring a friend, the gym is definitely not big enough for that at the current price point. Staff is really nice, just concerned about possible overcrowding. They've been playing music, not sure if they have wifi or not. Hopefully they can expand downstairs somewhere.

This review is for Jump-n-Shout.
I hosted my daughters birthday party at Jump-n-Shout despite hearing negative reviews from friends because I was pressed for time. I wish I would have listened. The planning process was unorganized-they would call for details and I would call back and give them details (ie. number of kids, pizza etc.) and then the owner would call back asking for the same thing I had communicated to her employees. The owner was rude and continually hurried us through the party to make sure we were out on time (actually even a few minutes before) and hovered around to make sure of it-she was very much in it just for the money and made zero attempt at making the birthday girl feel a tad special despite the amount of money we spent-she didn't even acknowledge her and wish her happy birthday and was completely all business and rude throughout the entire experience.  If you are in the business of kids parties and operating a kids business you need to be more in touch with your clientele.  The "hosts" for the party were virtually non-existent and stood in the corner.  I have hosted numerous parties and this was by far the worst place. The party room was also old, dated and dirty. We will never host another party here. Jump-man-Jump does a FAR superior job-they keep things moving without making you feel rushed or like a bother to them.

My favorite gym ever. Feels like home. From the moment you walk in the culture revolves around getting to know the clients and team and spreading positivity. I love the classes and the cleanliness of the establishment and every single Lifetime across America is kept the same way. 
I haven't lived close to one in over 8 months and truly miss it. Cannot wait to be back in my flagship gym.

Okay okay...this gym definitely has its ups and downs! We can't all win. Majority of people with their negative talks are probably spoilt or just drink some shitty coffee. I would like to say that this is not your house so it doesn't have to be perfect and the way you want it (who knows your house might be dirtier) some of you may not even know how to clean a house. 

I would start by saying that this is a business after all. Most of you work in business...right? I mean we don't all enjoy our jobs and when we hate it we leave and find something better....
Most people that work there for the most part do it for the membership or the things they could get out of it---it's like any of you who work and see what are the best benefits you get out of this job before actually committing it and when poop hits the fan you leave. But there are some that put their all into making your fitness and health better! Like the trainers and management.
Just because the cleaning lady decided she wanted to go doesn't mean you get to whine about the bathrooms. , go home and take a shower if it hurt your soul oh so much. 
Just because the guy / girl at the front doesn't know the answer doesn't mean they're rude. For heaven sake these kids come in after school and sometimes things don't always get communicated.
You make a commitment when you signed up for the gym for the love of Pete, read the stuff before you sign it. Like dude what the hell do you just go around signing your life away? Who does that anyhow? Ah I lost money with training and guess what I've lived. I'm still living and I'm annoyed so I'm writing this review.

PSC Radnor has been a big part of my sanity! It helped me get away from a lot of things. I've made a shit ton of friends there and in fact the staff those who stayed and even the ones who left, definitely made an impact on my time here. So what the machine is broken, perhaps you behind needs a new workout. Go lift some weights get out of your comfort zone and push yourself. STOP EXPECTING MACHINE, DIRTY BATHROOMS AND BROKEN SOAP DISPENSERS TO RULE YOUR GYM EXPERIENCE. These people working at the gym are human beings, who just like you go to work and try their best to help you as much as they can. So stop whining and go work out and be fit in this fat America! 

Okay I'm annoyed and I love this gym!!!

just to update - cliff personally called me and left a message so i do love that he took the time to do that - BUT i already had joined a new gym by the time he called and  i know nothing would have happened if i didnt leave that poor yelp review.  

either way - i'm giving the sporting club an additional star for all the efforts they made to contact me, but i wish it didnt happen in the first place.

The Les Mills classes here are amazing and the people that teach them are even more amazing. My favorite classes to take are body pump and body flow. Laura on Wednesday evenings at 4:30 is my favorite. The gym is always clean and the people are always friendly. I couldn't or wouldn't think of going anywhere else.

I like planet fitness and I like this location. It has always been clean and adequately stocked with paper towels and cleaning solution the times I have come. Staff have been decently helpful with questions and concerns. I don't have cable TV at home and I like how I can come here to get my fill of whatever channel/show I want while working out on whatever cardio machine I want. Ultimately, I am happy with my workouts here. And I am happy with the very affordable cost of the membership.

7 days and still no response- had to call Omar 4x and just got lip service. 
Hello, 
I am writing to lodge a complaint about aqua fit instructor Linda at Fort Washington PA on Wednesday, September 16 at 6 PM class. Linda was extremely rude to me as a first-time attendee at her class. When I first went in and took the barbells she assumed because of my weight that I could not keep up with the class when I tried to fill the weights with water she said this is a very hard class you might not want to do that. She assumed I had not taken the class before however I've been in aqua fit for over 10 years. When it was time to split into groups Linda just pointed at me didn't ask my name and said "you" go over there. I was pretty angry at how rude she was. There were eight other women in the class. The one that she teamed me up with said, "Oh we are used to her. She's not very nice. I said I don't have to get used to her and I left the class. When I went into the locker room I heard Linda talking about me behind my back saying that I couldn't keep up with the class and that she didn't care. I confronted her and said that I pay for her class she said "You don't pay for me go talk to my manager I will be here anyway nothing will happen". I told her that she was rude she said this is just the way she is and I could not keep up with her class. I have never been so disrespected at any gym in my life  I just paid the $99 fee so I could switch clubs- I regret that decision and would like a refund of that money I will never go back to Ft Washington and I may leave LA fitness for good.. I would like that apology to be from Linda. thank you.
It's been 3 days and no action has been taken from Omar the manager.

This location is huge. It is easy to access from hillsborough and has plenty of parking. The membership desk is directly in front of you when you walk in. There is a running track - the only crunch I've seen in the area with one - a large areas with machines and a smaller area with free weights. There are treadmills, bikes, rowers, ellipticals of all sorts and a Jacobs ladder. 5
There is also a weight lifting area with a few squat racks and heavy weights. They have drinks in a cooler for sale and some shirts. There are classes upstairs with the running track and an area like CrossFit with monkey bars, battle ropes and other various things. There is also a kiddie corner area. I would inquire within to find out  how that works, I'm not sure how it does. They have classes for those that opt in to the higher tier membership but I myself haven't been to any here. It is a spacious room and always sounds like there's a lot of energy.

The women's locker rooms are spacious. There are 3 changing stalls, a small area with a tv and a couch, a locker area and 4 showers. The set up is a little weird as the changing stalls are on the other side of the locker room from the showers. The shower curtains are cheap and have fallen down so just be mindful. They also clean at 7 am in the morning so be mindful if you don't like the smell of chemicals while you shower. Other than that the locker room is great. There's a large mirror above the sinks and of course a sauna. Compared to other crunch locations, the sauna is a nice size. There is also a full length mirror closer to the actual lockers. 

The staff is hit or miss. Some of the staff is great and super friendly but some of the staff have no manners and lack of interest in those who don't sign up for training. The young lady who works in the morning during the week is super sweet and has been helpful in the past. She is personable and always has a smile on her face. I also had membership issues so just verify your membership after you sign up or if you upgrade. I went back and forth for a few weeks because no one would fix the issue. It wasn't just this location. I tried to resolve it with multiple locations. This location actually was able to fix it.

My boyfriend and I got gym memberships here a couple months ago and I'm a fan. There's lots of equipment and never a wait for machines. I also really love the classes, BodyWorks Plus Abs is my fave. Kelli and Emily are great instructors!

Most fun workout ever! I came to revel ride after being really only a barre/pilates/yoga girl, with occasional spouts on the treadmill. I had no idea how to cycle but the instructors (and other riders!) were so friendly and happy to help. I got an amazing workout at each class, and had so much fun! I particularly loved Jamie's music choices and Marissa's energy. A (huge) bonus was the beautiful studio - clean, with free shoes and water (unlike soul cycle), and Duross & Langel in the showers! Will definitely be coming back and supporting this local business :)

I am fairly new to this gym, switching over from a gym that was way too crowded. So far I have had some ups and downs.

Pros: very cool, unique equipment. Definitely less crowded than most gyms around. Good space between folks. Separation rooms for powerlifting, stretching, etc. which makes it less noisy and disruptive. Pretty good hours open. Variety in music is played day to day, never slow boring music though. Always something with a good beat for working out. 

Cons: not enough equipment for smaller muscle groups - TONS of legs and chest stuff but lacking in shoulders and biceps etc. They could use an additional cable crossover and updated cardio equipment; kind of dingy with shelves falling off the walls and not enough spray and paper towels around.

COVID-wise, patrons are all wearing masks. Staff doesn't harp on you for taking a few breaths outside your mask but they seem to be regularly making rounds to make sure people are masked.

I love this place! They have a lot of options for climbers of all different abilities. It can get crowded here in the evenings sometimes, especially when they have student/military discounts, but if its not too crowded its great. The staff is really laid back, and its a cool environment.
Free parking, Close to Route 38 nice big facility good group exercise classes, women's locker room big lockers are available

Parking is definitely an issue even with being able to park in the Lilly lots next door during peak hours.  I had to navigate around people who made their own parking spaces along edges of the lot.  The staff is super friendly, but the clientele not so much.  I had to deal with a guy working out next to one of two rowing machines who refused to move away so I could use the rowing machine.  I had to scrounge to find a locker that wasn't full - awfully trusting people putting stuff in lockers with no lock.  The walking track is great most of the time, especially for me since I have to be careful walking outdoors due to hearing impairment.  But then you get the people who run like they are being chased who have no problem nearly knocking you over even when you are in the very clearly marked WALK lane.  I loved this place at first, but now I am going to switch to the Athenaeum or Ransburg even though they aren't as slick looking.
Always a great work out! The energy is awesome and the effects can be felt for days after!

For a family like ours, there's nowhere we'd rather be than the NAC. We have 3 kids, and a Nanny, and we all use the club to its fullest extent.  My kids are 2, 4, and 8, and they are ALL enrolled in at least 2 classes at the NAC. Even on weekends when they don't have classes, my wife and I go to work out, and my kids are THRILLED to go to the kids club. The Kids Club staff is exceptional. 

My daughter takes dance, gymnastics, and Yoga (Yes, they have a Yoga class for kids!) and she loves it. On busy nights, we can eat in the Cafe after exercising. There are always healthy choices, and even some 'treats" for the kids. 

Now, working out - I do olympic lifts (dropping the weights making noises), and no one has a problem with it. There is ALWAYS a piece of cardio equipment available. There's space to jump rope. There's multiple spaces for what I call "functional training" - flipping tires/pushing & pulling sleds, etc. There is ALWAYS something new to try as well. TRX,  Spinning, cross-training, yoga, pilates (reformer and floor) all kinds of aerobics. Also leagues and clubs of all kinds if you want to play some kind of competitive sport. Lastly,  the club is always looking to improve, and constantly adding new services. 

I've even worked out with a couple personal trainers there, and they are rock solid. If you want someone who is knowledgeable and can bring you back from an injury, they have the right staff for that. If you are a conditioned athlete, and you want to do something new, or want to be pushed to your limits, those trainers are there too.

My perspective is that of someone who has worked extensively in health clubs, and I'm now a father of three, and I have to say ESPECIALLY if you are a family, you won't find a more comprehensive facility anywhere that I've ever lived.

This is my favorite location. Its a relatively large space and I don't feel claustrophobic. Sometimes I wish they'd turn up the A/C during peak hours but even when its a little hot in there, I don't feel humid or musty. I'm always able to get on a machine that I like. The machines are usually clean but I've noticed them getting a little grimy.  Most of the TVs on the machines work, which is nice. Though, I'm not a fan that Club Fitness as a whole decided to downgrade their cable to 30 some stations. Yeah, the free weight area is a little small, but at least its not in a basement like the one at Hampton Village. 

It sounds like I'm ragging on this location a lot but this is just nitpicky stuff. The staff is ALWAYS nice and the ambiance is great. Definitely a great value. I go here whenever possible.

Great place for the kids to go and be with well trained and super friendly coaches. My son goes for fun and moving his bootay! Many serious gymnastic classes are performing along side his class. Busy, fills up quickly but well worth planning for upcoming sessions. 
Everyone we talked to there is nice and seems to be very happy to be there working, that means a lot to me as it usually reflects in the treatment of all the kids :)

Everything about Sierra Fitness is first-rate: equipment, cleanliness/neatness, courtesy and respect shown by other patrons, the hands-on attention of owners Dan and Beth Wirth, convenience/location (able to have gorgeous mountain views, or go outside and throw things around), diversity of class offerings and trainers, reasonableness of price and membership/seasonal flexibility, good manners of clientele of all ranges of age and ability (you will never feel embarrassed or intimidated here, unlike at a lot of places).

I find AL Z's comment an outlier. The gym provides plenty of disinfectants, wipes, sanitizer; also, clean locker and restroom/shower facilities; plenty of warm fresh towels...like anywhere, in the final analysis it's up to each patron to exercise common courtesy. In three very satisfying years, I've always found my fellow gym patrons very courteous and respectful.

Let me share a recent anecdote: sometime ago, in CT, I purchased a new Polar heart monitor etc watch. Not being very adept at setting same, I had to go begging around the Equinox I belong to in CT for help. I was told: no one knows how. Rather than challenge the ludicrous, I waited until I was back in Tucson. Dan cheerily did the settings right off!

Highly recommended in every respect!

I was skeptical of a group workout class at first but OTF is a game changer! it's the absolute best way to workout and have fun at the same time. All of the instructor are great and through. The staff is friendly and courteous. I would definitely recommend trying out a free class.

The staff is great at sales, but not so good with customers and it's "hard selling" tactics are intense--they are nice when signing you on the dotted line and all downhill from there.  I signed up in December for a personal trainer and from day one I did not like being talked down to and patronized.  Okay, so I'm not in shape, that's what I'm there for...and I'm not a twenty something, buff size 2, petite blonde with a condescending attitude from Wyoming either!  

I've left several messages to change to another trainer, with not a single return call....and to be honest, that's the stinkiest and noisiest, highest testosterone gym I've ever seen.  Peeeeyouuu!  The main workout room is so noisy and from the smell, it's not cleaned....so who wants to get on equipment with other people's sweat??? 

 Also, the pool room is dark and dreary, the water is cloudy...and there are always people lurking in the spa, like it's a pick up place....not to mention the H2o Zumba class is the worst I've tried--all Salsa music (can't relate to all Spanish music!) and no inspiration from the "teacher", she doesn't even know who we are or try to get to know her class--so I even stopped going there too.  The parking lot is so full there is never a spot even half way close to the door and it's not lit well at night.  Creepy.

I'm out a chunk of change every darn month until the blasted contract is up.  So, hey guys, we all need exercise and it's great to have a personal assessment so we know what's right for our body type, but I refuse to be treated like I'm just not good enough and stuck in a contract with ZERO response from my calls!  

What a HUGE disappointment.....Buyer beware people!

I absolutely love this gym. I have no idea why it has such low rating! Although it doesn't have a pool like most people would like, I am not a pool kind of girl so I am not missing it. It is smaller but that's what I love about it! I have been there when they first open all the way through the end of the night and I have never felt like it was busy which is of course a huge plus. 
The childcare center is phenomenal! My baby boy is just shy of two years old and he loves everyone who works there! They're all so loving and patient and they will do everything they can before they have to come pull you out of your exercise. Some days I don't have him with me and they ask me how he is and why he isn't there. That shows me they take the time to get to know your child and really do care.
The trainers are absolutely top notch! My personal favorites are Laura, Angie and Jamie! They're energy level is unmatched! They kick your butt and make you work hard without belittling you. They make you want to give your all and push yourself which is what I need! I joined Angie's boot camp class and it has completely changed my life and way of thinking! The way she has developed a sense of community is just amazing! I wouldn't dare go  anywhere else! 
The staff that checks you in and that you see throughout the gym is very kind and helpful. 
Overall, I love this gym and the people that is apart of it!

This LA Fitness is located in the new Seminole City Center, an open-air plaza that replaced the old Seminole Mall. This location also replaced an older LA Fitness on Park and Seminole Boulevards.

This location is smaller than your normal giant box LA Fitness, evidenced by the lack of a sauna and somewhat claustrophobic weight room. Compared to its twin, the Dunedin LA Fitness, however, there is a quite a bit more redundancy in the equipment.

The members at this LA Fitness definitely skew a little older than most locations and they all seem to know each other so there is a feeling of community here. People here also tend to rerack their weights, which is much welcomed.

The gym itself is also very clean. There are always people cleaning when I'm here. It does get busy but not busy enough to create a big problem with your workout. I'm a fan of this LA.

I didn't know how good I had it until moving and trying out spin facilities in DTSP! I went to Power Cycle for spin classes for roughly 6 months, losing approx 30 lb. My fitness level increased greatly during that time. The encouragement from instructors and other spinners is fantastic. I wish I didn't live so far!

Nice and Clean! I do wish the bathrooms had toilet seat covers but in all this gym is pretty nice! Been going for a month now and Its never been crowded like a regular gym. You can go at anytime you'd like and never seen more than maybe 5-6 other people unless its a group event.

They have mostly new equipment all in good shape. A lot of cardio machines if that is what you're into. Try the ab carver while you're there! It is the best! This gym is missing a few pieces of equipment but the fact that its never crowded makes up for everything.

I was a long time employee at the J, but I was a member for much longer. I love the facility. There are great people working on each and every part of the building. The early childhood of course has the most special place in my heart. I recommend this place to all my friends and new people I meet.

What a great gym!  I must admit that my impression of a Anytime Fitness gym was not what I experienced today.  It's a 24/7 facility that is the most clean and up to date that I've seen.  Other big box gyms would kill to have a place this nice.  We met Tanner and the owner Mark who were very professional and thorough with our tour of their gym.  It was obvious they were proud of their place and took extra pride in keeping it clean and up to date.  We look forward to working out with you guys!
Cleanliness of the facility & aged equipment in disrepair are concerns of this 17-year Charter member.  Disappointing - not the Y it formerly was.

I use many planet fitness locations but this is my home location and probably the best one ive been to. Its larger than most and offer massage chairs, tanning and my favorite,  red light therapy.  The staff are very friendly  and helpful. I never have any issues at this location.

My family discovered My Gym early in 2018 after permanently moving from San Diego to Tucson. We started off at their Pre School Prep along with their camps & they have been a blessing to us! I have 2 girls ages 3 & 4 and My Gym has been nothing but amazing for us. We haven't found anything that is as welcoming & fun as this place is. My girls take a weekly class, frequent open play & parents night out! All the teachers are wonderful, so kind and loving towards all the kids. Everyday is a good day here! My oldest daughter just celebrated her early  5th birthday here and we were so happy with everything. Not only did they make my life easier by planning & supplying everything but all her friends had such a great time! This center is for all ages, so many different classes that accommodates every child's needs. Our family is grateful to have found such a wonderful establishment. If you are looking for a place where your kids will be safe & have so much fun, I highly recommend it.

One year later... this place is still clean, the price has not gone up, the machines all still work and I am always greeted (sometimes by name) or encouraged on my way in or out. 

The whole TV thing on my last review has become a non-issue and has actually allowed me to become reacquainted with my iPod. My only semi-complaint is that this place has become so popular, depending on what time you arrive, the place can be packed. You may also have trouble finding parking. 

Speaking of parking... I don't understand the guy I see on the treadmill, legs pumping furiously, breathing hard and sweat pouring off him. Isn't that the guy I saw get into his illegally  parked truck just so he could get a spot closer to the door? Just sayin...

Super challenging, fun and effective workouts paired with an awesome staff. I've done their classes and I've done their personal training and highly recommend both! I worked with Mada and she whipped me into tip top shape right before my wedding and I couldn't be happier!

I like flywheel, I really do. This is more of a 3.5 stars. 

The staff is friendly, the convenience of shoes waiting in a cubby is fun, and I am SO thankful the the team that goes into the studio and cleans the bikes after every class.  

The downsides include the price $28/per class (MINIMAL discounts for buying in bulk), too few changing areas, and how many bikes are packed into the stadium. It all feels a little claustrophobic.

Greta, Louisiana ---

A day at Planet Fitness doing a partial pARTy Fitness session ...

The "Greta" location is ok ... plumbing maintenance would get 1 useless shower working ... 

I am still a fan of Planet Fitness ... it works for "Run-A-Way Bill" 

day 035 "DUSA 2017" (Discover USA) 

"Run-A-Way Bill" was here! 

#RunAwayBill #PlanetFitness #DUSA2017 

03.29.17

Ok I'm a regular at the beech groove location but I come here a couple days a week so I might as well review this too.
This place is immaculate. There is always a staff member cleaning and the bathrooms are spotless. The locker rooms are just like the high end gyms around here. Spacious and you can put your lock on there. I like that the lockers have the "mesh" design so you can kinda see in the locker. Sometimes I evidentially use way too much oxygen during my workout and I forget which locker I put my stuff in so I don't look crazy trying to get into every locker. Showers are nice and provide soap, they have hair dryers and a dressing room. Two big mirrors. 
The gym itself:
I like the beech groove location better but a lot of weight lifters will disagree with me and I'll explain why. This gym has rows all facing a giant mirror. 4 rows are cardio machines then the free weights and serious weight stuff is in front of the mirror. I could care less about a mirror but I know for people who use weights you need to see your form. I've never had a problem getting on the arc trainer or treadmill. 
Black card member benefits:
Freaking awesome.
This place is better than beech grooves black member perks because of the layout and perks.
The massage room is awesome. It's dark and relaxing. It lets you get away as you lay down (or sit depending on your choice of massage).
Tanning beds are insanely awesome. They have 3 different type (and levels of beds). One stand up and 2 different laydown. 12 beds in total.
Staff:
Ok I've looked on glass door and I know these employees get paid very little. With that said, how do they find these employees?? At both locAtions these guys not only get along with each other But they actually like us customers. They will talk and joke Around with you. They clean, actually like their jobs, and are very helpful. I really want to know how they have such great staff for what they pay them. I am out of space to review :)

I usually would rate this gym really well. However, if you're an early person like myself and want to bang out the gym in the am the only down side is you have to deal with the cleaning person. I don't go at night because it's way too packed and I don't want to have to wait for a spot. But at night at least you don't have to deal with the cleaning person basically cleaning your feet. I'm paying to come here. While the cleaning person is getting paid to work. Uses strong products and cleans right by you or mops over your belongings. I find it extremely disrespectful and rude. I'll be switching to another gym after coming here for over 4 years

This is the best gym in Reno. The gym is well equipped for cardio, machines, and free weights (including more than a few squat racks). Moreover, the gym and locker rooms are CLEAN. 

The gym also has racquetball courts that convert into squash courts and making a reservation for Saturday morning was easy. 

While one employee got a bit snooty with me, the owner Mike quickly fixed the issue and all other employees are friendly. 

I knocked a star off because this place is a bit expensive for me. This is largely because I only use the free weights and racquetball courts--for someone who uses all the amenities, including pool and sauna, the price isn't bad.

Aggressive telemarketing style. Signed up for a free class once- MONTHS AGO. They've called multiple times, even though I've told them I'm not interested and would like my information removed from their list. When I told them it's unacceptable to call after business hours, they said "well aren't you on the East coast." Yes- but I do not want gyms calling me repeatedly at 7:30pm. They are aggressive and clearly DESPERATE for clientele. DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR INFORMATION!

Wow! Caroline and Joseph and wonderful. They are so welcoming, which is great because I had not worked out in a year. I love the small group classes, music and workouts. It's nice that there are both 30 and 60 minute classes. Highly recommended!

Ugh Club Fitness Arnold, why am I regretting more and more that I joined your gym? Your workout classes are great and I love that you are expanding, but you have a severe bug problem in your classroom and I was told that I had 24 access to everything, INCLUDING unlimited tanning. When I tried to use the tanning booth today, I was told that the booths closed at 6PM. I thought that was ok, but I wanted to purchase replacement eye protection just in case and the lady at the front counter said that all the computers were shut down. I glanced over at the machines and all the monitors were on and some were at the club fitness screensaver. In addition, I was very offended that the lady at the counter treated me like I was 9 years old. I am 37!! Seriously, Club Fitness, get it together, or I will join another gym!

Gym atmosphere - 5 stars
Amenities - 4 stars (particulary because of parking and locker room availability).
Personal training - 5 stars
Group fitness - 5 stars
Staff - 5 stars

Amenities:
- Towel service
- Food Items. I believe they partnered with a nutrition organization that actually can prepare and deliver food to your home. That food was also provided in the gym and includes things like egg whites, fruit, salads, protein options, nuts, and some other food types. There are also beverages available for purchase.
- Nutrition expert consultations available for a fee
- Massage Therapist available for a fee
- And a few others that I can't recall

I heard about this gym and saw the opportunity to try it out by purchasing a 3-month groupon special, which included a full 3 month membership, and 3 personal training sessions. I think this deal was valued at approximately $400.

This gym is owned by a former Olympic power lifter and he uses that philosophy towards training and fitness. That means there are not a bigillion cardio machines for all you folks that believe in endless cardio as the answer to burning fat and building muscle.

This is the type of gym where the regulars know each other and so does the staff because it's pretty small. 189 occupancy, so that gives you an idea of the size. However, I feel that it should Be much smaller. I would say there are 4-5 elliptical machines and 5-6 treadmills. The rest is weight training equipment.

Typically I go into a gym with a mean face to prevent people from talking to me because I am actually intimidated by some of the people that work there so I try to show my strong face (go figure).  However, it's not like that there. Everyone has a friendly face. Most patrons also have a face that means business. 

This gym is structured for personal training sessions. When I come on a Saturday morning and there were approximately 6 personal trainers working with clients. I completed three sessions with a trainer and she was very knowledgeable, motivating, and thorough. I believe her name is Jessica.  I have observed in working with her and interacting with other staff members that their philosophy to proper form is core element to healthy and safe fitness. There are several postings of dynamic warm ups and cool downs that the staff expect for clients to complete before starting any routine. I found it very helpful in properly warming up the body without defaulting to stretching.

If you are not into personal training (or can't afford it) then I think the next bet would be the group fitness classes here at the Lab Gym. What I really love about the group fitness classes is that you can sign up at least five days before hand to save your spot online or in person, particularly because space is limited.  Unlike other gyms, the group fitness room only fits 15 (depending on the class) so it doesn't feel that crowded.They will also send emails out to all members if a class has been cancelled or rescheduled at the past minute. The majority of the group fitness classes designed by LesMills and most start with the world 'body'. Body flow (yoga/Pilates), body pump (weight training), body combat (kick boxing), Zumba, and RPM (spinning). The classes listed above are included in your membership. There is one special boot camp class that's taught by the owner for an additional per class fee. I have tried Body Combat and Body Pump consistently during my membership, both of which were good full body workouts so I would definitely recommend taking them. I also tried Zumba once, but wasn't too interested in that form of workout. 

*Tip - When I was there, the group fitness schedule was often structured (regarding body pump and body combat) to have body pump first, and body combat following. I typically signed up for both classes to get resistance training and cardio in for the day.

Women's locker room: really small! One shower (which I never used) about 30 school size lockers, 4 stalls. When there was more than three women using the locker room it felt crowded. Because of this, I would often change before coming to the gym- if I was coming from work, for example. However, the locker rooms were always clean.

Parking: there is meter parking, a small 15 car lot that is shared by 3 other businesses, and a smaller non-metered street behind the establishment, which is a little sketch (from a woman's perspective) so I don't park there. Parking lot is typically full by 5pm on the week days (peak gym time) and by 9am on Saturdays. However, I can't speak to other times outside of the ones stated above.

I joined because of how nice the staff was during my initial visit on a Sunday.  He was very laid back and honored the free trial visit day.  He was not pushy, didn't ask for a copy of my driver's license, and didn't require blood from my first born child.  Based on how cool he was, I joined the gym the very next day.  The management that is on duty Mon-Sat is a different story.  

You get what you pay for.  Fair amount of equipment, but just like other smaller gyms it's packed during busy times.  I've met a lot of good people while working out here.  When signing up, be sure to ask about all fees that will be incurred over the year.  In addition to the monthly fee there is a startup fee and an annual fee (2 separate things).

This place continues to have really shady practices when it comes to charging for memberships.

Mid-November, I realized I wasn't charged my monthly rate for the month. I called FIVE times over the period of a week before someone returned my call. They told me they had handled it. When the transaction hit my account, they overcharged me $15. 

It has now been three weeks since I was overcharged and I have yet to receive my refund. They refuse to call me back and I was forced to report them to the better business bureau. I have been calling at least once a day every week day, and keep being told that the person I need to speak with is unavailable. 

Jamie, who apparently is the manager of billing at this location, is a joke. It is alarming the amount of effort I am putting in to even speak with her regarding this matter. She has never once called me back and I've only been able to get in touch with her twice over the three week period. 

I really don't understand how what they are doing can be legal, and hope that reporting them to the better business bureau gets some form of results. This is now the second time I've had billing issues like this with this gym. It is not worth the effort. Find another gym.

3 stars because the first class was great, welcoming, inviting and the trainer was nice to newbies like me. The workout was hard, exhausting, but not bad.

Small building, kind of expensive. Parking is annoying

2nd class was awful. Different trainer, different building, different class/set up. No welcome, no introduction, not even a hi. Just walk in and have 8 people stare at you like you're a freak. I felt so unwelcome and confused with what the class was about that I just left. There is no point in working out when you feel uncomfortable and unwelcome. I will just work out at home.

I got Crunch Fitness flyer in the mail a while ago, my membership at 24 Hour Fitness expires end of August, so I was considering joining with a $5 promotion, listed here... https://www.crunch.com/join?club=reno&plan=Peak%20Results. 

It says $49 enrollment fee plus 1st month for $5. There is an annual enrollment fee, does not list a date, but costs, $49. After that you choose a plan at $9.95 (basic 1 club) $19.95 (all the clubs, plus more perks) and lastly,  $29.95 (every club, bell, and whistle). 

I thought for $5, it would be worth checking out, so I called the local crunch fitness, as I wanted to inquire about contracts, cancellation, and get a free day/week of training to decide on joining. 

I spoke with the rep, who was upfront that I cannot see the club it's not open yet, but the promotion would expire as soon as the club opens, which means instant price increases. If you want to lock in the prices, you could sign up now and can cancel. Okay, that sounds like a reasonable risk, especially at $5 to check it out. 

Then I learn it's only $5 now, once they open whatever plan you choose, you pay that on opening day, so essentially no first month at $0. I inquired, and she said how they explain is they don't charge you a month while they are not open. 

I was told I could cancel, no contracts, I would just need to speak to a manager. The annual fee is about 60 days after you start. So, I am assessing, and it sounds like I would pay $34.95 ($29.95 day 1 gym open, plus $5 enrollment fee) to decide if I liked the gym, it's a risk worth pursuing. 

I then asked if opening in person would help rep out, since being in sales I understand when someone provides service, you should give them business, if they provided value, etc. Rep only wanted to what's best for me, but did after prying say it does help for her to enroll in person. I agreed to set an appointment, I figured, I would get a better view of the club, but then found out, I could not, as they are working out of kiosk in Meadowood Mall, by women's Macy's. 

To make a long story short, when I arrived in person, I still was hung up on $5 for enrollment and 1st month, why is it not? I let her know she explained as best as possible, and then decide to get support. The 2nd staff member, does not come off professional, there's a sign in front of me that says, "No Judgments" but I felt a lot of judgment. 

2nd rep restated what the 1st rep said, we don't charge you until we open, that's what the 1st month free is, she even said, "Lots of places do it". I pressed for specifics, "Please give me some examples of who does?" I let her know I felt it was unfair and deceptive advertising, and that I used to be in advertising and I have business degrees, and her reply was, "I don't need to tell you". 

After all this I was about to sign up, because I do want a new and clean gym, and the biggest draw was getting a permanent discount, even though there's no contract. As I stated before I was about to sign up online, and it tries to get you to sign up with debit card, but you can sign up with a credit card (CC), and have to click a button to make the option for all the payments. 

As I was signing up, I provided a CC and was told I also needed to provide a debit card. I protested, she grabbed the unprofessional judgmental coworker, and who came over with a smirky snide, "Hello again" who told me, "I had to put up a 2nd payment form, which HAD to be a DEBIT CARD". I mentioned online, it gave the strictly CC options, which she says, "That's true, but when you come in, you have to give us your debit card". At this point, to many Red Flags, and I said, I am out, which I think made her happy. My guess is she's unprofessional as they are getting lots of negative feedback about Unfair and Deceptive Advertising and are over explaining this constantly.  

Working in banking, giving up your debit card can lead to many problems, and they can be very expensive and time consuming (debit card fraud claims are no FUN). I would have been happy to provide 2 CC's, and I had my wallet open and it was obvious your could see multiple CC's in my open tri-fold wallet, I was not provided this an option, which I would have been happy to comply, as CC's protect you! 

I am sending a link to this review to Crunch Fitness too. Also I am adding a SNIP from the website, so when the link goes down you can see the exact wording, that is Unfair and Deceptive advertising.

As expected, the first thing they started to was ask me stupid questions about my goals when I inquired about membership. In so tired of market strategies employed by gyms. I don't care about your product line, your personal training sessions, or your different membership levels. The first thing they asked is "what my goals are?" I immediately answered by saying "going to work out as soon as possible." Then they asked for my home number, email and some other questions about other gyms that I work out at. I politely told the guy that none of that matters and to just sign me up for the cheapest plan you have without a contract. Sorry Fitness Connection but I'm not going to listen to a business lecture; I'm not buying a time-share. Even during slow hours this place is packed. They have absolutely everything you would need but be aware that it is very busy. Pretty much all of the dumb bells have missing numbers/weight amounts so sometimes you have to guess which is ridiculous. A lot of the Precor/Life Fitness machines are missing the directional placards which can be a problem for new people. It bothered me even though I'm pretty familiar with the fitness world. Also, some of the Precor/Life Fitness machine have increment weights that have the increment rubbed off or missing so you don't know if you're on the 0, 5, 10 or 15 increment. With as much money as this place is making with its sketchy marketing strategies they should be keep these machines up. It's relatively clean and for the $10 a month plan it's decent enough but if you have a problem with crowded gyms then this place is not for you.

Two stars are for this particular location. I don't want to give even one star but the sales manager, Josh made sure my babies and I were okay with our first visit today and apologized for what had happened to us so I'm giving stars. I'm a happy Lifetime member and I enjoy my visits with my family at NY location. No complains! However, after today's visit to Mt. Laurel location as a guest, I was very disappointed. I felt very offended by their unwelcoming staff (Abby at the front desk and Odeta at Kids Academy). Especially with that kind of staff and attitude at Kids Academy, I will NEVER leave my kids there.

Today I had a free session with Tyler and he was great! He didn't push me to buy sessions and he wasn't obnoxious at all! I have been a member of the gym for a couple of weeks and so far all the staff are pleasant and courteous.

Our memberships were transferred here from Fitness 19 when they recently closed. They had reps at F19 the final week explaining they would be taking over our memberships and keeping our current rate plans, also explaining the amenities and location of their club. We were really wanting to enjoy it here, and the staff was super friendly when we came in. I'm not a gym snob at all, but I did manage the operations for a 24 Hour fitness about a decade ago, and we had newer equipment than this place. Their cardio equipment is a hodgepodge of stuff that looks about 20 years old. I saw someone step on a machine and a piece of plastic broke off. There are loose wires coming out of the ground not connected to anything and they have duct tape holding other wires to the carpet. A lot of concerns from a safety standpoint come to mind here.  It was really warm the day we worked out, and I heard someone else ask their staff if the AC was working, she replied yes, it's on full blast, but it definitely didn't feel like it--more like the heat was on. The free weights and machine side is what it is, no frills, kind of old school, no real problem there. Classes are included, which they seem to have a lot of and they also have a smoothie bar.  I was really blown away though by the fact that they stated to us that  we were getting a great deal from our old membership with F19, because normally their memberships are roughly $30.00 a month. We were paying $10.00 at F19. Great location, not-great parking and in bad need of a cardio re-fresh. We'll look elsewhere.

Great gym, service, and price. Has a great selections and amount of equipment. Far superior to any other gym in Channelside/Harbour Island area.

Only wish it had a basketball court.

I have a love-hate relationship with LA fitness.

They get three stars instead of two just because of their monthly membership fee. Outside of that, they have few redeeming qualities.

Today, among their many debacles, there were no lights on in the entire Bala Cynwyd location. This was because the person who opened didn't know how to get the lights on. Thankfully, you could go swimming as there were some overhead lights left on. You couldn't do anything in the ladies locker room because it was pitch black.

Frequently, pools  are being worked on or gyms are being remodeled; it is a frustrating experience to have a membership with LA fitness.

I tried to get a tour of the facility before deciding if it was the right fit for our active family. They made appointments and canceled them multiple times. Finally they stopped responding to requests to tour the place. We really wanted to get our daughter into their school, but we decided with the lack of follow through it was best to look elsewhere

Looking for a gym that keeps you interested and motivated? I decided to give it a shot because usually I lose interest in a gym a month or so after I start....I don't want to be in control of the workout, I want a trainer to tell me what to do.  I can't afford a personal trainer 3 times a week so Orange Theory is the perfect solution.  I love that I can't be late, and I can't cut my workout short.....just show up and everything will take care of itself.  It's been 3 months and I am ripping thru the workouts, dropping weight, and building muscle!  Joining was the best decision I have made for my health in a long time.  I should rate OTC 5 stars, the only reason I didn't is because of the 12 hour late cancel policy.

I cannot say enough about my home away from home.  Danny and his team are amazing.  They are my extended family. I began my training in the Strong and Healthy Woman's program with a colleague of mine over 5 years ago.  I had no formal gym knowledge and knew nothing about kettlebells.  That didn't matter.  Everyone took the time, and with great patience, to help me learn and become stronger. After a year or so with the Strong and Healthy Woman's Program I moved over to the Barbell Club.  I've never looked back.  The Barbell club has helped me achieve strength goals I never thought were possible.  I have continued my strength training through two pregnancies and was supported and cared for every step of the way. Tucson Strength has given me confidence in an area of my life that I didn't know was possible. In my profession it is important that I have an outlet for stress release; Tucson Strength is that place.  I know when I walk in that not only will I be challenged and told to #handlemyshit, but that I will be cared for like I am family.   I've seen this gym expand and grow not only in knowledge but in size too.   The new facilities cannot be matched. Danny, thank you.  You guys are remarkable.

One of the best decisions I've made coming here! I've been training for 8 months and my coaches Joe and Gus are amazing. I came originally wanting to learn more about self defense and get a good workout but I came out of it building a ton of confidence and building tons of strength. The community is great and everyone is really in the zone during a class. Every class is fun a diverse and you can build skill easily with time. The coaches are super supportive and incredibly kind. It's 100% worth the price if you are interested. There's a class for everyone and a ton of different times so you can fit it into your schedule (I'm a waitress and a student so I'm super busy but there's still classes I can always fit in.) whatever level of strength or fitness you're at I recommend trying it out, it gives you a boost in your step and the classes don't even feel as long as they are because they are so engaging. Thank you guys!

I've been going to this studio for over half a year now and it still deserves its five stars.

Since I've gone here, Green Locus has changed ownership. To be honest, I have no idea who the old owner was, but I definitely know the new one - Mallory. She is here constantly. Day time class, she's here, nighttime class, she's here, I don't think she ever leaves. I love supporting locally owned and operated businesses and this one checks all the boxes.

Now that I'm no longer pregnant, I no longer take prenatal yoga. Lucky for me, there is Mommy and Me Yoga! This studio is super family and kid friendly. They have yoga for older children as well. My class is for 18 months and younger. If you are thinking about bringing a baby to yoga, do it. Are you afraid your baby will misbehave and you'll be judged? Don't worry about that, there is no way your baby is crazier than mine. In the past eight classes we have taken, I've done maybe a total of an hour of yoga combined. All those other babies laying on the ground? None of those are my baby, mine is being held in the air Simba style, and that's ok. The great thing is this is more about the community than the yoga. I've made great friends in this class and I bet anyone who visits will too.

But let's say you aren't pregnant or a mom, they have tons of other classes. I had some classes leftover from the pack I bought for prenatal so I used it for Yoga for the back. The class was awesome and the people are super friendly. Again, I felt like I was part of a community. 

Yoga not your thing? They also have barre and ballet classes. Barre is the one fitness class that I hated in the past, I shook the whole time, but I'm willing to try it again. 

If you're looking for a yoga studio, give this one a try. I bet you'll love it as much as I do.

Great place for a kids party!!! Little cold but fun! Kids get a wristband from the front desk (which I think the party planner/person paying should get the throng of wristbands as it takes a while to get it from the person checking for your waiver sheet.) something about that check in thing could be improved but otherwise pretty fun! I'd suggest 4+ for a party or night out here. I also saw a sign that said Sunday nights from 6-8 pm if you pay for a parent a kid gets in free. Something to try!

My partner and I came to St. Pete for vacation last year and an internet search directed us to BE. We were not disappointed. We are back at BE again, one year later, and love it so much we bought a class pass to go as often as possible during our week here. We have been to many studios in our travels and this is our hands down favorite. My favorites this week were Monday hot hatha with Jenny, and then tonight a 7:15pm also hot class with Michelle.  It is the studio to which we compare all other studios. BE attains the yoga community energy on and off the mat. They are involved with the community (do service) and offer events geared at the task of helping yogis in their endeavors to live all yogi principals. Keep up the good work my friends, your efforts are so appreciated.

We just joined and the gym itself is great. However; I do not appreciate the hard sell on the training sessions. First off I have worked with a trainer before and support the benefits, but they were SO obnoxious and pushy trying to get us to purchase training sessions (@$45 a pop) that I am completely turned off and wouldn't do them now if they were free

Fair warning: if you're one of those people who enjoys pilates because it's typically less strenuous than most cardio or strength training workouts... then this class is NOT for you.  Lithe Method takes the word "workout" to another level.

This class is definitely worth it for anyone who wants to get in shape quickly as well as for people like myself who appreciate different, fun ways of working out.  I lost weight from the Immersion class alone. I recommend taking the Immersion class, as Lithe is very much its own thing, and mastering the basics will allow you to get much more out of the workouts in the regular classes.

The food is also delicious, although it's overpriced and probably not a sustainable habit for most people.  I've had the Athena Frittata (amazing), Quinoa w/ Chickpeas and Spinach (very good, minus the raisins), and Kale Salad (decent).

EXTREMELY DIRTY.... horrible staff who is always on their phones and leaving the scan machines on counters. They hardly ever greet you let alone looks like clean the gym at all. I was at the gym the other day and spent an hour there and the same sock laying on the floor right next to the front desk that was there when I walked in. It always smells Like a gym locker that's never cleaned! I refuse to lay on the mats in fear I will get a staph infection or ring worm. ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING AND WASTE OF $29.99/month prob why I belong to 2 gyms but can't get the rude manager to help me cancel she's always "busy" and the other front desk people tell me they can't help me.

I was kinda getting tired of all the vanilla style cycling classes that had mostly one position (cycling on the bike) while listening to mild temper music that made it hard to follow and truly engage. 

This place is a breath of fresh air.... or should say i place you will be out of breath! most of the classes are hip hop cycling where you will do many different types of positions to upbeat music that you will actually want to dance (or cycle too). The instructors are awesome and they do wonderful job of keeping the classes high energy and highly engaged.

I've found a gem in the Riverview/Brandon area!

If you see a MILF in the Cherry Hill area, ask her if she goes to La Belle Fit. Chances are the answer is yes. This place attracts the cream of the crop from the area. 

I had a Groupon and was very, very excited to try the Barre Ampped classes. I enjoyed the classes tremendously.  Great workout although not as intense as I would have liked.  (Of course, I had just finished months of straight Pilates and running so I was in pretty good shape.) I've only done the TRX and Barre classes here but they also have Zumba, pilates, yoga, etc.
