A few comments-yes, some of the instructors vary in quality and teaching style which stinks because these classes are expensive and for what you're paying, you should be able to get consistency.  This is normal for gyms though bc you will like some teaching styles better.

It is also pricey which deters me from going more often. They run specials frequently on their website which helps with the cost i.e. a barre class will be $13 instead of $20.

I was a member of retro fitness for a year, during that time I had Samantha as a personal trainer, she's since been promoted (yay) which means she's no longer training which is a bummer. The training was kind of pricey but I'd just had a baby and wanted some accountability and motivation, my pre-pregnancy jeans are now big for me, mission accomplished! CK is pretty busy but if you can get a training session in with him you're in for a treat. 

However, this is not an ideal place to lift weights if you can't get in before or after peak hours. People tend to hog the squat racks, of course you can ask to rotate in but that's kind of a pain. They are also always trying to sell those dang shakes! 

Bathrooms are always freshly cleaned, they have a movie room which I thought was kind of neat and they just added massages. Staff is very welcoming and helpful.

Considering the cost is only $10-$20 per month, this membership is well worth it! The gym is clean, staff is friendly, and equipment is great. I like the option to hook up my ear buds to the TV audio. I never have to wait for equipment, even during peak hours. The wifi is pretty spotty and they don't offer classes, but it was definitely a great choice to join this gym, especially for the price.

This gym would have been a 5 star if it had a few extra amenities. As far as equipment goes, this place covers everything (even if it is only one). For a relatively new facility, the entire staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Even on a Thursday lunch hour, the place was packed! Good job!

If you're going to give them business you should know how they treat people. I applied here for work, followed up with them, they couldn't even do me the courtesy of a callback. A few weeks later I run into the (at the time) manager Jim Abrams and he says "Planet Fitness wont hire you, its your age, maybe for overnights but they wont put you at the front counter." True story. I tried to get a hold of the district manager, multiple times, to report this behavior, left messages with every club, never got a call back. Aside from this place being a joke of a gym, no real bench, no real free-weights section, they practice age discrimination.

yazzzz Steve Pulcinella's gym is by far one of my favorite gyms of all time and I've been to Super Training before (have yet to visit BB). 

The facility is freaking amazing. Steve really spoils his lifters. You'll never be waiting for a bar that you need, but you'll probably be waiting for a squat rack lol. He has plenty of platforms for weightlifters and even deadlifting. He has bumper plates, eleiko plates, metal plates, etc. There's really so much to choose from at this facility. He also has an array of accessory machines and cardio machines for those who want to be a bunny. 

The atmosphere is awesome. There's always lifters who encourage each other and his dog who always barks at you haha. 

Steve sells a bunch of goodies up front like Lenny and Larry's cookies, drinks, etc. He has everything! 

It is $10 a day I believe, and I totally don't mind paying to come here and there. If you're deciding to visit this gym, I'd say go for it!

Kate & Rebecca MAKE MY WEEK. I will actually be disappointed when people start planning day drinking activities on Saturdays again because the 0945 Saturday class is what I live for. Should I start with the playlists? A little bit 80s, a little bit pop, and a little bit Pursuit of Happiness Kid Cudi- it's saying something that I am completely gassed at the end of class and still want to sing along. Kate and Rebecca both have a way of encouraging the crap out of you and also being the tough ass instructor you need and love. They tend to end the class on an inspirational note/ which no lie, brings me to tears sometimes, and then remind you to also go indulge on your Bloody Mary (thank god). 

I love this place. I missed it during Quarantine. I'm so glad to be back and happy that they have amped up the cleaning and spacing. Can't wait til we can a class packed full of people again!

Went in for a thinking I would get a really good stretch. 
Came out with my lower body stretched. 

I am pleased that they give high school students a place to be employed.

For my first gym membership it's pretty good. The equipment is new and very nice. I've never has to wait for anything. My boyfriend go and workout together when we can. Its very important to me that I can feel comfortable enough working out alone. Some cons are that the sauna isn't finished (still) and there are no scales (seriously you're a gym and you don't have scales!?). Oh well, went out and bought my own. I go about 5 days a week and always get greeted by some staff member.

I'm not a climber, but I love this gym. I joined for their morning circuit class taught by an InnerStrength trainer and quickly fell in love with their evening Yoga classes (taught by Sanctuary For Yoga) and Abs classes (also from InnerStrength). Their workout room is small but rarely used and contains two elliptical machines, a rowing machine, a treadmill, a bike and countless weights. I've never had to wait for either. Tuesday nights are a pretty crazy time to go as there are many young children climbing.

Stacy, I respectfully disagree with your opinion.  So what if the employees are young and "fit"?  It's a GYM!  They are there to represent health and fitness... I'm sorry that you felt inadequate and out of place but trust me, the staff here is incredibly friendly and remarkably more so than the staff at other gyms in Tucson.  I have been a member of Chuze since before they opened their first location in central Tucson.  I know for a fact that every staff member is incredibly approachable and trained on how to use all the pieces of equipment in the facility.  Not having the confidence to approach a staff member on how to use the equipment is nobody's fault  I am more than positive that had you given them a chance instead of prejudging them based on their physical appearance, you too would be a believer of Chuze.  

I will say, however, that this gym is not for everyone.  If you are looking for a gym where you walk in and are immediately greeted by a personal trainer that is going to put you through a tailored and customized workout, Chuze is not for you.  There are other area gyms that will cater to this type of clientele, but their membership prices are upwards of $80-$300/month.  

What I love about Chuze fitness and all their clients that go there is that we all have one thing in common- we all started somewhere.  Wether you are just looking to "tone up", overweight, or trying to maintain fitness, Chuze fitness will always be there to provide the tools you need to reach your goals.  All you have to do is make the commitment to yourself and start going.  No one can make that choice except for you.

As far as the bank account goes, there is no way that Chuze withdraws $40 out of your account every month.  Their highest tier of membership is $19.99 a month and with tax it comes to $21.39.  They have withdraw dates either 2 or three times a month and the date that they withdraw will be clearly printed on the terms of service that you would have signed upon joining- that is probably the "reminder" you would want to refer to.

I myself will admit that I have not been the most dedicated in going the last 6 months.  However this is a subscription service, not a pay as you go kinda deal.  So that means wether you go or not, you bet that the money will still be withdrawn from your account.  Again- this is a commitment, a dedication, and a way of life and not suited for everybody.

I personally love the east location because it's way less volume than the other Chuze gyms in town.  I started at the central location and worked my way over here when I realized I was more comfortable to do my workout routines with less people around.  I personally like that the staff stays out of your way but I am not everybody- I can only speak for myself.

I hope that you do give Chuze fitness another try, as they are a remarkable gym that has the potential of bringing a healthy lifestyle to people at a reasonable price.  The unlimited hydromassage and tanning are an extra bonus (although i really wish they would bring the standup booth to this location...)

I have been and will continue to be a loyal Chuze customer for many many years to come.

I've been going here for almost a year now. It's an excellent facility and probably the only luxurious club in the South Jersey area. The workout area is great. Aside from the traditional workout equipment (dumbbells, benches, machines, squat racks etc.) there are also a variety of other equipment  such as TRX, ropes, rowing machines, tires, punching bags etc. so you can do a variety of workouts. There's also a ton of squat racks, which is great cause most gyms only have about 2-3. So if you're squatting or deadlifting, it's easier to get a rack (unless there's a class going on). 

They offer a variety of classes all day, which is great if you're more of a class type. Within each class type, there are also different varieties. For example, there are about 4/5 different yoga classes offered (heated, surrender, root etc.) Different kinds of classes offered are yoga, spin, Pilates, cardio circuit classes (HIIT), kickboxing, kettleball, TRX, weight training etc. The majority of the classes are included with your membership but there are a couple that you'll have to pay extra for. You can also work with a personal trainer, which you'll have to pay extra for. 

The locker rooms are great and spacious. There is a sauna and steam room both in the locker room. They have complimentary towels, hair dryer, lotion, razors, shaving cream, mouthwash, body wash, shampoo and conditioner in the locker room so you don't need to worry about bringing any of that. There's both an indoor and outdoor pool with a hot tub as well. The outdoor pool can get pretty crowded during the summer time. The cafe is pretty  nice too. They have a lot of healthy food options and good protein shakes. Highly recommend the almond butter shake!! There's also a spa, barber and different massage services offered.


Overall, this is a great gym. There a lot of amenities, classes, and equipment offered that most gyms do not have. It is obviously on the pricier end ($100 a month), but you get what you pay for. The only criticism I have is spacing and the weight room area. The middle jungle gym area can get crowded at times with all the equipment. It would have been nice if it was a little bigger and spread out. Also, the dumbbell rack area can be crowded at times due to lack of dumbbells and benches. I came from LA Fitness before and they have dumbbells in 2.5lb intervals all the way up to 55lb, but Lifetime only has 2.5lb intervals up to 30lbs.

Atmosphere:

The atmosphere is large, but individual oriented. The gym has plenty of room to "stretch". Plenty of cardio machines, weights. Has a private women's weight room, which is nice! I always find the fitness classroom small. Some days there aren't enough room to attend a fitness class. 

Staff:

Upfront staff:
The staff is ALWAYS helpful at this location. I've had questions regarding vitamins, classes, and other questions regarding the gym in general.The gals up front always has the answer or goes and retrieves the answer. 

Personal Trainer:
I have a PT, Kelsey, she is such a delight to work with. She ensures she not only "coaches" but teaches you how to stay fit and get strong. She listens to the clients, and works around their needs. She ensures the individual is correctly conducting exercises. She is consistent with pushing you to the limit, but always accounts for your strength and weaknesses. She ensures the works outs are not stagnant. Overall, she is  one of the greatest PT's I've ever had. 

Classroom Fitness Instructors:
I've attended many different classes; with different instructors. The mass majority want to see you, the individual, succeed. The instructors strive to get to know each individual, especially when you become a regular. 


Prices:

The price is congruent to other gym memberships in the area. 


Location:
Meridian  



Parking / Venue: 
Plenty of parking! 






Star rating:
4 out of 5


More importantly Would we ever go back? 

Haha! Yes.

visited as a guest with a friend and had a wonderful day. i am a member at another gym and I have to say I was extremely impressed with this facility and location!
everyone had a great attitude and I experienced exception customer service and help.
their fitness manager has an obvious extreme knowledge and has great energy!
it was nice that he was around and available if needed. I wish the fitness manager at MY gym was like that. 

overall had a fabulous time
will return whenever in the area!
Love working on my fitness! Bikini mode!

This is a great environment to lose the meatball. It's a fun place to workout in a helpful team environment. When combined with a personal trainer you will Be all set. I am a year away from being put out to pasture and I use it for cross training for stair climbing. I can't wait to see my results at next years climb and at the Redbull 400 in September.

I went there yesterday for a simple tour as I've recently moved to this side of Tucson and Chuze is now too far to make my weekly spin classes on time. The receptionist was very friendly and tried his hardest to get the quote on quote "gm" to come give us a tour. After 15 minutes the "gm" arrived sweaty with a completely soaked shirt as if he just got out of the shower or was working out on the clock. 

He then proceeded to tell us about the options in membership and didn't even offer a tour until I said I wanted one. This made it abundantly clear that we were being an inconvenience to him. 

He didn't discuss many of the options and I kept having to pry for more information. For someone who is a sales person you think he would have tried to engage with us a little more. 

He had little to no information on the spin class as that was my main reason for being there. 

He then took us directly back to the sales pitch where he discussed the options for signing up not even allowing us to think about it. I told him I had a membership already and wanted to wait until June. He said, " I wasn't the only one with double membership and this was the best deal they offer". It wasn't and isn't. I already knew there was an offer for 20% a membership online. 

Ugh, I told him we would ask for him when we came back because I know they work off of how many sales they get and need to keep their quota. He got extremely defensive and asked me "who told you that!" I simply said I used to work sales and I know how this goes.

 My boyfriend being kinder then myself signed up for a family membership (which is completely our fault as we should have just done the individual for me). This guy was a grease ball. He claimed to be giving us extra materials like lanyards, towels, a book. The book was used and had someone else's name written in it. 

Bottle line: we were swindled, felt like inconveniences, and no-genuine interest given to us. I'll be trying the spin classes for the free 7 days then making my decision. The sales tactics need new perspective. I would have felt better if someone showed more interest in my becoming a member then the just a sales pitch opportunity.

No judgement free circuit zones for me.  I have a FREE gym membership with my job, but a one hour trip to the gym, turns into 2 because I have to wait for machines... Spent two weeks in the Charlotte area and was a guest of a member at the area locations.  I fell in love with the order and convenience of the 30/12 minute circuit program and the customer service.  Returned to New Orleans and joined...  Service- 2-3 ppl behind the counter looking down.  Circuit- 30/12 minute areas used as personal gym, when I attempt to get to the next station (in order), the other members get irritated or will not move, they will not wipe down machine because they are annoyed. The time I spend walking to the counter for the staff/manager to say, our policy is... (NOT OUR PROBLEM), we have to stay at the counter... is using up my gym time.  Then they share that everyone complains about it... and another member curses out members who do not move (put him on the payroll and I will schedule time with him!).  There is a white board that states a policy, they CHOOSE not to enforce. I even started attempting to find you a solution; guess what you have camera's in those areas????  You can monitor from the counter. I joined because of the 24 hr circuit availability and the service I received in Charlotte. One FB post, 3 conversations with staff and 2 suggestion box submissions later, I had to cancel my membership.  I guess you have enough members.  What really annoys me is, I recommended PF circuits to about 50 ppl when I returned... I am so embarrassed.  If everyone says the program is broken, get rid of it; continuing to market something you cannot manage is false advertising.  Throw out the red/green light and white board that says you will ask someone to leave or cancel their membership.  I really do cancelling my membership but I cannot to take my quality time to manage your members or program. Such a great unmanageable concept....

OUTSTANDING SERVICE BY THE REGIONAL MANAGER- Verushka Lagos!!!! FIVE STARS FOR HER RESPONSIVENESS!!!  You need to find 20 more of her!  I may return once I move..

What a fabulous hotel spa.  The services, particularly  by Jenny, are top notch. It is close to the subway so riders like me can get there easily. I am not sure about nearby parking as it is located in a difficult-to-park area of Philadelphia, so I have not driven there. The prices are a little steep, but not when compared with similar hotel spas.  The biggest bonus by the way is that you can use the pool, jacuzzi and sauna with your facial and massage.  Don't skip that part!

This is a 3.5 star place, but it's new so I rounded up. 

So I decided to give this place a try because I love boxing and I've taken classes all over the city. They start counting down ten minutes before and it's a very audible countdown. Then they begin by showing you all the punches. Followed by quickly paced calisthenics to warm up with lungs, pushups, and the like. After that they give you a few combos to start and as the time in the round goes on they add additional combos. During my class, people were going around with mitts and people were doing one-on-one combos for a few seconds which I liked. At the end we did abs for ten minutes and cooled down. 

Pros:
- one-on-one mini sessions
- being able to see your punch score at the end of class
- the difficulty of the combos 
- instructors seemed like real boxers 
- good for beginners

Cons:
- The music during my class was really generic and that really did not get me in the mood to do the class which was a huge miss on their part. 
- lack of jump rope component 
- no complimentary towels
- a bit gimmicky with the constant "how are y'all doing tonight" call and responses 

Additional things to note:
- you are working out in an all glass gym right on the corner of market and 21st. People can see you from the street so if you want to be hidden, choose a bag that more towards to back and the middle. 

- bring your own lock for the lockers. They are right out in the open, but you never know. 

- they have gloves and wraps. Not sure if you can rent them, but you can buy and if you plan on boxing at all in the future, I'd highly recommend buying. 

- plan on getting dressed before you come because there are only two bathrooms there.

All in all, great new addition to the center city work out circuit. Looking forward to them finding their groove.

So, I decided that I wanted to try out City Fitness and I figured being a former Ballys member it wouldn't take much to be better! So, I got a 1 week pass to City Fitness and it wasn't bad. I like their cardio equipment because you have your own TV to watch while working out, which is really nice. You can workout an entire hour watching The Devil Wears Prada. 

Its a nice place to workout and there is plenty of room and help if you need it from the staff. I only wish they had a steam room or hot tub! That could just complete the picture! :) 

Lets hope in their new location when they decide to span out - there is a steam room and a hot tub.
Taking the gym spa experience to the next level. Great for families with young kids.  Tailored personal training

Love the Caughlin Club. The staff is friendly and accommodating. I was a member here 20+ years ago and loved the tennis program. Now I use this club for the gym and for the pool. I come with my 9 yr old and we love it our time at the pool in the summer or on the Basketball court during year round. My son attends the afterschool program and summer camps here as well and we have nothing but positive feedback! Great place for active families.

if you are looking for a martial-arts based kickboxing place, this isn't it. HOWEVER, if you are looking for a high-energy, fun, enjoyable cardio-style kickboxing place, this is it! the classes are heated (hence the 'hot' in the name), so you get warmed up quicker and get into the moves smoothly. sometimes it is hard to hear the instructors (bad mic?) over the music, which can be less than awesome when you're trying to follow along.

everyone is there to enjoy the classes, so there doesn't seem to be any dude-bro/mean-girl vibes going on, which makes attending class even more enjoyable.

front desk staff have all be nice and are willing to answer all the questions you might have.

note: i have not tried the weight lifting classes at this time, only the kickboxing.

there are far more pros than there are cons with this gym, for sure.

Everyone at this gym makes you feel so welcome. Classes kick your butt, while educating you on what parts of your body are impacting the way you are moving. I really enjoyed my first class here, the bootcamp with Bao, and the attention I got while working out was really helpful both in my form, and in my workout- I was able to change how I was doing my kettlebell swings, for example, and immediately felt the difference. I've done probably thousands of kettlebell swings incorrectly and all it took was a little attention to help me course correct.

The class participants were also really fun, and welcoming- I didn't feel like an outsider even with it being my first time. 

They have a smoothie bar for your post-workout fuel, and I loved the green-drink to help recover. Several options to choose from and they are all pretty reasonable prices, too, woot woot.

Street parking and a parking lot are options, which is pretty great considering I was worried about finding a spot given it's across the street from townhouses. 

Last, bring your own sweat towel!
Great place to let the little ones run around and play when it's open gym. My son had a blast. They have a lot for the little ones to enjoy there.

Loving this gym. Staff is super nice and friendly. My daughter is taking swim lessons and is having an amazing time. She also is able to do kids yoga which she loves. I'm loving the fact that I can work out while she does her activities.

If you like to get all gross and nasty when you work out, this is the filthy club for you. Just ask the cleaning staff. They work extra hard to keep it filled with hair, tissue, grease and sorts of totally nasty stuff to fill your every nasty desire. And that's just the bathrooms. Try checking out the lockers. Or better yet - the actual workout equipment. Totally gross. They shut this gym down for renno last fall but turned out it was only to create the exclusive training space.  Same crappy equip. Not monitors on your treadmill. I maintained weight machines. Worth every penny to be part of montgomeryville's finest!

I love me some PSC.  I mean let's be honest, all gyms are shysters, but PSC is the least syster-ish I've ever encountered (that's a compliment).  Living in Fairmount there are 2 gym options- PSC and Lifesport, after riding the Lifesport train, and eventually being run over by it, I have been faithfully devoted to PSC ever since! I'm a cardio kinda gal and can appreciate that there are plenty of machines, that each have their own TV's.  The only time I've ever had to wait for equipment is during NY resolution season, but that's always short-lived.  I don't shower there, but there's a steam room and suana that I appreciate.  My favorite part of PSC is that the staff, and specifically the management, is so wonderful to deal with (which is extremelly rare when dealing with gyms).  Although $60 is a bit pricey for a gym, that's one of the downfalls of living in the city.

If I could've given a half star I would've!! They're thirst buckets trying to get you to join. You turn invisible once a member and the "gym culture", (this gym especially) standard is all staff that's got this "blah-zay" attitude about everything. Membership so cancelled!!! #2thumbsdown #lafitnesssucks

One of the best spin/high intensity fitness studios I've found.

I travel a decent bit for work, so I'm always looking for a great, locally-owned group fitness studio in different cities. And when you come to Nashville - where the superb Southern cuisine is not shy on calories - finding a great work out is clutch. Tylt offers the best spin equipment in the game - the bike actually rotates right and left (simulating a real road bike), and works both your balance and core strength/stability.

Off the bike, there is circuit training involving a blend of free weights, mats, resistance bands, and TRX. You rotate stations (7-8 min per) until you hit all of them.

Finally, Paige is a rockstar instructor/hype girl. She clearly knows what she's doing, isn't short on enthusiasm, and delivers one hell of a workout. Added perk for Yelp users - if you check in, they add a class to your account.

For some reason, I can't stand this place.  Let's not even get into the complexities of canceling your membership.

One problem here is hours.  They close VERY early on weekends, and close relatively early on the weeknights.  They open at the crack of dawn.  This isn't helpful to most people, like myself, who'd prefer to work out in the evenings.  They're obviously doing the typical downtown thing and trying to make workers happy, while giving residents a fairly intense screwjob.  I'm used to gyms with late night hours in major cities.

Here's some tips.  And this comes from a customer, not somebody who knows anything about running a gym:  for one, expand your hours.  It's not that hard.  Two, encourage people to take care of the machines.  In general, many St. Louisans tend to not understand communal situations like gyms where your mother isn't there to clean up after you.  I don't enjoy getting on a cardio machine and having to spend 5 minutes (while I'm already rushed due to the early closing time) wiping some douchebag's drool, spittle, and sweat off the machine.

I recently moved to Philly and found Malcolm on Yelp. I have been working with him for 8 months now 2-3 days a week. I love that I get a good workout in but also don't end up overly sore that I can't even move the next day. In the 8 months, every session has been different, nothing is ever repetitive and it keeps me engaged more than if it was the same cycle of workouts but heavier weights. He motivates me to also eat well and make sure to get cardio in when I can. I am more toned, fit and motivated to keep up my good work throughout the day after a session! I was absolutely recommend him!

Philly Dance Fitness, I love love love you. I wish I had a more predictable schedule so I could regularly attend Zumba and Cardio Hip Hop, as my experiences with both of these classes thus far have been quite positive. The instructors are enthusiastic and encouraging, music selection is great, and I walk out of class definitely having gotten my money's worth in terms of the workout. I've attended classes both at their South Street location and their new pop-up in Nest and found both of the spaces to be adequate, lots of mirrors which is key when you're trying to keep straight what direction you're supposed to be going in. Class schedules are available on their website, and their Facebook page posts the day's schedule daily.

Can't say enough about the JCC.  It really is "user friendly" and fills everyones needs from young to old.   I've been coming here for 5 years and really feels like home.  I've made many friends and relationships with the Staff and gym rats.  Me being one of the rats.  The instructors in the classes are the finest you can get anywhere.  Zumba, Power Sculpting, Yoga, Body Pumping all great.  Dance party  with Rhina is one of my favorites.  Not to mention, the workout room.  Newest equipment.  The JCC weaves a spark into my  life and adds so much positive vibes to my soul.  It starts my day on the right track.  Thanks JCC.

Great spot to workout.  The place is very clean and has a lot of machines available.  My only issue is that the cables machine for pec flys and tricep pulldown is exclusively in the personal trainer section.  Overall the cleanliness and atmosphere is very good and would recommend this LA fitness.

What I like about PF is the 30 minute circuit. Except when people think they can take as long as they want on a machine. After being called a dumbass twice for saying it was time to get off I went to the front desk. All the employee there was concerned about was avoiding an argument. What's the point of the posted rules if the staff doesn't bother to enforce them.
I don't expect 72 degree in a gym, but this is ridiculous. They refuse to turn on A/C when temperature outside changes. Extremely humid inside!

I started taking Jiu Jitsu at Combat Fitness as a way to exercise and start a new hobby. I set up a meeting to take a tour with Jesse Brock and he was very informative as to what I could expect. You can take a range of different classes from Jiu Jitsu to boxing to Muy Thai. There is also a modest free weight area if you wanted to get a lift in before or after training. The vibe isn't one of dominance or arrogance either. Everyone is there to learn, train, and have a good time. Jesse and all of the trainers are super nice and accommodating to everyone skill levels. I really enjoy the time I have spent at combat Fitness.

In this gym almost everyday and have been for the past few months. It's kept clean but they do need to enforce the the wiping down of the machines. Some of the staff could also use an attitude adjustment. Not very friendly or polite.

I joined LA fitness in Aug of 2019 great gym choice I ever made. There are few down falls especially when you have to use the bathroom there is no privacy as you walk past the old ladies getting dress which there needs to be covered dressing area as young teenagers workout they don't need to see a nude old granny boobies and more 
The equipment is ok not new they do there maintenance and up keep very well and very clean as I see the people always cleaning. 
The most annoying is when there sales ppl walk around asking there own Customers to promote LA fitness business I'm paying a monthly bill why would I promote a business for free? It's bad business tactic especially you are making money off customers using your facility monthly. if anyone promotes it hopefully you get something in return this is a billion dollar company. 
The Swift machine never has neck pads the personal trainer area keeps them if you ask they are rude as F about it I'm paying $$$ LA fitness should be offering  customers towels like some of the other local gyms. 
Good part is you are not fighting to use the equipment which is a plus. It's a business you either run it good or shitty.

The experience at Krank is different from other spin classes you may have experienced. When you walk in you might be concerned that you've stumbled into a crossfit gym, don't worry, you're in the right place. 

The staff was very friendly and greeted me immediately, handed me special spinning shoes and a fresh towel.They gave me a quick tour of the facilities and the instructor personally adjusted my seat height AND checked in with me after the class to see how I was feeling. 

I only have a minor complaint about the facility. The lockers are in a tiny hallway near the restroom. Personally, I get a little flustered with 15- 20 people trying to move in and out of a tiny hallway with their gym bags. I understand it's a small facility and they've done the best they can with the space. This is just to say that I really recommend getting there with some time to spare. That way you can avoid the hallway/locker smash up and have more time with the instructor, who is very eager to help! 

When class starts, the lights turn down and the music turns up. I got nervous when the instructor put on a microphone headset and told us to "turn it up to ten" while we pedaled our hearts out to Wipeout. 

The instructor is enthusiastic and encouraging and does a wonderful job keeping you updated on the progress of the class. "We are going to do x number of sprints now" I find that knowing what the mini goal at hand is really helps stay motivated. The class had great energy. Towards the end you use dumbbells for 5-10 minutes, this gives a slight cardio/lower body recovery but I wouldn't say it's enough to consider an upper body workout. 

I've taken a spin class or two in the past but I found them tedious. Sure they burned calories but I found myself watching the clock. You can only "sit. stand. Ok sit again" so many times. I wasn't bored for a second at Krank. There were moments when I wondered how much longer...but not because I had mentally checked out. 

This was one of the more intense workouts I've had in quite a while and I would definitely recommend this place to anyone, even a spin newbie like myself.

This was my first time at the Cherryhill Location. It was clean as it should be. It wasn't as many people as what I see at the Delran location. I decided to take the Zumba class with Bert and Landy. These guys are on fire. They had tons of moves, lots of energy, super fun and interactive. I sweat so hard my shirt was soaked as if I had jumped in a pool. That was what I came for to be worked out. I'm going to sleep so good. I think I'm sleep typing now. Try this class with these guys. You will not be bored or casually worked. 

Love these guys already!

I have never liked working out all that much. It's been something I've dreaded, made excuses about, and never really prioritized. I started coming to Fit Mania in 2014 and for the first time in my life, actually started to enjoy working out. As it happens, life got in the way from time to time and the consistency wasn't really there, but I made my way back whole-heartedly this year. It has been absolutely everything to me. It's my new hobby! The owners & trainers are great, it's nice to see familiar faces all looking to achieve personal goals together on a daily basis, and it's a really supportive environment. No one tries to push anything on you that you don't want to do. There is something for EVERYONE at Fit Mania!

Gym has gone downhill over the past year or so. I go there because there's not much of a choice of gyms nearby.

Among my beefs:
(A) You used to see gym personnel cleaning equipment, and I once actually saw a guy cleaning the mats in the stretching area. Now, those mats are disgusting and I hardly see anyone cleaning the equipment or the locker room.

(B) They recently purged all but three of their trainers, even the very good, experienced ones. Rumor has it they wanted everyone to go full time and most couldn't afford it (they pay the trainers crap and don't give health benefits, which adds to my not liking the place). I find this rumor hard to believe, though, because the three trainers they have don't seem to have many hours of training open. And of course,  when you only have three trainers, you know it'll be harder to line up a trainer at your convenience and if you don't like those three, tough luck.

(C) Along the lines of personal training, there's a revolving door of personal training managers. I've been there almost since its opening and I don't think any of them have lasted longer than 6 months. Which leads to a total lack of continuity and stability.

(D) Forget about any kind of interaction with the staff. If you were expecting friendly staff or people knowing your name because you're in there all the time, you won't get it. They barely look at you when they take your keys to swipe your card and hand it back to you. Maybe it's a small thing, but as the "Cheers' theme song says, it's nice to go where everybody -- hell, ANYbody -- knows your name.

(E) They often run out of paper towels out on the floor, so after you make the trek down there to find, surprise, surprise, there are none, you have to go back to the locker room to get one then go back to the paper towel dispensing area to put some cleaner on it so you can wipe down the equipment. And speaking of the cleaner, recently they were out of their usual clear stuff and put in some cloudy stuff that smelled like something they use on floors.

The good: It's close to home, the equipment is relatively new and maintenance is done on the equipment (unlike the old Lifestyles around the corner, where equipment fell apart and pieces peeled off the equipment). 

Please, someone out there, open up a gym close to South Pasadena/Gulfport that is large enough to have multiple pieces of the same equipment, clean enough that members are  not grossed out, decent enough to your staff (including trainers) that members don't mind giving you their money, nice enough that members feel like the staff and management knows they're lucky to have our money... My suggestion: Model it after St. Anthony's fitness center in Carillon (oh, if only that were closer!).

This place is dead now. I go back and forth btw CT and FL so I come to this location when Im in Tampa. Everyone that used to be there has ran off to other gyms. First it was Lori who was a wonderful body conditioning instructor, I enjoyed her class ever Thursday morning but she ran off sometime last year when the gym managers gave her grief for her style of training Carmen is ok for pilates but a really trained pilates instructor with modern moves would be much better, PLUS having the adding more pilate class to the rooster would make more sense. I used to train with Damien, he's gone, most of the trainers I used to see flew the coop, even the font desk staff are all new and inexperienced. One of the machines was turned off, instead of checking to see if it was just not plugged in or anything, a "need service" sign was just immediately placed. No one wants to do anything. There are not enough barbells either and all they have are the curled ones, even Planet Fitness has a mix of straight and curled barbells, two of each for every weight starting from 20lb. Since Ive been back I haven't seen the 40lb barbell anywhere and thats for I normally use for my strength training, but that's what happens when you only have one option.
I appreciate that they moved the location of the T-bar row, I no longer have to be around those trying to use the water fountain however the bar itself is more often than not no where to be found, which is really annoying, one would think at the end of the day staff would put things back the way they should be but that doesn't seem to be the case. There's only one flat leg curl machine for some reason, the seated leg curl doesn't do nearly as much for you as the flat one, there are also not enough weighted medicine balls to go around. There should be a set in the personal training room and a set for the general room. There should also be padded barbells for those who do hip thrusts with them or at least have padding around so we can add them ourselves. The fans for the treadmills are wonky, there should be fans on the stairclimber machines as well. Also there's not enough of the "better" treadmills to go around. They are only 4 clustered towards the right upstairs and 2 on the far left, the rest are subpar outdated ones.
I mainly come here now because of how close it is to my apt however with Damien now gone, Crunch will now be a serious consideration.

These guys know their stuff. I was really impressed with the amount of good stuff I learned during my CCW class. I'm former military and I still learned a couple pointers. These guys really do care about our community and it's safety.

Jumping from 2 stars to 5 stars is no small feat. This Club Fitness has done it! What a amazing job they did with the remodel.

Literally everything about this place is better. Here are a list of what are I feel are the major improvements:
- First floor has been opened up by relocating the childcare and spin area
- New and more cardio machines
- Locker rooms have been updated
- There is a women's only workout section
- Improved lighting throughout the whole gym
- Basement free weights areas have been expanded (this space wins for the most improved, no longer smells like sweaty socks)
- There are bathrooms on the first floor and the basement
- More water fountains
- Large digital clocks

This gym just feels so much nicer with the remodel. From the new gym equipment to the lights to the decor, I am very pleased.

I really can't think of other areas to improve. If you are looking for a gym, I'd recommend checking this location out.

Crossfit9 is the box that truly does have it all. The coaches, programming and environment are (in my opinion) the best in the area. Whether you're brand new to Crossfit or have worked out at other boxes there are classes that will fit your skill and fitness level. From 9fit bootcamps, Wods and Barbell Club, you can keep your workout schedule interesting and varied. One of my favorite things is the recovery yoga after our Sunday 9fit class... Super zen brah.

This has been life changing for me. I have been to many gyms and God only knows how many times other family members have tried to convince me to stay but I always felt lost or needing that extra direction or motivation... well, eventually life got in the way and another day missed. OTF Trinity is different and the care that is received from the wonderful professional fitness trainer team is like no other location or any other establishment I've been to. They keep you in line, want to challenge yourself to give it all for your Push pace. You will naturally find yourself giving it all and desiring to feel that burn. Anyone who knows me, would definitely do a "what-what" to hear me say this... YES, I LOVE TF Fitness place and our Professional Trainer team, not to mention the customer friendly support staff! I look forward to the nutritional class (free) and another helluva fat burning workout!!! I see and feel the difference. Just addictive- a good addiction!

This place is awesome. My boyfriend and I were interested in trying something new. We stopped in to check the place out. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. 
Who ever thought of this is genious. I can't wait to return with the kiddos. 
12 bucks for a day pass for adults  and 10 for kids...
Closed toe shoes are fine or you can rent or buy from them.

When compared to other similar LA Fitness Gyms in the area, this one:
Cons:
-is always missing dumbells or they are never in the appropriate rack
-no barbell spring clips to secure weights
-spinning classes may be dull and bicycles are outdated.
-they take weeks to fix broken/damaged machines or equipment; even for the most used ones.
-equipment and interior design looks and feels old.  
-not all water fountains work
-weight lifters tend to visit the gym with no inappropriate clothing 
-peak hours are almost imposible to use the equipment without having to wait for others
-no swimming pool in facility

Pros: 
-employees and management are very courteous 
-comfortable parking

If it wasnt because it was so close to my house, I will use a different location for regular workouts.  This is the worst LA Fitness and for the price, you can find a better gym in south philly.

Let me say right off the bat, this gym does not have classes.  They don't present themselves as having classes.  This gym has equipment...treadmills, stationary bikes, stair steppers, weights.  Based on these facts, this is an excellent gym.  It's clean, most (if not all) of the equipment come with tv's attached so you can plug in and watch a show while you work out.  

I joined a little over a month ago and chose this one because I mainly wanted to work on equipment and their hours work with my work schedule.  The employees are helpful if you need help or leave you alone if you just want to get in there and work out.  I pay about $20 a month for which I can not only use this Club Fitness, but the other CFs in the area.  There are different packaging plans available.  There's a Club Fitness in Hampton Village that does have the classes so it's not too far out of the way to go there.

This place is absolutely wonderful. Master Ray and his wife Ms. Lea along with every single one of their instructors are the absolute best with training these students. They all have such great patience. They are also very kind yet firm with the students. My grandson's self confidence has improved so much since he began coming here. He has goals & he understands that in order to achieve his goals it takes a lot of focus,self-discipline,practice, and hard work .The day he earned his green belt was one of his proudest moments as he knew how hard he worked for it. And most of all.....they stress values. Like honesty, integrity, and community service. 
I would recommend this studio for anyone who wants their child to get a good physical workout, learn martial arts and all the while having a great time. I can't thank this place enough for what they've taught my grandson.

Like many of the reviews here, good luck trying to cancel your account. I have tried MULTIPLE times to cancel my account with this place and each time, I'm told I'll receive a confirmation email or return call and never do. I'm still being charged and I'm not even in the state anymore! Absolutely ridiculous.

This is one extremely nice YMCA.  I wish I could visit it more often, but location just usually doesn't work for me If it did work, I would definitely join.
As far as alone excersise, they have an out any equine you could want. I especially love the pool, after a work out.
A very chill, laid back environment.  The staff is confident , casual, respectful & knowledgeable.
What more could you ask for a care free or dig it down deep work out. I love it & wish I lived closer!
What's a girl to do? Gotta get that gym time in wherever you can, just honestly ore likely to do it close to work or home.
Don't expect customer service... but if you want to  get out of the heat & don't want anyone to bother you by speaking to you or acknowledging your presence head on in!
Gabe is the best trainer I have ever had! I love reily because I always have a positive workout experience. It's a top notch facility and the staff is always friendly and accommodating.

This place is a godsend.  This review should only be read by avid climbers as I've never taken an intro or group class here.  You can skip to the section about the staff.
I am an avid climber and have been climbing indoors in San Francisco prior to coming here.  Basically, I got spoiled and my expectations were low when I came here.  But I was wrong and I am so happy I was.
The walls are definitely high enough -- can't give you an exact height, but if you're leading on a top rope wall, you can clip on 6 times until you hit the top.
It's got a great bouldering cave, and plenty of changing routes on the top rope wall.  There is also a section specific to lead climbing with routes in the 5.7-5.10 range.  If I were to estimate # of routes and their setting for TOP ROPE ONLY -- 5.5 (1), 5.6 (3), 5.7 (6), 5.8 (7), 5.9 (6), 5.10(6), 5.11(3), 5.12 (1), 5.13 (1).  The ratings here are also much harder than what I was used to in San Francisco (meaning a 5.9 here is much harder than a West Coast 5.9).
The thing that sold me was the staff.  Mike the owner is an amazing guy and ultra friendly.  Suraj, Brett, and Chris are the employees that work there most often.  They have amazing climbing skills and hang out in the bouldering cave all the time.
You'll see a lot of regulars and everyone is really friendly.  I climb here regularly to top-rope, boulder, and lead with or without my own clips.  Unfortunately, I am moving due to work changes and I will have to find a new gym in NYC...
Great place to go work out! Many different machines to choose from, up beat music to get you going & friendly staff. The owner Diane is wonderful!

Crunch Fitness (Meridian, Idaho)


When I'm traveling for work, I do what a lot of people do and that's to find the nearest gym. I found Crunch Fitness through Yelp. And to be honest, Crunch Fitness wasn't my go-to gym when I'm the area. But the gym I usually workout at closed their doors and the other gyms that I have memberships to were too far. I don't have a membership here so I can't give you an opinion on what it's like to be a member. What I can tell you is that this Crunch Fitness has some of the best old school equipment that's becoming rare to find at big box gyms. I usually pay $10 for a 24 hour pass. This may seem like a lot and it is considering that most monthly memberships are around $20. I'm all about stretching my funds and will typically get 3-4 workouts in a 24 hour period.  By far, this is my favorite gym in the Boise, Meridian, or the Eagle area. I highly recommend this gym if you're just in town a few days or if you're local.  

Pros:
-I love the equipment. This gym still has some of the older Nautilus and Hammer Strength 
-Metal plates and bumper plates 
-One squat rack and two power racks. 
-Deadlift platform also available 
-Heavy steel dumbbells 
-2 Smith machines
-2 cable stations 
-Enough cardio (dreadmills, bikes, & stair-monsters)
-Seated barbell rack for pressing
-Safety collars! No one steals them here. I didn't need to use my own.
-Nice and polite members. 
-Very clean gym. There's always a staff member cleaning. 
-The Manager and staff treat me like I'm a regular 

Cons:
-Tight dumbbell and bench area
-Only one flat, incline, and decline bench. Good luck on Monday aka International Chest Day
-Missing a Lying Leg Curl machine. Or, did I miss it?
-Not enough equipment for calves.

It was my Husband's Birthday so I wanted to treat him to a nice dinner somewhere. I had always heard Mr John's was better than Ruth's Chris (which is where we usually go) and wanted to dine there.

Recently, Mr John' s advertised a Groupon and I bought it.  I made our dinner reservation through Open Table.  I had left a message on the answer machine at Mr John's but no one returned my call.

We arrived at Mr John's for our 6pm reservation. We were seated at the very first table upon entering the dining room. I was not happy with this table, it appeared to be a busy traffic area, near the kitchen entrance. There were several empty tables (at least 8) in the room but when I asked the hostess for a different table she said the other tables had been reserved. We sat at our assigned table and dealt with the high foot traffic going by the table.

The waiter staff were great, very attentive. We started with a bottle of red wine, we enjoyed this wine having visited the winery recently in CA and knowing the winemaker as a past physician I worked with. My husband ordered the turtle soup and I had the wedge salad, both were very good. We both ordered the filet's. I would have given the restaurant a 5 star except they switched the steaks. I like rare and my husband likes his steak medium rare. I don't think they knew they made a mistake?

I had called Mr John's just before leaving home for the restaurant to ask if they did anything special for Birthday's. I alerted them it was my husband's birthday.  We ordered creme brûlée for dessert.  Either the message was not passed on to our waiter or he forgot to recognize the birthday.  The creme brûlée was good, but my husbands birthday was overlooked.

It was about 7:20 pm when we were finishing up with the bill.  I looked around the dining room once again before leaving, everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves.  More people had arrived but noticed there were 3 tables by the front windows that were still empty.  I wondered if we were seated based on having a Groupon???  Our table was in a busy noisy traffic area!

Although I would recommend this restaurant and would like to return, I was a little disappointed in how the evening turned out. It was important to me but seemed insignificant to them. I have to agree with my friend that said Mr John's is slightly better than Ruth's Chris.

I've been climbing here regularly for a few months. I've also brought friends and relatives here for fun day-trips. The atmosphere here is great! The staff are friendly and helpful, and all of the regulars seem super chill and nice.

There is a top-roping section, a lead-climbing section, and a bouldering section. Like the other reviewers have been saying, it's a little smaller than the average climbing gym, but they still have plenty of space and interesting routes to try out. They are also apparently expanding the size of their gym in March 2017, which we are all excited about.

Sometimes it gets busy on weekends during peak children's birthday party hours (12-4). But I've never had a problem with the kids-- the staff keeps them well in-hand. And if it ever feels too crowded in the top-roping section, you can always just climb in the bouldering section, which the kids never use.

The only frustrating experience I've had here involved an over-billing issue. It took a good while for them to put me in contact with the correct billing manager, and it still took some time after that to get the issue resolved. However, this is the only negative interaction I've had with the place, so it was probably just a one-off.

All in all, I think this gym is great both for beginners looking for a fun one-time activity or for long-time climbers looking for a permanent gym.
Love the lead routes! The setters are great, I constantly have a project because they reset every week!

This club membership is such a rip off. $255/month for a family of 4 and they no longer allow members to bring guests during peak months. Supposedly this is what the members asked for, well they didn't ask me. And they won't give out guest passes. 
$30/adult and $15/kid for guests from May1-Nov.1. Conveniently they put this policy into effect after we signed up for a year. The lady had assured me I could drop the kids off the membership in the colder months and just bring them as guests when I wanted to(up to 3 times a month). But now I'd have to pay every time I brought them or add them back in. 
More cons: the pool is frequently closed due to diaper accidents. 
The chlorine hurts my kids eyes and hair so much they are scared to swim here. 
Very limited classes offered. Only 1 or 2 decent spin instructors.

Like any other ATF this location is small and does not have a ton of equipment. With that being said you can tell it is a well kept location. There are 2 squat racks and dumbbells up to 100 lbs. The bathrooms and showers are huge and there is always an open treadmill and elliptical. While I usually go to the ATF in Westchase this is a top 3 location rivaling the Westchase location and the Odessa location.

Ripped PHL is sort of a cult: Katie is the (evil) leader, Malik and Alexander are her henchmen.  You go in, you get tortured, you find religion.  In 50 min, you get the complete HIIT experience. If you're dedicated to clean eating, the pounds melt off and your body gets jacked.  Resistance is futile.

Moving to az as a UCLA patient this is an excellent hospital. Honestly read Yelp reviews before coming and was very skeptical. After having an emergency and have a chronic medical condition this hospital is exceptional. Great doctors, very knowledgable, nurses are excellent also! We also need to remember this is a teaching hospital I find university hospitals excellent and provide the best care.

We went to the East location first, before stopping for lunch and then heading over here. It's nice that the day passes you buy allow you to move between gyms. This is what a typical to me rock climbing gym looks like. Lots and lots of climbing walls. They have a lot of the auto belays. Decent sized bouldering section. I like how there are fitness classes. If you want to use their lockers in the bathrooms be sure to bring your own lock. I plan on coming back here as soon as possible! :)

I have been a member of the Club Fitness clubs for over 5 years.  I pay $10/month as a long time member... but I have a few gripes even though I go almost every day.

Good:
1. This location is the largest of all of theirs and has a steam room / sauna.  It may very well be their flagship location.
2. Cheap. Did I mention I pay like a bit over $10/month?
3. Location. Right off of 270 Hwy & Olive Street. Easy access.
4. Ample parking.
5. Looks like lots of classes and a juice bar... neither which I use.

Bad:
1. Can someone please tell me why none of the weights (plates or barbells) are racked in the right places, or in many cases, not racked at all?  This is the biggest pain in the ass.
2. How come at all the other Club Fitness gyms, there are television units integrated in the treadmills and the stair-climbers? At this location, the tvs are on the wall, you cannot change channels, and the sound is spotty.
3. Dirty. Seriously, an old wash rag and unlabeled disinfectant manual spray bottle at some stations? Last I saw at other clubs, they had paper towel dispensers and disinfectant foam which is more hygienic.
4. Hours. They made me buy a new  $10 swipe card claiming "24 hour access".  This failed.  They are no longer "24 hours" open. What a waste. Don't bother coming at 6 or 7 am Sunday morning because they are closed.
5. Free weights and equipment too close together.
6. No towel service.

So this is my review.  I think the biggest annoyance from above is the weights not being racked and the barbells in the totally wrong place. Hygiene is next biggest problem.

I originally gave this gym high rating, but had to change it. Once I stopped using the trainer they no longer care that much about you. I tried to end my membership and it took over 3 months for them to close the account and about 30 phone calls. 

Old post.....Great gym really nice staff and my trainer Jon is great! Very clean and lots of equipment to use. Also great prices.

I'm FURIOUS! My debit card was compromised, I thought that I'd notified everyone when I got the new one, obviously I forgot Gold's Gym. I get a call saying I owe this month's payment-fine-BUT instead of the under $10 per month, they want $29 AND a $10 fee to cancel my membership or they'll send this $29 bill "to collections".  They threatened my credit-no biggie since I have none.  They must be really greedy or hurting for $$ to pull this sh*t for a mere mistake on my part. I knew I was making a mistake by joining, and this proves it. I have made timely payments every month, you'd THINK they'd cut a person some slack for a mistake. SHAME on them!

I've been going to Genesis for years.  You can't beat the value for the price! All the classes are included and they are great classes. They also have a great weight section and cardio theater. The new Spin classes are an awesome addition! The owners are attentive and obviously take care in how they run the gym.

This place will rip you off. Before you sign their documents, read it carefully first and not trust what they say upfront because you will be surprised in the card you have on file when its charged some fees that you're not aware of. My friend warned me about this, I regret now not listening to his advice. the only thing that's good about this place is the lady that works on the kids club otherwise I won't give it any star.

I myself love it it is a no frills gym you work at your Owen pace.
The place is always clean even the bathrooms are clean as can be
They friendly always say hello.
I got just  what I wanted I spend 3 To 4 hours here when I go.
To me it is great.
But no wifi dose suck and that I do not like.
So maybe if enough of us Complain about it we will get it.
Anyway I enjoy this gym I have not gone to the classes because I go during the day.
Love the lil tv's on the the machines that helps your workout go better.
  So my only compliant is the wifi.
I to was told about a month and it has been that and still no wifi.
      Come on we need our wifi so we can leave the MP3 at home and just use our phones.


                   Great Place Great People

I love this place.  I come here to get my hair cut, styled and to have a chat with my favorite stylist, Agatha. I have also tried out their manicure and pedicure station, which was such a treat!  It is pricey but oh so worth it!  It's in a private area of the salon, and Katie is so nice, and very attentive, paying attention to every detail of my manicure and pedicure.  She suggested a new polish at no extra charge, which lasted 7 day without chipping!  Woohoo!  The ladies at the front desk are attentive as well, and are very kind.

Great facilities and the child watch received a great overhaul.  The child watch is a saving grace, our boy loves it and it allows us to work out without a guilty conscious. The pools and workout equipment are well maintained and they have a very large catalog of programs for kids and adults. 

The price is steep but worth it if your going to participate in more than just weekend workouts.

The Heights is a wonderful place offering a good variety of activities for a single person and for an entire family!  I have been looking for a new gym because as much as I like working out in my basement, there are workout equipments that I need but do not own and I really did not want to renew my membership at the old gym.  In short, I needed a change of scenery and I found it here!

I did a one-day pass before committing to a full year membership. I came in on a rainy Tuesday and heard someone saying how packed it was. I was very surprised by that comment and started looking around only to find that compared to my old gym, the place was pretty dead. Please note that I did come in around 9:30am and for good reasons. I was trying to avoid the crowd but as it turns out, this place is hardly ever crowded during the times I like to go. They have newer equipments here and there's always a cardio machine available no matter when you come in. I have been here after work and after dinner (around 6 or 7pm) andstill found a machine away from other people on cardio days. 

I did talk to the person working up front when I signed up about the classes and the membership does come with 5 free sessions and then you have to pay for the rest if you would like to continue. There is also a card for free aquatic class when you sign up. They have toddler services as well but I told her I did not need it and that I would rather get something else so she offered the aquatic class card. There is also a free guest pass when you sign up. I haven't had the chance to try out any of their classes yet but I was thinking of trying out spinning one of these days.

The locker room is pretty nice. It smells quite a bit like chlorine because of the pool but I don't mind.  There is a sauna and a hot tub but I haven't used either yet. As far as the fitness center goes, I really like this place. Last but not least, this is a very economical gym especially if you are a Brentwood, Maplewood or Richmond Heights resident!

This gym is cool and is in the middle of Channelside downtown. You must workout during the day Cuz after 500 pm it's crazy busy in there. The employees are mostly friendly but not overly friendly. I love all the options it has to work out. I love the free massage chairs for after my work out. Parking is a pain and is not very convenient.  Overall, I enjoy it and will continue to come to this gym during off hours.

Do yourself a favor and try out a free class.  You'll temporarily hate your life but afterwards I PROMISE you'll be hooked!  I'll admit, I was scared at first.  Group fitness? Special heart rate monitors? EVERYONE can see how hard (or not hard) I'm working on the screen? I wasn't thrilled but I knew this was the push I needed to step up my workout game.

I've been attending OTF Ironworks for two weeks now and have been incredibly pleased with the facility, workouts, coaches and every single staff member I've interacted with.  These workouts will challenge you, make you question why you even signed up in the first place and by the middle of class you've probably convinced yourself that you're never coming back.  But then... you finish the workout with a group of amazing people encouraging you along the way and you leave feeling accomplished in the end. Totally worth it! 

No two workouts are the same and each coach brings a different energy to the class.  The music is blaring, everyone is working hard and you're likely burning 500+ calories each time! Classes range from 5am to 8pm, so you really have no excuse to not attend.  The workout is split between the treadmill, rowers and weight station for a full 60 minute workout.  Throughout your workout, you are able to quickly glance at the TVs located around the room to see what zone you're in (how hard you're working.)  If you notice everyone else in class has reached the next zone, it's time for a little self evaluation.  Talk about motivation!  

There are several different memberships available for OTF, ranging from Basic to Premier - so you are able to select the package that best fits your lifestyle.  There are transformation challenges that offer cash prizes, raffles and even a Facebook group to keep members connected and engaged.  Absolutely love everything about OTF and recommend to all!

The Best Workout in Tampa! True Grit is a major motivational experience! I needed this boost and change in my personal routine. I was greeted by one of the owners as I signed in. There were several members of the gym. It was great that the regulars there are so friendly and inviting, a couple immediately introduced themselves to me and asked me to partners up with them! The owners were great at demonstrating the workouts for newbies before we got started and although the work out was a challenge they made it fun by playing up beat music and walking around pushing everyone with motivational words! This is a great gym and awesome workout! They also have some monthly challenges I believe such as "mission slimpossible" and maybe a social gathering occasionally. On a side note, Love that this is a family business and they are clearly well respected. They were throwing a birthday party for their Son after the boot camp and invited everyone to join. Most everyone stayed and sang. Im pretty sure every person even brought the little birthday guy a gift! Wow, that's cool!

I have attended a couple of Linda's classes and absolutely love them.  She's very motivating and nice.  Classes typically involve around 30 min of kickboxing with the bag, followed by 15 min of varied cardio exercises to work abs, arms etc. By the end of the class I am sweaty and exhausted, but I feel great! I definitely recommend trying it out.
I canceled and they are still charging me $159 dollars !!! What a terrible company! I wouldn't recommend this company to anyone!!

It's hard for me to give VV such a meh review. This is only the second place I've been for indoor rock climbing - the first one being in my hometown of South Florida. However, it gives off a weird aura about it that just doesn't tickle me the right way. I know, I know. That's unfair Mark. Sure. It just feels like I have to rent out the stinky shoes each time I go unless I buy my own pair to use. Pretty sure I could use any sneaker I wanted to in So.Flo. Other than my own strange fickleness about the shoes, this place is pretty cool. The boulder for free climbing is pretty fun. They have a wall dedicated to free wall climbing and another for belayed climbing. They also have a tight rope and some pull up thingies to work out with if you're not feeling like hitting the "rocks". The venue is a bit smaller in comparison to what I've experienced though serviceable. I generally enjoy my visits despite the quirks that might nag me a little.

I have exactly one (1) complaint - I wish the pool was open later. 

Whew, glad we got that out of the way. 

Honestly, I have nothing bad to say about the place. It's clean, the staff are incredibly friendly, and it's never been too crowded to find a machine. It's a great facility, and offers a ton of options for an affordable rate. 

If you're searching for gyms on the east side (and you probably are, seeing as how you're reading this), I would absolutely recommend it.

this place have the most unprofessional trainers. I paid the personal trainer to train my daughter and she left us a very unprofessional message because she messed up her own schedule. Soni canceled our membership because she was a bitch! and guess what happened there? it's been over a month and I still haven't even recieved my refund.

I've never went to spinning. Ever. I ride a bike and that's usually at the beach with a decent buzz. But hey, how hard could working out on a bike be? Solid music and low lighting- cakewalk. 

This was NOTHING like cruising on a bike with a basket filled with groceries. This was INTENSE. I conned my husband into going with me early on a Sunday morning because there was no shot I was going by myself. We get there and it's amazingly clean and even at 8:00 am the staff was welcoming and helpful. Our cubby had our shoes in it and there are free lockers with electronic locks. It's super easy. We popped on our shoes, filled up our water bottles and grabbed the towels we would need to wipe down our sweaty selves. 

You go into this beautiful studio that could double as a night club (if you removed the bikes) and find your pre-picked bike- ours were in the back. lol.
The instructor and assistants help you on to the bike and it takes some getting used to having your feet locked into the peddles but that goes away. We got started with some Britney (my fave) and we were off to the races! I was sweating within 5 minutes! We did hills and and sprints and everything in between! Even did arms with weights! This is an incredible workout! I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to sweat like crazy!

This gym is honestly hilarious... get a good laugh every time I come, I have never seen so many low self esteem dudes in my life... hitting the body building flex in the mirror, jumping around like it's their high school varsity football game and singing out loud to draw attention. TONS of options for gym in Tampa so unless you just really want that douche bag vibe, i suggest elsewhere ‍

So, I started to frequent this location of LA Fitness a couple of weeks ago as it is about the same distance from my house as the other location I have frequented for the past 4 years.  I chose to try this out as I pass it often and it is one of the newly acquired Lifestyles gyms.  I figured why not give it a try.

The one difference I have noted on each visit is that the front desk staff at this gym seems to be so much more professional, friendly, and talkative.  I don't know if this is because they remained from the Lifestyles merger or were trained differently than the LA Fitness folks.  The overall appearance and cleanliness of this gym is so vastly better than the North Dale Mabry LA Fitness location.  There seem to be cleaning supplies readily available and the equipment also seems to be newwer and better maintained.  I have yet to find equipment in this gym not in working order or with an out of order sign at this location.

Another worthy mention is that each piece of cardio equipment has it's own TV.  This is so much of a godsend as the North Dale Mabry location only carries every news channel or infomercial channel on their 4 TVs for the entire gym.  Albeit that the channel selection is limited, it is still better to be able to watch what you want and not be forced to watch whatever the gym had selected for it's tvs for the entire day.  

All in all, this location is a much needed improvement over the North Dale Mabry location.  I think this location seems to be a hidden gem as there are hardly ever crowds when I frequent it, which is vastly different from the other location that is packed no matter what time of the day you go.

The location is in a less than desirable neighborhood.  The largest issue is they told me a day pass was 24 hours (turns out to be not accuarte) and the gym itself was a mess.  Old equipment, had to wait to use weights, and stuff was just everywhere.

In Indianapolis, I've been a member of Cardinal Fitness, Gold's Gym, LA Fitness, and most recently, the Jordan YMCA.

Cardinal was no thrills, never really busy, and cheap. Towards the end of its existence, we really felt it wasn't being cleaned properly...so we moved onto Gold's!

Gold's was tacky? We did not stick with it for long. 

LA Fitness was HUGE, always INSANELY BUSY, and really stuffy.  For all the money they took from me, why couldn't I get some damn AC? Plus, getting out of their contract was a bitch. Still, it worked when I lived nearby.

And now...the Jordan Y. The workers (there are so many!) are super friendly. The Y has classes, though the most popular ones (yoga, pilates) require a fee. Boo.

I love their sliding scale. I love that they offer free childcare. 

Unfortunately, the actual workout room feels small to me. I'm used to weight-machine OPTIONS, people. I'm used to so many elliptical machines, I don't have to work out next to ANYONE. Oh well. It adds the community vibe, in a way.

Avoid Saturday mornings and after 6 pm weekdays -- too busy. But Sunday mornings are pleasantly chill (thank you, Y members, for going to church!)

I was a member of PSC Rodin for almost 17 years.  I put my membership on hold during the pandemic.  During that time the gym closed down permanently.  I was never contacted that the gym went out of business.  Several months later I see charges on my credit card for the closed gym.  I contacted them and was told that my membership was transferred to the market street gym.  I replied 2 times asking when I was contacted about this change, asked for my membership to be cancelled with no additional charges, and to have the current charges removed from my credit card.  They will not reply to any of  my emails.

I tried so hard not to love this "fad" workout but alas I do. I don't see much trendiness about it other than keeping track of your heart rate which people have been doing for years. This studio just makes it fun, easier and more interesting. 

Workouts are always different. There is a general skeleton of weights and running that I love. 

The trainers and staff are helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. 

Facility always feels clean and I enjoy every workout I get. It's a bit pricey but I think it's worth it.

I wish zero was an option here. The only pro I can think of is the gym and locker room are clean. Now for all the con's.  The equipment is in horrible condition.  The gym can get very crowded.  The lighting is poor in several areas of the gym. They are horrible in terms of cancelling your membership after the proper 30 day advance notice.  You WILL get charged for a LOT longer if you don't watch it.  The staff upon enrollment was very friendly, after that horrible.  No Hi, no bye, just basically getting a paycheck, and seem to hate to be there.  In two months of training there 3 to 4 days a week, I was NEVER spoken to by any of the trainers.  Oh, and quite a bit of horseplay by the employees.

Fantastic gym. The staff is welcoming, the trainers are top notch and there are plenty of different and unique workout classes. They keep the facility extremely clean. I recommend Life Time to anyone that enjoys working out.
Lots of equipment. Peak time at this gym is no different than any other gym- so no complaints here. The place is clean and the staff is pleasant.

This is a big hospital and it is the one of the top hospitals. It is nice and the people are pretty nice in there. I don't go here as much but I always pass it on my way to class and I think it is beautiful from the outside. I wish to be a doctor but do not think I have the patience to go through all of the work but I give madddd kudos to all the Surgeons and Doctors for doing so. :D

Great facility with tons of options for people of all ages and sizes and abilities. The staff is mostly friendly and helpful (there are a couple exceptions), as are the members. 

If you like to really lift, they have squat racks and deadlift areas and quite a nice collection of equipment. If you like cardio, they have a huge variety as well. 

I'm very happy here and would recommend this branch to anyone interested.

I stopped by yesterday to get some information about the place. Sign at front said use side door. The side door was locked, so I went back to the front door which was open. Appeared empty so I called out and entered anyway. Walked up to the counter and talked with person there. He seemed uninterested in answering any questions and made me feel very unwelcome. I noticed as I walked away, he came out looked around and closed the front door. There were no hours posted, so I thought maybe I entered when they were closed. But, I checked and as it was around 2 pm on Tuesday, they post that they are open  during those hours. I'll take my pocket book and go elsewhere.

Absolutely the WORST "gym" I've ever been in. Dark, dank, no real ventilation, old weights, not even a full circuit.  And expensive? Oh man, considering the prices for one person for a month ($80), a complete rip off.  Meager facilities.  If you want tennis or swimming, great. They have courts and a decent swimming program for kids.

Wherever I may roam, no matter how many other facilities I might explore, no other gym in Philadelphia compares to the Sporting Club.    The equipment is top drawer, the classes varied and expertly presented and the amenities are simply superior.    You cannot help but be impressed with the maintenance and cleanliness of the Club.

Yes, there is an unfortunate cohort of spandex-clad gym-goers who obviously are  more interested in being seen than working out.   The good news is that the facilities are sufficiently large that one can easily avoid these decorative folk and focus on the business of getting a great workout.

I switched from LA Fitness to Planet Fitness about a year ago and LOVE IT. Staff is very nice and helpful. Very good equipment. Not ever a wait. Free tanning. Free training.  And the list goes on.
