Only thing they lack is classes else it would be perfect for anyone. I highly recommend Planet Fitness if you're looking for a gym to work out or jump on a treadmill for some cardio!

Working out alone at my old gym got me into a rut and was no longer motivating. Well, let me tell you, RiseUp Fitness is just fantastic. I'm spent after each workout, and it is great to be surrounded by other motivated people all wanting to get or stay in great shape! Classes are run by Kyle, Emily or Addison and they are so supportive. Challenging but doable sessions will leave you dripping sweat but with a major feeling of accomplishment.

Today a liw mark for a very unnoticeable sign to indicate that one item wasn't working. 
The other reason. It's more of a bathhouse than a gym.

This place is packed and their list of activites is off the top for a gym.  For a YMCA for that matter.  You can participate for $15 a class.  Makes for something familiar in another State.  Folk there are friendly.  Place is clean and busy on a weekday evening.
Superior Fitness is an outstanding facility for all ages with a great selection of equipment. It's rare these days to find such a positive, encouraging and unpretentious environment - two thumbs up!

We joined this gym nealry a month ago. There was zero *sales* push when we enrolled. Roman was kind and informed. He listened to my needs and gave great suggestions. I have visited 2 locations and have found it a great environment. Even for a heavier, older woman. Smiles are everywhere and cleanliness is very apparent. I have been at all times of the day and there is always something to do. The aqua classes are fun and my husband has even enjoyed them! I met with a trainer, Andrea and she was great. Again listened and gave great advice. I am glad to be on my journey with this gym!

Great staff. Great atmosphere. Great workout. There are a lot of numbers and educating at first but you catch on quickly. The staff is super friendly and always helpful. The workouts go extremely fast and I have yet to have a bad coach. Go try a class, your first one is free!

Just started the gym here so far not to bad. Customer service is very helpful and nice. Equipment isnt to bad they offer classes tanning and hydromassage for members. I would recommend if you live in the neighborhood and are looking for a gym to work out in. I will update you in a month or so after being here a little while

Meant to include a review of this place last year and never got around to it. Well I have time. It'll be quick. Advertised free membership but charged $50 dollars for a FOB for after hours acess. Free does no equal **with exceptions**. Eat the cost and buy a CCTV camera or change your verbage

Visited this location for the first time today. Everyone was friendly and welcoming. I love that they offer 45 minute formats during lunch time. I will definitely be coming back when I am in the area.

This gym recently changed ownership and the new owners are amazing!! It's really organized, clean and fun now.  Even as a past rower the workout are totally killer, you spend time on and off of the rowing machine, usually a few sets of each.  The rower gives you a great cardio workout and during the 'off' time you work on lifting - sometimes focusing on a particular body part like leg day or arm day - and the combination makes me feel like I got a great total workout in only 45 minutes! The on and off intervals also make the class time fly by which is a huge plus! Every time I've gone the energy has been high and the classes have been tons of fun so its super motivating as well! 
In sum if you're looking for a really great total body workout that is fun too you need to try this place out! I promise you'll be sore but in the best kind of way!
Recently joined and have gone twice now. Nice and clean, equipment is all new! Location is convenient and it's not crowded! Staff is helpful and friendly too. Love it here so far!

I am new to Tucson and this location, I am not overly impressed by the size of the place but it has what you need to get in a good work out. This location is close to various restaurants just in case you need a pick me up after your workout. Tucson Mall is close by. I have been to a few Planet Fitness with more equipment and weights than this one has but if your a serious lifter try another facility. I was able to work out on many of the equipment without waiting. It wasn't overly loud, clean inside, staff when I visited was friendly. One key thing I loved, they had two Veteran parking spots right up front. Thank you for that.

12th Street is a solid gym in the heart of Center City.  It's great for anyone on a budget, and meets/exceeds the needs of an average gym-goer.  The layout can be confusing at first (it looks to have been converted from an old set of homes), but you can become acclimated once you get your routine down.  

The owner was thoughtful in planning out the gym's offerings. There is tons of cardio equipment and a variety of classes (spinning, yoga, fitness, lifting).  There are express workout areas, a pool, a sun deck, and it is attached to the Camac Center (tanning, massage, other services).  In the six or seven months that I have been going, I have no complaints.  

Bottom line: If you can get a reduced price ($30/mo) it's worth it if you live or work in the area.

Going into my forth year in the senior class. Am incredibly pleased with fewer aches, pains and especially lower back issues. Focusing on balance, core strength and mobility, taught by knowledgable trainers is ideal. Have learned to focus, no machines, the body is the machine!
Will continue as long as possible. Adrian our trainer is incredibly focused on our movements. Lots of humor.

hevenu shalom aleichem (oo! aa!) aleichem hevenue shalom (shooby dooby dooby do wop do wop) 

the TJCC goes down in my life history as the best day care ever. and trust me, i went to my fair share of daycares growing up. NONE of them even compete with the JCC.

Gosh, I wish I could still go to daycare at the JCC. it was so much fun. 

After school this is where I went and I filled my afternoons with challa, swimming, jewish music lessons(ask me to sing for you in hebrew), raquet ball, basketball, lanyard-making, games, and fun. 

There was even this amazing smoothie chef in the cafe, i'd be surprised if he's still there but he made the worlds best strawberry peach smoothie. 

ALL, and i mean ALL, of the people working there were the nicest people possible. They all really loved kids or were super good at faking it. 

it was SO clean, so friendly, so family-oriented, and everyone loved it.  

enroll your kids and enroll yourself and go have fun! even if you're not jewish, you should still go here. it was such a blast.

(Boise) I was super stoked to go and work on flips for the upcoming snow season and instead worked on explaining how a line works to a bunch of rude children with no adult supervision. You aren't allowed to do multiple flips and the trampolines have a pretty weak amount of bounce. The foam pit was constantly full of children just throwing foam and not getting out. 
There is no enforcement of etiquette and none of the kids would wait their turn. A 40# kid to the face is a pretty lame way to spend 15 bucks.

I love this gym!!! So many classes to choose from and it's inexpensive. The classes are challenging and the instructors are awesome.  If you take one class a month the membership pays for itself.  They also have all the equipment and weights you need at a gym. The staff is welcoming and not judgmental at all.  It's just a great environment. I should've joined sooner !!!

I was a member of FitGym from 2010-2013 (I've since moved to Colorado), and I MISS fitgym!!!!! Don gave the BEST spin classes in the WORLD. Think: pumping r&b music, flashing lights, awesome workout, and the best atmosphere, and I still cant find a better spin class anywhere in the US. Amazing. The price is the best, and it's open at great hours. Everyone was so friendly, and it is affordable! Fitgym, I miss you

This program WORKS. The last 6 weeks have been some of the best times ever. My coach DAN is amazing and always encourages you to be your best.  The diet is hard. It's clean eating and for someone that loves eating it's hard to change but it's SOOOOO WORTH IT!! I'm down 21.4 lbs in 6 weeks!!! I have now made the choice to try another 6 weeks for FREE!! Your money rolls over.. It's simple follow the program and lose the weight for FREE!! Thank you NV TRANSFORMATION!! This place has changed my life!!

Absolutely in love! I had NO idea what to expect. It's the end of my first wk and I already feel incredible support from the trainers and staff. Not to mention, I'm feeling great with completing such intense workouts. Would highly recommend.

Nice club that offers classes such as yoga in a studio, features tennis, racquet ball, karate, machines, free weights,  massage and even a physical therapy office.  Attentive staff who seem to actually care and know what they are doing.

this place sucks. Aside from the hours it closing at 12 am its about the only good thing about this gym. I have never seen more pathetic people than the looser that come to this gym. It seems as though this is more of a place for chilling and relaxing and guys to hang out than working out. Some perpetual hating jealous people here. Not only they dont do shit but even when others work out they hate and hate. Even the old farts are perpetual haters here. Staff are asswholes aside from the counter people equipment is old as shit this place sucks.

Note: pictures posted DO NOT reflect their renovations. The location is much more cramped/small compared to the many pictures shown. To disagree with another commenter, the pictures do lie in this case. They're outdated. 

This Snap used to be awesome, but has been average at best since they remodeled. When I originally signed up, the Snap occupied 5 suites in its building - after renovating, it only occupies 3 suites. Same amount equipment, but now it's all mashed together with limited space to exercise. Additionally, they did not lower the membership cost after shrinking the size of the complex by 40%. That's inexcusable, imo. But to my dismay, they're convenient for me so I tolerate it. 

My biggest complaint is related to the equipment layout. The mirrors are not full-length (do not reach the floor) in the main weight area. Additionally, the squat rack and smith machine are not lined up appropriately with the mirrors, so you end up with a distorted view of your body while lifting. When I approached Amanda (the manager) about it, she suggested that I spend more time exercising and less time posing in the mirror. This was a laughable dig, and I reminded her that the mirrors are tools used to watch form. My comments/complaints were shared by several other people, but no changes were made to the layout. I have since accepted that I'll have to go elsewhere to squat safely because Snap does not care about my safety. In most other local gyms (like the Zoo in Kenner, St. Charles Ave. Athletic Club, French Riviera Fitness), the squat rack and smith machines are practically surrounded by mirrors providing you with a nearly 360 degree view of yourself while exercising. This is generally the standard, but one this Snap has chosen to ignore. 

Pros: month to month membership without cancellation fees, safe parking area, inexpensive membership (though it should be lower considering their rent/lease expenses cannot possibly be as high since renovating), 24-hr access, decent/average assortment of equipment. 

Cons: no amenities, drink machine does not take credit/debit cards, poor mirror setup, no stairstepper, no locker room, bathrooms aren't well maintained, impossibly crowded sometimes, very poor gym etiquette by members, poor customer service.

FANTASTIC group fitness classes! Been a member since it first opened. Great trainers and staff. Locally owned and operated. Someone commented about the "gym smell". well duh, it is a gym. What did you expect it to smell like. Shesh.

I just want to say this gym makes you feel welcome.they have free trainers on board to help with weights.it has a big parking lot full of parking.amazing massage chairs tan beds...its always people there working out in a very positive safe environment. I like it.Planet Fitness Gym ,Mantua NJ  Monique Henry

I was recently in St. Pete for a 24 hour business trip and needed to do legs at the gym. I came in looking for the pricing of a one day pass and the girl was so sweet. She had someone in her office and due to a meeting I was in a time crunch. She offered to let me use the facility on them! Traveling often makes it very hard to stay on track with my workouts and I so appreciate everything they did to help me stay on track. The gym had everything I needed and was kept at 70 degrees which I so appreciate!! If I am ever back here for work I would definitely come here again!

They allow DIRTY people Not in swimming suits in the pool. Too nasty. Have not been back.We take showers, wear appropriate swim suits, and go there for exercise. I have seen this place go downhill for the last 4 years.

I have been a client of J'aime Fitness for over 6 months.  My first session was with Jaime who I instantly liked.  She was thorough and patient.  Since that time, I have trained consistently with Lisa who challenges me just the right amount.  My fitness level continues to improve and you can believe that I am never bored!   Always something new being added to the mix.  If you want to get in shape and are are willing to make the commitment to do your part --- give Jaime a call.  By the way, I was in Key West 2 months ago and a stranger complimented me on how great my arms look.  Makes it all worth it!

Nice spot! I went there with a meetup group and was not disappointed. The staff is ultra competent and welcome you perfectly. The price is cheap at $18 the day. You can rent the shoes or anything else. The place is very clean. You will have a little bit too much of people sometime but overall it's ok. The walls are not tall and the place is small. I will come back as soon as I can and I recommend it.

Hate running on a treadmill?  Feel the urge to unload stress and aggression in violent, yet legal ways after a long day at work?  Require the motivation of appearing weak in front of members of the opposite sex in order to go that extra mile on your workout?  Title Boxing Club is for you.  I won a membership package including a month membership, gloves, wraps, gym bag, and a free class at an auction and was surprised I was the winning bid, nay, the only bid.  After my first class I know why I came into possession of my prize so easily--most people aren't masochists.  They are kind to newbies.  Tell the front desk it is your first time and they will give you a quick tour, a class schedule, and even wrap your hands for you.  I recommend getting there early so you can select your bag as far out of sight from the others as possible.  That way only those in your immediate vicinity will see you skipping entire sets, reeling in agony, and simultaneously fighting sports induced asthma attacks whilst holding back the urge to vomit.  

1 hr classes.  15min warm up, 30 min bag annihilating, 15 minute cool down. 

If you can complete the full class without slacking on a few sets your first time you are already in great shape.  

Highly recommend this place for the full on Rocky experience.

I liked this place at the beginning but very quickly found that the owners of the gym don't care about customer satisfaction.  The gym is dirty and rarely cleaned.  After finally cancelling my membership they continued to charge me.  Good luck to anyone who's stuck in their web.

Last year I attended Kaia's Brik which is a six week Boot Camp. At first I didn't like it because I thought the workouts were hard and I was so out of shape.   I'm a strong skier and I hike all the time but my upper body was really weak.  I ended up losing 10 pounds and got some of my strength back. Flash forward a year and I'm doing the Brik Boot Camp again.  I mainly attend class at the West location but I have tried East and the Midtown location as well. The workouts have a lot of variety and all of the instructors are awesome!  I'm hoping someday they'll offer the dance workout class at the West location because it was my favorite class thus far.  I still don't like doing planks and Burpee's (does anyone?) but slowly but surely I'm getting stronger.  What I like the most about Kaia is that every week there are several different classes to attend -the normal work out, the dance workout, yoga and the TRX suspension.  As they say variety is the spice of life!  If you're looking to lose those stubborn pounds and inches this is the place to get results!

This studio is an incredible space.  It's like something you'd see in Chicago or Denver. There are two rooms for yoga and plenty of space all around for placing your stuff and checking in.  The owner is a fabulous instructor.  There is also a boutique with super cute yoga gear to meet your needs.

I've started dating this really great guy. He understands me, can anticipate my needs, and even provides helpful tips for the days when I just can't decide what to do. 

His name is Netflix. 

And while Netflix is sweet and very caring, he is also very addictive. It's turning into a very unhealthy relationship that I just can't seem to get out of by myself. I'm spending all my free time with him, blowing off social events to click his buttons, and even using him as an excuse to not workout. 

Enter Hotbox. The best breakup tool any girl could have. Though I've only been to one class, I have to say I can already feel myself getting pumped up to go back! I'm so ADD that running just doesn't cut it for me. And I'm too stubborn to workout by myself because I just won't do it if I don't want to. I needed to find a place where everyone is there for the same reason: to get pushed to their limit and sweat their asses off. I can already tell that this gym is a COMMUNITY. A safe space where you can go and give this intense calorie-burning workout 100% of your most hardcore effort, and probably look like a complete dork while doing it - but no one cares because NO ONE IS LOOKING AT YOU. 

I am so happy that I found this gym so I can start becoming the Best Version of Me. 
Thank you Hotbox!

Worth every penny. There are no other gyms out there, in this area, that offer what life time does. I don't have kids yet, but I cannot wait to after seeing everything they offer for children and families! This is more than a gym...it's a community. Indoor and outdoor pools, sauna and eucalyptus steam room, luxurious locker rooms with towels and toiletries, more squat/power lifting racks than every gym in south jersey combined, cardio equipment for everyone and then some... The list goes on and on!!

I was in NOLA for work and decided to get a professional massage since I've never had one. I called three days straight and they never had an appointment open. I opted for an eyebrow wax and facial... the girl burnt my eyelid and told me I had sensitive skin. I got over it, was still super nice and thanked her. I came back the next day for my facial and was ten minutes late. She said it would cut into my half hour facial even though the yelp coupon said it was for 55 minutes. The facial was great, but my overall customer service experience was poor and I will never go back.

My family of four has been a member of Lohse for over three years. It is reasonably priced and comes with FREE child watch from 9AM-1PM each day. My only frustration is with parking ($2/day when you go) and the fact that they're closed on Sunday. The staff is so welcoming and they know our kids by name. Classes are great, kids sports leagues are great, there is a pool on the second floor and the equipment works. Yes it's a little older gym, but they're continuously making improvements- the state of the art basketball gym, the spin room, the locker rooms, the cardio machines, etc. We love this place.

OK, sooooo here's the deal. I do NOT like to work out.  I hate it.  I have tried and done so many things to NOT hate it but I do and Pure Barre in Carmel was no exception to this rule for me.  I almost left the class early b/c I was annoyed. It wasn't anything they did.  It was just not for me.  It was a "feel the burn" class but not too difficult and I should have probably felt amazing after but I didn't. I just felt "over it" and didn't have any desire to return. The women running the class were nice, pleasant and welcoming. I wasn't intimidated or felt out of place.  I just WAS out of place. I cannot possibly give my experience 5 stars b/c ....well it just wasn't.  

In addition, it's overpriced but almost everything "class" based is so I'm not surprised.  It's just definitely not happening for me at the price point.  For me it was just OK but I'm sure for those who love this type of work out and can afford the monthly fee, it's wonderful.

This is an excellent facility. The only reason I'm not giving it a 5 star is because it's very pricey. 

So many machines for cardio, I'm never left waiting for one. Even if the parking lot is full. 

The weight area is incredible, anything you could possibly need for a good lift. 

They have an indoor and outdoor pool. Track upstairs. Free classes. And a friendly staff!

Never transfer to this club. I heard they have new Management and let me tell you they suck. I was told the MOD when I called about a complaint was Walter Brock. He in no way handled the phone call, but allowed an employee to try and handle a situation that was beyond her control. They took dues from me in Oct then again in June the following year. They then told me I would have to come in for a refund. Why would I need to do that when I didn't come in for you to take it! I never had problems like this in my previous MI Planet fitness and regret transferring to this one. On another note they also have been missing dumbbells in the stretch room for the last year. You get how much money a month per person? There is no excuse for this. I can keep my $ and workout at home or somewhere else.

The staff are great: professional and courteous. They do their best to keep the place clean too. This review is negative because of the patrons:  Trash constantly thrown on the floor, despite the place having ample waste containers.  People using 2 - 3 different pieces of equipment at once so no one else can get anything done.  I tried to use a piece of equipment last week and some guy from across the floor came up and said he was using it and got in my face. Thuggish behavior - Gets old very quick. Clowns like this can ruin a business.

This review is specifically for the kick ass "Zumba" instructor Ruben I had this morning not for the facility although I will note a few things... 

5 stars for sauna, boxing ring, elliptical availability and parking in the city. 

5 stars for the awesome kiddie care staff -2 stars for it being on closed randomly on Tuesdays. 

1 star for the either the super pushy personal trainers or lack of staff all together. There's no in between. 

1 star for lack of yoga classes. 

Ok, end rant. 

To the good stuff! This morning I happened to look over at a class already in progress as I lifted. It looked SO intriguing. See, I swore off Zumba a few years back when it was first popular. The instructors, clad in blinding neon was basically yelling directions, doing moves that were short and made no sense as they were bouncing all over the place. I HATED every minute of it. I tried it a few other times, 5 or 6 different instructors in fact, and it was just people with no dance background trying to teach a type of dance. It was awful!!! AWFUL! It was boring. It was old school aerobics with grapevines and cha cha galore. Too much latin music. In every class. I swore this stuff wasn't for me, a former dancer and that was a shame because I love to dance. This wasn't dance. Zumba is not dance. I thought it would've been more dance, less robotics and more fun. I never thought I could possibly like this type of class ever again. I was wrong and it has everything to do with the instructor this morning....

He was buff, stylish, wore a newsboy hat the ENTIRE class and knew what he was doing! No question. As a former classically trained dancer, I can smell talent and passion for dance a mile away. I loved every single minute of this!!! It is honestly one of the best things (beside the obvious family and house etc.) that has happened to me in my adult years. It took me back to my dancing days with kick ball changes, box steps and more! So freaking fun! He has incredible musicality and attitude. The choreography was amazing!!!! He didn't miss an opportunity to perfectly match each beat, note and lyric with the appropriate movement. The music was a mix of popular tunes you can sing along to, empowering songs, theatrical jazz, even Native American sounds, Hip Hop, some Latin songs, (but not too many) and even a big lovely, relaxing finale. 

The class was filled with everyone... older ladies, black, white, Hispanic, Asian, beafy men, out of shape, in shape, newbies. You name it. It was truly a thing of beauty. 

The class was the perfect blend of the workout necessity like squats and leg lifts, waist trimmers, even boxing, mixed with a good amount of Latin flare, a little hip hop 'tude mixed with some Broadway type theatrics. Even the cool down was dramatic with big hand and head motions. Awesome!! 

I actually stood there afterwards wanting more. That's not to be confused with it not being a complete kick ass workout because it so was!! It was just THAT good!!! I cannot get enough of this class! You MUST try it! 

Dare I say I'm going to be a regular?! At "Zumba"? I really don't even want to call it that. This guy is a game changer. In fact, I think they just have to label it "Zumba" as this class doesn't fit into any one category. He's so unique and different than any other "Zumba" class I've tried. It's sooooo good and very different than what I've seen labeled as "Zumba". If you too have sworn off Zumba and you actually like to dance and can, give Ruben's class a go!! 

This class is an absolute blast! So much so that I followed him to another gym! The best way to burn 900 calories in an hour! Yeah baby!!!

Update: There was a Zumba sub for Ruben today. I walked out. It was awful!!!! Still loathe "Zumba". Still obsessed with Ruben! Try him! You will love him! Everybody does!

Update 2: Won't  even walk in when I know he's not there. Not worth the time.

Retro Bordentown is a terrific value, especially with a new "super gym" right next door. The staff are always friendly, the management is always present and attentive, and it's always clean. There's a ton of new equipment available and despite being busy after work hours you never have to wait. There's also childcare available at certain hours. I would recommend this gym over others in the area unless you're looking for a pool which they don't have.

The gym itself isn't bad but LA Fitness corporation itself is garbage. I was a member at the one on Swann and was told by multiple staff members there that since that location is closing, that all members are grandfathered in to the LA Fitness sig club under the current monthly rate. So I start going to the sig club for a few months then out of nowhere I get a $5 charge on my card after I signed in. So I go inquire and they say, or more specifically Jen said (btw she is a real treat to work with) that she can't speak for what the staff members at the Swann location said and I would have to start paying Signature Club fees immediately or else my card will be charged $5 every time I go in.....JOKE. Cancelled my membership.

I've been going to this gym for a while now and I can't get over how clean it is! The employees are constantly wiping down machines and cleaning the bathroom and locker rooms around the clock! All the employees are very pleasant!

I belonged to the LA Fitness in Collegeville for about 1 1/2 years, but gave it up. Due to medical problems with my legs, I was there primarily to use the pool. Unfortunately for me, the pool was a few degrees too cold; a number of other members had the same complaint. Tried switching to the LA Fitness in Norristown, but had the same problem there.
Up thing about LA Fitness was there was an age minimum of about 14 to use the gym and the pool wasn't being taken up with kiddie lessons like at the YMCA. It isn't that I "hate" kids, but when you have a lot adults trying to work out, we're there to work out, not babysit other people's unattended kids or have to go at odd times to work around kiddie programs like at the YMCA.

After practicing yoga consistently over the past two years, and trying numerous local studios I have finally found the perfect yoga studio in Santa Barbara. The classes  that I have attended are both challenging and uplifting, the atmosphere is upbeat, and the staff are very welcoming and accommodating. They have really nice locker rooms/showers and everything is clean, fresh and brand new. I have taken Brandon's core power 2 class multiple times, he is a great instructor and just a kind and genuine person. I have brought several friends along to try the first week free deal ( I believe the only studio in town which offers this for new comers), and they enjoyed it as much as I have. Well done indeed, Core Power SB.

There are so many wonderful aspects of joining the JCC.  Fortunately, it is good to get old and enjoy the few good benefits of aging.  No. 1 is having Silver Sneakers.  The "J" is like my second home. Stay well and make new friends.  Not to mention keeping your bodies in tip top shape.    The many choices of  classes they offer keep getting better and better.  The fun for me begins with Tuesday's dance party led by Rhina G. an amazing energized lady who is a joy to be around. .  Also the Zumba classes with Brenda are cardio as well as choreographed with finesse and class.  Can't get enough of them.  Thanks JCC for being a part of my life.

I returned to finish up my summer membership. In between sets, I checked my phone and the manager went out of his way to say to me, "This is a gym. If you want to text, go do it elsewhere." His audacity!

I joined Planet Fitness during their crazy April special that boasted $1 to join. I opted for the black card membership for $19.99 per month, year contract.  Because I"m a hoity-toity black card member I get the benefits of $1 drinks and since I get a water (24oz thank you!) every visit the extra $10/month evens out nicely as non-black card members are charged double.  My membership also includes an unlimited guest pass, free tanning, massage chair and the ability to visit any PF around the country.  Word, me likey.  

Okay so I am sooo not in shape, nor do I claim to actually know what I'm doing at the gym but this place is pretty easy and it's helping me to enjoy exercise.  Every weight machine has instructions and the cardio machines are pretty self-explanatory.  There are like eight billion cardio machines, mostly ellipticals and treadmills, 9 televisions that  cardio machines hook into via your headphones, a circuit training area, free weights and a stretching area.  They don't have classes but they do offer a trainer to set up a regimen for you. 

Locker rooms include lockers, showers, changing areas and bathrooms, bring your own lock.  The staff are quite nice, though I think few of them are knowledgeable about fitness.  My one gripe is that since I joined during a crazy promotion I was never actually given a gym tour.  It left me feeling scared and afraid on my first day but the other members are laid back enough that my fears quickly faded.  And really for $19.99/month I can't complain at all.

I had such high hopes. The service is like junior high school with no teacher in the classroom. The floors look dirty. The air vents are covered with dust. The steak,although hot ,has no sear. It's not good food. Sorry

IFF is a gem.  I hate that I didn't happen upon it soon for my gym needs.  It has EVERYTHING, it's clean, and it's accessible.  I was quickly signed up with zero fuss and was able to make myself comfortable in my workouts right away.  I'll recommend this gym to everyone especially people who are new to working out so they're not overwhelmed by the commercial corporate style monstrosities they call gyms these days.  Look no further for a great fitness experience.

I love this work out. I'm an analytical person, so I really like seeing my heart rate on the board and knowing how hard I'm pushing myself. You only compete against yourself, despite being in a full class. It's a different work out every day. I've been going since October 2016 and it's not gotten boring yet. It's intense but not impossible. The trainers are great and will help you reach your goals if you share them with your trainer. It's also nice to see trainers take the classes themselves. Adds some credibility to the work out.

Mrs Gennie is a superhero! After getting a huge runaround from another company in Tampa, and wasting our money, we reached out to Tampa lice removal. Mrs Gennie was supppper accommodating. She and her amazing assistant and daughter, drove all the way from Wesley chapel to do an urgent, last minute house call for us. The amount they went through to help us was super appreciated and shows a lot of their care. 
Her price for treating my daughter and checking her mom and I was cheaper than most places I spoke to for just one person. (Even without doing a house call.)
You can tell she genuinely cares about her profession and is super sweet and caring. She was very understanding of our situation and the panic we had behind it. She is very good at what she goes and makes you feel at ease about the whole process. My ten year old daughter was super comfortable with her and thought she was super nice. 
So thanks again to Mrs Gennie and Tampa Lice Removal removal! We will make sure to recommend this company to anyone and everyone we talk to in the future. Thank you again. I only wish I can leave more stars.
Inflexible front desk staff. Not worth the money. I prefer body cycle studio, a local spin studio

Got pretty much everything you need and the staff are friendly and helpful and the patrons   seem nice. All of the equipment is in order and the place is kept clean. Couldn't give it 5 star as its a little smaller than a usual 5 star gym but that doesn't mean it's bad.

It's not just for students! Alumni can join as well, my parents went through the hassle and found it well worth it. 

The new 'Rec' is awesome, plenty more equipment as well as a restaurant (fuel, it's called). It's LEED certified platinum (yay for sustainability). The new rec is not meant to just be a gym but a place to study and hang out, promoting that healthy active lifestyle I never seem to achieve. 

Crowds, ok yes being the UA gym it can get packed but opening to about 9am is pretty tolerable as well as 9-10pm. Be prepared to ask some of the meatheads if you can work into a machine, cus some can bench press all day long... Also there will be bad form almost everywhere you look, but hey at least they are trying.

Evoke is a great gym here in Reno that I highly recommend anybody looking for a gym give a look. Evoke is a wonderful place to go for anybody of any fitness level. I am usually intimidated by going to the gym because there are usually the "Super Bro" type person who is there to grunt loudly, show everybody how strong they are and throw weights around. This isn't like that. Evoke has a wide variety of services, from group training (10-20 people) to fitness boot camp/challenge type classes (30 days long with a pre test and post test as well as an event awards dinner at the end) to personal training to pilates to crossfit to bikini/fitness/physique training and so much more. 

They are able to do this with the help of some wonderful trainers that are incredibly knowledgable and motivating. From making sure you maintain the proper form to helping you make sure your diet is complimenting the work you are doing, Evoke's trainers are some of the best in Reno. 

Trainers are only a part of the equation though. The people who attend classes at evoke are some great people who are really friendly. There are usually people of varying fitness levels so finding someone to partner with or pace yourself with is easy. People here also are attentive, helping to motivate me when I need it, compliment and cheer when it is deserved as well as give me a call or text if I miss a class I said I'd be at. Ultimately, these are the people who help make Evoke as great as it is. You feel like you are a part of a big, fun, friendly family when you are here. 

I've been doing their fitness challenges for the last couple months and have really seen some great results with the help of trainers who keep things fun and interesting while motivating me to do my best and my fellow attendees and challengers helping push me and making sure I show up. If you are looking for a great place to start or continue your fitness journey, I highly recommend you give Evoke a try.

That's my gym! :)

I love that there's a good variety of the population at this gym.  I love that there are geriatrics getting fit and some young college kids getting toned.  I love that it isn't crowded with obnoxious muscleheads.

There's a good variety of machines and the environment doesn't stink.  They have a ton of group classes and a lovely pool!

So my daughter had me try it one night and well let's just say I signed up that night. I am so excited to see results I am already feeling better and have never sweat this much in my life. The staff is totally amazing and helpful with teaching me the correct way to punch. So excited for Spanish Springs to get a place like this. If I could give more stars I would!!! Woohoo looking forward to a better me!!! It's only 30 minutes out of your day.

There is one bench for bench press here.

It is short on other lifting equipment too.

Pretty much unusable.

I guess it's okay if you just want a treadmill.

I am guess this is an old Bally's set up. The gym is just structured funny. I didn't know if I was walking into an LA fitness or a condemned building. The locker room showers are two arms length from the urinals/toilets. I can't work out here. Feels awkward.

I coach USDBF Team USA Premier Women and I regularly use CrossFit to train (myself and others) in the off season.  After visiting CrossFit MontCo, I was convinced that it would be the perfect place to hold a national MiniCamp for the Team USA Hopefuls on the Preliminary Roster.  When I visited and observed, I noticed that the energy of the space is just AMAZING.  I was only supposed to be meeting the owners and observing, but the place was so hopping that I felt like picking up a barbell and jumping right in!  

CrossFit MontCo did NOT disappoint!  The owners generously donated their space to host Team  USA Premier Women for part of their minicamp training weekend.  Over 40 top athletes visited and laid down some sweat at CF MontCo!  The space is positive and open - the owners and coaches really know how to communicate and work with the athletes.  Do not walk, but RUN into this place and sign up for some great workouts in an amazing community of athletes.  Go CF MontCo!
This is my favorite HIIT workout class I've ever done, the teachers all have a different vibe to each class and mix it up. It's challenging and I leave feeling so accomplished every time.

This Club Fitness is literally 2 min away from home and i choose to go to the other Club Fitness locations instead. Despite the fact that this place is new and clean and fancy looking, it lacks a lot of the important stuff.

This particular gym is small, very small, Tiny people! There is no room to do personal workouts. So if you are looking for a room with a mirrored wall like most gyms have so that you can get a bit of privacy, you will not find that here. 

It does have a good amount of treadmills, bikes, elliptical machines but when it comes to the machine workouts on the floor there is seriously like 20 machines that is it. Probably not even that many, i could be exaggerating. There are not many free weights, and when you do get your hands on some you will be touching elbows with the person next to you. 

I like my elbow room and air space when I work out.

I do like that this is a 24 hour locations, The people here are also very friendly and nice. The parking is interesting since you park in a parking garage and walk over. Still When it comes down to the important things in a gym this particular gym lacks. 

I wish I could love it since I wouldn't have to waste gas driving to another gym but unfortunately that is not the case. Oh well.

My family had a great time at Rock Solid, Saturday, 5/15/21. 
I am not a rock climber but I am a parent and I was very happy with the safety and cleanliness of the gym. I didn't climb but my husband and four-year-old son did. They rented harnesses and shoes. 
It was our first time, we came all the way across town and it was worth it. It is nice to have something active and indoor for kids, especially with the Tucson summer heat. 
Because it was our first time we filled out our waivers and Amelia gave my son and husband an introduction. My son loved her. He really paid attention to the instructions and learned how to fall correctly. 
One nice feature of rock solid is everything is color coded and spaced well. This makes it easier to give instructions to smaller kids. Although I wasn't climbing, there were plenty of nice benches and lounge areas to watch from. 
Overall, we enjoyed our time at Rock Solid. We purchased a gift card for a friend, and we will be back.

Let me tell you about this place.  When I walked in, I was greeted with a warm welcome! 

The place looked very clean and well organized.  The staff were ever so sweet! 

The lady at the front desk gave me a tour and walked to me my hot cycle room.  She explained everything clearly and even brought me a water! 

It is cycling but in an infrared sauna.  My workout was only 15 min but it felt like it was more after how much I sweat.....

After that, I showered and dressed there. The cleanest bathroom ever. 

It was seriously the coolest experience!  I will be back once they open a downtown location.

I'm a student at East Bay High and having a gym that's literally 1 minute away was absolutely amazing. I've been going since they opened in early January and it's been adequate until a few days had passed. First of all, anytime I want to call about a pressing matter I can never get in touch with a live person. There also been an ongoing issue that there's no hot water. Anytime I finish my workout, it's crucial that I take a shower because I have work right after and I cannot let myself look like a lunatic. My parents are paying a hefty family rate and it's not fair for them to be paying when our needs as a family aren't met. Even when I've called and was lucky to have someone to converse with, they simply say "we're working on it". 

Considering this is a new facility, I had astronomically high expectations. But sadly, they've gone down quickly. 

Update 2/13/19: Well, they still have no hot water. I'm changing my membership for Crunch. They have a sauna and you guessed it -- hot water.

Been a member for over 8 months now and quit today. Why?

The good:
- Clean gym
- Never overcrowded
- Never took any classes, so can't tell

The bad:
- A machine broke and it took them literally 2 months to fix
- Charged me $5 more on my month-to-month subscription without notification
- Was given attitude after I inquired about the $5 increase... (When I inquired about a $5 increase in my monthly fee discovered on my visa bill, they said the manager would call me. Never did. Inquired again on the same day and I was told they have a notice on. I said where's the notice? They replied, "oh it was on the counter somewhere and we also tell people when they come in." Seriously? I go there twice a week and said hi to the lady every time. Why didn't she tell me? Then she gave me attitude as if I am supposed to read all announcements on her counter when I walk in. They then found the announcement BEHIND another announcement - and guess what? It was printed in 12 size font on a letter size paper. Good luck reading that. She then called her manager to resolve the situation, which was great, but couldn't resist giving me further attitude in the process. That was the end of that.)

So what made me quit? Bad customer service - can't even deal with a little troubleshooting without getting emotional... very amateur staff.

If I go back, I'd have to fake a smile every time I see the front desk staff and feel upset. Rather avoid the negative emotion and find another happy place to work out at.

The training here is no joke. If your serious about getting healthy and FIT the staff at D1 will teach, push and encourage you, all you have to do is show up and do the work. The classes move fast but your free to go it at your own pace... However if they know you can do better ( heavier weight, faster run, more reps) then they will expect you to do so. After all your their for a reason... 
I appreciate the sign on the exit door after each class... "you just got better" .

I've been a member of LA Fitness for about 8 years now and have gone to several in the area (Montgomeryville, Fort Washington, etc.). This LA Fitness in East Norriton is middle of the pack. I've been to LA's that were better and others that were worse. 

The best aspect of this location (other than proximity to my home!) is that there is hardly ever a wait for equipment. 

The lack of yoga classes is my least favorite feature. There are a total of three yoga classes on the schedule and two of them are in the middle of the workday (~11am). 

The poor parking is also a problem.
Love it here so far, especially after the renovations. All the machines are awesome! I love the classes just wish they had more at night! The place is clean and well organized. Never too crowded.

I use this gym all the time, like nearly every day.

Pros: clean gym, friendly staff. Has all the basic machines and weights that I need.

Cons: RIDICULOUSLY HOT in the summer. I am not even sure if they have air conditioning, but you can see the temperature on the thermostats throughout the gym at peak times is literally 78 or higher. There are giant fans on the ceiling, but when you are doing cardio it is near impossible to work out in these conditions. And baseline I am always freezing and never complain about heat -- that just speaks to how hot this place gets. And I have overheard many people with the same complaint. I am not sure if its to save $$ on air conditioning, but come on, how are PF's clients supposed to work out in a sauna.


Addendum: a few days ago, after I posted my review, I did see the manager walking around the gym with an AC serviceman. I am glad they take their clients' concerns seriously. I hope that the AC problem is fixed bc I do like this gym, but the heat is intolerable during a workout.

Extremely poor customer service unless you are being sold something. I was a Ballys member before the sale to LA, they stripped away the use of the racquetball court from me because I still have the Ballys plan. I paid $3500 when I signed up with a $120 annual renewal fee. Now LA Fitness is trying to force me to cancel my plan and sign up with a new plan just to use the court. It's bad enough that the staff already sucks there, but this was just the icing on the cake.

Friendly staff, but dirty facilities ruin it for me. Routinely find trash in cup holder of cardio machines, bottles and paper towels next to weight machines, no more paper towels in cleaning station, bathrooms always smell bad (most likely because 3-of-5 stalls are always left unflushed/clogged) and at least one stall always has a malfunctioning lock. Oh, and no hooks on most bathroom doors. It's all just a real drag :( don't bother joining.

I've only been working out at OrangeTheory for the last two months but I'm a big fan. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Ive been very impressed Bird and Fury-- they're both amazing coaches but have different styles. The studio is clean, organized and has plenty of space. The workouts are always different so you'll never repeat the same exercises or routine ever again, which I believe, helps prevent boredom and monotony.  Each class is a new experience and high energy. The stats on the screens are also extremely motivating; helps you to track your own progress and push yourself. I highly recommend to those looking for a new HIIT workout.

Last Friday of our Christmas break and we see these guys have free Fridays. I had been hearing a lot of buzz about this place and was super excited to finally be able to experience it. We had already fill out waivers online but we had to watch a safety vid before climbing. Super funny short film btw. After getting shoes that fit super snug we were on our own! we had a blast for a solid two hours. Our 5 year old didn't go too far off the mat but still had a blast perfecting the safety fall. I will say I didn't make the best decision in dress. I have no clue why I didn't think to wear athletic clothes but I still rocked it in my jeans. I cannot wait to return and to also visit the Tchoup location. So many options and routes I think it's impossible to ever do it all. Very well built.

5:00 AM training?  YES! Christian is it. I am so grateful he's willing to wake up at 4 am and ride bike over to my building. Due to my commute to Anaheim evening workouts are difficult. Thank you Christian for waking up before dawn and taking care of my physical wellbeing. His training method is well thought out and effective, his personally sure helps time fly by while training.

I hate working out, I really do.

Does Fitness Factory inspire me? No, but I don't think anything could.

Luckily for them, there isn't much competition on Wash Ave, but they do a generally good job.

I don't take any classes or personal training, but for what I need to do there is plenty of nice, newer  equipment and usually not a wait. The people working there are friendly and things are always being cleaned.

Seriously though, would it be that tough to get more little towels? There are always hundreds of big towels ready, but it's a treat if I get a small towel. For $50 a month that's not too much to ask.
This is the closest location, the only problem is that the cost of this place is expensive. The fact that people have to pay to workout is pretty sad.

I needed to mix up my workout routine since sitting in the Y to lift weights was getting monotonous, and my visits there were getting fewer and farther between. I had done some rock climbing in a gym years ago when I worked close to one, and I have had my eye on this newer place for a while. I decided to make the change and recently signed up for a membership here at Evo. 

The location is convenient for me since it is close to work. It is in the middle of a big industrial area with a lot of trucking and warehouses, but it is actually pretty easy to get to. The building's location close to the interstate makes it a fairly easy drive from a lot of the city. They have a parking lot in front, but could have used a little more space than what they have when it is busy. All of their pricing, business hours, and other great information are very easy to find on their website, so you can look at all of that on your own.

Getting signed up was easy, but was also the one big issue I have had in my limited experience here so far. I knew I wanted to start a membership, so I went straight to the desk and said that. It was easy, and was just a matter of filling out a form with basic information, and signing their waiver form. After that, they got a credit card on file for monthly billing, and handed me my scan card to get in each time. And that was it. No tour, no direction, no intro to what they offer, no discussion of the rules, and no sort of safety or competency lesson whatsoever. It's really not a problem for me since I had spent a number of years climbing already, but he didn't know that. Other than the fact that I came in with my own gear, he had no idea what I knew or didn't know. I'm sure if I would have asked I could have gotten all of that, but it seems like it should be standard.

Other than that, the experience has been fantastic. They have a gear shop that has all of the essentials you need for climbing, and their prices are reasonable if you wanted to get something that day and didn't want to drive up to REI. Their bathroom/locker room (at least the mens) has a bunch of lockers and plenty of space to change and get ready. They also have a shower. There are lots of storage cubbies out in the main area as well. They have much more lead climbing than other gyms I have been to, and it seems like most walls are set up both for lead climbing and top roping. It is a nice variety, and you'll find a route with most features you could be looking for. There are currently 3 auto belays spread throughout the room, and each of them give you access to numerous routes. Their bouldering section is a little on the small side, but still has a variety of problems. They are set up so that almost all problems top out if you wanted to. They set their routes using the same colored holds for each route, which is much nicer than having pieces of tape everywhere that get torn off or are hard to see. I put myself more on the beginner side of the spectrum, skill wise, but there are lots of routes and problems for someone at any level.

The people here are what really make this gym stand out compared to others. Everyone is extremely welcoming and outgoing,  and it appears to be a large group of regulars here. The one owner I met is a very nice guy, and all of the staff that I've interacted with has been great. It seems like this is more of a place that attracts members rather than random visitors, but they still have plenty of those. I have made it in a few times during my lunch break and it seems fairly empty during the day, but in the evening after work, it does get pretty full. 

In addition to the climbing area, they have a smaller gym with some free weights and strength training items and a few pieces of cardio equipment. They also offer different instructor led classes that include yoga, strength training, aerial silks, PiYo, and even dancing. I have seen things about intro to climbing classes, special kid's events and classes, and even women only intro to climbing classes.

Now, the obvious comparison to Hoosier Heights, the other major rock gym in town. HH is just way too inconvenient for me since I live downtown and that area of the city can be a mess in the evening. That being said, if that drive wasn't an issue, I would probably personally pick HH over Evo so far. Hoosier Heights is cheaper, bigger, offers more climbing and variety of routes, and just seems like an overall better deal. Evo, however, does have a much more community feel to the place and caters more towards climbers and regulars rather than kid's birthday parties and singles outings. They are also still growing and adding more things, so I'll see where they end up. 

I certainly like it here so far. It's only been a couple of weeks so I will update later if anything changes, but I plan on making this my go-to activity for exercise for the foreseeable future.

This is a new location so all the machines are working and they have water filing stations which is nice. The best time to come is during the day because it does get pretty hectic in the evening. It is not a large building so when it is busy, it is not the easiest to get around. I've had pleasant encounters with the staff members and the personal trainers. They're definitely more polite than the other locations that I have been to.

I feel at home at this Y. It's cleaner and typically less crowded than the Mid county Y. Plus the staff are friendly and welcoming at the downtown location. This location is small so it doesn't have a pool or basketball courts, but if you're just looking to do strength work or some cardio then this is a good spot. They also have boot camp classes. This place has been a great spot for me to keep up with my fitness goals.

Main Street Gym is a perfect fit for the historic St. Charles area.   The gym has everything you need for your workouts including cardio, tredmills, free weights, Machines, bosus and so much more.  MSG has tanning, group ex classes, a juice bar, personal trainers and the people are super friendly.   The gym is very nice and the locker rooms are spectacular.  A lot of thought and care goes into making this gym exceptional.  Skip the corporate gyms & give MSG a tr

Finally, a high-end cycling studio without the high-end price!

CycleBar is one of the newest cycling studio franchises to enter into what could be called an overcrowded industry. Rest assured, however--CycleBar is not like the others, and it's WONDERFUL!

Taking a class at CycleBar is an experience you won't soon forget. Upon walking in, you're greeted by CycleBar employees, who will help you sign into class on an iPad (if you need help), and find the bike you're signed up to be on. Once you're logged in, they'll help you find the perfect shoes to wear for class (at no additional cost), which will clip onto the bike.

Next, it's time to head to the lockers, where you'll swap your shoes, and lock your stuff away (no need to bring a lock--they've got you covered). Fill up a complementary, reusable CycleBar water bottle, and you're good to go! Time to head into the studio.

And then....the class! Dim the lights, turn the music up, and get ready for the cycling experience of your life (yes, it's like a nightclub, but with bikes)! For the next 45 minutes, the instructor will motivate you and challenge you on your state-of-the-art bike--guiding you through the different resistance levels, speeds, etc. Towards the end of class, you'll do a few arm exercises with a (light) weighted bar, as well. 6 pounds never felt so heavy! If you're competitive, you can opt to have your stats displayed on the board overhead, so you can see how you compare to your fellow cyclers. By the end of class, you're drenched from a good workout, yet invigorated at the same time!

Once you walk out of the cycling studio, you're greeted with refreshing, lemon-scented towelettes, and fresh fruit (apples and bananas). From the water bottles to the shoes to the towels to the locker space to the fruit...everything at CycleBar is complementary, and feels like a first-class fitness experience! 

I've tried the other popular franchise cycling studios, which I will not name (although none others are in the Tampa Bay area)--and while I've enjoyed them, I must say, I've often felt like I've been overcharged. FINALLY, CycleBar is the cycling experience I've been looking for--affordable in price, but extraordinary in experience. Thank you, CycleBar!

P.S. The only thing I would change about CycleBar South Tampa is the schedule. I would love to see more classes added in the mornings (i.e. 7:30, 8:30, 9:30, etc.), but right now, the majority of their class times on weekdays are in the late afternoon and evenings. I am hoping this will change as customer demand grows! :)

This gym gets the job done. 

Upsides: 
Childcare is included in the membership! 
The pool is well designed for lap swimmers! 
The showers are HOT and they have soap at each station. 
They appear to provide towels (Not sure exactly about this) 
The Spa is plenty hot
They appear to have most of the machines you'd want for lifting weights 
Staff is friendly

Downsides: 
The lockers are rusted out (All of them) 
The tops of the lockers are coated in dust (All of them)
The steam room isn't very hot, nor was it clean (18+ only) 
The spa doesn't allow anyone under 18 in it (see freezing children cold from the pool)
The showers are in the hallway that everyone has to travel to reach the pool 
The floors are visibly dirty (even in the mandatory feet only area's) 

This is an older facility. It feels old in its design and function. Millennial types will likely abhor its lack of privacy in the locker rooms. 

But when it comes down to it, everything you need is here and with a little effort on your part it can be great (see clean).

Attempting to park in this gym's parking lot or around this gym is a nightmare. We missed our first class and ended up taking a class an hour later because we couldn't find parking. We had a groupon pass but this is the first gym to pounce on us immediately as we walked in for a tour and sell talk. The gym itself was packed; people were everywhere, which explains the parking lot although my guess is most people live or work in the area. The gym is just too cramped for me. We barely found locker space. While class was enjoyable, I wouldn't fight for a parking space to get there every week.

I love working out at Wellbridge!  There is never a wait on machines, the trainers are really knowledgeable and helpful, and the facility is clean.  The locker rooms are great for getting ready.  They've got you covered if you forgot deodorant, need a hair dryer, etc.  Highly recommend!

Just joined two weeks ago and I've gone every single day, with the exception of two, because there's always a class that strikes my interest. Want to go hard and sweat your stress out? Try swift. Need a good stretch and to feel powerful and less stressed? Try yoga. Also, I'm brand new and I already feel Npatown's tight community. Everyone is very welcoming from the attendees to the staff members. Very pleased with my experience!

If you have a family (young kids) this is the best gym around Media. It's more of a community than a gym. It takes a little while to find your way into a group, but now it's like a second home. My family loves the Y. We have been members for five years. From an equipment standpoint, they just invested in a big upgrade. It's still not a power lifters gym, but again, for a family, it has it all. The Kids Zone staff are great, the pool/swim lessons, kids art classes, birthday party facilities, camps, and they have great  group fitness classes with great instructors.

One of the best gyms I have ever been too.  Prices are very low and there is not monthly commitment.  From the outside it is hard to tell but it is much bigger then the chain gym next door.  
The pool is not very good but if you are looking for a place with more free weights/ machines then any other along with plenty of classes and cardio equipment then this is the place for you.

I was able to snag a 3 month unlimited membership coupon from Gilt.com for about $225. I was a bit nervous at first due to the price tag and 3 month commitment and the fact that it's a new studio but the savings were steep (from the Gilt coupon), the location was perfect, the schedule had super early classes (6 a.m.) and late classes (8:30 p.m.), and I was looking for more cross training than just yoga zen. I've been to half a dozen classes so far and I love it. This studio will definitely get you in shape and help gain and tone muscle a lot faster than a traditional yoga class. However, do keep in mind that this is not a traditional yoga studio. If you're able to overlook that aspect than you will fall in love too. Only catch, membership rates are super steep. Even though it's a good fit for me as far as style, after my three month membership experience, I won't be renewing unless I win the lottery or they decrease their rates... I'd rather join the Bellevue's gym for all that money.

I've only been to three classes but I love it!! I so wish they had told me membership prices before I tried it so I wouldn't have fallen in love lol. Thankfully I was gifted with 5 class pass for Christmas. Coach Fury is the absolute best-if you don't understand something she is quick to break it down calmly for you. Never frustrated or irritated that you couldn't get it the first time! Only downside  is parking isn't too great, and if you cancel a class they take one away- it's hard when life gets in the way!

Great place to work out.  It's clean and well maintained.  The place is small, however it was not crowded and there were plenty of choices. I took a star away because the showers did not provide soap.

I just settled in town, so wanted to try this gym, signed up online for their trail.  When I got there (within their business hour), no one is in the office.  I left 2 voice messages to ask them to call me, they returned my call 2 weeks later.

I took advantage of the first free ride with some of my friends....I had taken a cycle class before at other gyms so I had an idea of what to expect. 

The staff was super helpful! When I got to my bike there was issues getting my shoe to hook into the pedal but the young lady was determined to make sure that everything would go smoothly so she got me a new shoe and worked on the pedal. 

The class was really cool. The instructor kept me engaged and she used the song lyrics to motivate the class. Her words of motivation were much needed! 

After class they har cool towels waiting as well as water and snacks. 

I will be back for another ride!

So, I've been coming to this location for about a year now with a client that I work with. The staff is always friendly and your greeted as soon as you enter the gym. Whenever, I have questions about a particular machine, the staff is always their to assist.  The equipment seems to pretty up-to-date and in good shape. Everytime, I've used their locker room there always clean and well kept. I usually go in the morning time, so I'm unsure if the cleanliness of the gym changes throughout the day. However, everytime that I visit the gym it's always a pleasant experience.

I received 4 months free membership from Anthem and fell in love with the place and joined. I love love the Mon and Wed 7:25pm group exercise class with Kathy! She in fun! No ore-sign ups just show up! Lap swimming g 8-20pm indoors every night. No extra class free like others! They have day care and book club and kids events. Great friendly staff.

I recently joined LA fitness at this location. I really like the equipment but not the overall cleanliness. This place serves my purpose because I'm not fond of the nearby planet fitness or Giant in Delran.  My experience of joining was a little overbearing and quite unnecessary; it seemed like a car sales pitch and I quickly interrupted the staff member signing me up. And I responded "just tell me what is the cost and what do I have access to"!!!

After joining I was introduced to one of the personal trainers and he tried to give me his pitch and quickly dismissed the need for his service; I mean I have been weight training for over 20 years and have ran several long distance races. At age 43 I maintain a pretty high level of fitness and I wasn't in need of there personal trainer and I made that clear to both the salesman and the personal trainer at my initial signing. However even after making that clear; I received 6 additional phone calls from there personal trainer Joe trying to sign me up. After each phone call I said I wasn't interested and he continued to call me. These phone calls came from a similar number of a family member so each time I answered interrupting important work meetings. I am not sure how much clearer I needed to be???? These calls annoyed me so much that I contemplated canceling my membership.


Lastly my observations while weight training were a little disappointing. Weights and equipment were scattered all over the floor, which is literally an accident waiting to happen.  The men's locker room cleanliness was disturbing. I observed  fecal matter on the wall in one of the toilet stalls; as harsh as it sounds men's locker room in public gyms are generally fifthly. I just wish these issues we're addressed. I'm not sure what type of environment people grew up in but a locker room in this condition would cause me to have least contact in that area or use better hygiene. I literally saw people walking bare footed.....which is disgusting in a public gym......has anyone heard of shower shoes???????Besides theses issues I generally like the gym they just need to work on the sanitation and keeping things off the floor in the free weight area to prevent accidents.

Overall ok gym just some fixable issues that a decent manager should address.

I finished the second round. This was much harder than the first go at. I still tried to STTFP (stick to the f*n plan), but I wasn't always so diligent so it wasn't a huge shock when the scale didn't move every week. The FitFam was always sharing different ways to cook or season the food so it didn't become boring and repetitive. The workouts seemed a bit easier because my body knew what was going on. I was stronger and a bit faster with some of the workouts. I was super happy when the scale's numbers went down (of course) but the real progress and joy came when people started noticing that I was losing weight...not to mention I needed new clothes!! The coaches are so wonderful. I sat down with Dylan because I was worried about not making the final goal. He gave me some pointers on what I should do which included extra cardio after the workouts. I lost over 5 pounds that week! I also started going to the mobility class on Saturday morning. Coach Adriana led that class and she showed us the right way to do deep stretches with foam rollers and lacrosse balls. I have to say that Fridays are my favorite times of the week. The workout is lovingly called "Booty Friday"! That's also the night I go and join Zumba Dan for a great dance routine. Still can't make my hips move, but it's fun none the less. I'm down almost forty pounds, but I still have a ways to go. I'm a member of the club, but more importantly, a member of the FitFam. There is so much support from everyone in the community. I wouldn't change this experience for anything in the world!! Thanks to some of the best coaches- Adriana, Dylan, Phillip, Dan, Rachel, Anish, Bre, Shelby and of course Matt Weaver for starting me on this program. (and anyone else I might have forgotten...)

Maxercise is one of those little gems that once you find it, your torn between telling everyone so that they can experience it too and the desire to keep it all to yourself so it doesn't get too over-crowded.

I come here for their Kettlebells & gym but they also have several other martial arts programs (Jiu Jitsu, Muay Thai & Judo).  They're like concentrated weights or cannonballs with handles.  Apparently, Maxercise was the first gym in the US to feature kettlebells and every instructor here has years of experience in teaching and using kettlebells.  For the first time in my life, I have muscle definition in my arms and shoulders.  I love it! 

Gym- it's small and unassuming but I feel more comfortable working out here than anywhere else in the city.  Nobody bothers me and I don't feel like I'm getting checked out by the guys.  Everyone here is just focused on getting in shape and I've never felt judged for my flabby thighs or my girl-gut.

Personal trainers- Reasonable rates, each instructor will develop a personal fitness plan for YOU and not some weird outline that they expect you to change your daily life for.  For instance, they're not going to demand that you buy a medicine ball or kettlebells for your home, you tell them what your goals are and what you have available (as in, not at the gym) and they'll work around that.  Ask for Alma, she's a godsend.  She's helped me lose weight and stay on track, something that I haven't been able to do, well, ever. 

PROS- several different packages to choose from, very friendly, NOT a meathead gym, SUPER woman-friendly

CONS- no pool, no kid's classes
Probably one of the best steaks I've ever eaten. Top notch service. The only bad thing was the checking in and getting a table. The Paula Dean look-alike seems to frown upon non-Caucasians. #nola
Seven Minutes is a fun and exciting place to workout.  The coaches are super helpful and actually care.  I don't dread working out anymore!

I dropped by for a post Thanksgiving workout. Everyone was so friendly. I felt like I was at my usual box in Studio City. The WOD was fun. The people were great. What can I say? Ill be back... arnold style.

I've always been a bit skeptical about Crossfit in general let alone starting with a Groupon to try it out but I figured it was my best way of seeing what it was all about for a really great deal. You'll begin in the On Ramp classes at first to master the moves and understand what each move is supposed to be done like and with proper form using no weight. I was immediately impressed with this technique and have since actually corrected moves I had previously been doing wrong for many years in the gym and not known it. 3 weeks into my Groupon I already had noticed a difference in my strength, fitness and body and couldn't believe it. I've accomplished things I never thought possible thanks to the help and support all the coaches here showed me. I was hooked after 3 weeks, graduated to the main box shortly after and have never looked back. I've made great friends and I always look forward to my workouts, which are at 5:30am :) I've never been a morning person but I'm truly motivated to get up and workout, starts my day off right! You won't regret giving this gym a shot, it's the best decision I've ever made and I've never been in better shape. They even do fun events and outdoor WODs & competitions pretty often which I absolutely love. They even have Crossfit kids which I think is awesome!

P.S - the negative reviews below appear to be from truly negative people, you'd really have to be a bad person to get kicked out of this gym. Show up ready to sweat and have a good time!
I canceled my membership but they charged me a 30 day cancellation period which means I paid for an extra month. Ok fine but...Now they keep calling me to update my billing information. What?!?!

I love this place!  My friend got me to do the first week free, and I managed to get 4 classes in the first week.  I love that it is just enough distance to have a personal workout, and enough instruction to make sure I am not going to get hurt, and that I am working the right muscles, and have the right form.  It is tough, it is crossfit, and right when I get to the moment where I think I'm going to die, the exercise stops and we move onto another body part or exercise.  it pushes you right to the limit and then backs off.  Everyone is very relaxed, and it is an instructional class format.  It is intimidating to walk into the gym, but half way into the class, you quickly realize everyone is into their own workout, nobody but the trainers are watching what you do.  I Highly recommend Battle Born, for the long timers, because they will find a way to challenge you, and to the new comers, because they will welcome you and turn you into a crossfiter.  Where else are you going to git a great workout and a personal trainer at such a great quality and price?!

Not happy with the women's locker room.  4 people on the same day were face timing men.  Seriously???  What's wrong with women, if don't think you are worth it.  Sad, such low self esteem! 
I tried to send emails but they bounce back.  Hopefully something will be done!

We have moved to Philadelphia Gymnastics Center in Conshohocken - what a pleasure to be treated like a paying customer instead of something the cat dragged in.

I do want to make clear that I never had a problem with the teaching staff - only the front of the house.  Front of the house represents the owner/business - they're the first & last people you see & talk to and if they're not good in customer service they're in the WRONG profession!

Philadelphia Gymnastics Company - (610) 825 - 3023
www.philadelphiagymnastics.com

Call them!

December 2011:   Just completed my first 5 mile trail run without including any running in my training, only crossfit. My previous best was barely finishing a 5k road race last month. Progress is a beautiful thing! Thanks CF Revolution!!!

October 2013 update:  Thanks to Eric's programming, I'm 5 days away from my second marathon after another successful triathlon season!  Phase 5 can prepare you for just about anything.

Y'know, when you go to a salon for the first time, you're really not sure what to expect.  You hope for a great experience, that your stylist will understand what you're trying to say even if you don't really know what you want.  That you will walk out feeling like a million bucks.
Well, I can quite honestly say that Dominic's did that for me today.  
As soon as I walked in the door, I felt welcomed, not belittled.  I loved the atmosphere...it was lively and comforting without making me feel alienated.  My stylist and her assistant were knowledgeable and thorough and easy to talk to.  
Definitely go, you won't be disappointed.

Aside from the issues clearly out of the region's control this is a family friendly facility. The hours are perfect for the suburban area, classes are great and the management staff does their best to address issues that are presented to them. I've witnessed so many angry people losing their minds over their cancellation issues, maybe read the agreement and complete the process correctly? I don't know how their front desk staff does it, they always have a smile on their face and seem to try their best to assist members.

Absolutely the BEST gym in Indy!  The workouts will have you burning calories, increasing strength and mobility.  I get a full body workout every time I attend. They also don't nickel and dime you to death, for various fees and charges.  

What makes this gym different though, is the investment they have in you, as a member.  They make you feel as though you are a part of a giant family, always willing to go above and beyond to make sure you leave happy and with an excellent workout under your belt.  

Their investment in their members has been even more obvious during Covid times.  ETF has done a great job in sanitizing, limiting class sizes and a fancy air purifier.  

Check it out if you get a chance, you won't be disappointed!

The facility is great for kids, but constantly overcrowded. The administrative staff could care less about anything except money and will treat you like a number, which is what you are to them, a checking account number to be exact. Nancy, the customer service manager, is condescending and rude. The assistant fitness director is so stressed out and rude, her name is Rachel ling. The only time I have tried to speak with either of them I have left furious and wouldn't recommend this gym to anyone who wants to be treated with respect. They have so many members they truly don't care about anyone who has a complaint, they will flat out dismiss your concerns and act like you don't exist.

Great place to work out! I go here almost everyday with my friends and lemme tell you the staff is great here! They're always helping people out and letting them know if they're doing something wrong. Also the people here that work out are supper supportive. I've had multiple people when I'm not with my friends help spot me and it's great. Plus the pricing is really cheap not even expensive! I would highly recommend people coming here to work out!
