I my self have been going for about one year now these people are great if you ask one of the coaches hey can you show the best way to do this or that's they will,show you and and work with you for a few min till you get it.

They had no problem freezing my account after I had my shoulder surgery I showed them the Dr note and bam they froze me till I cam back I was out three months.

The people are great always getting hellos never Met a bad person there even management is great the people working out or just as nice.

This is a no frills gym no wi-Fi but hell I use my lol MP3 player and it dose just fine.

So if you are looking for a gym with great people not pushy but nice this is it.

They do offer you a coach but you have to pay for that they never pushed me when declined.

Not pricy ether.  



                   Great Place Great People

It's a decent gym for the price. They're not LA Fitness, but then they don't try to be, and I really do appreciate the affordability.

If this was pre-Covid I'd give it more stars. I appreciate that they let members suspend their memberships for a few months, and not have to cancel them, while the pandemic is still going on (which it is). But I'm very disappointed in their corporate HQ's decision to allow customers to not have to wear masks "while actively working out":

https://popculture.com/trending/news/planet-fitness-walks-back-mandated-face-mask-policy-during-workouts/

It's a ridiculous policy - it's exactly when people are working out that they huff and puff and exhale deeply - and exhale the most aerosol droplets from their lungs, which then circulates all over the place! So, until either they change their policy to require masks 100% of the time - including while working out - or until the Covid risk is 100% over - we will keep our family's memberships suspended, or we might even cancel our memberships.  All because of an unwise corporate policy. It's really a shame.

The staff here is sooo friendly. There's an older woman there-she's super sweet. The machines are typically clean & it doesn't get too crowded here. The only reason I've stopped going is because it is too far from my house & work to keep going there-especially in the brutual Philly weather!!

Great gym, all the equipment you need for a killer workout including free weights and a squat rack. 
The lighting in this place rocks, as does the the music and energy. 
The owners are way cool and take great care of their members. 
The gym also has a dry sauna and alkaline filtered water.

The Monon Center is in my opinion, the best thing Carmel has to offer. 

After moving here from southern California in 2007, I was stunned by how different life was. I felt like there was nothing to do from the months of November til April, or May, whenever Indiana stops being so darn cold. 

I found the Monon Center and everything changed. No need to go into gory details :-)

They offer an outdoor aqua park, with lazy river and slides, kiddie pool and playground, huge sandbox, etc. An indoor, heated pool...kiddie and adult lap pool. You can walk the indoor track year round. You can go to group fitness classes (everything from turbo kick to spinning) or you could sweat it out in the fitness center on your own. They offer a wide range of recreational activities for young and old. In the nicer months you could go for a jog on the Monon Trail that splits this place, or take a walk/jog, maybe feed some ducks near the "pond" and many paths. 

I have heard people say that they thought the Monon Center was private, and it IS NOT! 

I recommend this place to anyone and everyone.

This review is long overdue. The owners and coaches are 100% committed and passionate about every single person that walks through their doors.  The members are diverse and friendly. Maybe because of the centralized location and simple navigation, I've also noticed a steady stream of drop ins. The gym itself is an spacious, well maintained and has many options for group Crossfit classes, Olympic lifting classes, personal training and open gym. Lastly, the group programming can be as challenging for all levels. I definitely would recommend this gym.

The only thing that saves this from one star is that the massage therapist herself was a-mazing.  I'll follow her to her next gig, but I won't be going back here.

This place is not at all relaxing.  You walk in to a gym complete with clanking equipment and blasting music.  There was some sort of crime movie on the flat screen tv in the waiting area.  When my friend and I walked in to redeem our Groupons, the receptionist didn't really greet us.  In fact, she looked confused when she saw us come in.  Then I found out why.

They lost our reservations.  Instead of saying they lost our reservations, she insisted that I never called to make them.  I had to show her my cell phone log to prove I called.  THEN when she saw the date and time, she announced that she was the person who had taken my appointment.  No apology.  None.   No offer to do anything for us.  My friend had come in from New Jersey for the day specifically for the spa.  Apparently, nobody was there to take us so she had to try to call someone in.   She was only able to get one therapist to come in, so she said we could either re-schedule or go back to back.  Still no apology, still no offer to compensate.  

My friend isn't one to take things lying down so she asked for some kind of consideration for the inconvenience.  At first, the receptionist  said nothing could be done but then said she would call the manager.  She came back saying they could offer us 15% off a future service.  Since we wouldn't be coming back, that wasn't going to work.  Instead of dealing with it, she offered to let my friend call the manager, which she did.  Ultimately the manager offered to increase our massages from 50 minutes to 85 minutes each with no extra charge.  That was nice, but unfortunately made each of us sit even longer with nothing to do while the other was getting the treatment.   

When we were finally brought back we had to fill out some bizarre forms to get a locker.  I don't know what's happened in the past but they're really protective of their lockers.  The steam shower in the locker room was broken.  The "waiting room" for the actual spa is a small bare room separated from the locker room by a curtain.  Again, not at all relaxing.  

The actual massage was fantastic.  I wish my experience wasn't so bad or I would go back to her every week.
Love this gym! Lots of friendly staff and great equipment for a low price. Best gym ever!

The staff is so friendly and welcoming, as well as the facility! The gym is large and doesn't feel dirty or claustrophobic. 

I love how easy it was to find a class time that worked out, they have so many options. The online portal makes it so easy to sign up, pay, and communicate with the staff. Any issue I had was met with ease almost instantly, which is hard to find. Highly recommend.

This gym is too expensive for what it offers. Machines are broken often and there aren't many to begin with. I was always waiting to use a machine after work. My time is limited and I was spending too much time waiting for a machine to free up rather than working out, so this gym wasn't for me.

This place can only be described in one word: AWFUL. I taught swim and life guarded for 8 years. Based on the condition of the pool area, I can tell you that they probably scrub the deck once a month, if that, and almost never vacuum the pool. The locker room and bathrooms are always filthy, as are the machines. Dust everywhere. Too many peacocks for my liking. Too many meatheads and women who think it's appropriate to work out in their underwear. The girl at the front desk isn't nice and doesn't even acknowledge your existence when you walk in. She just plays on her phone the entire time. My fiance is the nicest guy you could ever meet. He always says Hi to her and she just ignores him. The Yoga class is not at all relaxing and only focuses on stretching but not breathing or "finding your center". They also roped off a giant area for personal training. Most of all, too many people/meatheads, who just stand around and talk and socialize and don't actually work out. No wifi and from what I understand, cars get broken into all the time. I quit and went to Planet Fitness. It is by far the worst LA Fitness in the whole serious, and of course, the one closest to me.

When I first became a member of planet fitness everything was nice, the staff and gym members were awesome. Now it's the complete opposite, you're lucky if you can snag a machine or even get a good workout.

There really isn't a good selection of gyms near the Havertown area. You have LA Fitness, which is old and dirty, but cheap. There is also PSC Armdore, which is old, dirty, and expensive. 

Snap is growing chain of small 24x7 gyms, with a basic selection of cardio and weight training equipment, but none of the extra crap at a gym that you probably don't use anyway. Seriously, the only reason one should ever venture into a gym sauna is to study infectious diseases. 

This snap location is great for me, since its literally a few blocks from my house. The equipment is all brand new, and they have a good selection. The place isn't oversold, so you can go there at any time and get on the equipment you want to use. 

The equipment is clean, and the people are normal. Because its not some gigantic gym, it doesn't appeal to the meathead crowd you might find at other places. 

To top it off, they have a no-contract option too. The only catch is you need to give 30 days notice to cancel.

Really disappointed in this gym. I came home to visit for the holidays and wanted to workout while I was vacationing. First off, there was a sign on the door that read that they would not be giving guest passes during the Thanksgiving weekend. What an awful way to advertise that you truly care about peoples fitness journey rather than making money for your gym. I used to gym here when I lived in Boise a few years ago and I will make sure to never recommend this specific gym to anyone of my friends and family who still live in the area. Secondly, the gym hours were visibly plastered on not only your website, the doors and also the note placed on each of the windows. I made sure to go during the hours a membership specialist would be there because I had a feeling my key fob wouldn't work...and sure enough it didn't. I called and left a VM and STILL have not received a returned call. It's now Sunday and this was Wednesday. Horrible business practice.

Great Boutique Gym near the busy district. They had everything I needed to get a good workout. You can buy day and week passes and it was worth it. Any type of fitness plan can be achieved as there is open functional space, free weights, TRX, cables, Smith Machine, 1/2 Rack, a loaf of selectorized strength equipment and cardio. Great gym

I really do like crunch, I love how everything is new the gym is always clean and also the fact that they have saunas, and also it's only $10 bucks. 

But I live way to dat I'm about 40 minutes away also every location I have been to is super small and everyone is lotion top of each other. 

This has been my experience for the locations in center Florida and the Miami area.

I just started going back to the gym recently and I will say I really do like this gym. It's always clean and never busy. Even though sometimes when I come up to park and see the parking lot looks full I feel discouraged but when I go inside i am always surprised that there isn't that many people in the gym as I had thought. You have access to personal training which I LOVE. I was never looking for a personal trainer but definitely someone to just show me how the equipment works so I can strength train. You sign up for the classes online and show up and Liz will show you how it works and tech you reps! I really do like this gym but if I had to add one suggestion it would be to put fans in the locker room area of the bathroom. I like to sit in there after I'm drenched in sweat to cool off by myself but it sucks with no fan in there

This is a story that will come with impending updates...

So, I've been a member of Anytime Fitness for several years now. All locations are independently owned, though visiting one location more than X times per month automatically means your home club updates.

This location opened last year, which was exciting to me because it meant I had a gym to frequent when I stayed with my significant other. 

For at least a month, this gym had that "new gym smell" free of dirt and sweat. They had done a great job with the contemporary feel of the place, and there was almost always a staff member on site cleaning the equipment or vacuuming the floors. These are all good things. Not to mention that with several sites across the country, it's rare to find an Anytime Fitness that is so packed you have to wait on your desired machine/piece of equipment. 

So, I was sitting happily at 4 or 5 stars for several months.

The nasty weather we've had, combined with a new schedule has left me very little time to visit the gym to work out. Additionally, things have changed for me financially and it just does not make sense monitarily to continue to pay $35/mo - especially when some bigger boys have come out with more frugal offers.

So I start to look into canceling my membership. I read many, MANY horror stories online about it being nearly impossible to terminate a relationship with Anytime Fitness. I start to worry. So, I call my 96th street gym and the gentleman to talk to an actual person about canceling my membership.

"Hey, no problem. All we require is 30 days' written notice that you would like to cancel your membership with us. You can send an email if you'd like, and here is your account number."

Though a little disappointed that they hadn't tried to keep me on as a customer (lower price, hint hint), I sent my little email informing them that I wanted to cancel my membership in 30 days.

About four days later, I receive an email stating that they're sorry, but they can't accept written notice as a means of terminating a membership. They're sorry, but I physically have to come into the facility and do that in person.

Oh, okay, so THIS is where Anytime Fitness wants to start dicking me around.

So! As this is a story that shall remain "To Be Continued" until I can drag my out-of-shape ass across town to see what they're going to try to say to me in person, I'll offer them the benefit of the doubt with three stars. 

To improve things, I'd recommend this location makes sure ALL staff is aware of ALL policies.

Professional trainers that ACTUALLY cater to your personalized physical heatlh needs!  

My previous trainer in Chicago was actually overweight which made me feel like, "If he's asking me to do these things, shouldn't he practice what he preaches?!"  So when I moved to Nashville, I ventured out to find a new personal trainer in Nashville, independent of large franchised gyms.   

When I first walked into LEAN, I was pretty nervous.  You know walking into a gym with fit people and me walking with my gut hanging out made me feel really uncomfortable.  But all the trainers aren't here to judge, they're here to actually make you feel better by losing weight and making you stronger and even provide educational classes on nutrition on occasion.  

I've been going to LEAN for the past few months and they really know how to motivate you to go one step further that I probably wouldn't be able to do on my own. 

For me and probably like many others, I lacked the motivation to push myself to my limit, hindered by negative attitude.  The trainers at LEAN positively motivate and encourage you to do your best and whip you up into shape.   

If your New Year's resolution is to get in shape in Nashville, go to LEAN personal training!
Friendly staff and great organized workout options close to home. Who could ask for anything more!

Very happy to have them. Clean facility, lots of great equipment, awesome environment. I spent several months in physical therapy and decided to invest in a gym membership instead and it was far less expensive and some of the same equipment which was most beneficial.

This gym smells like piss they need to stop hanging out at the counter giving themselves bro high fives and grab a mop and bucket and clean the place top to bottom. For a 24 hr fitness that's NOT open 24 hrs you think they would have some down time to clean the machines and bathrooms. I've told the pitiful staff that the gym smells bad and they just say ....yeah oh and the drain in the woman's shower doesn't drain its full of nasty water. Honestly whoever is managing this place needs to go because it's obvious they don't care about anything.

I came here for the second time to try out a class bright and early Saturday morning! I haven't been to CorePower in a hot minute but decided to give it another chance. And I love it! The location is ideal: close to trolley stops, restaurants, shopping and coffee shops right in the heart of the city! I tried out a C2 class and a sculpt class and I loved both of them! Mats to rent are $2 and towels to rent are $2. They have showers and a locker room and it's a very nice space to get a work out in and freshen up before you go out the door! The staff is very friendly and welcoming and the studio is just really nice. I will definitely be back to try out a few more classes in the future!

So happy that classpass led me to trying classes at Shred 415. Well, Class Pass and having an instructor that is a friend (hi, chris!)

Shred 415 is one of those classes that energize you at the same time it's kicking your booty. This studio does an amazing job of making everyone feel comfortable and really pushing you to your limits.

I cannot say enough good things about all the people I have met thus far, and I can say this without being an actual member (and that's on me due to a travel and work schedule - nothing on them! One day I will be a member :) 

A clean, welcoming lobby - full of inspiration from their word wall, a small area of retail and a memo board with all the upcoming events for the week - nice touches. 

They even have a small child care area which is a rarity in studio life around Indianapolis. 

Great, clean equipment - nice and spacious bathrooms - and locking lockers. OH, and a personal favorite -an ICE MACHINE. 

Love, Shred. Do yourself a favor and take the challenge of a class here.

I found this fitness center near my air bnb and I only wiish my home gym had this wonderful staff. They have everything you need for a killer workout here but the staff really follow the sweet New Orleans charm and make it a great experience. Skip the fancy location and come here!

CycleBar is awesome! My first time I thought I was going to walk out and puke but I stuck it out and have been going ever since. CycleBar is like a small family! Absolutely love the staff and the instructors are bar none the most motivating and inspiring when it comes to getting the most exhilarating cardio workout! I get much more out of CycleBar in 50 minutes than I ever did at the gym. Where else can you burn 500+ calories in one session WHILE laughing and dancing?! I love this place. Highly recommend.

I joined in at the beginning of August and I have enjoyed it.  There's plenty of different equipment so you rarely have to wait.  The group classes are good and the instructors are all really nice, especially Brenda who does PT Circuit and Abs.  The personal trainers are a little pushy about selling their services but I understand thats how they make money.  

It's open from 4:30 am until 11pm Mon- Thurs.  I have been in the morning between 8-11 and it's not too crowded and I've been in the evening between 9-11and its not too crowded.  I heard its busy around 5-7pm but I have never been during that time.  they have all the stuff you need and none of the stuff you don't.  Only one shower, no pool, sauna, or tanning beds, just free weights and weight machines and cardio gear, ellipticals, treadmills, and stationary bikes. 

The price is reasonable and its location is convenient. No contracts, no bs.

Mei Fitness is my favorite place in Indy to work out. It's in a super convenient location for people who live in the Geist area. I love that's it's open 24/7 - it really helps it never feel too crowded. It's also great to have that flexibility to work out whenever you please. 
I love working out in smaller, locally owned fitness centers. Maybe I'm slightly biased because my family owns a small town fitness center in the town I grew up in so I'm partial to smaller gyms. But this place really feels like home and reminds me so much of my families business. 

Probably my favorite aspect of the Mei Fitness is they are UNASHAMED in their faith. I love how they play Christian music and have "there is Power in the name of Jesus" written on the wall. I just love this about them. 

I highly recommend working out here. The equipment is brand new and they have a great selection of items. The only thing missing (or at least I can't find it) is a reclining ab crunch bench. Other than that they really do have everything there. Group classes are available as well! Go get your fitness on here!

The gym has good classes and is clean. Their front desk staff really needs to be better. Over half the time there is no hello and they are on their phones, chatting with each other, or eating. I've worked at a gym and we had to say hi to every customer with a smile. Makes for a better customer experience.

Former member of both this location and Queens Village. I'm going to be unbiased in this review.  

Pros: Multiple locations, so one membership gets you into all of them.
Modern equipment for the most part.
Training staff was always fantastic, informative, accommodating, and helpful. 
Not terribly priced. I used personal trainers and were essentially $50/session and once you used trainers the fees for standard membership became included. 

Cons:
Cancellation process was difficult. I thought I had cancelled everything correctly only to find out that my account renewed. I must have done something incorrectly but I was suddenly getting phone calls from a collections agency (over $88) and took a hit to my credit. 
Showers are gross. Can confirm that at two locations.
Front desk staff at some locations seem like they'd rather be daydreaming/on their phones than assist you if you need something.

I love love love Life Time athletic.   I drive 45 minutes from my usual Princeton NJ location to come take a class with Lisa Gonzales, who taught SOL.  If you get a chance come take her class.  With over 95 people in class tonight the energy was very uplifting and she controlled the room with ease.

From Day 1 this has been the best place to workout at! I love everything about it! Welcoming and friendly front desk staff, incredible Coaches, clean facility, motivating and challenging workouts! OTF is the best!

I joined this gym for a week while on Vacation in Indian Shores. It was a little over a mile from where we were staying so I was able to run easily to the gym every morning and was happy with the cleanliness and the amount and quality of equipment at this gym.  And I belong to a small gym back home and this reminded me of that. You could tell everyone kind of knew each other, but everyone was also very nice to me and said hello. It was an encouraging environment to workout in and the trainers really knew what they were doing and everyone seemed very happy to be there. I hope I can come back again some time!

I don't go just to excersise. I go to heal my spirit. The passion that the cycle bar stars share is truly infectious. There's a magic in the room that studio with you all day.

Aside from that, the workout is tough. There's crazy moves, challenging hills, and the arm workout is no joke. 

The music and workouts are always different, and the theme rides are super fun. There's also charity rides that help the community! 

The service that is provided is amazing. The staff is friendly and always ready to help. They help configure your bike and fit you into shoes. The towels are always clean and they have chilled water. All you need to bring is an empty water bottle and socks!

I wanted to get a membership with retro fitness so much, but they REFUSE to help me over the phone.. 
apparently if I can't go there, I should not be a member. 
My attempt of sighing up: I googled, saw the info, had few questions and decide to call the gym, hoping that they will clarify, I will provide my cc info or pay online and viola! Gym membership
Apparently not at Retro Fitness. 
Called this morning- the GM is answering the call. I start with  explaining him that I can't come to the facility and I just have few questions about specific membership. 
He tells me that he cannot go over the phone about all their memberships (why not????); I tell him, that I don't need him to, that I think I know the one I want, I just have few questions about it. 
At this this point he starts to talk fast and I feel that he is not interested in talking to me (yes, you can feel that over the phone) and send me to the website. 
I explain him again- that I was using the website and I just have few questions. He says AGAIN that he cannot help me over the phone and I need to come in. 
Dear Retro Fitness management: 
1) The time you spend NOT answering my question and blabbing about it, is more than the time it would have take you to actually answer my questions
2) After I'm getting such a bad attitude and service over the phone- why would I even want to stop by and talk to you in person? 
3) EVERY other gym I called gave me full information and only suggested that I'll stop by at their facility to get the vibe.. if they can- why can't you? 
I guess these questions will forever stay unanswered. I guess bad customer service is their forte.

You will never workout like this on your own, it's impossible. The trainers push you hard but in a good way. There is nothing out there for the price that will work you out like this. I have worked out "hard" for years, I thought! After 5 weeks of 4-5 workouts a week I feel fantastic and my body is visibly changing. I can't say enough about this place. Also, if you download the app and book your sessions on that it should alleviate some of the other reviewers complaints of phones not being answered. If you go you would know that before a class starts the front desk is mobbed. Love it!!!!

As other reviews have stated, this gym is super clean, cheap and the staff is very friendly.  I've always been able to use the equipment I've wanted to, even at the peak hours after work (5:30-6 p.m.).  However, I prefer to come when it's not as packed. Overall, no complaints and am quite satisfied with Chuze.

When I joined in January 2017, they told me "the men's locker room will be finished within two weeks."

It is now middle of May 2017.  I just spoke with the office again and the men's locker room/bathroom is not completed and "there is no timetable."

What good is a gym without a locker room? There is no place to shower or change.  Awful.

This is the 3rd state I have had the pleasure of attending Orange Theory. I must say all of them are pretty consistent with workouts. The difference has been the reception and trainers. It's nice to have a place to workout and feel at home no matter what state your in. Thank you OT for having so many locations!

Pretty crappy locker room. One of the worst I've seen in my black card experience. Shower curtains were just plain dirty. The showers handles in the three stalls checked were in need of repair.  It took a while but the water did warm up. The rest of the locker room was as expected. 
Also, not even a visual nod as I walked in & scanned my phone.  This is important as a safety feature: some employee should at the very least get a visual on every patron given the crazy world we live in.
Love Tone Zone! Scott does a wonderful job!

Very simple, basic gym. I have gone here for at least 6 years and it has not changed much. Extremely affordable. I do wish the hours were better. Closes fairly early on weekends (9pm Friday, 7pm sat/sun). The tanning booths are very old and in need of new bulbs and a good clean. They do not offer classes. Locker room provides showers.
Love this place. There are so many activities, classes, great gym, lectures, movie festivals, galleries etc. something for everyone.

I can only comment on how I am treated and their gym

Despite my having free access through Silver Sneakers, I was warmly welcomed by November and then Mackenzie.


The gym is large and at times I am there [I try not to come the hours before and after most work schedules] fairly empty.  It is clean.

The women's locker room is clean.  I often see someone mopping floors.

I am very satisfied
Came here while on a road trip and did 17.4, the coach Brandon was awesome and extremely encouraging! The gym is large with plenty of equipment! I would recommend this gym!
The no risk complimentary guest pass.....DON'T TRUST IT!! It is actually a high risk, high pressure to sign up so beware of the sly words they use to get you to sign up
Its outdated, the weights are from the 1980s and the power lifting area is tiny- however, staff is awesome and if its not crowded like the one time I went you get a throwback old school workout

The classes here are THE BEST!!! There are classes Monday through Saturday, morning through early evening. I come here after work on the weekday and on Saturday morning. I do wish that the temperature in the studio was a little lower. 

There's plenty of parking spots, so no worries there!

Although I hardly use the equipment, they have a lot of treadmills and all of those other gym things. I've never see a wait for equipment. 

I love it here!
Very nice facility! Has 4 racquetball / handball courts and one basketball / volleyball court, swimming pool and jacuzzi, all kind of cardio equipment, free weights and exercise machines.

Updating this review about a year later. 
The situation has really declined at Powerhouse.  It's sad because the gym has an excellent location and some much potential.  Also, I have taken a few classes there and really enjoyed them (most recently, a great yin yoga class.) But maintenance is deficient on machines.  Certain cardio machines remain broken for weeks.  Half of the treadmills are squeaky and feel unstable. Certain weight machines, while not broken, are in clear need of maintenance they are not receiving. There is a annual upgrade charge that is supposed to be used for new equipment but I have not seen any new equipment during the past year. The music is unreasonably loud and only tolerable if you enjoy never-ending 90s trance and breaks (word to PHG: most people enjoy listening to their earphones when working out).  I stay here because it's convenient to my office and home.  I will probably switch to the JCC as soon as it opens .
Frank Borusiewicz one of the owners extremely nice guy and welcomes each member. Good gym, clean, friendly . New equipment well maintained

This gym has it all - pre and post COVID-19. Before COVID coffee and tea was offered as well as free snacks occasionally popping up on the counter. The snack selection is FIRE as are the drinks. There are plenty of options, and if you need chalk or some gear either to rent or buy - they've got it covered. Post-COVID they still offer snacks and drinks to purchase - but the complimentary coffee is on hold until further notice. Totally understandable.

As far as route setting goes - it's solid. The routes vary across the board for difficulty and the rating is very consistent. They make it easy to locate start holds, as well as determine the difficulty with range of color for bouldering rather than individual route names. This makes the wall significantly less cluttered - and the makes the routes super easy to read.

The employees and management/owners are amazing. Super friendly, kind, and knowledgeable. Always down to help with beta, offer a catch on the wall, or answer any general questions.

The gym is clean, well stocked, and has great circulation of air.

During pandemic times - all members and employees must wear a mask. It makes me feel safe and taken care of knowing that they are putting health first! 

I've been climbing here for over a year and will never switch as long as I live in Indy!

This is one hard work out! But I really did love it. I always have a hard time trying something new, and going alone so my anxiety really gets to me. The instructor and ladies behind the desk were so sweet. They really made me feel comfortable. But there were a couple regulars in the class who kept whispering and during the course. Made me feel like they were talking about me, probably weren't though, but it did make me feel uncomfortable. I will definitely do it again, but probably not stand in the front of the class again. I had lots of fun and man am I sore!! Can't wait to try again.

I joined City Fitness with a Rue La La deal. I am a fitness fanatic and go to other bootcamp classes with a trainer; however, I needed to have a back up gym to go to for other types of classes and with equipment to use on my own when the mood strikes me.  City Fitness is not far from me, and newer and nicer than Sweat, so I decided to join.

I like the facility. The machines are new and so far have been kept in great condition. There are different spaces throughout the gym for stretching/abs/body weight things as well as lifting and cardio.  

I primarily go to the classes, though. My thoughts:

1. Mondays at 5:30 there is a Bokwa class. Super fun/easy/high energy dance class. Instructor is fantastic. Go there.

2. Yoga classes -  I like Carmencita, but she doesn't use music. Which I think is a little annoying. Malik and Abby's classes are good as well. Studio is a little small, so try to get there a few minutes early. There are straps, mats, and blocks for use.

3. Spinning - I like Steve's classes - some intervals, more endurance. Timaree's Friday class is one of my favorites - high energy, lots of sprinting and jumping intervals.  You have to reserve a bike 90 minutes ahead of time. And if the class starts at 6:00, you have to call at 4:30 on the dot. Seriously.

4. Zumba - I went to one of the classes. I don't remember the instructor's name, but I was definitely NOT impressed by her. Maybe it was an off day, but she was more tired  than I was. Not okay.
Super friendly staff and great spot to hang and get in some exercise. Adults loved it as much as the kids in our group, so we will definitely be returning.

I was looking for a pool in order to swim laps. I tried a non-olympic sized pool, one that was in fact not even 25m long, and it was miserable. And then I discovered the Kroc Center!

This facility is fairly new, built last year (it is now 2012). All the spaces are brightly lit, and there is a cafe right in the middle (that smells WONDERFUL by the time I leave). The lockers are also really clean. The pool facilities are AMAZING. When you first enter, there is a kids fun park type play area and hot tub. It was pleasantly busy, but not overcrowded when I tried visiting on a Saturday.

The pool has 25m lanes and is 25 yards wide. It is made with Myrtha Stainless Steel technology imported from Italy. It's supposed to absorb the vibrations caused from swimming and increase speeds. I don't know if it's true, but I WILL say that my times compared to another pool I recently swam at were pretty drastically better. Super clean, super nice. The one thing I don't like is the temperature between the lockers and the pool - I diligently take a shower before entering the water, and it's really cold in that space.

The staff is really great and friendly. I haven't tried the rest of the facilities, but it looks very well used and liked. It's a little tough to get there from Center City, and I imagine it wouldn't be convenient for regular use if you don't own a car, but it's certainly the nicest AND most affordable pool I've found in the area.

ehhh I don't know if this is better than Pottruck. Even though it claims to be bigger, it feels smaller. It has everything you need, but it is crowded until about 30 minutes before closing. The best time to beat the crowd is early in the morning, when all the undergrads are sleeping in.

The workout equipment is like loops around the basketball courts. The huge plus to this place is that it has an indoor track on the third floor.

We switched to planet from another 24 hour gym in January. I can't speak at all about day time activity but it's pretty quiet from 10pm-2am. The staff is always super cool too. 

The machinery is very nice and there at least two of every machine. Cardio machines are super plentiful. There are rows and rows of treadmills. I do wish purple wasn't their signature color, but such is life. 

The black membership offers unlimited access to tanning beds and massage chairs/hydro beds. I can't say anything about the tanning beds because I'm Irish and we don't tan. But the hydro massage beds are soooo nice. The chairs are nice too but not as relaxing as the hydro beds. Black membership gets you half off drinks from their cooler too. 

Overall this place is well worth the monthly fee. Be advised though that if you go late at night on weekends they are only open until 7 on Fridays and Saturdays. Not a big deal, but worth mentioning.

My friend and I had a great experience at this store today!  I have not been running for a few years due to medical issues, and have gained some weight. My friend and I had been at a competitor store on the northshore yesterday and I was dismissed by the sales lady, after we came to the conclusion that my shoes were too small. Wow. Ok. If you don't look like a serious running I guess they won't sell you shoes there. Fast forward to today and Louisiana Running + Walking. Outstanding service by the two young me in the store. They were very pleasant and helpful. I ended up buying 2 pair of shoes and compression socks, more than I had in mind when I walked in the door. 

This company had a booth at the CCC10k expo, which is how I found out about them. They were nice enough to stand out in my memory to make me visit the store today.  Great customer service all the way around.

This Y is conveniently located 5 minutes from my home. I know this was meant to be a replacement/upgrade from the old Pike YMCA. Before Covid, the Y had towel service which I kinda miss, but I get it. The fitness center has a good variety of cardio and weight machines as well as free weights. It is surrounded by an indoor track to walk or run. There is a basketball gym as well as a pool used for classes and lap swim. Also since Covid, you have to reserve a lap lane. Before you could share lanes. I do wish they had a hot tub or sauna to help you relax after a workout. The staff is pretty friendly and helpful. I also wish they had longer hours on Sunday. Overall, a good place.

Lots of equipment, lots of weights and room as well as about anything you could ask for.  The pricing is excellent as well.  Was a member but sometimes they seem to like to try and save money by not running the AC.  I complained once and was told they only change the heat to ac once a year and even though it was 80 outside they would not turn the AC on as likely they would have to use the heat again.  I asked them to make sure they knew they were in TN and they assured me they knew that. (I know several days I have had my home's AC unit on and turned the heat on later in the day and vice versa)  Working out without AC in high 70s and 80s?  No, not my cup of tea so I bolted.  If you can avoid those times of the year when they have turned on the proper heat/ac it is a great place.
Very clean and comfortable enviornment.  Nice location.

I came to 9 round fitness because I've grown tired of taking the time to coordinate my own high intensity workouts at the gym. I dont want to keep taking breaks looking at my phone to figure out what the next workout is and how long to do it for. 
9 round is just what I needed. A full body, high intensity workout that allows me to choose how good of a workout I get simply by hard hard I try. 30 minutes, each workout is timed and just when you think you cant do it anymore you move to a different workout. Great flow and very motivating. 
Membership costs are just a little high but the drop in rate is only 25 and first class is free. I still think membership is worth it, it comes with workout gear (gloves, etc) and you can workout unlimited number of times. I will definitely be signing up as a member.

Cityoga has been my 'home' yoga studio since 2008. My second class was with Lisa D., who still teaches there to this day. In fact many of the teachers have been teaching and practicing there for many years, which I feel is a true testament to the quality of studio and the community built around it.

You will find a variety of classes at Cityoga to meet every skill level and almost every yoga style. Here's a quick run down of my suggestions:

Beginner: Lisa Daugherty's Saturday 9:15am Slow Flow class. Lisa has a great knowledge of yoga, and communicates very effectively in her classes to get you into the poses. She is also known to give a quick massage with essential oils at the end of some of her classes. You can also always, always expect to sing the Shanti song at the end of class too, but no one is judging if you wish to remain silent.

The Traditional Yogi: Carol Tharp-Perin's Sunday 12:30pm Ashtanga class. If you like to always know what posture is coming up next... this is the class for you. I like to call Ashtanga the bend-y pretzel style of yoga. Also, you aren't supposed to 'watch' other people in yoga class, but I recommend watching Carol. She is very graceful and makes yoga look effortless (she's had a bit more practice than myself!).

Fun Spirited: Any Adrienne Lovell class. She's a new teacher compared to the majority at Cityoga. She likes to experiment with variations to postures and always adds a little something different to each class.

Feel the Burn: Diane Hancock's Sunday 11am Kundalini class. If you are looking for something way different from what you'd expect from yoga... This class is it! Kundalini is one of the oldest forms of yoga and it is meant to stoke your inner fire. Motions in postures are repetitive and are done while doing the 'breath of fire', breathing through the nose and out through the mouth. I've only been to this class once, and it was quite the experience! Not many yoga teachers in town have been bestowed a spiritual name by a master yogi in India, nor do they sit on a fluffy white rug while teaching.

Seeking Technical Perfection: Any Lisa Riolo class. She's really great at fine tuning alignment.

So there are some classes I suggest exploring on your Tour de Yoga. Now for the studio itself you can expect an spacious lobby where you will store your shoes and other belongings in cubbies along the wall. There restrooms for women and men to change in. Beverages are available for purchase. They offer a variety of yoga related products including clothes, mats and jewelry. 

I highly recommend following the studio on social media or signing up for emails. They offer so many wonderful workshops! Last year I did the couples yoga class around Valentine's day taught by Lisa D. and her husband. It was a great experience! I've also done a few other workshops with guest teachers from around the country/world. 

I have had the great honor to practice with teachers in Central America and Asia and even a vedic monk, and I can honestly say that some of the teacher's at Cityoga are truly world class. I highly doubt any other yoga studio in town has the combined years of experience that Cityoga has. You truly are placing your health into the hands of these teachers. You can injure yourself in yoga! Pay attention to how your teachers pay attention and stick with the teachers that aren't just all about blaring hip-hop music and yelling out instructions. Paying $11-15 a class should buy you experience and/or attentiveness.

Namaste and have nice day, Yelpers!

I love this fitness center! I was not planning to join because you can get a gym membership at a traditional gym cheaper, but they had a free trial so I tried it and now I see why it's worth the upgrade!

 I could go to a gym and struggle by myself trying to figure out the machines and never know if I'm truly doing it right or getting anywhere, then probably giving up early because I feel I worked hard enough.

Or I could go to Orangetheory and have a personal trainer who is knowledgeable and friendly come and give me effective workouts without complicated machines and lead me in proper form. 

Coming here is like coming to work with a personal trainer in a group. Because it's a group you save so much money than working 1:1 costs , but you still get a good amount of attention. They manage to give individual attention really well despite being in a group. They make you feel special and they are a available for questions during and after the workouts. 

Being in this group motivates you. You also get the proper mix of cardio and lifting in a HIIT style which is the best type of training for strength, health and weight loss. 

They also have really good music playing which pumps you up and they keep a good variety to every workout. It never gets boring and you get a great workout every time.

I can only afford to go 1 day a week with my current budget and schedule, but it's one of the things I look forward to most in my week and I'm already noticing improvements in muscle
Clean, quiet .. I've tried many gyms in this area and this is one is the best  Also the staff is very Friendly

I buy the class packages, so fortunately i haven't had any issues with the business side of things.  It's been a positive experience with OTF And I've seen improvements in my overall strength and endurance.  The workout always changes and I never know what to expect (which I like).  I travel a lot, so although this is my home gym, I've been able to take other classes in different OTF locations which is awesome.  

I also hate running on the treadmill, but the programs are varied and challenging, so even the long blocks on the tread go by fast.  I find I push myself a lot harder with the coaches motivation.  And I definitely think Blaze is the most challenging!

Benn going there for years. Understood that Covid changed things. But this is a gym. People are sweating, getting dehydrated while working out. SO they cut the water to the Fountains? How safe is that ? We are preventing Covid by causing dehydration? Cutting off the water is a bigger health hazard.

Nice gym, but you need to fix your sauna door in the mens locker room. It does not shut all the way and cold air flows in like no tomorrow keeping the temperature down. It could barely get over 125 degrees this morning. Your average sauna should be able to hold a steady 150+. Yours is no bueno.
Great coaching, great programming, great atmosphere, and great friends.  I've spent extended time at several boxes and none is better than this.
The staff at the gym were very nice and professional. I didn't stay at this gym very long because it had a really strong odor. Other than that it was pretty good.
The trainers make this place. I hate that Yelp makes me elaborate because if I wanted to say something else, I would have said it the first time.

I was in town for 8 days and wanted a place to get my workouts in. When I emails some of the big box gyms, I got an average quote of 50.00 for a 7 day pass. WTF. The gym I used to belong to didn't event cost close to that for a month's membership! 

I looked on Yelp to see what I could find with small business owner locations. That's when I found reviews mentioning the option to buy an online pass for K2F. I purchased a pass online, received a door code via email and visited the gym that night. Everything I needed I found here, as well as something I never see when I visit gyms: a deadlift jack! They keep the place really clean and I love the brick walls. I am not sure but I think I spied a hip thruster platform as well. If it was, major plus to these guys. I do wish there was a little more of a kettlebell selection, but it's not a deal breaker. 

There isn't a locker room but there are 3 large bathrooms and each one has a shower in it. The gym also provides towels if you need them. I love that they are dog friendly (some members came in with a dog and an employee set up a small pen near the door) and provide doggy treats to them. Huge points. 

If I lived here, there isn't a doubt I would join. I like the variety of equipment, it's clean and the members seem nice. I'm really happy I found this place.

If you're looking for a fun, fast paced exercise spot, look no further. Amanda and Zack are very helpful and give modifiers to the program if you need. And, I torch between 450 and 600 calories each time. Great place! Clean and inviting.
The weights are too heavy here. But seriously, the club is out of date, and seems too small for the amount of people that frequent it.

I did a groupon for this location.  I thought the classes were amazing and motivating.  The coach is great and he plays a pretty good mix of music.  My groupon is ending soon which is pretty sad, if the location was closer I would def consider continuing but it takes me sometimes over 30 mins to get there living all the way in Snell Isle.   Highly recommend  this place!

Where are the freaking towels? One of my gym barometers is "how obvious are the towels?" I'm an observant person...if I can't find the towels, likely no one else can either, and that means I'm going to be sitting in their pool of sweat. I'm not a germ freak, so I really don't care about the spray bottles of disinfectant, but these were also nowhere to be found. There was "sanitizing foam" on the walls, but I find this inefficient. 

I have done 2 spin classes. For one, the instructor didn't show up, but the class was taught by one of the people IN the class...a good work out all the same. The other class was Saturday morning, and it was AWESOME. A really hard workout with a great instructor that really encourages you to push yourself. The spin studio is still too hot though, with only one lousy box fan. There should be oscillating fans in there, for sure. 

It kinda bugged me that the people I saw who worked there didn't look like they were in shape at all. I think I've been forever spoiled by the Wisconsin Athletic Club. ...sigh...

The gym is nice and very clean, with plenty of equipment to go around. Lots of parking, and pretty easy in and out. I did notice the babysitting area looked nice, and they do have a good selection of snacks and smoothies for post-workout.

No one will ever mistake me for a gym rat, sadly.  As a kid I vastly preferred dance class, ice skating, horseback riding and running around like a psycho at the playground to any sort of scary ball-coming-at-my-face team sport. 

Even in my perma-intoxicated college run I made it to yoga several times a week and took advantage of Temple's dance program, but now as I edge up on thirty, I can no longer rely on my superior metabolism to keep me on the attractive side of chubby. 

Here is where Sweat's trial program comes into play -- 7 days to scope it out for free.  I took several yoga classes, used the ellipticals and stair climbers, even did some silly-looking motions on weight machines.  Keep in mind I am the most novice of novices when it comes to organized exercising.  I don't know what to do and the whole thing seems scary and intimidating, so I just get on the nearest treadmill and hope desperately that no one looks at me jiggling away.  

Sweat in Bella Vista is a very nice gym -- it's well laid-out, there are plenty of machines, the group fitness instructors are friendly and competent.  Still, once my 7-day trial ran out, I didn't take the plunge and join.  Mostly because I still hate exercise.  But one can hardly blame that on the gym.
Best gym! I love the atmosphere, the trainers and their professionalism. The facility is conveniently located and always clean.

I LOVE this place!~ It took me 33 years to find a workout that is right for me but I have finally found it! I'm in the best shape of my life all while doing a workout I enjoy!! I'm fitter and happier and I still eat foods that I love. The instructors are amazing and I could go on and on but sign up for a class and see for yourself. You're gonna LOVE it!!!!!!!!

Bad service slow and no one was there for there reason for poor service . Got drinks right away and waited for server for about 15 mins then when asked for a baked potato and it was 5mins b4 the menu says they serve them and I was told no . So I ask for the bill for the soda and how I got that lightning fast

This was my gym for a few years. It was super super close to my job at the time and I would just work out after work when it was dead. I love using the spinning room when it is empty.. That's the best part, privacy.  It's a nice gym but the one on Arch is a bit better. Ground Zero Salon is amazing, it's located on the second floor after you go up the ramp. I got my hair done there a few times by Matty and he always did a great job.

I started off having a great time going to this gym but once Covid hit that's when everything went downhill. Of course all the gyms had to shut down by state mandate but this gem continued to bill as which was fine however they sent my account to collections even though I was still paying when. I reached out to membership services I got really bad customer service & inconsistent information. On top of all that I had moved and can no longer go to any other two locations that they had in the area so I requested about three months and in adVance to cancel in which I was giving really bad directions in terms how to cancel. They wanted me to stay in contract and just pay for no reason which was really weird. Kept emailing the same guy and talking over the phone and he said he would cancel but he didn't now I'm totally fed up and that's why am writing this as the gym it's just so desperate for members They can't even cancel memberships even if their members move it's just really ridiculous. My boyfriend had a membership and even before the pandemic he wanted to cancel and they refused to as well so at this point I know it's the gym and not only the nuances of the pandemic.

Best gym I've ever been to, well worth the investment.. Loads of cardio equipment; woodways, intenzas (one with virtual scenery climbing mountains, beaches in Italy..), stair climbers.. and more weight lifting gear than I've ever seen. Everything stays clean, staff is very friendly & welcoming.. Coolest cross training area; long painted turf track for sledding ;) Med balls, bungees, jungle gym for circuit workouts.. love this place! I've achieved a 6lb loss in mass since I started a few months ago. Surely I've lost 10lbs in body fat.. feeling great. Think they hook up the local policeman with memberships, cause I've met a few and they're super friendly too, pretty cool.. and safe! Beginners, and monsters alike.. no competition in STL. See you there.

This gym is decent, small, but very convenient. The fact that they are open 24/7 is their best selling point. Another great feature is the ReAct Trainer machine. If you've seen that video of Ice T's wife Coco doing her booty workout on a weird sideways rotating machine, this is the one. LOL They actually have one in this gym at this location. Yes I did try it out, but I was so embarrassed and felt uncomfortable in a room full of guys. Maybe I'll sneak back in the wee hours of the night and really get my Coco on!
Love! Love this cross fit gym! Ben and his entire staff is amazing. I don't feel judged..I feel welcomed. Thanks

UPDATE: Brandywine Y management has restored Silver Sneakers to this and other Chester County branches.  
This is what happens when a health club tries to do too much, and tries to please everybody (and ends up pleasing nobody).  All those different facilities (tennis, pools, kid stuff...) mean the place is often packed.
Don't bother with the treadmill; the parking lot is so crowded you'll probably get a long walk just to get inside.  Part of the problem is all the special promotions in which non-members crowd out actual members.
The physical plant is OK.  The problem is the classes.  The instructors are poorly supervised; each does her own thing.  Find a class you like and then somebody else shows up and it's completely different.  No quality control, training or supervision.  When one instructor subs for another, she often walks in and admits she knows nothing about this type of workout (cardio, pilates, yoga or whatever) but acts like it doesn't matter.  
Too many people treat the Health Center as a place to hang out and socialize.  They "Bogart" the machines as they get into conversations (forget about listening on headphones as you work out).  Management thinks the Health Center is a place where everybody knows your name.  It's not a place to just go and do a workout routine.
The target market is clearly families with kids.  If that's not you, forget it.  If you are looking for a particular type of work out and don't need everything in one place, there are better (less crowded) options.

Sadly Sports West has gone downhill and is in disrepair:

It's Just OK. Now I know why I got no enrollment fee and it's only 40 per month now, let me explain...

Honestly I'm staying a member simply because I live a few blocks away and one of my friends I grew up with is an incredible trainer there and it's only 40 bucks a month for me.

The men's locker room, showers, steam room, and dry sauna are super run down and deferred janitorial and maintenance seems to be the policy. The towels are super rough and like sandpaper. The Men's steam room has a broken door that is untrue to frame and the steam is out of order most of the time. The wood work in the dry sauna has got to be decades old, and is rotting and creaking and ready to break and hurt someone at any moment. The shower fixtures are unacceptable: some are only hot water, some are only cold, and most spray water in a way that is painful to the skin.

I have been a member (this time) for less than one month after being away for over 2 years, and I have to mention that nothing much has changed or improved over the years, in fact it's gotten worse. Some of the current staff, young kids, that run the front counter are rather brash or even rude in the morning, and don't make me feel welcome when I arrive. I even remember hearing one of them make a comment to his buddy that his meal time was being interrupted or something, and all I could observe is that this particular kid only wanted to chat with friends and eat. 

When I left that morning I had to wait around for several minutes to trade my locker key for my membership card and other members were also gathering around front counter looking for assistance as well before one of them yelled out. Then this male employee comes out with a mouthful of food and a bad attitude!  I'm like: your STILL eating? He looked at me like I just offered edification and said ALL I DO IS EAT! Then laughed it off like it was acceptable to be like that.

Some of the staff there are super unprofessional and some are just the opposite and very nice and friendly! So I'm not generalizing that the entire staff has a training issue, only most of them. So it's a like a dice roll or based on someone's mood that day. I'm considering getting a tour of Lakeridge Athletic Club, I hear it's super nice and I'd rather pay more and be happy than deal with a gym that won't repair or renovate or properly train their staff.

Thanks for considering my opinion and what is true for me.

Thanks for listening.

I love our YMCA. lots of classes to take and child care available. Indoor and outdoor pools. 
The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because they don't offer afternoon classes for those who exercise on their lunch breaks.

I took a flywheel class about 2 years ago and totally swore it off. I could not walk for a week afterwards and I was so hot during the class it was painful.

Then, the real stress of medical school kicked in and I needed some sort of relief. Pushing myself in the gym wasn't doing it for me. I was so mentally tired after a long day that going to the gym became a chore.

Enter Flywheel back into my life, considerations of a buy a 3 class pass for $28 promotion. For less than a dinner out, I got 3 butt-kicking, sweat drenching classes. Best part: I did not have to think for one. single. minute. This is what I love the best about Flywheel. Every worry about my day was checked at that studio door and the only thing I focused on was RPMs, the Torq-board, and the bumping music. It was therapy. 

3 classes in 1 week later and I am hooked. I am shamelessly buying more classes although they are out of my budget because I love it. My 3rd class was my best so far. After the first two my body got used to it and I could really push myself. Yes, it gets hot in the class, but that actually motivates me to go in this freezing winter weather! I was intimidated at first (like with the shoes clipping into the bike) but seriously, no one gives a damn about the neighbor on the bike next to them (in a good way). In other words, this is a judgement free zone where people come to zone out, so you have no reason to be self-conscious! Plus, all of the workers are super friendly (when they aren't kicking your ass on 34 torque).

If you are looking to get away from a boring fitness routine and let your mind zone out for a good 45 minutes, I highly encourage you to check out Flywheel.

Pros: Cheap membership, clean, ample parking and good equipment without being too crowded.

Cons: Sales staff is like a caricature of pushy, untalented sales people using painfully transparent tactics. Had already decided to buy before talking to them, but they still lied to my face, added in fees after I signed and tried to pressure me into signing up (make your decision before, they are worthless to talk to and are always running a "special' that "just about to end" for the same price perpetually listed on the site.)

I hear AWFUL things about the trainers. So, I would avoid that part. But, all in all, its a cheap gym with all the equipment you need and lots of flexibility with locations to use.

Unless you want a "signature" location which is the exact same gym + towels for 50% higher monthly rate. 

Just don't ever expect anything but the worst from their staff.

Gary is the best! He'll will push to your limits and then some! If you are serious about exercising by doing a combo of cardio& strength training but get bored easily, then this is the place for you because each instructor has their own style but they all are great! And there is so much variety within the workout that 45 min flies by, your body can barely move& you think you might die...but isn't that the point? 
I  Rowzone

A beautiful gym with excellent equipment, tall ceilings, bright natural light. They take feedback from members and are always striving to add more value. I've been going to this gym for over a decade. The staff feels like family. They are the best of the main line for a reason!

This gym is amazing!! I'm from CA and here on vacation. Looked up "gyms near me" on Google and QNTM popped up.

Vibe is awesome!

Equipment is amazing.

Variety of equipment is perfect for all.

Now, how do I bring this place back to CA?!

Thanks for the hospitality QNTM! Bravo!!

This review is for the Platoon Boot camp at the Art Museum. 

I have been doing it for the past couple years and would recommend it to anyone.  The group of people that work out are very friendly and range in ages from 20's to 70's.  For $115.00 monthly fee, you can work out at any of their locations 6 days a week which rounds out to about $5.00 a an hour long session.  I think that's a fair price since most personal training sessions are like $50.00 and above.  Basically the week days are split up to cater to certain body parts.. Monday is lower body workout, Tuesday is upper body workout, Wednesday is cardio day, Thursday is lower body workout, Friday is upper body workout and Saturday is whatever the teacher wants to do.  They break up the workouts by always moving and changing things up so your body never gets used to 1 particular workout.  There are also 2 different groups.  There is a phase 1 and a phase 2 group.  Phase 1 does more modified workouts than phase 2 and you have your choice as to what group you would like to work out in.  Some days if I'm hung over, I'll do phase 1.  It's completely up to you.  The instructors are all VERY well versed on anything that has to do with form, fitness, etc.  If you have any questions or aren't doing a particular excercise correctly..they will let you know in a nice way.  Just recently I needed help on doing arm circles above my head..my hand eye coordination sucks..it was funny.  They also motivate you when you are slacking or when they know you are about to quit.  Even a little " come on guys!  keep moving!" can really lift your spirits when you think you are about to die.  It also doesn't hurt that you can look out over the  the beautiful city while you are getting your ass kicked..or look at Rocky's Statue for motivation!

This place was small but have everything you need ...I like that place because not too far from my house and very convenient to go after work ..
    Little bit crowed , clean and have parking lot of frond the gym . 
   If you want training , they will have someone helping you for free ...price little bit expensive then other fitness .

Great gym for the price. It is usually clean and most of the machines work. You never have to wait to get onto the cardio equipment. The free weight and stationary weight area are just the right size. Sometimes you have to wait for the weight machines though. The daycare center offers 2 hours of free child care, which is awesome! My daughter loves it there, and she has separation anxiety from me 99% of the time. The woman in the daycare is super sweet! I don't stress at all about leaving my daughter with her. My daughter also loves it there. My only gripe is that there is one person who works there that isn't very nice and has a poor work ethic. She is super sweet to all the guys that come in, but is on the verge of rude to the females. The gym is also dirtier when she is working. But, I'm not there to make friends so, it's not a deal breaker for me.

When the sub-par gym at the bottom of our condo building wasn't cutting it any more, my husband and I finally succumbed and joined PSC.

I'm really enjoying the classes, especially Zumba and Vinyassa Yoga. They definately have a great selection of classes to keep your workout interesting. I also love taking advantage of the sauna and steam room, it's a nice way to end a workout!

The real icing on the cake is being able to use the outdoor pool on the weekends at the PSC in Society Hill. It is a nice size, and has a great sundeck for laying out.

Had a free seven day pass to this gym, and opted not to go over once. The place was not the cleanest, the equipment was so-so and the staff was meh. The price is high and the contract long for the gym type it is. This is not an upscale gym, it is basically so-so, you can join the crappy club fitness for 10 dollars, so why pay more for the same crap. Someone please open a nice gym in the Troy, Maryville area.

The best LA in Indy!! 

I've been selfishly keeping this location a secret. It's the cleanest fitness center I've been to! The morning cleaning staff is awesome sauce..so much so I'm always thanking her for what she does "You are appreciated" in my Tupac voice! Members have been good at cleaning up after themselves and respecting each other's space. 

There are multiple sets of dumbbells ranging from 2.5 all the way up to 100+, not sure of the heaviest. DB's are in 2.5lb increments..YASSSSS!

This location also provides 2 sets of preloaded EZ curl bars in 10lb increments 20lbs - 110lbs. Multiple benches that move from flat to various degrees of incline and fully seated minus the weird incline on the seat (never understood why some benches do that)

There are 2 smith machine, 3 squat racks, numerous bench press setups including a couple for decline, 5 dual cable machines..lots of other fabulous pieces of equipment.

I could go on and on about this place but you get the idea, it's great!!

On the downside, they don't have a racquet ball court. Besides that everything else is sweet!

Once upon a time this place was incredible. The reason for the lower stars now is the lack of cleanliness. The showers are missing grout which tells we we will have mold soon. I've brought it to the attention of the manager but seems to fall on deaf ears. Shelves in the shower and shower heads are leaking frivolously. Maintenance overall has gone down and is my reason for less stars on this update (2 1/2 years now)

We came for my best friends bachelorette and it was the most fun thing we could have done. Jillian was our instructor and she was absolutely fabulous. We couldn't have asked for a better instructor. We got some great photos before we started working haha but it was definitely a work out. Most of us have little to no strength and there were things we could all do. Nobody felt left out. Jillian was very encouraging and made us feel great with every move no matter how good we actually looked. If you are in New Orleans, you need to take this class!

You get what you pay for. It's the cheapest gym in town, but you have to pay for parking and it's a meat farm. The weight room is stuffy, there's no air circulation, and many guys are strutting around. The classes are overcrowded and there's not enough equipment for everyone. I loved my trainer, Cynthia, but she was let go and that's when I cancelled my membership. Staff are friendly but there's a high turnover of trainers.
UNBELIEVABLE!!!!!  Best filet I have ever had, Service was fantastic.  Had filet, fried green tomatoes, and bread pudding for desert.  Highly recommend each of these and a trip here.

Overall, this is a great gym. It doesn't get overly crowded, even during peak times. My membership costs are low (if you are a student, ask for the student rate) and there weren't any additional fees when signing up. This gym is a no-frills type of place, which is fine by me. The only change I would ask for is to add some more basic equipment to the gym. There is no regular leg press (just the seated version) and there are no pre-loaded barbells. I definitely miss those during my workouts.

If you are looking for a great workout, you will find it here.  Heather and Rick make you feel like family from day one! I came here in okay shape. I can now say I am healthier than I have ever been in my life.  The cool part is, you have professionals watching and assisting you with every move.  
Reno Academy of Combat offers you personal training in a group setting with a very friendly atmosphere at an amazing price.  

ZUMBA: Okay I wont lie the thought of this class scared me to death!  I have been going now for over a year now and I am still loving it.  Zumba is soo great for the core.  Heather will have you smiling and laughing through the burn.

CROOKS, AVOID AT ALL COST.

I'd give zero stars if possible. Moved out of state and cancelled our membership IN PERSON before moving (we were not bound by any contract per our agreement--it was a month to month payment). I actually went back twice to confirm that the manager had gotten the notice, since I left the cancellation notice with a front desk person who hand wrote a note on a scrap of paper and put it on the manager's messy desk. When I returned and found the manager he did not know about the note, dug through the piles of paper on his desk and found it, and confirmed that he would take care of the cancellation that day. 

They never cancelled, lost the record of our cancellation, continued to charge us for three months, refused to refund, and insisted that we needed fly across country to cancel in person (AGAIN). We had to file false charges with our bank and send a written letter to cancel our month to month membership--a letter they were supposed to email and knowledge receipt of and did not. 

While we were there the place was in constant disrepair. One of the attachments that allows you to rack the squat bar on the one squat/power rack broke and it took 2-3 months for them to order a new one. In other words, their only squat rack was out of commission for months. When they did fix it, it broke again and took another month or so to replace. There were uneven parts of the floor near the squat rack and seeing as the cleaning lady was in the women's locker room on her phone 99% of the time, I would venture to guess the equipment was constantly dirty as well. The bathrooms sure were. The only reason we did not leave earlier was that we were planning on moving across country anyway and the place was a couple blocks from our house. 

The shoddy equipment and poor service could be explained by a tighter budget and explained by the lower cost of this gym, but the 1) billing mistakes and 2) complete refusal to acknowledge those mistakes and make it right were what prompted me to write this review.

With so many other choices popping up in Philly with great prices, there is no reason to ever join this gym.

Was able to grab a Groupon for this steakhouse the other day so figured why not try it out. As soon as I walked in I was impressed with the classiness of the restaurant, all of the servers were very friendly. Myself and my friend decided to split a bottle of Pinot noir for our beverage which hit the spot. They give you complimentary warm garlic bread which was nice. For an appetizer we ordered the peppercorn crusted yellowfish tuna, it was quite yummy the Asian slaw that the tuna was served on had a nice tang to it! For our meal we split a medium rare filet mignon and a side of garlic mash potatoes. Everything was yummy although the steak could of been a little more rare for me. Overall good dining experience!

In town for thanksgiving. Calendar on their site says their open today, day after thanksgiving. But they are closed. I paid for parking (I love SpotHero) and all, just to find out this place is closed. Huge bummer. I recommend management maintain their calendar.  I drop in at gyms all around the country and not a single one has been closed on Black Friday.  

***

Updated review since they did reach out and apologize. I'm not in the area frequently enough to check it out, so I can't really fully endorse.

This is a great powerlifting gym with very friendly vibes. There was a good selection of high-quality barbells (safety squat bar, standard power bars, deadlift bar, and others I can't remember). Power rack, plenty of plates, and a competition-style bench press.

John Pena is a positive and helpful guy who was happy to give me some technique advice. I was fortunate to find this gym while traveling in Tucson. I will definitely return if I'm ever in the area again.

This gym is excellent! Where do I even begin? Variety of quality equipment (they even have a rope climb), top notch personal trainers, offering classes such as boxing and aerial silks! There is something for everyone here. To top it off, it's affordable! Definitely sign up for team training. It's challenging & engaging. They're so good at challenging people of all different fitness levels, and they do so safely. I've worked with Bill and Curtis, I would recommend them both. It never gets boring because it's different every time.

Great staffs! They always greet you when you walk in and they say good-bye when you walk out. During closing time they give you advanced warnings when they are about to close so that you can adjust your workouts accordingly, they do so in a way that you don't feel rushed (compared to other gyms with multiple announcements in a short period of time). You also can't beat the price of $10/month (if you select one location only).

I've been a member here for a little over a year and have had a great experience! Axiom on Parkcenter is a big and spacious facility and offers a wide variety of workout equipment. It's a good staple for your workout regimen, and is a great place to go and hammer out a lifting sesh or some cardio.

I've taken their cycling classes and really enjoyed them- aside from the fact that cycling seats hurt my booty so bad (that's my own issue though). I've also tried out BodyPump (liked), Yoga (loved) and BodyAttack (not a fan).

While I've had a great experience here, I recently wanted to cancel my membership to pursue other fitness classes that Axiom doesn't offer, and this has been a hassle. The biggest bummer is that my $25/month gym membership is costing me $65 for my final month. Axiom has a yearly enhancement fee of $40, and mine just so happens to land in the month of March. Since I didn't get my cancelation request in 15 days before this fee, I ended up having to pay it- even though its for the following year. Bummer...but I suppose I should have kept better tabs on this and then I wouldn't be throwing $65 down the drain.

Lesson here? Great gym...but be aware that should you ever want to cancel your membership you need to do so at least 15 days before your next billing cycle, or you'll be paying for an extra month.

I have been training under Master Somnath for some time now and have trained with  martial artists from around the world and I can honestly say that he is the most respectable and true martial artist I know.  Being a Korean in a Korean martial art, I often have to rebuke fellow Koreans for being closed minded about me training under a non-Korean.  But his understanding of each skill and movement is impressive, he is truly a great master because he is an even better student.  Master Somnath and the Dragon Gym staff are a rare group of people who are skilled, creative and are living out the spirit of martial arts.  Being under his guidance has been a blessing in my personal journey and I know that my fellow classmates feel the same.  I have yet to hear one negative thing about his character and its understandable once you have met him.

Just walking down the hall into the entrance of Escape, you know you are in for a totally different spin class experience. Walking in the dark past the boxing area you find yourself in the spin room that seems a little shy on space.  You soon realize however that in nearly complete darkness, you have no idea how large the space really is. And while you're riding a stationary bicycle, how much do you really need.

Colie led the class well, explaining to all the newbies the equipment we would be using, the positions she would be utilizing and that the strength level was totally up to what we were comfortable with. 

A very pleasant surprise for me was that the amazing music set that was being utilized was complimented by the display of the music video that went along with it. The projection was large enough for all in the class to see. It was an engaging distraction from the ass kicking that Colie was handing me. In other spin classes that I have attended, I would typically find myself reflecting on the time hoping the hell I was going through would end soon. That was nowhere nearly the case here.
