So as you can see, I was quite thrilled with the spin class experience that the Escape had to offer. The only downside for me is how far from home it is, but as with the gym I go to, I think the extra drive is worth it. It is also nice to see the revitalization of the downtown area and giving locals amazing reasons to re-visit their home downtown.

My new gym! Ignore the fact that I joined a gym as a New Years Resolution to get back into running along with hundreds (okay thousands) of other Americans who make these silly promises and don't keep them by the third week in January.
"The Heights" is totally rad. Come here for the clean locker rooms. There's a family locker room for you and your toddlers (currently undergoing floor renovations-but I think that will be done soon). The pool is huge, with a slide, kiddie pool area and lap lanes. Treadmills? Plenty at 5pm, I haven't had to wait, or I just have had really good luck. There's an indoor track where 16 laps is a mile (um, dizzy much?). Basketball courts if you didn't get cut from the 7th grade team and don't have a resentment toward that whole god-for-saken sport and actually like playing basketball. 
I have a friend (shout out Joy Jones!) who teaches classes here that I have yet to take. But soon I will get up enough guts to take on her challenges. Maybe I'll try my legs at spinning-I've only fallen off twice before. 
Oh....and the price is AHMAHZING. $20 a month for a single lady. You'd have to look up your own cost. I'm not your financial planner.

They need to put more details on their website about how to sign up.  One of the FAQs specifically talks about memberships and it says to stop by a location for more information.  So I did that, and they told me I needed to sign up online and that they couldn't help me sign up in person.  They really need to put that on their site before someone drives there and gets rudely turned away.

Nice variety of equipment but a poorly maintained facility
8:30 Monday morning, no towels, no audio out of the one recumbent bike and the resistance on the first elliptical I tried varied so wildly that it was unusable

TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE! This place should be ashamed of themselves. Food was good, service was good but my wife, my one year old daughter and I were cussed out and screamed at by the Valet. We were told we were fucking idiots and didn't know shit, I was told my white cracker ass needs to leave. This guy was one touch away from me pulling out my concealed carry and forcfully making him back away. I talked to the manager of Mr Johns and he informed me that the valet is run by the hotel and there was nothing they could do. He even said it happens all the time! Long story short.... if you want to pay several hundred dollars for dinner then get cussed out for parking your car this is the place for you! Absolutely terribly you guys should be embarrassed.
Pretty stoked to finally have a membership here.  By FAR the best climbing gym in the Nashville area.

This gym is the best! The owner and trainers are fabulous and helpful. It's a brilliant idea - you just need 30 minutes free in your day since there is no class start time. If you're busy, like free parking and a healthy and kind environment- give it a try!

I wanted to make sure I was using this gym for a few months before I wrote a review.  I have now been going to this Planet Fitness for over 6 months, and there are some very obvious gains and losses that I need to point out.

This is what I call the "McDonald's" of gyms.  It's cheap, no frills, and to the point.  A friend of mine joined a gym around the neighborhood where he lives and we are constantly comparing amenities at our respective gyms.  Since my gym has no "extras" I was constantly saying to him "oh damn I wish my gym had that! But mine's cheaper!"  I also wouldn't say the staff at PF is exactly "friendly," either.  I had one instance when I was trying to check in at the front desk and nobody was paying any attention to me (I stood there quite awhile), no warm welcome to this Planet.  I finally just said screw it and started to walk in.  AT THAT EXACT moment a gentleman looks up from his computer screen and says "YOU NEED TO CHECK IN HERE!"  Just peachy!  Other than that no problems.  Clean facilities, no creepy guys in the locker room, and an overall "get in and get out" atmosphere.

The price is probably the biggest thing to highlight in this review.  I pay 10 bucks a month with a yearly 60 dollar fee, which is the only reason I would stay a member of this big box of a gym.

Came here the other day with my wife. We live in the area and have been wanted to check it out for a while now. It was super chill. Everyone was extra friendly. The place was actually pretty incredible. We enjoyed it. Definitely will be back as soon as my body recovers.

Nothing but love for this place. It's new, clean, brand new equipment, friendly staff(except one guy). They have every piece of equipment you could possible need. This gym lacks for nothing. And only $10 a month!! Best deal in town.

Not a safe establishment for children. I visited this Jump time and was immediately startled by the lack of cleanliness and staff for a children's play place. My son had a Groupon for just this location and the reasons are apparent because of the age and bad condition. Before I even sat down my 12 year old grandson hurt his neck on a jump do to another child's illegal flipping. Upon his injury, my son (a PA at Primary Health) examined him and decided to take him to St Luke's ER. The staff seemed unhappily obligated to come and take a less than minute report of the incident in their notebook. We decided I would stay with my 7 year old grandson while my son took the oldest to the hospital. While awaiting the report and return of my son I became increasingly concerned about the safety and lack of cleanliness of this facility. The food was very unappetizing and high priced. The staff, whom was hard to distinguish between staff and customer, did not seem to be concerned for the safety of the children. After having to remain there for an ungodly 3 hours I will never take my grandchildren back there. When my son returned from the ER with my oldest grandson the staff did not even inquire about his well being. Beware or be aware of a place for children.

Our family was newer to Arizona and had just moved to Marana - we found the Staff at the N. Oracle location friendly and the people at the club very welcoming.  And for only $24 a month, you get to bring a visitor, you get the use of tanning beds, hydro massagers and red light therapy - you can't beat this price!  Plus, unlike Anytime Fitness - Planet Fitness has actual front desk staff working at all hours!! The only reason that I did not give this location five stars is because they need more mirrors and more work out benches.  Other than that, the location is clean, with a decent variety of equipment, cardio and free weight selection - again for only $24 a month!!

I arrived about an hour early to enjoy their facilities.I was greeted warmly by the receptionists. The first thing to note was how tiny the reception area was, and how cramped the entire spa felt, with treatment rooms adjacent to the locker rooms, and a narrow hallway adjoining all. The receptionist was polite and directed me to the locker room, but did not give me a basic tour of the facilities until I asked. 

She essentially gave me a cursory run-through, but without showing me how to turn the dry sauna into a steam sauna,nor even putting the jacuzzi on for me ( I had to come back out to ask her how to put it on, and then she showed me the dial). She failed to direct me to the existence of a "relaxation room", which at first, I honestly thought was a break room for the spa staff. I was expecting a detailed tour of the entire facilities, how to best enjoy each, and to be shown everything ,so that I could relax without having to walk into the reception area each time I had a question. 
The lockers in the locker room were tiny, and all the robes honestly looked a bit worn out (but very plush). I waddled over to the jacuzzi, which is deafeningly loud. The jets are strong, but diffuse. I moved over to the sauna after, and then waited by the pool, where I filled out the intake form. A huge note of disappointment in retrospect was that no one had directed me to where water could be found during my initial "tour", which I should have drank after going through the sauna and Jacuzzi.  Beverages and  a sparse select of fruits were located in the relaxation room, which I was never even pointed out to in the beginning.

I followed Yalonda, the masseuse for the session, into a dimly lit and comfortable treatment room. She was very polite, and very respectful of covering the parts that she was not working on. I was feeling a little parched in the middle of the session, so she got me a glass of water in the middle of the treatment. I loved how her strokes were very firm, as I requested, and she focused on the areas that I had the most tension. The massage was exceptional, moving me into a comfortable nirvana; she devoted the entire time to the treatment.. What I did not appreciate was how when I asked about the body treatment ceiling water spouts, she described their use, but distastefully added "it's quite expensive, though". Sure, I came in on a group on and I'm a student, (which I never told her). But noting the price of a treatment when a client asks about it, assuming that a client cannot afford something, was sort of rude to me. This sentiment was reiterated by Sarah, the pedicurist (although after conversation she knew I was a student and clearly had a good rapport with me to give me this little factoid). 

I went after to the relaxation room, a small, uncomfortable setting, with very outdated magazines. I waited for a few minutes until Sarah, the pedicurist, took me to the second treatment room. Sarah is very gregarious and chatty. However, because my goal for the day was to relax by absorbing and focusing on the treatment itself, I sort of did not want to be talking the entire time; I felt a little forced into conversation, when I truly just wanted to sit back, relax and read a magazine. However, chatting with Sarah did not fully detract from the experience. 

The biggest complaint I have of my entire session at Balance was how I *SPECIFIED* on my intake form that I am ALLERGIC TO LATEX. You would expect that a high end spa would have non-latex gloves to cater to individuals with these allergies. However, Sarah used a latex glove on her right hand, because she had a small cut on it. She said she "would not touch me then, and not put her hand in the water". 

Does anyone at the spa read the intake form, and communicate such a concern? When she initially said that, I was offended that my medical need was being brushed aside. She did not touch me with her latex hand, but did occasionally brush my feet with it. I am glad that she did wear a glove to prevent contact of her wound with the basin water, but, the glove should have been another material. She took off her latex glove later when she massaged my feet with rather relaxing massage oils. Her technique is very on point and she did not rush through the procedure. I was left to relax for about 10 minutes with paraffin wax and a soothing aromatherapy neck pillow; finally, I was able to soak in the effects of my spa day in quiet. Her nail application, afterwards, however, is not the best that I have seen. 

I would return only on a group-on,which is what I used for this visit. Improvements are needed to make the entire experience flow smoother, especially in regards to acquainting clients with the facilities, their use, and location of the relaxation room.

I was a member of the Aquatic Fitness center for five plus years before they moved over to the Future Fitness facility powered by Aquatic Fitness. I didn't have to go through any of the hard sells. They just transferred my membership over at decently priced fixed rate with a contract. 

Future Fitness is an attractive gym. They usually have enough machines that I can get on what I am looking for in some part of the gym. The equipment is fairly new and a lot of the machines have TV's. The locker rooms and shower areas are very nice and kept fairly clean. There is a sauna, a saltwater pool and a hot tub. I wish I used these more but I don't.

My wife and I do some of the classes. There are some limited good general fitness and spinning classes at decent times. They have yoga, and Zumba classes also which I don't do. The thing I do not like is that members can't use kettle bells, TRX, ropes, etc., unless they take an additional pay class or use a personal trainer. I don't get that.

The two things I miss about the Aquatic fitness center are one, there were more boot camp/cross fit classes at no extra charge at the old location. Future Fitness has gotten away from that but there is pay for class TRX style class. I am already paying over $45.00 per month so this doesn't appeal to me. Aquatic fitness used to have treadmill-running classes that were pretty cool also, none at FF. Secondly, Aquatic Fitness also had more athletes as members compared to just people trying to work out a little to lose weight and weight room types.  There is nothing wrong either of these and I admire people trying to better their health, but I just liked the more athletic feel at Aquatic Fitness. 

Future Fitness does have a few very good instructors, Lucy and Diva are excellent. Some of the classes offered in the evening are just OK at best. They are pushing their pay classes and small group sessions instead.

I have never had to deal with the sales people, but all of the people at the front desk are great. They also let me freeze my membership during the summer when I am riding and not using a gym. As a member, you can use any of the other Future Fitness locations. Just be ready for the sales tactics and aware of the exit/cancellation policy.

P.S. I left Future Fitness in November of 2015 and the exit was surprisingly painless.

I spend a lot of time at the Maryland Farms YMCA as a tennis member there. I love the atmosphere and the friendly staff, it always feels like a home away from home.  The courts are in excellent condition and the reservation system works like a charm, with the desk calling  you back when there is an opening and you've put your name on the waiting list during peak times. I love that there are armchairs around a TV that always plays the tennis channel, and I even love more the Subway and Juice Bar inside the facility. 

The reason I'm not giving 5 stars is that I find it a bit pricey. Yes, you get some nice benefits with a tennis membership, like free court time and a reduced rate for lessons with the pros as well as league play, but it is still a lot of money. I feel like a non-profit like the YMCA should not have to be this expensive. I also feel at the price they charge, they should do more to dry outdoor courts right after it rains, especially on NALTA play days, reschedule their leaf blowing to a different time than NALTA and USTA play, and put water coolers on every court (it is quite far to get to the water fountains and ice dispensers from some of the outdoor courts).

Other than that, I can highly recommend this YMCA and especially the tennis club.

Just started a few weeks ago - great people, great workout.  Class times are super convenient, never get bored with the work out, and already I have more energy, sleep better, whole nine yards.  Highly recommended.

They have a decent work out area and have made some improvements to their entryway, but the whole building is still dated.  My sons both take swim lessons here and enjoy it.  There is little room for playing basketball since most of the courts are taken up with aerobics.  They do have 2 racquetball courts which is a plus.
Amazing food!!! A memorable food experience for a foodie like me. One of the best in NOLA so far. Will definitely be going back!!!

Love this gym. It has everything you need. I don't go during rush hours, but every time I've been in it hasn't been crowded at all. The staff has always been friendly. I am very impressed to see the staff walking around and changing out the towels often. I seriously thought those things stayed there all day. The workout equipment is all functional. I don't believe I've ever seen a broken machine. There is quite the variety of equipment as well. I'm
Happy with the Y.

Decent enough for the price. I agree with Denise about the staff. It is clearly obvious the majority of them do not enjoy their jobs and are quite rude to the customers. I would say there are possibly 3 employees that are actually wonderful and greet you pleasantly when you come in. The flourtown planet fitness is a much better location to check out if you have the chance to. They have more free weights, balance balls, even a whole ab section.

The community pool at MCC was great for the whole family. There were plenty of parking and reasonable priced per person and child. We got there early can be and to my surprise the line was long but once the pool's gates open - the lines was fast. They have police to search your bags for alcohol which was not permitted at this location. 

Seems every one has got their spots reserved and we were happy to find a spot by the trees (which goes fast). The food lines was long and can be expensive. 

Only negative I have is the crowding and people tend to crown you on purpose to get your spot under a tree. 

Overall, the MCC is great place to enjoy the sun and cool off in the pool.

Went to my first class today and loved it, will definitely be going back! The instructor was fantastic, music was upbeat and kept you going even when every muscle in your body was protesting. 

Place was clean and everyone was super friendly. There were several of us who were there for the first time and the instructor took the time to explain the machine to us and split us up so that we were near "regulars" who we could look to for guidance during class. Having said that, I can't say that I disagree with some of the lesser rated reviews especially for people who are just getting in shape. The class is very fast paced and the machine does take some getting used to. To be fair, if you read all the info on solidcore's site, they state that although all fitness levels are welcome, you should be able to hold a plank for 1 minute before coming to your first class and that it does take some time to get used to the machines.

My instructor, Kelly, did a great job of correcting my form during class as did one of the more experienced attendees who was on the machine next to me who also gave me some tips throughout class. 

I was surprised not to see any beginner classes offered at any of the locations and agree with other reviewers that these should be offered regularly and would likely increase membership numbers and comfort level for first timers, but overall had a great experience and will definitely be back!

The coolest this gym compare with others around center city is they have place for swimming indoor,and quite alot of tools.
And friendly customer service...live fresh!!!

I came here for an IPL treatment and it was only 5 minutes. Not worth my time. It should have been at least 15-20 minutes. Their products are over priced and their stuff is real unlike everyone else selling fake products which they aren't. I understand the selling point but be more reasonable. Also for the service they tell me all kinds of different treatments but it wouldn't work for my skin and tried to get me into an annual program.
Love it..  living in Lenox home in village is great. Love the area, the shops.. lived here a year and also working outs great so close to home and can walk there. Convenient

We like this place.  My son enjoys his class.  It's very affordable and staff very personable.  My son wasn't comfortable at bigger gymnastic gyms but he loves this place.  I do think the kids goof off too much in the class which is my only criticism.  I think the teacher needs more help in the class but i think this is a really nice find in Springfield Township and i'm happy it's here.

I have been member of this gym for a few months and I liked it. At the end of the summer I decided to cancel my membership. I sent the request to cancel my membership at the end of September, however they have been charging me the fees during October November and December. When I realized I called the gym and the staff provided Jennifer's email address, the Manager. I sent emails to her with no answer. I went to the gym to speak in person with them. I spoke with Carlise, he was very helpful, he was able to fix my status and give me explanations of what happened. But to get the refund he told me I needed to speak with Jennifer. I have been calling her and or she is not in the gym, or she is not available and she doesn't  call me back. I think the manager service is very very poor.

The impression I got from this gym and from the guy I toured with (I think his name was Mike?) was that they want a very particular type of client. I guess, they want people who are into crossfit-like culture but don't want to pay crossfit prices? I'm not sure exactly.

I think their target audience is people who want to join a social cult-ish group of workout people who obsess over their bodies as their new hobby. Not really my deal, I like to read the newspaper in between sets. 

They really empasized their big group and small group classes, all of which cost extra.

I think they said it was $65 for a membership that includes spinning classes (and other classes, but not the small/big group classes) and $55 for just the cardio and weight equipment. 

I may have been tempted, but they were very shady when I asked about a trial membership. You basically have to give them your credit card info and it will autobill you unless you cancel in writing or something. In any case, if you've ever been a member at any gym in the 2000s, you know this is a dangerous proposition. 

It's a decent gym in a convenient location, just be very wary of the particulars, especially when it comes to trial memberships.

I mean...it's $20 a month. I get charged 20 bucks a month. I have no commitment and I know what I need to do to cancel if I need to, because I actually read the terms and conditions....

For those 20 bucks a month, its more than worth it for my needs. It's never crowded during the day, only during peak hours after work. And even then it's fine. The dumbells go up to 115 I think which is great. There are enough benches, and even DARE I SAY enough squat/leg press rack options?!?!?

Stop whining yuppies. This place is great.

CycleBa was great! I went there for a birthday ride, a week after my birthday because I got sick on the actual day. They were quick to change my reservation, which I appreciated. When I finally made it there, you could tell that many people were regulars, and the energy was buzzing! I am not a regular, but my class was accessible and fun! The accommodations, like lockers, bathrooms, food, and water, were all very nice, and would be great if you were a regular. I wish there was a bit more affordable class package, but for now I will just have to do a drop in now and then! If cycling is your thing, then going here is totally worth the price!
$16 for a bang trim after the hundreds of dollars I've spent there over the years?!  No way!  Love my stylists, but not this!  Time to move on...

I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. I feel extremely welcome by Jason every time  even when I do bad and stop going for months - he is amazing at his job and the fact that he takes the time to learn ur name and greet u every time makes him an amazing person to chat with  as well as an amazing motivator - he has now gotten me into personal training for the 3rd time and ppl don't be dumb his job is to produce money for the company - HE IS FANTASTIC AT IT & I DONT MIND IT AT ALL- keep it up Jason. As far as the trainers, I haven't had a chance to try classes w every single one of them but mannnn - Jocelyn,Gina,Manny and of course CHARLES - are completely amazing !!!!!!- I have struggle a lot w my weight, my confidence, the way I see myself and even the embarrassment that I mAke myself feel. In this place I have not only found motivators, trainers and fit people to look up to I have also found people That I trust and I can honestly say I consider part of lifestyle change. I love Gina's energy and awesome positive attitude she is always super happy and legit worries about u and what works best for ur body.  Jocelyn is incredible she is sooooo funny she makes me feel comfortable and she keeps me in check - she is someone w a beautiful inside and outside - next is Charles ... well this man continues to hear my every failing attempt to loose weight and sometimes i believe that he has more faith in me than myself, he has been my trainer and my friend I love being around him even when he kicks my ass- he is brutally honest and anything I ask to work on he always manages to drop in every work out - he keeps me in check and focus even in my bad days. He is crazy and he will make u have a great workout every single time - these people are amazing and know what they are doing - if u need motivation, a good workout and want to surround urself w amazing people this is the place !!!!!!!!!

Awesome Amenities. We Pay Under 100 a month for a family plan which includes:
Gym Memberships- with Childcare
Unlimited Water Park

No brainer for the money if you have kids!

This is the cleanest planet fitness around.
It is new but seems to be managed well.
It could be a little bigger but for 20 bucks do ya expect?

One of the best gyms I've ever trained at.  The gym has anytime fitness on one side and resultz1 attached.  The resultz side has any piece of equipment you could need, and there are open gym hours which is awesome.  The staff are all really cool, very accomodating and helpful.  By far the best gym in Indianapolis.  Easy 5 stars.

I absolutely love this place! It really is the best workout in the world. Every instructor I've had has been super encouraging and motivating and the music and ambiance helps too! Antonio and Alex are my favorite, but really they are all amazing. I never enjoyed running until I started taking classes at Barry's! So if even if you aren't a runner, I would still encourage you to go. The only downside is, it's expensive. You do get what you pay for though -- it's the best workout class I've ever been to. I just can't afford to go more than twice a month. 

Background story: I used to be too intimidated to try this place (even though I love working out) because I thought I wasn't cool or hot enough. I went with a friend my first time and I was so pleasantly surprised. I really misjudged! The staff is super friendly, helpful, and it didn't feel cliquey at all. I tried it through "class pass" and loved it! I have been going twice a month for 5 months! If I reach my 2.5 mile goal I always treat myself to a protein smoothie from their "fuel bar." Now THOSE are a good deal. $7 for really high quality ingredients and at least 30 grams of protein. The blueberry cobbler is my favorite!

I am a member of your LA fitness located on Countyline Road in Wesley Chapel (New Tampa), FL. I was very excited to restart my membership there only to go in a see how disgusting the equipment looks in the facilities. Everything is rusting. I know this place brings in enough revenue per month that the equipment should look much better. The picture attached is just an example of how the equipment looks. It's horrible. The reviews on Yelp are in the tubes and no one in your corporate seems to care. I will continue to email and have others to do the same this is just sad.
Location is a plus.  No steam room is a minus.  And why hasn't LA Fitness upgraded their water fountains to the new gym friendly format vs the ones from my 4th grade school???

I'm not sure about you, but when I work out I throw on an old t-shirt and pants without gussying up since I'm (hopefully) going to be sweating like mad. At Green Hills Y, you will see some lovely ladies who get matching gym attire and are working out in pearls and perfectly coiffed hair. Which, I'm all for if that's what you are into, but it definitely threw me off on my first visit :)

The Y has plenty of parking with some in the back up the hill close to the cardio equipment and aerobics classes. They also have an outdoor/indoor pool and plenty of weight machines. 

The classes are great; Chris teaches a kickboxing class on Tuesdays at 6:30 and a weights class on Wednesdays that are always a killer workout. Missy teaches 2 classes on Mondays and YOU WILL SWEAT. She's tough!!

My biggest complaint is that they charge extra if you take Pilates. However, they offer Yoga and aerobics included in the membership and offer a good amount of variety for whatever you are in the mood for. Green Hills is in my rotation, and always provides a great work out!

Niiiiiiice!  Real nice. This one is much larger than my home club in Rocky River, OH.  AND..... THIS LOCATION IS OPEN 24x7!

I'll love it when my home club finally expands their hours to being open 24x7!

It may be pricy but you get so much for your money. Even if you just wanted to go hang out at the pool in the summer and relax. So far everyone is super nice and accommodating. I love all the free classes they offer and the extended hours. No contract!! You can cancel anytime you want.

I have been to two classes on my "trial," and I have mostly positive things to say so far! 

1. The space is great. Nothing fancy, but clean and open. Bathrooms are stocked really well!

2. Katie and Bri are awesome instructors. They have so much energy in class that it makes me wonder if they have any left for the rest of the their lives. (Maybe they are secretly superheroes!) They are good at providing corrections/tips during class also, which I really appreciate.

3. It's a great workout! You start with 15 min or so of conditioning- think Bootcamp. Then you stretch and move into bag work. So fun! You can go at your own pace, so it's good for beginners and more advanced fitness people. That probably lasts about 30 min. You end with 5 min of partner work and then stretching. 

4. The trial classes are a great deal. They will try to sell you memberships to be in their "family". They are a little more aggressive than most fitness studios I have been to, but they are not pushy either. 

5. The classes always have the same structure. While it's a great workout, I really like variety. I would want to incorporate this 1-2 times a week, but I'm not sure I would be into this every day as my only workout. (I am currently still on my trial classes, and going to explore class pack options when I use them.)

6. They recently expanded their schedule, but they only have one 7am class (tuesday I think) on their schedule and nothing earlier. I am hoping for early morning classes at 6am. That would be a way they could get me to be a member for sure. 



Definitely go check this place out. There aren't really other kickboxing studios like this currently in the city.

Been going to this 24 hr for about a year. Lots of negative reviews on here.  But a few months ago they have I think a new manager. Place is much cleaner..floors, locker room. They just need to keep up with it.  People used to use lockers for storage...you couldn't find an empty locker. Now they keep people from storing overnight or for days. Staff is friendly.  Just wish they would clean the machines more. The treadmills definitely need a good cleaning. But overall a pretty good gym.

I love this gym, it is close and has all you need.  However there has been some serious issues as of late, basic upkeep has been suffering (paint, broken mirrors, locker room amenities), machines have been broken for way to long( all 4 stair climber for the past 4 months!) and don't get me started on the recent towel situation.  Hopefully they can rectify these issues for the future.  Also I hope the club can sell basic sports drinks and protein supplements soon, ever since last year all you can purchase is water!
The coolest parks! Gets crowded, so try to go during off peak hours! The Monon center has a park and splash pad - it's a Carmel Gem!

Shout out to Bob Christie for being the best trainer ever. He is patient and knowledgable. He enjoys weight machines and makes sure the seats and bars are properly adjusted to fit your height. He pays close attention to your form to be sure you are not straining muscles or have bad form. This also helps maximize your workout. Overall best trainer I have worked with. Only reason I go to this gym....Bob. Thanks Bob!

Ever since the renovations on the first floor, Pottruck has become a much better place to workout.  All the machines have TVs on them which makes the mundane task of running in place more enjoyable.  However, my favorite thing about Pottruck are the group exercise classes. Membership rates for the classes (if you're a Penn undergrad) are extremely cheap compared to those of other gyms and they offer a variety of classes throughout the day (Pottruck in general is "free" aka included in your tuition if you're an undergrad, but you have to pay a fee just to enter and use the machines if you're a grad student or part-time).    Times are early in the morning 7:30 AM or earlier, midafternoon at 12 and 12:30 PM and afternoon/night from 4 to 7:30 PM.  These include classes such as spinning, body pump (weights class), body combat (similar to kickboxing), Zumba, and some pilates and yoga classes.  There's another rate you have to pay for more advanced pilates and yoga classes, but I've never looked into those so I don't know much about it.  You can also take dance classes and I'm sure there's a lot more to explore! 

The main problem I have with pottruck is that it gets extremely crowded at peak hours (late afternoon classes) to the point where you either have to get to a class really early and wait outside until it starts of wait a while for a machine.  I wish that had a sign up sheet online like some other clubs have, but I'm not so sure that would work at a club like this.  The also run out of towels frequently. It may not necessarily even be at just peak hours, because it seems pretty random when they do and don't have towels available.

If you're a Penn student, I suggest you check out this gym at least once during your time here, because it really is a great facility and you should exercise anyway (gotta stay healthy!).  Also, you'll regret missing out on a great deal when you see the price of other gyms.

This gym is a disappointment. My wife joined to work out with their "Training Camp" but the Training Camp was soon cancelled. This was the only reason she joined this gym. Once that service was no longer offered, she no longer wanted to be a member. You would think this would be a valid reason to be let out of your contract but oh no. Never mind THEY CHANGED THE SERVICES OFFERED. They would not let her out of her contract. Her choice was to either to continue to pay for the remainder of the year or to "pay out" what is owed on her contract. This place runs a bait and switch operation and is unapologetic about it. DO NOT JOIN THIS GYM.

I don't have enough good things to say about this place. I joined in January and was a little wary about the price at first, but after taking class found it was worth every penny. 

Since joining, I've taken classes in different places all over the country and this studio is by far the best and here's why:

-The people are amazing. From the coaches, to the SA's, to the other members, everyone there is so kind and encouraging. It's such a positive environment to be in and I'm excited to go everytime.
-They cater to every fitness level. As an ex-athlete, these workouts push me like I used to be pushed by my coaches in school. But they also provide tons of alternative lifts on the weight floor for beginners, and you can adjust your workouts to fit you.
-You can see/track your progress. With coaches who help you evaluate your numbers, periodic benchmarks, and voluntary fitness challenges, it's so fun and easy to watch yourself grow and never become complacent.
-Workouts are diverse. Yes, the weight floor, rower, and treads will be components of every class, but there are different focuses each day (endurance, strength, power, and different combos of each) to keep your body on its toes, and always being challenged.

Your first class is free, so even if you're a little interested I highly recommend you check out the studio, meet some people, and see how you like a workout!

I live out in Vail and if you know anything about Vail, there is nothing out here.  I joined the snap fitness since it was the closest gym to home.  You can't beat the 24 hour access!  I'm an early riser so it's nice to never think about gym hours.  The staff is friendly and know me by name.  Plus it's always clean and never smells like a "gym." I have never taken a bootcamp class but some of the women have had amazing results with the trainers.

Their motto should be "Caughlin club hates kids."  I have never seen kids yelled at so much for either just swimming and minding their own business or minor typical kid infractions in my life.  The facility is sub par at best.  The locker room by the pool rivals that of my junior high.  The food is decent but takes forever.  But it's the service, or lack thereof, that really makes Caughlin Club the worst experience ever with kids.  My husband was one of the first members.  We've re-upped our membership on several occasions thinking that surely the convenient location could make it worth it.  But no it does not!! I will continue to avoid this place and drive much farther to go anywhere but here.

Holly K - your review above is SPOT ON!  Having dealt with the "M" that you refer to, you are completely right the the only place this women should work is in a prison camp.  After being members for 22 years and after being yelled at by the Clubs membership manager, we were actually forced to physically come down and pick up what I can only assume was an old fashioned ditto copy of a cancellation form in order for them to eventually cancel our membership.  We cancelled because of "M". 

If you are a shareholder in this club and reviewing these reviews, you should definitely consider firing everyone and starting over.  Everything bad about this Club trickles down from management.

Amazing gym, and great friendly staff. Thank you to Yelp for having a cool 3 day pass first of all.
Went to gym today and gym has a huge FREE parking garage. Nice entrance and was greeted right away. Gym offers towel service, so bang! Talked to a fitness consultant, super friendly, and let me get on my way.
Cardio equipment is super clean, and they have way too much. 
Locker room is like being at a country club, as nice as one of the larger gyms that charges more.
From the locker I made my way to pool, and this is one of the best pools I have swam in.
Overall, great gym and their rates are beyond competitive.
On my way out, got me a smoothie, and wow, this is good.
Might wake up with a lot of muscles tomorrow.

CF was closed for upgrades one day this week, and today was my first time visiting since. and upgrade they did!! they got rid of one of the smith machines (which were never really used) and now the weight room has FOUR SQUAT RACKS! including one power rack!! and TWO incline bench presses instead of just one!! and they added a squat machine (which personally, i love). this meathead is very happy. Now i won't have to fight the guy who curls in the squat rack for space on the weekends :)

Those who get bored easily like me are going to love the class options, which is $50 a month for access to all of them. The next tier down is $30 a month and then $20 a month is the cheapest one. 

One of the classes offered is an "orange theory" style class, and those fitness centers charge an upwards of $150 a month. So to me, the burn zone class alone is totally worth the $50 membership. The gym is large and fairly spread out with more than enough cardio machines and a decent amount of weights. There's also a cardio theater where you can run and watch a movie, a cycle studio and a recovery zone with hydrotherapy massage beds. Each locker room has a dry sauna in it as well. 

Like many others, I came from Gold's gym (which is now closed) and while I miss that gym, this one offers pretty much the same amenities I'm use to using at Golds. There is no pool or basketball court so if you enjoyed those amenities you're better off joining a YMCA. But they have cycling classes and the Les Mills  classes like Body Pump. 

The downside of this gym is that it get fairly crowded especially since the highway 50 location is permanently closing. Around the time of 4:30-7 there aren't even enough parking spaces. I have a feeling this will fizzle out soon though as most people don't stay consistent.

I do not like the size of the women's weights area. I miss the one at Golds. Not only is it very small, it's very dark in there as well.

The only thing that makes this gym stand out is the fact that it's 24 hours but besides that this gym is pretty small, equipments are mediocre, and the locker room is so hideous with only 2 stalls with absolute no privacy because the Dry Sauna is facing the stalls. Whoever designed the locker room is an utter idiot! They have no juice bar but they do sell some supplements but lacks plant base options or vegan/vegetarian options. Most of the supplements and protein they sell are the typical toxic products full of preservatives, carcinogenic carcinogenic chemicals etc. i'm hoping luxury gyms like Equinox will soon build a location near Downtown/Midtown Area.

I've been a member about two weeks now and have been loving most things about it.
They have a ton of fun group exercise classes, ranging from the typical (step aerobics, cardio boot camp) to some interesting ones (hip hop zumba, piloxing--a combo of pilates and boxing).  There's a pretty large-size room filled with cardio equipment, weight machines, and free weights.  Unfortunately, their Fitlinxx tracking system is being eliminated at the end of the year, so if you want a way to keep track of what you're lifting, you're on your own.

There's a Subway inside the Y where you can grab lunch or dinner before heading out, and you don't need to have your children as members in order to use the Child Watch.  

All the single ladies:  this isn't the gym to hit if you want to scope out hot single guys---so far, everyone I've seen appears to be married.  #toobadsosad

Way to kick butt, Reno Kicks! I recently had the opportunity to workout at Reno Kicks and had a killer high-intensity interval training session (HIIT). The workout consisted of various stations: jump rope, lunge & weight, high knees on hanging bag, punching bag, planking, noodle abs, TRX and battle ropes among others.

Jordon, the owner, and his team, Marshall and Jess, were fantastic coaches, correcting, encouraging, watching my form, offering modifications, always making sure that I was not only getting my butt kicked but also having fun. 

Reno Kicks has all you need for a killer workout and the location, on a visible corner in the up-and-coming Pine Street neighborhood, is perfect and accessible for those who work in downtown. It is currently open from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. but they will be opening soon at 5.30 for those early birds who like to squeeze in a workout before heading to work.

They have a mini fridge for a quick after workout snack and offer protein bowls and other items from BFF cafe. I am a big fan of their peanut butter protein balls. They are quite the treat and a healthy reward after a workout.

I feel like that this is not like any other gym. I come here a few times a week with my dad and get a little workout in, and I gotta say, I like it here. Good atmosphere, great staff, and other nicer gym patrons. I know this sounds weird, but it smells good too. If you're in the market for a new gym, I definitely recommend this one.

BEST GOLDS EVER!!!  So impressed with this facility and staff. Especially the manager on duty Tristan - he went out of his way to help me, as did the young lady at the desk. The staff here are so friendly, go above and beyond. The gym is spotless as well as the lockers- I can not recommend highly enough. Wow!!!

I've been a member here for four years. I love this gym and I love that I can go to any LA Fitness, which is great when traveling throughout the US.

Mt Laurel's pros: 1.The staff, especially the trainers - I've worked with Kenny and Kraig. Both are great, giving me workouts that are challenging but not beyond my capabilities - I don't know what's worse, not feeling like you've gotten your money's worth or not being able to move for days after the workout! I've had a very positive experience with both trainers - they are pleasant, knowledgeable, and helpful. Workouts are always different and have progressed with my skill level. My experience with all of the staff in general is a positive one. I'm greeted every day with a big smile and a, "good morning!" I love the trainers, and have enjoyed the enthusiasm of the class instructors.
2. Classes  - although I currently don't take advantage of the various classes - these days I usually just workout with a trainer and do some cardio - I have in the past participated in many of the classes and have enjoyed them all. Still have yet to do a cycle class, but am looking forward to starting this spring.
3. Care of equipment and facility - this is a very busy gym. Because it is such a high volume, it can get pretty dirty quickly. Staff is constantly cleaning. On the whole, I think they do a pretty good job. Also, because of the constant use, the cardio equipment does brake down, but it's usually fixed pretty quickly.

Mt. Laurel's cons: 1. Lack of appropriate space and equipment for training workouts. In traveling around and going to different LA Fitnesses throughout the country, I've seen what other locations offer and feel that this is the Mt Laurel location's biggest weakness. Most other LA Fitness gyms have a dedicated area for training, not just a little corner by the locker rooms. I was impressed with a few locations that each had a very large area with multiple sets of equipment for both members working out alone and those with trainers. Because there was ample room and equipment, the equipment didn't travel all over the gym and disappear, which seems to be a big problem in Mt Laurel. The more I see other gyms, the more surprised I am that the powers that be haven't done something to resolve this issue. This facility has a high volume of trainers and clients - it seems to me to be a lot more than other locations - yet very limited space and equipment for them. For this reason, I can't give five stars. 
2. Updating needed. Although the staff does a good job maintaining the equipment and facilities, because of the constant use and high volume, things are getting a bit run down and need a bit of updating. Maybe they should also look at expanding, adding a space for personal training and more cardio.

This is by far the best CrossFit gym I've ever been to. I've done trials at three others and was super disappointed, and started to think this type of workout wasn't for me. But this gym just clicked with me. I came for boxing originally, and those classes were amazing too, but I fell for CrossFit!

Oliver makes CrossFit so accessible for everyone (love the Lean/scaled versions available for every workout!). He pushes you to work hard and improve, but he doesn't push you blindly into injury as some gyms do by encouraging you to do too much too fast. He's so kind and friendly and really knows his stuff when it comes to form etc.

Plus, love the other CrossFitters at this gym. It's a really nice community of cool, supportive people. No one is trying to be over-macho and intimidating like at some gyms (even though there are some total beasts that go here!). Everyone is down to earth, chill, and welcoming. 

If you've ever considered CrossFit but backed out bc you were intimidated, this is the place for you! You'll be welcomed no matter your experience. And you get 3 free classes to start with, so you can get a feel for it before you sign up.

The Springfield location was just renovated and boosts to be the best gym in the area.  I had been a member of LA Fitness before and stopped by to check it out again.  

The location has been expanded and offers more cardio and weight equipment.  While the equipment has expanded and a pool and basketball court has been added, the smaller areas for training have diminished.  The place is less female friendly than it was before.  There are fewer areas to work out with a little privacy and less mirrors to be able to watch for proper form.  

On the service side - their training program has increased in price.  Their sales folks won't let you take their prices sheet out of the building and the gym doesn't even offer wifi.  They just renovated and no wifi.  I asked the location - they referred me to corporate.  I asked corporate and they referred me to the location.  

As a gym - if you are looking for equipment - they boost to be the best.  If you are looking for customer service, a nice environment for you to feel comfortable and have a good experience - I would keep looking.
Not bad.  The place is generally clean at the staff is friendly.  Initially it took a bit to get oriented in the layout compared to other gyms but it is manageable.

Easily the best club in Indy. The best group fitness classes in three studios and endless equipment. Even during "busy" times it's so big that I never wait for anything. Friendliest staff and extremely clean.
This is my home away from home

Wasn't too impressed with this 24 Hour Fitness. This is the first location I joined and I expected more. This gym is in the process of converting to a super sport, which explains no towel service. However, the gym needs a deep cleaning and some major renovations to model what 24 Hour Gyms should look like. A majority of the equipment is really old also. The customer service was great no complaints there but the cleanliness of the locker rooms and the overall gym could be improved tremendously. I did see an employee walking around checking the equipment for soil levels or cleanliness so it's obvious that they are aware of sanitation. I would still work out there if need be but prefer other locations.

Best pf in town. Huge facility, very very clean. Never smells like a gym, and they do a good job of enforcing the judgement free zone and lunk alarm. Tons of machines, tanning, massage beds, and cashless for safety. Nice kind staff. Trevor knows me and my husband by name. We've only lived here 6 months and they really made us feel like home. I just got back from the greenwood location that is poorly designed and way too crowded. This place does a great job!

The Brentwood YMCA is YMCA with which I grew up.  I visited there weekly from the age of 7 until I went off to college.  It is a quaint little YMCA with everything that one could need:  gym, indoor and outdoor pool, tennis courts (outdoor only), and a plethora of soccer fields.

What's really great is the outdoor skate park.  That's right a skate park for your kids, your teenagers, and even your college students.  It is very cool and very engaging for young people - guys and girls.

An added bonus is that the YMCA backs up to the trail that leads around Crockett Park.

SO happy to have discovered cycle bar. Their customer service is top Knotch! They are clean, on top of communication and really have a hint of love at their studios. I have enjoyed all my different classes with multiple teachers that have their own flavor. Until we meet again cycle bar!

I wasn't a huge fan of this gym at first, there was dust on every surface and a lot of machines were out of service ALL the time.  I believe the management changed and the placed cleaned up quite a bit.  The atmosphere is nice, people are great.  But, today I dragged myself out of bed at 4:40am to squeeze in a workout before heading to work.  It is currently 5:20am, there are a bunch of us sitting in the parking lot, because the door is locked and the lights are off.  (Supposed to open at 5am) Guess I'm heading home to shower and go into work early.  Not cool, Retro.

One of the most challenging yet most rewarding workouts! It does take some time to learn the machine and movements but the instructors are there to help! I recommend taking a beginner class first to help learn the basics but keep coming back and you will see and feel results physically and mentally.

Do not join this Gym. The equipment all needs repair or replacement. It's filthy dirty, staff is even worse.  Also, when I first joined they sucked me in with a low initial rate then increased it every year without notice.  Also, had my credit card stolen which was the one that I paid their dues with. And for a few months their billing was declined because I had a new number.  So instead of them reaching out or telling me when I walked in door day after day, they wait 3 months until you I was delinquent, they start reaching out to me then of course, telling me they are sending me to collections, then charged me monthly late fees and didn't even tell me that.  Next if you want to cancel you can't call or email, you MUST walk in personally complete their form then they charge you Another cancellation fee.  This is the worst Gym I have ever experienced on all levels. And I even said to them if you refund the late charges I will stay...and they said no. So instead of keeping a customer they lost one, which in my opinion they can't afford because their stock price and performance is just as bad as their facilities: Ticker CLUB if you want to look for yourself. Planet fitness is a way better choice and a better stock....lol. Find another gym to join bottom line, worst customer service experience I have ever had.

Physical focus is a great gym because it is open 24/7 to members but is more private than 24 hour fitness, which I love. I can go there after work late at night and I have the gym almost to myself! The equipment is great and the staff is really friendly, plus the remodel is looking great with a shower in the bathrooms. I would highly recommend this gym to any busy-body like me who enjoys a late workout. Great job Micheal and Kasper!

I've had a membership here for just over amonth, and I love it! The place is spotless, the staff is very polite, and the price just can't be beat! If you feel like the gym can be intimidating, then check this place out. Their "no meatheads" policy makes for a pleasant and welcoming workout experience!

I've been to many gyms and this LA Fitness location is one of the cleanest locations I've seen. The locker rooms, cardio are and weights area are kept clean. 

The equipment is fairly new and it's all working. There are many new treadmills, bikes and stair steppers. The weights are usually in order and look legit. 

If you sign up for a longer term, it's the best way to get a good deal. Less than $30/month is a good deal of you are not getting personal training.

I have been to any number of 24 Hour Fitnesses and enjoyed them and their amenities. Unfortunately, this one is filthy and badly maintained. Went to a different health club and letting my 2 year costco membership simply run out. 

Heard and thought that they were going to make major improvements after 24 hour fitness was bought by an investment group (a teacers retitement fund) and had continued my membership. Unfortunately the Santa Barbara facility stayed same (actually got worse).

Pluses: like some of their equipment. Minuses: dirty; no parking.
Lagree is an awesome workout! Such a good challenge but also fun. You almost forget you're working out.

Just moved to Nashville/Gallatin and my daughter said to check out the "Y" on Gallatin.  Joined up yesterday with Latoya who made everything so easy!  Every person at this YMCA was simply fantastic and made this very EX Californian feel very welcome!  The facility is marvelous and my wife and I will enjoy our memberships thanks to the great folks at this "Y".  Latoya is  my hero for making our new life easy in Nashville!  Thank You Latoya. Merry Christmas.

I absolutely love coming to cycle class. Everyone who works here is very nice, helpful and kind. I love the energy of all the instructors. Classes are challenging and I love it. The location is perfect. So glad I found cycle bar and tried it.

What a great class! I just did my second class at this studio and it was so much fun and so hard!!! I chose to work on a treadmill for my cardio but they have a bike option. The trainer was super friendly and really helped me feel comfortable with what I was doing. He explained everything clearly and supported me as I went. The weight section of the workout was arms and abs. It was a "choose your own weight" so everyone could work with what challenges them. I would recommend this studio to anyone and everyone who wants a great workout that perfectly blends cardio and weight training.

This was the "Y" I grew up at.  Day camps in the summer, Indian Guide, Indian Princesses, The seekers, swimming in the indoor pool, working out at the fitness center, the locker rooms, classes in art & music, theatre & cooking.

But wow - now it is expanding and getting absolutely HUGE.

A great commuinty resource.  Expensive to join - but if you will use the facilities and take the classes - well worth it.  Got kids?  cConsider joining!
Katie who teaches 4:30 bodyworks Tuesday nights ROCKS!!  Motivating, safe and tough.  Pushes you but in a good way

I'm very disappointed in billing with Banner. I went to this hospital because I was told by my doctor that they are really good with helping you out with medial bills with people who do not have medical insurance. So I went in on a Friday to ER with abdomen pain and the doctor was crap and didn't do anything for me but run labs. (I suffer from cyst ruptures on my ovaries) and he knew this. He tells me he doesn't want to do ultrasounds or xrays on me because my labs came back normal.. well fast forward to Saturday. I was rushed to Banner ER via ambulance in excruciating pain, turns out I had ovarian Torsion going on, little circulation to my left ovary and devolving an infection. So now I sit here with a 5k+ bill and was double charged for test that where done twice by two doctors on visits less than 24 hours apart.

I called today after getting my bill and I asked for a payment plan. The billing dept told me the minimum they could do was $300. I said I couldn't afford that. Then they said they could do $209. I still cant afford that. I told them that I can make monlthy ,but not what they are asking. I was told they wouldn't accept them and that I would be sent to collections and that a machine decides when....


So ridicoulous!! I am trying to pay my medical bills. I have a life, other bills, a 4 month old daughter to take care of and I'm going affect my credit because they wont work with me. This hospital needs to be more realistic with billing for people who don't have insurance. At least I was trying to pay, but now I realize why pay if I'm going to be sent to collections anyway? Might as well not pay and send me anyways! :)

Powerhouse Gym is your father's gym, no nonsense, no yoga, no spinning, just working out.  It's open 24/365 and the membership is a bargain.  My main issue is that the upkeep of the treadmills is seriously deficient.  3 of the 5 machines have non working buttons or broken heart rate monitors at any given time.  I literally have to jump on each one until I can find one that works properly. Other than that, a great place to actually exercise and not have to look pretty.
This place is updated, with clean facilities and machines, free coffee and an incredibly friendly staff. What more could you ask for?!

This place is amazing.   Martial Arts Family Fitness is a work out for your body and your spirit.  I've seen kids enjoying classes to grandmothers punching bags, there is something for everyone here.  Kids take classes in martial arts and learn life skills like discipline, respect and confidence.  I've seen amazing results from their KUT program with people slimming down, becoming healthy and glowing with their results.  The KUT program uses a combination of classes for maximum results, and works with your diet educating everyone on healthy choices.
My favorite class is a strength training class that they do with bands.  My upper body is much more toned since taking the class.  I also enjoy their kickboxing class, where I get to work on my form and technique.  The instructors are always there to help you out and support you.  I feel so good about myself after every class that I take here.
There is a reason that this place has been voted #1 in Santa Barbara as the Best Martial Arts School.  They get results and they want you to show up.  This place is for your entire family and it is run by a family.
Can you beat 20 a month for new equipment all the tvs massage chairs and tanning..  I'm here today after the blizzard and they are open

I have been going to the gym at this recreation center for over a year now.  The people at the front desk and working around the center are always very nice.  The center attracts young and old.  Its a great option to serve the local community and includes an outdoor pool.

There is a row of Treadmills in the back of the gym area with a row of TVs you can watch while you are treading.  There are also plenty of ellipticals and bikes.  They also have circuit weight machines and free weights.  

I've always thought the larger gyms were kind of overkill.  This is smaller than i've seen but does everything i need.  I don't know about their personal trainer options since I manage my own workouts at this time.

Enjoy!
This location is much better. Equipment is new, staff is friendly and here I get the best workouts.

Smells like urine and every meat head here slams the weights down like the steroids slammed down their veins. No decency for others . Very unclean and unpleasant. Unfortunately I'm limited to this gym due to location otherwise DO NOT JOIN
So staff super nice. I go early and never have any problems. No dead lifts really sucks but whatever. Most people dont do um i guess. Im satisfied.

Don't go here unless u want a gym owner who only cares about himself during a pandemic & not his "fit fam" since he bought new equipment for Christmas while he had clients who were struggling when covid first hit & his reaction was he needed his money. Also if u wanna feel like you're back in high school with females being catty & hateful to u while again the gym owner hears & sees yet says nothing-then this gym is for u! The reviews u see besides mine are all of current friends of the owner so don't let that fool u!

Out of the four AF locations I've been to in the area this was my least favorite. There are no benches or hooks in the bathrooms, which makes it awkward to change clothes or even shoes - no toilet lid either so you are left to sit on the bare seat or stand up. Also no coat rack so you have to roll up your coat and stuff in into one of the cubby holes. I also didn't see many people cleaning the equipment and I agree it did not smell that great either. The only thing that was good about this place was there were a couple of pleasant staff members.
Very clean. One of the best that we've been too!

I had a great time climbing here and the overall experience was terrific. 

...until I tried to cancel my membership. More than a year had passed since I'd joined so cancelling should have been straightforward. 6 months, a dozen phone calls, two trips to the gym and a call to Visa later, I've finally blocked them from charging me. First I cancelled over the phone, which was excellent and had our relationship ended there - 5 stars! Then went I went to climb on day pass a few months later and was told that the person who took my previous call shouldn't have cancelled my membership as notification was required in writing. So they back-charged me and told me this and that and the other... I thought the situation was resolved but wasn't as attentive to my bills and I could have been; another few months passed. Eventually I got written confirmation from PRG that my membership would be cancelled. When the next charge appeared a few weeks later, I gave up and called Visa to contest it. Should have done so months ago.

Absolutely love this gym! The staff is super friendly and know the members by name. Multiple perks include: free towel service, tanning, free classes, TV's on cardio equipment, juice bar, etc. (and all of this for an incredibly reasonable price) I live 15 minutes from this location and still choose to be a member here over gyms that are closer to home.

Joined a few months back when I moved to CC. A pretty good gym for the price. The key is picking the correct times to go to the gym. During peak hours it's to crowded and several people are just hang out on the equipment. As far as cardio equipment they have more than enough. I wish there was more free weights. The machines are good. The gym is well kept which is a major key.
I love working out at Orangetheory in Franklin. The staff and coaches are always so positive and helpful! It is a great workout and only takes an hour. I would highly recommend it!

This place was packed on a Saturday morning. I went to this one since it was the closest to the hotel I was staying, but man all machines were busy and it was not my usual experience at orange. The instructor was more focus on the weights you grabbed than correct form. I wasn't really motivated to push myself because of the size in class.

Yelp is always right!
I looked for simple gym whit out all the bullshit 
Fee, contract, etc...
I check for new gym and the reviews here is greet 
I go and check it out 
 first is took me long time to get answers 
But I am not give up because I am really won this place 
After few the owners contact and i go to see it 
Is little bit hidden on st street 
I go there and in 7 min I be out whit my new member gym
No contact 
No bady try rip you off 
Very simple & fast
Mount to mount 
You have evrething there 
No to many people 
Very nice owner 
The best gym in Santa Barbara !!!
Trust me this your next  gym

I've been going to OTF for just over 3 months, and I've lost 37lbs. Enough said. The classes are amazing. The coaches are each so special and perfect in their own unique ways. The music is awesome. In the words of the Lego movie, everything is awesome. 

I tried to finally cancel my membership to LA Fitness today, and it was such a haste. I'm so glad I'm done with that place. OTF is it!!

This gym is adequate for daily fitness needs. The service is very poor. The management is often not available, and charges are often incorrect. Cancelling or making changes to your membership is difficult. Overall I would probably join a more member friendly club.

First of all, I love the workout. The class had me running and doing strength training even on days I thought I was too lazy to break a sweat. What I don't like is the inconsistent heart rate monitors, the location, and the cost. When the whole premise of the OTF group class is being in the orange heart rate zone, but your heart rate monitor doesn't work half the time, it ruins the experience. Add the expensive price tag, and it's just not worth it. For someone who can afford $160+/month gym membership and who lives 10 minutes away, definitely give it a try. It really was a great workout, but after giving it a try for 3 months, it was too expensive and too far away for me to continue my membership.

Great studio! I was excited to see a lagree studio in the area since I was visiting from out of town. Class was great, teacher was attentive and I liked that the moves were in a screen if you needed a reminder.

I've been a member for a few years now.   After I injured my ankle that required surgery, I gained a bunch of weight.   Got up to my heaviest around 200 (I'm only 5'6) and used Workout Anytime as my home base for strengthening my ankle and shedding pounds.   Now that they have one in Cool Springs I go there and to the one in Bellevue so I can workout during lunch while at work or near the house out in Bellevue.  It has all the basics.  Only downfall is the locker room is pretty cramped, but no biggie.

Hell yaaaaaa!! Ready to stop being bored at your normal gym? People don't sit around looking at their cell phones here. So you workout, really, BRO?

JRB

Lately the gym as been super hot and smells bad. I had to gave up on working out 1/3 way through because I felt sick and irritated by the hot temperature and the bad smell of the gym. I really hope they gonna improve this cuz I loved this gym as u can see from my previous review on this gym.

This is by far the most snazzy, jazzy YMCA I've ever stepped foot in and I LOVE it. 

Very easy to navigate, friendly staff and plenty of machinery even on a busy night. I was able to get onto a elliptical and a treadmill without any wait. 

I'm looking forward to returning and trying out the Cycle Studio. I popped my head in and the video screen is a great addition. 

The cafe and close proximity to so much of downtown Indy is going to be a major plus for all who live in the area. Can't wait to come back for another gym sesh!

I love some of NIFS specialized programs they offer like the Mini-marathon Training Program, but their facilities are pretty dated for the price of membership. Staff at NIFS are very nice and helpful, I just wish their facility reflected the level of professionalism and knowledge that the staff have.

This is the best place in Santa Barbara for yoga. I was in town on business and was told this place was the kind ting! Well it was and I will be going back whenever I am in SB. I had Sarah as an instructor and found the class very accommodating for my level, i.e., no pressure to keep up with other students and excellent attention to detail by her.

I've been training to climb Kilimanjaro for several months now in the mountains now I'm back in Florida and the only reason I joined was to use the stair steppers I've been here eight times in 3 days and have not been able to get on one. Starting to really regret paying thirty bucks for three weeks to use a stair stepper here. Just keep my 30$ Im joining different gym! What a waste. Fix your machines!

I've been a Y member in a number of other cities, so when I moved to St. Louis, I was excited to check this one out. I made an appointment and went in for a tour with Sal. Before I could go on the tour, I was handed a piece of paper to fill out, which asked for some really personal information - date of birth, driver's license number, employer and contact info, etc. in addition to phone number and address. I told Sal I wasn't comfortable giving all of that out without even knowing if I was going to join yet. He said it was required. I asked why, and he kept referring to "policy" and that he'd be happy to show me the policy. I politely explained that I believed him that it was in fact policy, but that what I was looking for was the reason behind it. He actually said, "Well, I wasn't in the room when that policy was made, so how would I know?" I was pretty irritated by this point, so I asked what the minimum information was that I could give in order to receive a tour. He said I could leave off my employer but that was it. He then said he needed my ID and to do a background check. I said I'd be happy to do all of that once I joined, but that I wasn't going to do all of that for a tour. He said, "Yes you are, and I'm going to take your picture too." I walked out.

I'm not sure if this is all truly YMCA policy or if it was merely Sal's delusion. YMCA, either fire Sal OR, if you really feel that the general public is so untrustworthy as to require an actual background check and the disclosure of extremely personal information before literally walking them through a couple of rooms WITH A STAFF MEMBER, then I don't wish to be a member of your organization any longer. I found a different gym that's also cheaper.

Dropped in for a couple of WODs while I was in STL for work. I enjoyed the coaching and most of the members were friendly too. Only reasoning I gave four instead of five stars was because the space was so small compared to their number if members, it was cramped! Not necessarily a bad thing for them, but I felt like I was always in someone's way! :(  I'm sure it's difficult finding large space in a city though too. I would still recommend them, maybe just try a less popular WOD time- I went in the evenings.

Crossfit Roux just recently opened in Playmakers Indoor Sports- Southshore. Bradley, the owner, is a certified Crossfit trainer who has done a really incredible job of setting up the gym. 
There are a few things that make Crossfit Roux stand out from other Crossfit gyms:
1. The price! It is lower than any other quality Crossfit gym I have seen. There are discounts for teachers, first responders, musicians, students, and members if the military.
2. Few Crossfit gyms are air conditioned- and this is a huge benefit for our New Orleans summer months.
3. This is one of the most women-friendly gyms I have been to ever. There is a women-only boot camp class!! Mothers can bring their teens for free to do a work out alongside them- which not only is convenient for moms, but it encourages a healthy lifestyle at a young age.
4. There is a strong focus on health here. Several times Bradley has said something along the lines of, "the way most gyms do this movement puts a lot of strain on shoulder muscles and can really damage your shoulder, so we won't do it that way in this gym." This demonstrates what is trying to be done at this gym: help people lead a healthy, strong lifestyle through Crossfit.
5. The classes are capped at 12 people, where many other gyms are 20. This means more attention to you as you perform some complicated movements. Bradley is very in tune with everyone's levels of ability and suggests scaled versions for you- and demonstrates everything!

I highly suggest you sign up for classes at Crossfit Roux- even if you haven't done Crossfit before, there will be classes to go over the fundamentals of Crossfit. Reach out to Bradley at krewefitness.com

I popped in here on a Monday to take a boot camp styled class after hearing wonderful things about this gym. I was on a class pass. The workout that Dan gave us was superior in my opinion and challenging. He was clear in his instruction, motivating and offered alternatives. This was designed for an  advanced participant. Although the main gym is air-conditioned, the boot camp was given in a building off to the side that is not. They had a small fan and a large door was left open for ventilation. The heat was draining for me and this was in November so just keep that in mind if you have issues with heat and stay hydrated.  Water and towels are provided, which I thought was nice.

I really love these workouts.  Though I'm always intimidated during the first five minutes of knowing absolutely nothing about what we're doing (this is all new to me), I quickly feel right at home.  The trainers are super friendly and always give us newcomers extra attention.  The workouts are over as fast as they started; I'm never bored and always enjoy myself.  Everybody in class is super friendly.  And their schedule is the best in town; they have the most class times mid-day which is pivotal for me.  Check it out; you won't be disappointed.  A great workout & great value.

I was in town visiting family, who had just moved into the area, during the holiday season, and I saw on the website that new guests could visit the gym for a free three day trial. "We are happy to let you try out the facility, and we offer promotions that are designed to assist in whatever category you have the most interest. Please complete the form below to receive a FREE 3-day pass and special offers sent directly to your inbox." I was pretty excited to try the gym out and thought that if the gym was awesome, I would refer my brother and his family. I showed up at the gym at 6:30am, it was not busy at all, and was told I would not be able to utilize the trial as I myself am not a local resident with a local ID. This was NOT stated on the website, but, it was stated in small print at the bottom of the pass sent to my inbox. As I had already read the info. on website, I didn't think to double check the fine print on the pass sent to my inbox. In my opinion, good customer service is transparent. Also, I would have thought the front desk person would have been a bit more accommodating as I was already there at 6:30am and, again, the facility was not busy. Needless to say, I will not recommend this gym to my family new to the area.

This facility is now overcrowded since it merged with the other site. The clientele has also taken a slide, with many loud younger men using bad language and showing a general disrespect for the facilities and others. The men's locker room is usually a mess and the management seems to care only about their bottom line and not at all about quality control.  It seems like all of the former employees who cared about their jobs have left. The parking lot next to the facility has also become overcrowded and a general hazard for accidents.

Absolutely agree with the previous reviews, this place is poorly run, poorly maintained. The air conditioning was broken for more than two months in the middle of summer.  I complained about it on many occasions and was summarily dismissed with "we're working on it."  It's beyond my comprehension how any business, let alone a gym, expects its customers to be ok with a broken air conditioner for several months during the hottest months of the year.  Their customer service is nonexistent.  I also spoke with Jeff and got nothing but a rude runaround and refusal to refund any membership fees.  Jeff is one of the rudest individuals I've ever dealt with in any setting! He's unprofessional, rude, and without any tact. 

Trainers and staff are conspicuously missing from the floor at Kennedy Fitness. There've been many occasions that I had a question about the correct use of equipment and couldn't find anyone to help me.  Between the broken AC problem, the lack of anything resembling customer service and absence of trainers on the floor, what the heck am I paying these people for?  

 Don't waste your money at this facility. There are so many other clubs that will treat you right and cost less too. I've joined a new fitness club where I'm always greeted at the door and treated with courtesy.  Don't waste your time or $$ at Kennedy. Look elsewhere if you want a good gym.

The staff ant the MCC did a great job reopening. Their preparation, communication, and execution was excellent on Day 1, session 2. It was nice to be able to return to the gym and feel safe while doing so.

I signed up using a groupon. The deal cost 24 dollars for one month at the gym. The gym was clean and the machines worked properly. My only complaint is that the membership coordinator called me about 6 times to try to get me to join the gym. It was a bit excessive. If I had the money, I would definitely consider joining here!
