Also I hear there is an outdoor pool for the summer.

I did the 6 week challenge, which is NOT free as advertised. You pay $500 up front and if you don't complete they keep your money. You get little to no support on the challenge, and it's much more difficult than they make it out to be. Aliceon and Ryan did not seem to be coordinated as to all the parts of the challenge and who took care of what. DO NOT DO IT unless you can afford to lose $500. 
Bill and Char are great trainers. Ryan is nice, Aliceon is condescending, judgemental and mean. 
The equipment seemed to be new, clean and in working order, although I didn't use it much. In the training sessions (required for the challenge) the sound system didn't always work, the heart rate monitors weren't working one time, and the app where you sign up online wasn't working for a week. 
I did get a heart rate monitor and a few new recipes. Hardly worth $500.
If you don't do the challenge, and you want 24/7 access, I would recommend it.

I had a wonderful vinyasa flow class here from an excellent instructor Alia Aizenstat. Due to the intimate class size I felt like I got a lot of individual attention on proper form. She was very calming and kind. I felt very comfortable and left feeling rejuvenated.

I moved to Reno from the East Coast smack dab in the middle of COVID times.    I showed up to OTFRNO with 30 pounds gained over the last 8 months and ready for a change.  COVID gave me permission to eat (& drink) what I wanted to.  Over the next 11 months the trainers and staff  helped me  lose 40 pounds, but more importantly I gained my self confidence back.  Because of lock-downs I wasn't able to meet any friends in the area.  It was a wonky time for everyone.  I never met my kids teachers...or even step foot in their school.    The trainers, the staff and the other members were my friends.  They didn't realize it but they were my "tribe".  They were my people.   Although we are moving back to DC OTFRNO will always mean so much to me.    I changed physically but more importantly it made me a better mom, a better wife and a better person.   Thanks team!  Leesa W.

Extremely rude staff, Harvey at the front desk is very inhumane. he wouldn't allow me to enter to use the bathroom after checking my temperature. I also had a mask and towel over my shoulder. Also the GM is so busy that he avoided having a face to face conversation with me.  I'm just a guest and not even a member.  I've read most of their reviews online and it looks like this maybe a recurring issue with their staff and communication.

This isn't even close to the best facility I've ever belonged to, but it gets the job done and it's close to my home. 

I do wish they had sanitizing wipes located throughout the gym as opposed to the paper towels and soap-dispenser type sanitizer they offer sparingly throughout the facility. I am diligent about cleaning the machines before and after use, but I know others are not. 

I also wish the staff would enforce the "No longer than 20 minutes on cardio equipment while others are waiting." I've waited upward of 30 minutes for a Precor elliptical on more than one occasion and found it extremely frustrating and rude on the part of the other members who could tell I was waiting and continued their 45 minute + cardio workouts 

The price is right for what you get which I really appreciate. 

Overall, average.

BEWARE OF CON ARTISTS AND POORLY MAINTAINED FACILITY!

Myself and my wife went in 6 months ago for the $10/month no commitment membership and were sold up to a black card membership.  Unfortunately for us, the person who sold us the membership neglected to tell us that the black card membership is a 12 month commitment.  We were each charged $60 cancellation fees on top of the $20 annual "maintenance" fee we were each charged in June.  I put maintenance in quotations because the facility is rarely clean and always overcrowded.  The assistant manager condescendingly  told us "sorry there is nothing I can do."

I would highly recommend finding another gym, unless you want to work out in a smelly, crowded, filthy, sweat box that has very low-end equipment and horrible customer service.

Probably not even a real hospital.  Every time I've called to schedule an appointment they've said that they're not accepting new patients for over a year and then they sass you over the phone.  More likely this place is a front for some sort of criminal behavior.

You'd be better off finding a youtube channel on home surgery.

Ooh this boulder gym is nice, luxurious even with all the nice touches it has, being Philly's newest gym. 

Climbing: The layout is really nice and feels very spacious. Huge amount of walls with great variety of features and inclines. I love the monochrome holds and ranged grading system. All the problems I tried were really fun and interesting.

Amenities: They have gender neutral bathrooms, a shower, a separate hand washing station, water bottle fill station, and lots of various training equipment. The kilter/tension boards are really cool and something I haven't seen before. They also sell coffee and are down the street from a brewery. Easy street parking or to bike to, though they could probably use some actual bike racks outside. So yeah, it's great!

Great customer service was provided by Lindsay.  I joined and love how clean and organized the equipment layout was done!  The equipment is also updated and not old, with just enough options to get an effective workout.  Lastly I would recommend this location because you also have 24 hour access.  Oh one last thing if you attend this location late at night the parking lot is dark and kinda isolated so women and men be careful when exiting this facility and check out the surrounding before you go to your vehicle!

Wish I could give them a ZERO star. We were charged for our April dues (while gym is closed) and then again for June (no notice the gym was reopening) however due to the COVID we relocated to a different state for work. No way to cancel our membership and as soon as we heard the gym was back open, we called to cancel. The young man at the front desk stated they needed 30 days written notice to cancel. Well, how could we do that if we had already moved and we tried and tried to contact the gym? Sooooooooo then we were charged AGAIN for June dues. My husband also had knee surgery at the end of May so he CLEARLY would not be using the gym at all until cleared to do so. 
We had other memberships at CRUNCH FITNESS and all we did was call and they graciously cancelled our memberships and wished us well.  Thank you Crunch Fitness for your superior customer service!!!!
Surely hope this won't have to go to litigation, as I see the owner of the gym is taking monies that the gym is not entitled to and using it to cover her expenses at the expense of the members. I would not recommend giving them any more money. 
I called and asked for the membership department was put on indefinite hold and then was advised that it might be easier to call back, so I did - two hours later - another indefinite hold and advised to call back AGAIN. 

Now the hubs is trying..... will update soon

Ok..... customer service at this place is ridiculous. Jessica in "memberships" in not so many words said, "too bad, we had plenty of members who contacted us and cancelled their memberships, and offered to send us (in a different state) our "gift cards" to the gym for the spa and juice bar for the portion of our memberships they stole. NEVER in my life, really? Why on earth would I ever come back to this gym? She said "read your contract - we require 30 days notification to cancel a membership"


Read the reviews - they're  true. We know this firsthand. 

Now time to contact legal. This is simply not ok.


Response from the complaint on BBB I FILED  - mind you NO EMAIL was sent to us regarding the reopening of the club - though my husband email was listed on his contract- 

"Sports West Ahtletic Club did charge for April dues because we belived we where giong to be able to reopen on April 10th as the President was announcing on TV. When we were not able to open in April we posteded on our web site and sent out e-mails to all members saying we would refund each member in the form of a gift certificate to use for services and good in the club and our day spa when we reopen. 

As for cancellation of membership, we require a 30day written notice. It is a procesess to cancell re occuring dues so in order to ensure our accuracy we use the thirty day to procees the request. Mr B agreed to send in a written notice to terminate his membership. See attatched documents. Mr B could have mailed a letter to terminate his membership any time in March, April or before May 15th to terminate his membership. The club closed on March 17th so he could have called and emailed or walked in to the club and filed out a term form before that time to canell for April and Mr. B could have mailed a letter in to Sports West any time in April and before May 14th to cancell his membership for June. We did not process any dues in May. Mr B has filled out a term form brfore as he has been a member scince May of 2019 adding and taking off people on his membership.

As far as CRUNCH FITNESS CENTER being able to cancell by a phone call, that is nice for them. We are not a corporate conglomerate with millions of dollars and grants from the government to be able to handle calls from all over the country and process them. We are a single local fitness center trying to actively support our community and utalize local busineses to do so.

There is no way we could have know that Mr. B wished to cancell his membership without some some form of communication in writting. If Mr. B would have emailed or mailed a letter we would have accomidated his request right away. 

It is sad that Mr. B resorted to defamatory accusations on social media trying to hurt a local business when all he had to do was write a letter as he agreed to. 

As for a refund If Mr B could send us an official termination letter by mail or e-mail and take down the defamatory post on Yelp. We will consider a refund."

We received no notification of the gym reopening and we did try to call and discuss it with the gym at the time of the closure. No information was given AND then we had to move due to his knee injury and jobs. 

I've worked for many "small businesses" and we support small business - but even the owner stating that they "thought" they would be re-opening doesn't give them the right to charge members for services not available.

OK, I'm bumping up my stars for the Downtown Y because of the awesome event they had last Saturday.

They offered a group exercise super sampler where they did 30 minute sample classes of everything they offer. How freaking genius!! Each of the instructors came in and did a preview of the classes they instruct, and I got to try out a really fun "dance it out" class with an instructor I had never had. Awesome!! I only wish I had more time that day to try out some other classes! I've never seen a Y do this, so it really made them stand out to me. 

You can't go wrong with any of their classes, I really enjoy everything this Y has to offer!

For the most part, yelping requires a lot of eating, so there's got to be something to counteract the more negative effects of that pastime. That's where 12th Street comes in! And wait, I can yelp about it too? Double wow.

12th Street is, I think, one of the most affordable gyms in Center City. Full disclosure: as a student, I paid $350 for a year membership and was waived the initiation fee. And all the classes are included, as well as two personal training sessions, which I haven't used yet but am totally excited to! Isn't it sooo Kardashian to have a personal trainer? :) This gym wouldn't be Kim's cup of tea though, cos while the facilities do the job, it's nothing state of the art. It's kind of like a step above an old boxing gym. I mean, everything is clean which I appreciate but I'll put it this way, nothing is shiny and new. Also, the layout is a bit strange. Someone described it as a maze, which it definitely is, with all its nooks and crannies and narrow passageways. But it's nothing too complicated that you won't know your way around after a day or two. At least I hope. 

So far,  I must sound pretty tepid about 12th Street, right? But I'm just warming up like a good workout should :)

I actually credit this place for revolutionizing my mentality about working out. Heretofore I was pretty "Zen" about exercising, as I'd just go for a long but moderately paced run on the Schuylkill Banks whenever the mood struck. In fact, all I had intended do to at 12th Street was hit the treadmills when it was too cold or rainy to go running outside. But the classes are like crack (yes I know, lazy metaphor...). They're not only intense but also loads of fun! So far, I've tried Ballet Tone, Yoga Core, Tae Bo, and spinning. Goodbye, lonely treadmill in the corner.

I won't say much about Yoga Core and Tae Bo, since I think most of you know what those might entail, but I will say that the Tae Bo here is like Billy Blanks double, maybe even triple time. And if the idea of doing straight sets of roundhouse kicks to Lil Wayne appeals to you, look no further... That said, don't let Ballet Tone trick you because it's not all unicorns and cupcakes and pink tutus. It's actually a pretty effective workout, and it takes extra discipline because you're supposed to look graceful while doing it too... I loved it, especially the refreshing way music was incorporated - light, poppy fare like One Republic, Maroon 5, and TLC :) Lastly, spinning. The one-hour class with Na'Tasha is no joke... no joke at all... I was sweating like an onion! That woman will make you work! I wish I could carry a mini Na'Tasha in my pocket for homework motivation - I'd be such a better student! And the way she times the workouts to the music (so that both build up simultaneously)? That is art, dude. You'll leave that class looking like you got into a fight with a wet grizzly bear but you'll feel like a BAMF, guaranteed...

And now for the cool-down: I have to say I'm not all too thrilled with 12th Street's night hours. They close at 11 on weekdays which is aite, but at 10, 8, and 7 on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, respectively. Maybe they're just watching out for my social life that I'm not hitting the gym when I should be hitting the dance floor, but I'll make that decision thank you!

I received a free trial period to this gym, which was great because I wasn't quite sure that I wanted  to make the commitment just yet... The gym looked very nice and everything was going great until the staff became very rude. Ted, who was at the front desk, was very rude and short with me after I let him know that I had a trial period and I wanted to check
In to workout. His looks could have killed, just a very rude guy. I felt like saying if you don't like your job then go get another one. Other than the staff, the gym is nice. However, I do not want to spend my money and get the rude treatment. I made it to the second day of the 7 day trial period and I never went back. I enjoyed the first day though.
These workouts really push you to your max and give you quick results. What a great gym to be a part of and amazing trainers at the midtown location!!!

I'm pleasantly surprised with how much I love this gym! It has a more down to earth feeling than the other more expensive -more pretentious gym close by. It's refreshing that I don't feel any pressure to wear make up when I go to the gym here!  People come to this gym to work out!! PERIOD! I've met ALL of my fitness goals since working out there and I love that the employees are always happy upbeat and positive and they're always giving me a thumbs up or a high-five! They r supportive without being pushy. Really the happy upbeat positive attitude of the employees makes such a huge difference for me -thank you! You guys really care! Also love the sweet genuine smiles and youthful laughter...it's so contagious! Thank you to whoever does the hiring here!

Active Fitness is a great gym.  They have an excellent selection of equipment.  I love the fact that the main area is open.  The best part is that it is so convenient and parking is never a problem when I go.  Check it out.

Dropped in to Crossfit Abbellire this morning for a pre-Thanksgiving WOD. It was a great one! I had a wonderful experience at this gym. The coaches were friendly and super supportive throughout the entire work out. I was greeted with a smile and felt very welcomed in the gym. The community provided a lot of support to one another, which is always a great vibe to feel in a new gym. Definitely felt comfortable here. 

Best of all, they provided a great workout! Frank and Julia gave us plenty of time to warm up and then reviewed all the standards for the class. Once we were ready to go, they were constantly cheering us on and pushing us further. 

Great, great time this morning. Thanks Crossfit Abbellire!

Too. Freakin. Crowded.

This LA Fitness gets very crowded in the early evening, to the point where is it difficult to find a free locker or machine.  The locker room looks beautiful, but it is poorly laid out, so that you constantly have to excuse yourself to get past other members. The only way I manage to get a workout in a reasonable amount of time is to just use whatever station happens to be open; waiting for specific machines would take too long.  

The facility overall is fairly nice, primarily because it is only a few years old.  I see some evidence that the management isn't putting enough into maintaining the place, but time will tell.  I don't have any complaints about the equipment quality. The temperature is always comfortable. Most of the members and staff are polite.  I've used their babysitting service (the Kids Klub) a handful of times and my daughter seems to like it. I pay $18 per month, but I've had other members tell me that they pay more or less than I do; apparently you need to negotiate when you sign up.

I am going to keep this short and sweet so you read it!  This place is amazing and has innovative and challenging classes!  I have taken Zumba, PiYo, Turbo Kick, Sculpt, and Club Cardio!  The instructors are fun, fabulous, and knowledgable.  Everyone is friendly and welcoming which makes you want to keep coming back!  I have been coming for almost two years and don't plan on stopping! The new class called Club Cardio created by the owner the wonderful Melissa Jo Watkins and co-instructor Michelle Tripp which is awesome! Check it out on Facebook for videos of what we do here and the FAQ on the website!

This gym (and I am speaking for this, Arch St. and Fitler Sq locations) is a bad one to get involved with. I have just FINALLY ended my relationship with them and they have put me on a delightful 2 month waiting period, which basically means they are squeezing two more monthly fees out of my checking account before they will release me from my month-to-month contract after 4 years of uninterrupted payments. Then they called and offered me 2 free months if I stay. 

It's like being in a bad relationship. You want out. You try to get out, but they won't let you go and try to manipulate you into staying even after they force you to stick around. It's hard to even wrap my mind around how that could be a good business model. They have a TERRIBLE reputation. When I signed up for my new gym, I was like a battered wife. I asked them a thousand questions and was outrageously suspicious of the contracts and their membership terms. They knew I had come from Sweat. 

Beyond the horrible terms and policies, the gym itself is just okay. The classes in South Philly are good enough. There are days when the music doesn't work, the fan doesn't work, etc. My first ever group fitness class there was conducted without music - an hour of bootcamp in silence other than the grunts and pants of your sweaty neighbors. 

The locker rooms are abysmal. I would NEVER shower there. Yikes. There is mold on the showers at Arch Street. There's a handicapped chair in one of the stalls that is literally brown with mold. That must be lovely for the person who needs it to sit on. There are many days I'd hop on one, two, three treadmills at either location before I found one that functioned properly. They all have TVs but you never know which 2 fuzzy channels might come in. The wifi NEVER works so streaming spotify or pandora while you work out is not happening unless you have a monster data plan. 

And to make all of this more delightful, the atmosphere is really not conducive for women to enjoy a workout without being leered at. The weights are strategically placed between the group ex studio and the cardio so the guys who are "resting" on the bench between sets can take their pick of what to stare at before they return to slamming their weights on the ground.

As the saying goes, "Iron sharpens Iron", and the team at Black Diamond are an amazing bunch of highly skilled Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (BJJ) practitioners of all skill levels and belt ranks.  

I am very thankful to be a part of this team and train with such solid people.  Coach John 'Magoo' Villarruel and Coach Ryan Jennerjohn do a great job at fostering a family like environment.  The school is always kept clean and the mat space is incredible!  

If you have been interested in learning a martial art, getting in shape, getting in better shape, improving your flexibility, or learning how to defend yourself... drop in and check them out!

Tip: When looking for a BJJ gym, here are some helpful pointers to help you with your search. 
-Meet with the head coach/professor and feel them out. 
-Is the gym clean?  
-Is there adequate mat space or are people rolling into one another? 
-Ask the head coach/professor about their lineage.  Who did they get their black belt under and are they IBJJF certified?  
-Do the coaches compete or have they competed?  Did they win?

Hope this helps you in making the right decision for you!  Best of luck to you on your journey and hope to see you on the mats soon!

This is what you'll need if you really serious about changing your life style, living healthier and looking friggin good. But then again you yourself have to be motivated enough.

Anyway, they got treadmills -which I love, ellipticals -which I never use, and any other gym equipment to buffed up yourself -which I only use from time to time only.

They have promotion going on now to Oct 14,2010. $10 activation fee and $10 per month. That's for the white card I supposed. Go upgrade it! It's worth the money, IF you are commited. Only $20 per month. Not sure how is it with white card but with black card every drink is only $1. Plus you get to use tanning and massage unlimited. As well with bringing guest. No charge for the guest and it's unlimited as well. And you can use the black card in any Planet Fitness location.

The only down side about this place is people hanging out and chatting it up with their buddies. I can't believe when I saw even a personal trainer just stood there and start yapping it up with his client for over half hour. That's damn annoying. Especially when he start hang out around treadmills.

Go here if you want to work out. Just stay at home or go next door at pet store if you just want to hang out or talking.

I have been coming to Breathe SFS for 8 months now. I have joined their Spa & Fitness membership, which gives me access to their state of the art yet private fitness center and pool, steam sauna, as well as a massage or facial a month at a significantly affordable price. It's a well kept secret in the city, and most times people truly do not know what to expect. This is not a holistic fancy shmancy spa. It is a great fitness center, with nice amenities, and the added bonus of a full service spa on location. I alternate between massages with Dr. Tom or Chiane and facials with Emma each month, and treat myself to a manicure with Nath here and there. Nath is the best!! Being a member also guarantees you discounted prices on all ur services. It's a small amount I put away for myself each month that makes me feel spoiled, pampered and taken care of. You should give this place a chance and the benefit of the doubt. Ask tospeak to the manager, she is very sweet and helpful, i just can never remember her name..it's very foreign! But she is a sweetheart and will work closely with you and assist you in whatever you need.
Dirty. Don't look in the machine cup holders . My husband and I went only a handful of times due to the no response from us telling them there were no more cleaning towels.

I mostly use PSC for their Yoga classes, although I sometimes also use their treadmills, depending on the weather.
I attend Wednesday's Yoga class religiously, and I have to say, Meghan is awesome. Not only does she keep things tough and challenging every week, but she is also extremely personable and fun. 
Overall, the studio could be cleaner and I have submitted some feedback in the past... but the staff at the front desk is so sweet, I feel bad making a fuss. 
It's a great gym, and the pool is the cherry on top.

I can't tell you how amazing this place is. It's such a friendly atmosphere. Everyone is welcome. There are all ages and abilities. The teachers have been so sweet and patient with my grandkids, even when the kids are having an off day. It's brought out so much confidence and discipline in them.
I took my son there today. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. The routes were challenging. I strongly recommend!

Came here on a Sunday with a friend and took the 9:30 am class with Julie! When we walked in and we were immediately greeted by the front desk employees. They checked us in we waited in the waiting area where there was One Bars and fruit. The locker area is big and there are showers and big bathrooms to change in. When we went into the studio there was about 48 bikes and Julie and the staff were so helpful when setting up our bikes. While in class it is pretty dark and the music is loud and awesome! Julie really knows how to connect with the room and push you to your limit. I really enjoy the races throughout the class it is competitive and love the leader boards.  After class Julie stays and talks to you she also is willing to take sweaty pictures lol Overall this class was awesome and can't wait to come back

Complimentary:
One bars- first time having these and they are so good. They have 20 grams of protein! You can't beat that
Fruit- they had clementines and they were fresh

Came here for a celebratory dinner with my boss and it was a wonderful experience from beginning to the end! I highly recommend Michael as your waiter! The Who dat shrimp (wrapped in bacon and stuffed with crab meat) is easily the best appetizer I've ever had. Would come back just for the shrimp! Creamed spinach and Crawfish Mac and Cheese were phenomenal sides! The New York Strip was divine along with the Bernaise sauce which was a perfect compliment to the steak! 

Easily the best meal I've had in New Orleans! Some great wines also!

I have, over the past 5 years, had horrible experiences with this hospital ranging from extremely long telephone holds; to 6-hour waits in ER while suffering a saddle pulmonary embolism, to prescriptions for other patient's drugs ordered for me at my pharmacy; to a blame-shifting Patient's Relations Department ... the list goes on & on.  Now that Banner has taken over I had the foolish illusion that things have changed.  Based on my initial attempts to renew my relationship with that hospital earlier today, every indication is that they have not.  I mourn for the lost hope of quality academic medicine in Tucson.

Very nice staff and relatively clean for a YMCA but good grief it's crowded! If you want to see and be seen while you workout, this is your spot but my preference is to get a solid workout without all the gawking.
I go to the bootcamp at Wholistic Fitness and the instructors are challenging, prepared and give the class a great workout every time.

Every time I go to this YMCA in Quakertown.  The employees are rude especially the people at the front desk on Sunday morning.  Who does the hiring? and is being rude a must to get the job.  In addition, they are paid to talk the on their mobile phone the whole time.

Being from California I needed a good gym to get my workout in. Luckily for me, I was fortunate enough to be nearby this gym.

For starters this place is extremely clean and well organized. When you walk in you're greeted by a friendly staff and make you feel like you're like one of the regulars. 

Secondly the layout is perfectly planned. There's multiple benches and squat racks so no wait regardless of what body part you're on. However that is not the best part! 

In the rear back room, there's a half cage for the bumper plate cross fitters. Quite honestly this place has a little bit of everything, so whatever your reasons for coming in to the gym, there's a place for you.

Crunch Fitness Bloomingdale provides state of the art equipment, clean facility, great classes and positive energy. I love going to workout whether classes or in the gym. Vanessa Gonzalez is my most favorite instructor I've ever had at any gym. She makes working out fun and positive for my soul. I enjoy working out in the gym area. The energy of the members is amazing and motivating.

I have not been to other Y's because I love the staff and the variety of equipment available. The kids can come and swim while I workout or I can workout in the early AM before work. I wish some of the equipment was newer but it's ok!

I used to come here as a child and this is where I learned how to swim, where my brother had summer soccer camp, and where we wreaked havoc during summer pool time.
Recently my hubby and I decided to get a membership because he uses the Bike hub for work. We like this location because it is has good group exercise classes, like Zumba for me, and plenty of workout equipment for the hubby.
I find the staff polite and the place clean, which is important. The instructors are great and really get to know you. There is a lot of equipment in the gym and I enjoy the fact there is an indoor pool and lovely locker rooms. I will keep enjoying my membership with its lovely benefits and hopefully we continue to have a good experience!!
Equipment is brand new, staff is friendly and the gym is kept very clean throughout. Salespeople can be a little pushy, but overall it's a good fitness center.

Pretty much everything I'd want to say has already been said in previous reviews: It's spacious, solid equipment, with friendly staff and slightly annoying but perfectly manageable parking. It's all true, but that's not what got me to finally get myself a membership: It was the Zumba classes.

If you haven't heard of it before, Zumba is essentially a combination of aerobics, dancing, and modern dance music. It's cardio focused with a relaxed atmosphere, so you don't have to be skilled or particularly coordinated to participate, although I admit I like to showoff when I can :)

Kim teaches an excellent Monday night class, and Samantha does a Zumba-toning class for those who want to focus on muscle tone while still moving around. Jenny does a Friday night Zumba class which is especially intense. There are also plenty of other Zumba classes, but these are the only ones I have been able to attend thus far.

In summary, I can't find anything wrong with the Downtown YMCA: It has all of the qualities of a solid gym, and helped me find an activity that lets me laugh even as I'm ready to keel over in exhaustion. I couldn't ask for more.

Have been a member of The Sporting Club pretty much since coming to Philly about a year ago. I am a member here rather than somewhere else largely because they have basketball, something other health clubs lack. The other facilities are definitely excellent - it is very well maintained and staffed, cafe is great; they also have a running track. But for me the # 1 reason is basketball - a nice court, and can pretty much find a good run just about any time (though I play with a regular group of aging hoopsters). It is also very conveniently located for me, equidistant between work and home. Of course an extra plus (or minus, depending on how you look at it) is running into the Governor occasionally in his shorts.

This one is my "home" location. It's larger than some of the other PFs with some of the extra bells and whistles (massage chairs, hydromassage, red light therapy, tanning). Two floors with all your usual gym equipment. Some people have issues with this franchise as a whole, but I don't. It's cheap and I get a lot out of it. I personally don't mind the sun in my face while romping around the downstairs area. I'm a fan of natural light. I also love the 30 minute circuit when I'm pressed for time-- however, it sucks that some people don't follow the rules that those machines are dedicated to those who are there for the circuit (sooo, if you're one of those people, stop yo). Locker rooms are clean and the staff is nice. The one guy who was there on my first day was pretty chill and answered all my questions without any issues.

Probably one of the best gyms in the Philly area. Great setting, very clean facilities, and excellent instructors. They also have an acro yoga class on Wednesday and Friday nights. Walls go to ~60ft. Huge bouldering area on the 2nd floor and top rope, lead, and 2 speed climbing walls on the 1st floor.

Just finished my 30 day challenge. I am telling EVERYONE about this. It was hard, don't get me wrong, but worth it. The instructors are all friendly, knowledgeable and are there to help and answer questions anytime. My favorite part of this gym is I quickly recognized how the instructors got to know the clients by first name and on a personal level. This is a true family atmosphere. Also they took their time going over proper technique when doing all moves from squats to the rowing machine. I just joined up as a regular member after the challenge and looking forward to working with this team to continue on my fitness journey. All good things happening at Evoke!

I tried looking really hard, but I could not find a single squat rack / power cage, bench press, or any way to do barbell deadlifts in this gym. If you're looking to do strength training, this isn't the best gym for you. Plenty of cardio machines and the place was clean, though.

If there was an option for a "no star" ranking I would have used that. I have been a member of this gym for many years and have finally threw in the towel. Over the past few months, the new manager there has completely turned me off from ever going back to this gym. Do not sign up for their personal fitness classes! They will charge your account until you physically come in and handwrite that you want to stop paying then you have to wait 30 days. Apparently, the entire staff knows this information and neglects to tell you. I literally had to change my credit card account to get them to stop charging me. Do yourself a favor and join Chuze gym right next store. For two months of "training" at Desert Sports, you can join Chuze for an entire year and you do not have to deal with a sales staff.

If you're looking a workout and a way to relieve stress from the work day, flywheel is the place. I am sold on the concept and have been taking classes for over a month now. It is not your average spinning class. The studio is about 40 min away from me, but I'm so willing to make the trip in order to get my flywheel on! The staff and the instructors are amazing and kind which is an added plus!!

My car key got stolen out of the locker room and they stole my debit card out of my car right outside. The management can't do anything about it. Terrible place will NOT be coming back to this sketch place.

Great gym for both kids and adults alike!  Perfect for busy families, as the kids can take a Ninja Warrior or Parkor class, while parents take an RxFit class or do Open Gym. To have fun with your kids, the adults can do some Ninja Warrior or Parkor too. 

The staff is awesome! They are experienced and knowledgable. They live and breath what they teach, and are good role models. 

The Ninja Warrior gym has been carefully built to accommodate all skill levels. You will not get bored!  The combination of obstacles are endless.

Parkor City gets better and better with each visit. You can jump, climb, roll, hang, flip till your hearts content.  

Back in the RxFit gym, you will also find variety and challenge. An hour long workout class goes by quick because you keep changing stations while being carefully coached and challenged according to your individual fitness level. If you want to get strong from your core outward, you have found the place. Proper technique and form are instilled in all of the exercises. Classes are fun, upbeat, and challenging. A very supportive atmosphere for all fitness levels.

this is my home gym.  it has been since 2002 (i think) when it opened.

i have been to dozens of lafitnesses and their m.o. is to NEVER replace equipment.  well in the fall of 2012 this place got new equipment and a new gymnasium floor.  it feels feels brand new.

i would rather go a few miles out of my way to another newer facility most days but all that has changed.

way to go.  kudos.  right on.   solid!  word!

(ps - id love a steam room)

Great variety of equipment and plenty of it.  No waiting.   I do notice the staff suddenly got  a little friendlier.  One of the trainers, Avalina -- outstanding.  She was a great trainer for my wife and youngest daughter.  The other trainers look like they like their jobs, their clients and the place.  They look like they know a variety of workouts too.  Me?  I grunt through weights with my headphones on and periodically slam the punching bags.  I wish the hours were longer and the music was better, but that's what headphones are for.  Also, the snack bar doesn't seem to be open on the weekends when I really want a smoothie bad!  But I am there to workout, and always get a good one.   I think I've seen a new manager walking around?  Anyway, check it out.  Yelp always asks:  good for kids?  There is a play room for the little guys and, as I said, my teenage daughter got in great shape there.  Next time I go, I am going to ask a trainer for help.  I notice they never offer it on their own.  Is that a trainer code or something?  Or am I doing everything right?  Hey, no steroids.  I got this way naturally.  And I am a spectacle.  Trivia note:  then-candidate Obama worked out there on his tour through the Philadelphia area.

Ugh. what to say about this gym.

for one, it's a perfect location for me, and the price is comparable to other city gyms (it IS a lot better than the horrible walnut st la fitness/ballys)

This gym has some awesome equipment: tires, battle ropes, rings, etc. 

this gym is pretty lax about what you can do: chalk, deadlifts, snatches, whatever. this space is shared but it's open to do what you want to do. love it

however, only 1 squat rack. only 1!!! this is craziness. 

the towels kinda suck, and they run out frequently, i have to hoard towels to make sure i can take a post-workout shower

there's also just a lot of little things that annoy me, the overall cleanliness of locker rooms/bathrooms

the paper-towel dispensers are frequently jammed or empty

i guess right now i'm just annoyed about the sheer # of people (resolutioners) that take up all the machines while they dick around and play on their phone. and again, the squat rack. 

but overall, i think this gym can make a couple adjustments and really be an elite amazing and enjoyable place, the members and trainers are awesome!

ultimately, it feels like a very comcast customer service vibe: the price isn';t bad, and the product is alright, so if you don't like it, you are free to leave, sweat won't miss your business.
Great place to train and excellent coaching staff! Lots of community feel and welcoming members.

Beautiful studio...amazing workout with incredibly fast results!! Perfect for the busy mom who has a hard time finding time for herself! So happy I can get my Megaformer on while I'm visiting my cousin in St. Pete! Definitely check this place out!

I was here at 4:30am and the doors were closed.  I along with a small group of people waited at the door for someone to open it to no avail. Apparently the employee never came to relieve the employee before and they just decided to lock the doors. The only real perk of PF is that it's 24 hours-- if they can't open when they say they will then it's just better to join another gym.

Worked out at this OTF location when i was visiting Nashville for the weekend.  Nikko kicked my butt!  Compared to the three other studios I've been to, this one is brighter due to more windows than the studio configurations I've seen elsewhere.  It's roomy enough that you aren't bumping elbows on the rowers or in the weight room.  The location is great, just off Music Row on 17th Street.  It's only a mile or so from downtown, so you could easily walk or run from your downtown hotel.  It's super close to the Gulch if you want to hit up brunch and retail afterwards.  They have a cute backdrop near the reception desk if you're the selfie-talking type.  The only negative I'd note is the floors looked dusty and I could see hairs on them when i was doing floor work in the weight room.  I was there on a Sunday, so maybe they only have housekeeping on weekdays?  They have showers and lockable lockers for your stuff.  They also have a good selection of Nashville-specific OTF gear if you need some workout swag to reward yourself for getting your sweat on while on vacation.

Club St. Louis or The Club as it is referred to in the gay community, has been around for many many years. it offers men a place to work out, swim and socialize. the club has earned quite a reputation as a sleezy place, however those views and opinions are usually from someone that hasn't been to the club recently or hasn't been to the club at all.

I personally go to the club for the pool benefits on these hot summer days and nights. the club is open 24 hours for your convenience,  so there is always time to get away.  they have a huge workout room, a tanning bed, huge outdoor heated pool, private changing rooms, a huge hot tub, a dry heat sauna and a full sized steam room.

you must have a membership to use the facilities, they are available in single visit memberships or 90 day memberships, you must also purchase a locker or room each time you visit. your visit time is several hours. The club is a men only facility.
The best cycling in town!!! Highly recommend! Instructors are fun and SUPER motivating!!!

A pretty basic YMCA with a decent price. Biggest issue I have is the thin selection of weight lifting machines. There's enough to get a decent workout, and it's usually a small enough crowd that you won't be waiting around. The pool is okay, though currently a touch foggy. Oh, and the staff is plenty friendly.

Horrifying. Dirty. Small. Crowded. And to top it off when I signed up I was told if I had to move I could cancel my membership. Turns out the memberships are handled by ABC Financial who essentially are requiring I sign over my first born child before they will cancel my membership. I'm moving to New York. Its a gym membership. Some common sense and decency would help but no. They're ridiculous. DO NOT JOIN THIS GYM.

My husband and I came here for a much needed date night.  Even if my brother (Jimmy) hasn't been working here for years, I would still rate 5 stars.  We started off with the Turtle soup which was delicious!!!!  The Who Day shrimp are amazing and the sweet chili sauce goes really well with it!  My husband got the Rib eye (medium) and I got the petite Filet (rare).  Both were cooked perfectly and I asked for mild spice and it was absolutely delicious!  For sides we got asparagus, Freddie Mac n cheese and Mashed sweet potatoes!!  They were all sooo good!!  My husband ate all the sweet potatoes and left me 2 bites!!   my brother recommended the Walt Pinot Noir, so smooth and lite.  Complimented our steaks and sides great!  The Tiramisu is always delicious, so creamy and not overly powered by coffee flavor.  My husband got the Spumoni and he engulfed it!!  we made reservations for our anniversary before we even left!!   Totally worth it!!!!
Clean and awesome facility. The staff is amazingly friendly and helpful. Our daughter has been involved with this program for over 2 years and we have enjoyed everything. Can't recommend them enough.

Dirty. Overpriced. Incompetent staff and worse leadership. Don't waste your money. The staff is miserable and overpaid. The Y was great until about 10years ago. There you go YMCA! You wanted a review, there it is. You suck.

I would like to give 2 1/2 stars, because while I think the staff and the instructors for the classes are terrific, the business end of this gym sucks.  When I joined, they advertised "no enrollment fee" and a month to month membership. A month later, I got hit with an "annual fee" on my credit card.  So many people complain about this, they have a recording when you call to complain that says the charge is for an annual fee listed in the fine print in your contract. 

They also charge $30 a month to be able to go to the classes, but no one checks to see if you paid.  It is an honor system, so many people who haven't paid the extra fee get to go to the classes for nothing.

The so called "month to month" membership promotion is also a bait and switch.  To quit, you have to send a certified letter, which cost me $8 to send, and you have to give 60 days notice.  I thought this was fraudulent, and I complained to the local BBB.  I never got a response. They do have a large number of complaints against them for their sales practices.  I think someone should file a class action against them for fraudulent business practices. Buyer beware!  LA Fitness is so much more professional and much easier to work with.

We had been looking forward to dining here for months! First, the food and aesthetics of the restaurant were wonderful. It has an old school steak house feel, it reminded me of Crescent City Steaks, just more modern. It's so disheartening and disrespectful in 2019 to still deal with blatantly different service in a fine dining establishment due to race (it was the only difference between us and the other restaurant patrons). Especially in a city whose main economic draw is tourism. Either they don't realize you notice it or maybe they just don't give a f÷@%! I can only speak on the experience we had at this restaurant, if our treatment was due to something other than race we could not identify it. We dine out a lot, everything from holes in the wall to fine dining establishments and sadly this type of treatment is still very prevalent. We pride ourselves on being exceptional tippers 20% is our norm. I will tip a lackluster server no less than 15%. I tip this way because I understand they don't think "we" are tipping at all let alone tipping properly. Needless to say, we won't be back anytime soon. I will say we have dined at their sister restaurant Desi Vega and the service was amazing!

My first introduction to Weston was due to the DT60 promo on their website, which stands for don't think for 60 days. The package involves group training. I called in and spoke to Mike and he set me up for a visit which included an assessment, part of which was moderate exercise. Haha. Moderate my eye. lol. I think that Mike just wanted to provide a challenge, which is what a great trainer does. He was very welcoming, engaging and encouraging. 

After the assessment I began my onboarding with group trainer Scott. He was very though and challenging. He did an excellent job explaining the basics and showing me how to challenge myself. He made me feel comfortable enough to go outside of my comfort zone. I love weight traing but for some reason I have not been able to get enthused about it for almost a year. The stuff we do in group training is varied (TRX, kettlebells, planks, lunges, and other stuff) thus pushing my body in different ways. 

Mentally it was very difficult to get myself to the class, but wow! After having my butt kicked for 40 minutes, sweating profusely I felt AMAZING!  The next day I was like "I feel awesome today" I had extra pep in my step. I could feel a difference immediately. After a couple of days I crave the class, but still, on the day of the class, I have to keep myself from wanting to quit, because it is tough. But I really really really love it.  Even in a group Scott is able to challenge us individually, correct our form and make sure that we are safe. 

Overall I am very pleased with Weston. I really hate gyms, but Weston is very comfortable. There are people of all ages shapes and sizes, no men looking at you like a pork chop. All of the staff is pleasant, including the wonderful people at reception, Kara and Adam.  They all seem to really enjoy it there. Also it is amazing that they remember member's names.   And they really seem to care about your progress, how you are doing, how are you felling, how did you feel after the last class. I also enjoy that they are up on technology, you can scan in and sign up for classes using their app.  They are very responsive via email as well. Also they send you nutrition tips from time to time. 

I committed myself for two months. I just completed one month. Two and done I said.  I think that I may have a new addiction. Darn it!!!

I had a black card membership that I opted to downgrade earlier this year. Every time I've gone in since, I have not had an issue, other than being mostly ignored by the bored-looking staff too busy checking their cell phones to notice anything else. Tonight, my card didn't work, so the girl asked for my black card (still on my key ring). For some reason that no one could explain (or attempted to find out), the black card worked. However, I was told I owed back membership fees for March and May. Now, my account was up to date, and payments are regularly charged. Why would this month be paid, but not March or May? Makes no sense. They wouldn't let me in without paying up. No investigation into the discrepancy or weirdness of it all. So, I opted to pay the bogus fees ($20+) and just cancel the membership. Let's just say this isn't the first time I've encountered truly bad customer service at this gym, and this was my last straw. When I inquired about my credit card remaining on file and said I was uncomfortable about the whole situation, the manager threatened to call police. Out of no where. And it had been a civil discussion up to that point. I'm guessing that she was tired of me asking questions to which her only response was "I don't know." I was truly shocked, and just said "Excuse me?" She responded by laughing and calling me an offensive name, which was apparently funny to the rest of the immature staff at the counter too. On top of this appalling unprofessionalism, the gym has been a wreck for months as "construction" is going on. Men utilizing the gym are forced to use a port-o-potty outside ... in December. This a painfully slow project with very little actually getting done. In the meantime, customers are breathing in dust as they attempt to work out. Tonight, the tables near the entrance appeared to be the staging area for a pizza party, based on the mess. Apparently, they think customers want to see the staff's half-eaten dinner lying around. Not that it matters. The staff turns over so quickly here that you rarely see the same people month to month.

I initially decided to join OTF because I didn't want to go back to the indoor/outdoor Bootcamp that whipped me into shape years earlier...and at the time so many other Yelpers were checking into OTF all over Tampa Bay. I really like group Bootcamps because I need someone to tell me what to do...and kinda kick my butt. I also need variety. Doing the same thing bores me, so muscle confusion workouts are ideal for me. At first the OTF concept seemed really cool, but the thrill was gone for me within a couple of months. 

Some items I liked:

1. Most of the trainers were fun.

2. The music was motivating.

3. It was nice to be able to see your monitored workout stats and how many calories you burned after every workout.

4. HIIT style workouts...the strength sessions were different every day.

5. Everything is indoors.


Here's a few reasons why I'm not a fan:

1. At first it was thrilling to get up to a certain rpm and changing running speed, but I got bored with the treadmill and row machines for cardio.

2. I sometimes couldn't hear the trainers over the loud music.

3. You are forced to buy a strap for over 20 bucks and wear a monitor during the workout. This is very gimmicky and after a month they changed the type of strap you needed and forced everyone to buy new straps. 

3. I had an autoimmune medical issue that was new to me that was draining all of my energy. It made my joints hurt and I was quite weak after doing anything physical, so I decide to change my membership from month to month to a certain number of workouts that I paid for up front because I didn't know when I'd be well enough to work out again. I dealt with this autoimmune issue for almost a year before I got it under control. When I felt better and decided to go back I realized I could no longer log into the app and schedule a workout. Apparently when you buy workouts up front you only have a year to use them even though you've paid for them. I didn't think this was s good policy. I messaged this facility via the app and never heard back. Zero stars for the contract. Not happy that I lost 10 workouts, but I knew I wouldn't have continued with OTF afterward.

Best hot yoga studio in the area! All of the instructors are amazing - Sara will push you to work hard and accomplish stuff you never thought possible. Michelle is so bubbly and friendly, I always leave her class feeling happy and energized. Thom is SO FUN, his jokes and awesome music make the 90 minutes fly by. Plus there's a whole assortment of classes beyond your Original Recipe bikram - there's flow, bikram plus yin, rocket - lots of variety to keep you from getting bored. Their 6-month membership is super affordable, the place is clean, parking is easy... Literally no bad stuff to say about this place. 10/10, A+++, would recommend.
I always like going to this little gym with its rag tag equipment and south-side feel. It's the only gym that still has an old school ambiance and less distractions than the others. Game on!
Will who answers the phone behind the main desk clearly was never trained on customer service. He is extremely rude. Crunch should look into training him on how to talk to customers.

I've been going here for a year and a half and I love it!!! Front desk is super friendly and have a variety of equipment so I get to change my workouts based on what I want to do such as cardio, lifting, etc. Only downside is that they don't have a variety of exercise bands compared to the other Crunch facilities I go to like the one in Tampa Palms. BUT One of the front desk associates let me borrow her own personal one which I really appreciated 

It tends to get reaalllllly busy during certain times mostly the evening and early morning. To the point where I actually have to schedule what workouts I do based on what time I go. but I say afternoon is the best if you have gymtimidation and want to workout in peace.

Hand down, the best gym I've found in Tampa. They have the most unique equipment and you won't that in the larger commercial gyms. The only other gym I've been to that has just as good equipment is at USF but you can't really compare a gym to a division 1 college gym. I will say this, the only advantage the USF gym has is that they have more equipment; and a tibia machine which I didn't know existed until I worked out there. Not to mention it's open 24/7 and also has a boxing ring with trainers. My only complaint is that they don't have sanitation stations. Other than that, it's perfect.

Great service! This was my first time coming here and I had a great experience. I found this place through a Groupon that I bought. The lady I had was named Demi and she was very nice. I enjoyed our conversation while she stretched me. She did an amazing job and I would definitely come back and also recommend to my friends. I made another appointment for next week

A great facility and one of the best around for the money. There's a nice kids center with lots to do, subway, meeting rooms/party rooms. The fitness center is newly updated and there's also a downstairs weight room. The basketball and volleyball quarts are newly redone as well. Very convenient location off of 170 and right by shawpark and Clayton high school.

I thought I would give this gym a try what a joke the sales manager is absolutely fake behind the smile carring attitude deep down inside all she cares about is dollars sign's and making her sales quota for the month . Let see stated 200 to 400 a month for a personal trainer fine yet towards the end she added on the following ...

1. Nutrtionist , umm I use to be a licensed vocational nurse I know how to eat healthy and what I should eat.

2. Chriopractor  umm I don't want 

3. Massage therapist...  umm I don't want ..


All I wanted was a personal trainer 3x a week plus access to join the gym .

4. Because I am concided a fat fucking ass by their standared body annalusis which is a joke they want to charge me 420.000 a month lets see half of what would be considered rent which adds up to 13,000 just to loose 30 pounds . Shit will I get a husband too at that amount plus a vacation? Needless to say I will certainly never join this gym can you say gid dam biggest rip off ever !!@

I've been coming to this gym for about 3 weeks now and I love it so much! The community vibe is very welcoming. Both the staff and other members have bothered to learn my name and get to know me and I have never felt like I've belonged so quickly at any other gym. I love taking kickboxing classes with Josh and Xavier and Brandon at the front desk is always a delight! This place also has so much to offer, I wish I had the time to utilize it all!

overall, good dining, though ponchartrain's mac and cheese was tastier, more robust and didn't stick to the plate, considering the hefty price tag.

regrettably, the two star rating goes to the abysmal performance by waiter "aaron" - i've never been made to feel more out of place than i was here and hope to never experience that sentiment again, regardless of aparent scale or dress code.

the guy seemed out of touch, stoic and took our order without ever returning...oh yes, he did eventually remember to come back for the bill :(

nice work aaron, we will never return and will never recommend this restaurant thanks to you!

Became a member after free class.  Started unlimited but had to switch a month later to elite (8 per mos) due to class schedule. It was a smooth process no issues.  I have called a couple times to get some help with registering myself to the corresponding app & with booking classes and have had great customer service. They were friendly & personable over the phone which is a rarity with most gyms once you've signed up.  Even though it's franchise you feel like everyone gets to know you. On to the workout--I think what keeps me hooked is the variety in the workout.  It is absolutely challenging so you do have to be willing push yourself. Just as you're wondering whether you'll survive the next round, it's time to switch it up to another activity.  It keeps it interesting and I can see & feel the results.  Trainers are motivating & friendly.  The gym itself always looks clean, modern.
Great gym!  So glad I gave them a try.  Friendly and helpful owners and trainers.  Train at your own pace and on any machines you want.  Can also tan included in membership.

I had a terrible experience with the customer service side of Club Fitness.  I was in St. Louis for 2 months this summer for my job, and I joined for those dates.  The gym stipulates when you join that should you like to cancel, you need to do so online and 30 days before you are charged again.  I knew when I would be leaving, so I put this in my calendar, and made sure to cancel on time.  I followed through with this and double-checked on my last day by going up to the counter, asking them to make sure my account was cancelled, and they said everything looked good.  

I got back to my home in Illinois, and have been charged every month since leaving.  I called customer service, completely confused as to why I have been charged.  They claim that they have no recollection of my cancellation online, and therefore will not reimburse me.  Additionally, I asked right then and there to cancel my account immediately, they said, "You must cancel online only, we can't do it over the phone."  Which probably means I will be charged again, since I need to give 30 days notice.  UNBELIEVABLE.  The confirmation email from my original cancellation no longer exists (why would it, because the gym confirmed it with me on my last day at the gym) so I have no proof that I cancelled.  It is their word against mine.  

I had a nice time working out at the gym, but I have NEVER had to deal with such bad customer service in my life.  I am out a lot of money, and it was never my fault.  I say to you: stay away!!!!

PROS:
1. Cute names for the classes; they rotate monthly or so, so if you can only go Thursday at 4:30, you will not be stuck doing the same class every time. They work different areas of the body, and some are total body, with varying degrees of cardio workouts.

2. Lots of fun props, like the bands that hang from the ceilings

3. LOVE the cheer portions. As a dancer, I find these super fun. As a girl who never made the school cheerleading team, I get to live out the dream. Like someone else said, don't let it intimidate you--you're not tossing other LIthers around or anything. It just uses cheer positions and exercises to strengthen your body.

4. The food is actually really tasty. It's expensive, and there's no way I could both Lithe and afford the food all the time, but as a treat, it's great. Lithe Latte, pizza bites, cookie dough truffles (OMG), and carrot cake oatmeal are all amazing--it's all health foody, but those taste like the real thing. 

5. Four locations (new one just opened on the Main Line) and tons of class times--you can always find one to fit your schedule

6. Showers!! Absolutely essential if you're trying to go to Happy Hour afterwards.

Now, on that note...

CONS: 

1. Lots of classes, but no guarantee you'll get in. It's so popular now that even when you book weeks in advance, you can still get put on the waitlist and never actually be put in the class. Sometimes I get out of work early, but I typically can't make a last-minute decision to go Lithe because there will be 8 people ahead of my on the waitlist. 

2. The music can be annoying sometimes. Some of it is pumped up gym type music with Madonna/Britney/etc or 70s mixes. Those I don't mind. Other times it's weird trendy jungle/lounge/new agey stuff that doesn't make me want to work out. Often, the music is just background, and you're not doing the exercises to the beat, which I don't like (again, former dancer--we stay on the beat.) The exception is the cardio sections, in which you do actually have to stay on beat.

3. The vibe can be a little hoity-toity. I've never seen so much Lululemon in one room, with the exception of the actual Lululemon store (it's a close call, though.) One you get talking to some of the other students, they're nice, but the beginning of classes are usually people just sitting there in silence and not really yakking it up, unless they came with friends. It doesn't bother me much, but I can see how it would turn some people off.

4. Price--it's expensive. But hey, if it keeps me exercising and interested, I can deal with that.

5. Many of the instructors do not correct form individually, which does bother me a lot. I'm paying a lot to go to the classes, so I feel like I should be getting individual corrections/praises, but that's what's really lacking in most of the classes. Bari is the one instructor I've had so far who does do person corrections/praising, which is why she's my favorite.

I just did a comparison on the Purre Barre Philly Yelp page, so you can look there for my opinion of PB versus LIthe. Overall, though, PB wins out slightly for me because I feel like I get a deeper, different kind of workout than I do at Lithe or anywhere else. Lithe is a great workout, and you can always made modifications to make it more difficult if needed, but PB just works muscles in an entirely different way. That said, I do each at least once a week and likely will continue to do so for a long time. 

So if you're thinking of trying Lithe, do it! Just the variety of classes alone is a good enough reason to go. The cheer aspect is what makes it different from any other workout and what keeps me going back.

I need to start this by say: I hope this gym doesn't go out of business. I truly hope they succeed. A gym is a place people go to get healthy, push themselves, free their mind, and types of positive outcomes. I'm always going to be rooting for the owners here!!

Alright guys, grab a drink, sit back, and get ready. It's about to get real, real quick:

I had a very unfortunate experience here. I'm only in the neighborhood for a week, so I was hoping there would be a free trial, or a cheaper deal than 20 dollars a session. I just wanted to keep my routine while I'm here for work. But time after time it felt like they were doing whatever it takes to not give me something that worked out for both of us.

At one point I even said "please" a couple of times. I thought, you know what, when it comes to going to the gym I'll never be ashamed to use the word please - no matter how desperate it may make me look.

It didn't work.

Okay - I paid the 20 bucks for the one night session, because I really needed it. But the next day I found out, if you go on the website, you can fill out a form and get a 7-day pass. What the heck? I was confused... was my 20 minute speech not clear enough for them to mention this? Were my cries not enough to be told about this option? I spoke to three different people that night - neither said a word.

Oh well, I filled out the form, and jogged my way back the next day. Again, it didn't work out... the form is only for the local residents, they said, and I live in NYC. But nowhere I saw that on the website (NO, I MEAN IT, Here is the link and if you find anything about the requirement of being a resident, I will personally venmo you $20 (http://go.cityfitnessphilly.com/7-day-trial)). Someone even called me after I submitted the form, and he said he'll make sure I get in. But it didn't work.

At this point I know they remembered me :D because as soon as I walked in I could tell they were annoyed  -- judging by them avoiding eye contact, and avoiding conversation with their "sorry bro - wish I could help bro - I understand bro"

Listen, if the management is reading this: we both know you're not making your money off the $20 one time sessions. It's the monthly/yearly plans that makeup your revenue. It's the people who pay the huge amount on January 1st, and never show up. But you just lost a customer who's enthusiastic about going to the gym and working out. 

You had nothing to lose from letting me work out there for a day or two. I'm not even asking for free. But 60 dollars for 3 days?! 

I mean it when I say I want you to be a successful gym. But I showed up twice, talked to 4 people total, said "please" wayyyyyy more than anyone should for going to the gym...

And I'm sorry... your $6.50 'protein shakes' were not that great to make me wanna come back.

I just wish we could be friends.

dirty dirty and cheap. The ladies locker room gets cleaned when the woman who cleans the entire club works from 5-9 M-F and 11-5 on Sundays. That means if you go in the morning there is hair in the drains, on the shower walls, soap scum under the sinks, etc. The pool is at times cloudy and the bottom is slippery with scum. The staff is sullen and uninspired. women walk in the sauna and wet areas of locker room with street shoes on and no rules prohibit that.
i only go bc there is no other pool nearby.

I am rating this based on the swimming pool and programs for children/toddlers.  The teachers were/are lovely but the facilities (locker rooms & pool) are just Meh.

Meanwhile, I am thankful that my (then) 3 year old (now 5) had 2 great sessions of lessons here for a decent ( a bit high but not horrible) price.  She loved it here!

I love this place! It's not very big but it's a great ways to get some really fun exercise. They have discounts on admission all the time and it makes going often a lot easier on the wallet. 

The facility itself is always very clean. The culture of the gym is always friendly and welcoming. Everyone that comes is always willing to help each other figure out different/new routes and cheering each other on. The staff is always super friendly too. If you ever need any assistance, they are always eager to help you out!

The bathrooms are always clean. There is a shower available if you need to clean up a little after you work up a sweat. 

In the lobby area, there are cubbies where you can store your things. There is not any security in place at these cubbies. They are right in front of the front desk and I have never had any issues regarding security of my things here.
Got the job done! Ample parking. Big spread of machines. HOT showers. They even have a scale unlike some of the PF gyms.

Cedar Street makes powerlifting accessible to anyone. I found Cedar Street through a Squat School event at the end of last month. It is not super close to where I live but I definitely wanted to drop in to see  what this place was about. The event was fun but the real reason I became interested in training here was how knowledgeable Nick was about everything. I go to a lot of group fitness classes and I have been to a lot of gyms and my main thing is learning how to do something the correct way! At Cedar Street, you can come in with ANY level of knowledge (mine was zero) and leave knowing a lot more and having a goal to work towards.

I originally signed up here because it is right around the corner from my office. It is brand new - in a former ACME market. It is only $10 per month with no contract - that was enough for me to sign up without even seeing it. Ive been going for over a year now and stepped up to the "black card" membership which is only $19 a month - includes unlimited free guests. unlimited free tanning, half priced drinks. The free weight area could be bigger - there is def an over abundance of cardio machines - bikes, ellipticals, treadmills, ect. The majority of the people that go are either seniors or high school kids...no meat heads really.

This place is awesome!  Far from being physically fit, I want to find something that was tough and challenging and most of all fun.  The instructors Brooke, Dave, Brian, Anna, Josh and Kelsey are so helpful and encouraging.  They know your name when you walk in and it makes the environment comfortable and inviting.  I have always felt comfortable here unlike in other places. The place is clean.  I have met so many nice people here during partner drills.  The workouts are killers but well worth it, I feel strong in body and spirit and what a stress reliever to be able to punch and kick something. Love it #cantstopwontstop

I am a  life member of LAF as LAF bought out Bally's with which I had a lifelong membership agreement.  I started a personal training contract in June 2014 that was to provide sessions until late June 2015. LAF Walnut is ceasing operations on May 29, but the LAF "customer services manager" at corporate headquarters told me that I still need to make payments including one due days before it closes, despite the fact that LAF won't be able to hold up its part of the bargain to provide sessions at Walnut. LAF won't refund the money paid for sessions it cannot deliver either.  Apparently, LAF's "policy" to not give refunds outmatches its contractual obligations. 

My advice to anyone interested in signing any agreement with LAF is to read the fine print carefully and reconsider. For those of you, like me, who are finding themselves in a jam, perhaps calling the Bureau of Consumer Affairs will work.

TDY in Nashville and needed a place to lift for the week. Gave me a great military discount for the week ($25...I've had to pay that for a single workout other places before). Clean facility and friendly staff.  Large enough to do what you need to do with plenty of space for the big lifts (5 squat racks).  Highly recommend if you live In the area or find yourself here briefly like myself.

I dropped in for a whole week. Great mix of highly skilled athletes and beginners. The coaches were experts and were hospitable. The gym was clean, spacious, organized, and had all of the peripheral-but-not-necessary equipment you want in a gym.

Run! Run! Where to begin... Nothing to clean equipment after use, if you try to end your membership it's a "Where's Waldo Adventure" where to find the forms hmmm.. don't trust paperwork being dropped off with the staff, because it'll magically disappear, the training session packages are a scam. 

Bottom line if you like a dirty gym with shady staff and a never ending contract, then come here!

For the last few years I thought it was worth paying the extra to go the gym at the J -- supporting a good cause, and all... But the center TV in the workout area is ALWAYS on FOX News. I asked to please change it to something non-political.  Or put MSNBC on another one of the side TV's to give some balance. Asked staff several times and was told that FOX News had to be on all the time because it's what "the people'' want.  "What people?", says I.  I'm a person too, aren't I?  "Sorry.  Can't change it." Who says so?  The staff? The management? The members? Who is it who insists that they need to have Glenn Beck screaming at me while I try to work out?  Do they think my blood pressure isn't high enough already?  After 2 e-mails went unanswered and staff refused to change the channel -- repeatedly -- I quit and found a happy new workout home at Bally's for half the price, and a wide range of TV stations to choose from.  So much for my fantasies of a progressive, a-political, welcoming Jewish environment. Yes, they might have good day care -- can't comment on that.  But be damn sure they aren't raising your toddler to be a little fascist. The management is apparently 3 steps to the right of Genghis Khan.
PS -- I'd be interested to know if FOX News is still the "must watch" TV in the gym. After quitting, I was assured by the management they would change, but don't know if that's really happened or not.

I usually work out for 60-90 minutes, so I didn't have high expectations on being blown away by a 45 minute spin...BUT, it was really great.  The instructor started right on time and we went all out for the whole 45 -- I was exhausted.  Also, the screen that occasionally flashes your power position was more motivating than I expected -- it really pushes you to go hard and not let up!  I would like to continue going once or twice a week, but the cost has to come down, or they should offer 50 or 60 minute classes.

OK, so I always wanted to try rock climbing, and I finally worked up the courage to go to R&R, the first Time I went by myself checked the placed out since I needed a partner, I could not do any climbing. So I made some call and talked an old friend to accompany me to this place..... What an adrenaline RUSH!!! can't wait to do it again anybody looking for someone to partner with on a regular basis let me know. 
I feel better going to this gym than LA fitness or any other of such nature, because we find all types of people there from really children to elderly, everybody just enjoys this place. 
it is just the perfect place to train for the real deal... I can't wait to go to their next expedition...

Solid gym, if you're looking for something fancy this isn't it. If you want everything you NEED to be in shape theyve got it! Downstairs is mainly weight training, upstairs they have the cardio machines, bike classes and a room for additional classes. 

Beware peak time is 4 to 8pm. Legit becomes a zoo. 

Would be a 4 star if.. their water fountains didn't put out water at a snail's pace. (sorry I like water at my gym...who would've thought)

Worked out here once while traveling, using my Black Card membership. It is one of the nicest Planet Fitness locations I've been to. Large facility, lots of equipment. Best of all, this location has the Hammer Strength machines for chest and back exercises. Not many PF locations I've been to have these, and I've been spoiled on then at my home location. Had a great workout here. Staff was friendly and courteous, and I saw employees walking around cleaning machines during my time there, kudos.

I came here to try out the booty jam fitness with Ramona, and it's the most fun I've had in a group class recently! Ramon is not just a great dancer, but a motivator. Her energy, choreography and music choices are SICK! As a Korean K-Pop dancer I can follow routines and steps well but I lack the raw energy and that swerve needed to do all the bouncing, gyrsting, and vibrating! In just first class, I feel like my moves got better and I got a killer workout! Definitely highly recommend anyone who loves to dance! Ramona's moves look hard but it's fairly easy to follow-- how much you sweat will depend on your own sass and attitude

WOW. This workout is not for the faint of heart. Even for any seasoned workout junkie, this work out will make you SORE and will get you to have a solid core. You will get a full body workout during the 50 minutes that will leave your glutes, thighs, abs and arms sore. But the good kind of sore. Studio is brand new and therefore BEAUTIFUL, it has all the amenities one would expect from a boutique studio in this price range (towels, filtered water fountain, storage, dry shampoo, deodorant, tampons, body spray, etc.). The staff does an amazing job at pushing you to your limit without over stepping their boundaries. Solidcore gets you hooked with the first class, and leaves you wanting more right away.

Recently joined after my wife had done the same.  We switched from "The Judgement-Free Zone". Glad I did, this gym is clean, well-run staff is friendly and helpful.  The smoothie bar is great too, I treat myself once in a while. I live about 15 minutes away, that's the only downside I've found.  Fortunately, that'll be changing when the Levittown location opens in a few months, it's 5 minutes from home.  Keep up the good work!

Haven't dined here. That was the problem. Called 6 times over a 30 minute period of when they first opened. On the 3rd call I was sent straight to voicemail. We really wanted a nice steak dinner before leaving NOLA and was disappointed when this establishment couldn't even pick up the phone.
