So I humored him, then he asks me for medical history and about my goals and their monthly plans. Again, reinforced just wanted a day pass, that he said was a "ridiculous $20" (his exact words) and explained I did not have the time today for the full red carpet tour. Once he tried to get me to sit down again, I bounced out to PEAC for the $10 day pass. Peace Urge, totally would have possibly become a member if the mngr didn't try to stage a show & over complicate it.

I started Jiujisu in August of 2007 after becoming bored with lifting weights in a gym. NJMA was the first place I went into and I continue to train brazillian jiujitsu there now. It's honestly one of the greatest and most rewarding decisions I've made in my life - not only are my workouts inside the gym way more intense than anything I've done but my health outside the gym improved drastically to be able to go back everyday and train more. Even if you're not looking for it you truely start to adopt a new healthier lifestyle with martial arts.
NJMA is a great place for anyone to come in and learn how to defend themselves on the street or for a jiujitsu/MMA competitor looking to take their game to the next level. Not only are the students at the school world class but the coaching you recieve from Marco is by far the best in South Jersey. This should definitely be one of your first stops when shopping around for a jiujitsu or mixed martial arts school.

Great gym but I can't get over the fact that they play their music SO LOUD. 99% of gym goers wear headphones and I can't even hear my music through my headphones because it's so loud. I saw someone else reviewed negatively with this problem and they haven't changed anything about it.

These people are THIEVES! I moved from Miami to Harbour Island and toured the facility with a representative named, Sue. I mentioned that everything looked quite outdated and old, she PROMISED they were starting a massive remodel that very next week in the Mens Locker Room with brand new steam rooms and saunas. Reluctantly, I signed on. On my first visit, the group fitness studio had no air conditioning and the mens locker room was filled with bandaids in the lockers, hair balls and cracked tiles in the steam room, moldy shower curtains and dust filled air vents.

I emailed Sue and requested my membership cancellation considering the club was not how she described nor were the renovations actually underway (or actually happening). They charged me 3 months minimum to cancel my membership and then charged me a 4th. month on top of that! I drove the club to speak with the General Manager, Scott who refused to see me because he was "in a meeting" even though I said I would wait. Sue was no help and literally put me on the phone in her office with a corporate representative and she walked out. I have now been charged over $700 for stepping foot in that place TWICE!

They are liars, deceivers, thieves and manage a glorified YMCA. The club's conditions are horrible, it's dirty, unkept and outdated. STAY AWAY - You are way better off hiring a personal trainer to come to your house for the amount of money they will scam you from and the condescending treatment they will give you.

I'm a member at one of this gym's competitors, and was interested in switching because it's 2 miles closer to my home. I went to Amped last week to take a look at the facility and decide if I want to switch. I got there just before 10 p.m. and was refused the standard service of getting a tour. Apparently I was there after hours. But people were working out and 4 staff members were there. Four of them. One refused to help me, the other 3 just sat there, redefining uselessness. The one who refused to help me then said he had been there since 8:00 in the morning. As if I'm supposed to care. All I wanted to do is look at the equipment for less than 5 minutes. He asked me if I could come back another day. Genius, do you really think I will ever go back after you and your incompetent coworkers made me feel like I'm not welcome? Is my money not good enough for Amped? I'm sticking with the gym I belong to. By the way, Amped, I've seen the staff at my gym give tours to potential members after midnight. Your staff should all be fired. They are an embarrassment to your company. This gym is a disgrace.
Dustin and CoreFitness are fantastic. The workout varies every day so I'm never bored or complacent. It's a great way to stay on track with goals while pushing myself harder than I would alone.

I love this gym! The new staff is making great progress to organize and create a clean environment. I give this gym 5 stars because I know they will make an initiative to REPLACE the women's floor mats as a Christmas Gift or Something!!! Then all of the woman from there on out can dry off before entering the locker rooms. The smell is something I'm putting out there. Also showers. Lol get a new night cleaner and pay that person how much you would expect to get paid for doing that job BOSS! Some of Boise avoids minimum wage and cost of living gap and wonder why their cleanliness suffers. If it isn't clean you're losing people!! Take pride in your communities hard working money because without us you would not be Axiom.

Worst gym ever. Genrral manager is extremely rude and condescending not sure if it is  because I'm a woman or because I'm white .   He did not seem very intelligent as he was not able to answer even the simplest of questions.

 The workout rooms wgere the hold classes run to extremes, when it's freezing out they are freezing when it's hot out they are extremely hot and humid.  A woman once almost passed out and actually had to stop class and we had to actually get her water and a cold compress.

Additionally when you're in the sauna the cleaning crew comes in and they start spraying chemicals to clean the inside of the sauna which is extremely unhealthy.

For a  chain as large is this they should get their act together or sell the business to someone actually who cares about their clients.

Needless to say in all good consciousness I cannot recommend this gym to anybody who cares about their health.

As far as hiring a trainer their  I wouldn't bother unless you get Gwendolyn she seem to be the only one who shows you the correct way of doing things and that actually cares if you succeed.  Other than that it seems like you'd be wasting your money.

Dorota absolutely the worst yoga instructor ever.   Does not know difference between left and right, asked you to do things that are anatomically impossible.   Does not even know the name of simple basic poses, takes breaks and gives multiple breaks in a 45 minute class.  They must be hard up in getting qualified instructors.  Should actually cancel class instead of risking getting someone hurt.

Recently tried a spin class here and I was blown away by the studio amenities and service.  They guide you through the entire sign in process all the way to getting your bike set up for newbies like me! They provide free bikes, free lockers, free towels, and have a water machine! 

The studio is very well kept with a large stadium style bike room.  My instructor was great! He was so encouraging the whole time, but made sure to push us to our limits.  Song selection wasn't my style it was mostly remixes but hey it got me moving! Throughout the class you can see where you rank in the class (if you choose). That's a nice way to kick it into gear! Who doesn't like a little bit of competition? 

A great go to if you wanna squeeze in a good and hard workout! I would love to take another class here very soon!

I love OTF.  The workouts are awesome and the coaches are fantastic!  Working out with the heart monitor to get into the different zones has been very helpful to push myself to do things that I thought I could never accomplish.  I would recommend it to anyone.

Wow after being a member for 5 years i have been totally insulted by club fitness and their corporate office. Talk about a bait and switch. I am certain that I am not the only member that feels this way after receiving a letter in the mail. After speaking with Chelsea who said he would not give me her last name. I ask to speak to her manager and I she said yes that is not going to happen and sent me to another voicemail. Wow! I will not be recommending anyone to club fitness

While small, Vertical Ventures really packs in a lot of climbing into the space.  My wife and I took the introductory safety course which was $50 for the two of us and included instruction and all the gear we needed, as well as a two week membership.  Gear rental is very reasonably priced (about $20 for two people each visit), but it looks like if you plan on visiting more than a few times you should go ahead and buy the equipment.  They had a reasonable beginner's package that was very tempting.

Even though you can see that the staff have to give these courses out several times a day, they managed to stay very enthusiastic while presenting instructions and would even wander around yelling encouragement to us after we were left to our own devices.  The whole process from walking in to climbing walls was quick and enjoyable.  

You will definitely need a partner to get the most of our your experience here if you're a first time climber, and you can only expect about an hour or two unless you do a lot of forearm work already.  Your spirit will be willing, but your fingers will fail you!  And if you're a weenie like me, you can expect some odd arm cramps the next day when you try to pick up something.  But despite all my whining, I had a great time and will be going back within my two week membership period, fingers allowing!

It's in a good location, clean, new equipment, and nice flat screen tvs to keep you entertained on the cardio days. 
However...

I don't think anyone would disagree with me when I say it is one of the most crowded gyms I have ever been a member of in my life. After work hours like 4-9, crowds are expected but I work late so I go at around 10pm and the place is crawling with people still. The parking lot has no fewer than 100 cars in it any hour. 

Forget the free weights room, your best bet is to fight for a spot on the machines.

As I'm a cheap sadist who enjoys working out within an inch of my life I was attracted to Fit Body Boot Camp's Groupon deal of 3 weeks unlimited workouts and nutritional counseling. I had been doing High Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) at home, but lacked the large ropes, jump boxes, TRX straps, full weight and kettlebell sets, and a trainer yelling, "C'mon, get those legs moving, don't slow down!" to counteract the screaming voices of despair in my head.

My boot camp experience began with an orientation with Rocio, who showed me the facility and made me sign the usual waiver. As this place just opened up not too long ago, the space was clean and the equipment in good shape. Rocio even mentioned that we should wear only clean, non-street shoes while working out, to keep the mats clean. A container of wipes was available to achieve this purpose. My orientation was over in less than 5 minutes, as it was established that I was active, had done HIIT previously, and had no idea what the true meaning of "pain" was.

I returned a few days later for a noon boot camp session with Joe. There were only a handful of other unknowing hopefuls.  Each 30-minute workout starts with some warm up, consisting of jogging, arm circles, etc., while the trainer takes us through the 5 or 6 stations. Each station is 30 seconds of 2 exercises done 3 times through, without a break. The exercises usually comprise of something on the TRX pulleys, the ropes, floor exercises with weights or slides, ending with some abs/plank work on the floor.  We have only 5 seconds to transition between each station, not including the time we are on the ground, writhing in pain. 

The exercises change daily and are designed by a sadist (aka. Fit Body Boot Camp franchise), which takes no care in arranging the exercises.  I've had circuits which went from ropes to push ups to renegade rows or arm work without little rest in between.  

Trainers give variations on some moves, to increase or decrease level of difficulty, or for those with certain issues (ie. Sense of impending death). The sessions are thankfully quite short- 30 minutes - so instead of the experience feeling a slow, painful death, it's more akin to someone hitting you hard on the head with a 2 by 4 then telling you to get up, because the class is over, when you're trying to figure out which way is "up".

I've had Joe and Rich and both are knowledgeable and have their own teaching style. As I go to Joe's noon classes, which are less full than the usual peak times - the vibe is more subdued, and the classes smaller. (By subdued, I don't mean that Joe will let you get away with doing a half-assed job.) Rich teaches the larger, after-work crowd and does a great job of learning everyone's names, motivating the masses, giving everyone a high-five when the workout's through, 

There's also a sense of camaraderie among the regular participants, who are thankfully very normally-attired, average-bodied people. I'm not sure who the chiseled, spandexed, sports-bra'd smiling, happy people people in the video ads on the Fit Body website are, but I've not yet encountered one in class. I think if you're smiling through this workout, you are obviously not doing it correctly, or have so far surpassed your pain threshold that you have truly lost your mind.

The only reason why this isn't a five-star review is the rather confusing and misleading pricing plan. I got the 3-week Groupon via Groupon for $39.99, but if you purchase the Groupon directly through the company's website, the cost is only $29.00 for the same 3 weeks. But wait! There's a 21 day boot camp experience for only $21.00 and then the 21-day fat loss at $67.00. There is no explanation of what each plan is on the website. But as I got more than 3 weeks through my initial Groupon, I'm OK with the higher price I had initially paid. And $21.00 for 21 days can't be beat.

I have no chill - I'm fully obsessed with Shred. 

For me, the keys to a good workout are a killer playlist, a high energy, motivational instructor, and a workout that doesn't get boring. Shred classes check all the boxes! 

The studio asks you to arrive early for your first class, so they can have you sign your waiver and then give you a tour of the studio. The studio space is so nice, and the bathrooms have showers (!!!), plus all the things you forget when you inevitably need to rush from workout to another thing (hair ties, brush, hair spray, deodorant, blow dryer, ALL THE THINGS.) When you enter the class space for your first class, your instructor tells you more about what to expect and shows you around your deck (which I found to be extra helpful because I've never really lifted and had no idea what I was doing on that front!). 

Typically classes are four 15 minute intervals, two on the deck (floor with weights) and two on the treadmill. Some instructors change it up and do different intervals, but they cue very clearly to let you know when there's a change coming up. 

This workout can be totally customized to the fitness level that works for you - as examples, the instructors tell you to grab a light weight, or to raise your treadmill speed .1-.5 - so you're in control of your workout. I appreciate that if I'm having a rough day (or rough interval), I can take it down a notch, but when I'm feeling great, I can make it more challenging. 

The instructors are SO, SO good. Like truly, I can't say enough great things about the instructors. They cue well (which trust me, now speaking as an instructor, it's harder than it sounds!), and they're great about keeping things moving during class. The entire staff is so friendly, and they make it a really welcoming environment. 

Oh also - I'm a sucker for merch, and they have cute stuff!

So, I figured it was about time I wrote an updated review. I've been a member of this Crunch since August of 2017- back when the gym was only open for "express workouts". This location offers group fitness classes, tanning, and hydro-massage. You get free 2 hour parking in the West parking garage, even though it's a bit of a pain to get in and out of.

Pros: 
-Updated Bathrooms with brand new Sauna.
-Cheap membership, starting at $9.95/month + annual fee.
-Friendly staff.
-Lots of weight/cardio equipment.
-Large group fitness room.

Cons:
-Santa Monica stairs: this location has these giant Santa Monica stairs which seem really cool, but no one uses them and they take up valuable space.
-Location of the bathrooms: you have to walk in between everyone squatting and lifting weights to get to the bathrooms/locker rooms. Sometimes I feel like I'm stepping over people.
-The equipment is so cramped, you can barely get by some of the machines because they're that close.
-They got rid of the wipes and only offer paper towels and bathroom cleaning spray to wipe down machines. Which is fine, but they're not conveniently located to the machines and usually either the paper towels or cleaning spray is empty so I know most people are not wiping down equipment. Yuck.

This Fitness Connection doesn't even deserve 1 star!  The staff is extremely unhelpful, they honestly spend all day either talking to each other, hitting on the young women who are there to work out or just work out themselves.  Ive tried on numerous occasions to ask/get some help about membership for a friend and none would spare the time to talk to me at all.  Horrible customer service I think.

The pool and jacuzzi will leave you with a film of disgusting slime on you, I think because they do not clean the pool it builds up with the human body oils and filth washed off in there (mostly because people do not shower before entering the pool right after they come from the gym all sweaty and dirty).

Probably 2 people in the entire gym use a sweat towel when they work out (I would be one of those 2) which I don't think I should have to say, but it is so disgusting.  Signs all over telling everyone to use a towel but no one does...  Just work out then leave all your sweat, body odor, hair and filth stuck to all the equipment when your done, I bet if a health inspector went in tomorrow he would have a cow at all the bacteria on the benches, seats, handles, and weights.  And if to make matters worse, NONE of the gym staff use a towel when they work out either!  The first time I have ever seen such a badly run gym in my life!

They have one 1 custodian working there usually, and all he does is vacuum the rubber floors...  Never seen him, not once, wipe equipment down or even just spray them with alcohol or cleaner or anything!  Absolutely ridiculous.  I have been in the gym at hours from morning to night and have only ever seen 1 guy working there and all they do is vacuum...

The only saving grace would be the variety of equipment they own and maybe a class or two held there, other than that this place is a bacterial nightmare run by unprofessional slobs.  I feel it would be my duty to call the health inspector after seeing all that goes on in here, I'm sure there have been reports of infections and fungus being contracted here.

I have a hate love relationship with this gym. Let's start with the likes since it'll be quick. I like how close it is to my house, I also like that it is open 24 hours a day. Now for my dislikes: The cardio equipment is horrible, very cheap bottom line stuff, it is also broken most of the time. Next are the 15-20 buckets sprawled out all over the gym floor used for catching drips falling from the leaking roof. No one wants to see buckets full of nasty water, or get dripped on when they are working out. The workout equipment is in great disarray as well, many of it broken for months at a time. People spend hundreds of dollars a year to use this gym and they can't fix their roof or equipment. Where does all the gym membership fees go? Clearly not back into the gym. I personally would not recommend this gym to anyone who lives nearby a fitness connection or frankly any other gym.

I'm a huge fan of this place. Mostly. To make it easier I'll break it down pro/con style.

+ Student discounts for UArts and Art Insitute. 3 months should run you about $90. More if you go to other colleges. I transferred to Temple but lived near 12th street so they hiked up the aforementioned college discount, but I still went through with it because it was such a great gym.
+ Great variety of classes ranging from cardio striptease to salsa dancing to boot camp at 6 in the AM, etc. My ass was usually first falling asleep at 6 AM so I never made it to that. There was one called Urban Corps that looked pretty fierce. 
+Really clean
+Very gay friendly environment, which should go without saying. Very friendly environment in general with an emphasis on students and younger professionals in the area, but don't worry about feeling self-conscious. People are welcoming, cool and keep to themselves.
+There are trainers but they're not up your ass
+Nice assortment of equipment and weights, including a Cardio Theatre where you can plug in music/watch tv and work out.
+Stays open fairly late Monday thru Thursday, and is open at 5 or 6 in the AM.

Cons.
-Like most gyms, gets incredibly crowded between 5 and 8 most week nigts, maybe even earlier.This is to be expected and I've never been a member of a gym where there was no rush hour, it just feels a little overcrowded this time of night. Good luck trying to get a treadmill or elliptical during this time. You might want to sign up.
-Would be cool if they extended their hours Fridays through Sundays
-Get ready for a lot of Deborah Cox remixes. And the Dreamgirls soundtrack, remixed. This isn't a complete negative, because I really was getting into it the first couple of times. But I'm almost positive the music played at nearby Pure is funneled in through the 12th Street soundsystem.

That being said, great place!

I love this gym! If I lived closer - I'd be a member again in  a heartbeat. During my short time as a member, I experienced the great variety of classes, steam room, and other amenities. I've taken the trx, yoga, Pilates, and spinning - all great instructors. Never had to wait for a machine either.  

If you need a great massage therapist - ask for Jon. I go there now only for massage therapy but I can use the club with a purchase of massage services. The club loans you a comfy robe, shower shoes ( to keep), and a lock with the massage service. The steam room and whirlpool are great. Personally, their sauna could be hotter. 

Try to visit during peak hours to see how you can deal with the heavy traffic in the club. If just for a massage, try to enjoy during off peak.

I love this place and have been a regularly here for over 2 years. This is a fantastic value for the price, Fantastic!

While they don't have the best and latest equipment, they have all the essentials. Really the only thing I would want from them is a free bar for swats and dead lifts (they only have the Smith Machine). 

But for $10 a month you get 24 hour access and free Pizza the first Monday of the month. That's an unbeatable proposition. Haha I was even showering here daily when my bathroom was being renovated. If your homeless or on the verge of homelessness, this is the last expense to cut!

My only real complaint is that they have FOX news as one of there channels on there T.Vs for people doing cardio. Don't they realize that the average age of the Fox news audience is 66? Change the channel!

I'm going to be honest... This is my third time coming back to OrangeTheory to get my butt into shape!  When work gets too hectic, or grad school overwhelms my calendar ... I tend to back away from taking care of myself. I keep coming back to OT, however, when I need a fun, challenging, and effective workout to make me feel refreshed and motivated. 
Each class offers an amazing balance of cardio and strength training via the treadmill, the rower, free weights, and TRX bands. Just show up, and a professional trainer will guide you through a powerful hour of fitness! 
Bonus: Accurately track your progress through the heart rate monitor strapped to your chest or arm during class... you will be able to view the results in real time on the screens in the gym, as well as via an email summary that's delivered to your inbox after you leave. 
I just signed up for a monthly package that includes 2 sessions a week... make sure you sign up with a fitness buddy so they can help hold you accountable!

Absolutely obsessed with this AWESOME place!  The last time I remember enjoying these activities truly was at Camp.  They have nailed the concept and I look forward to (vs dreading) going in the mornings.  I should have joined years ago (and I am NO gym Guru, BTW), but grateful I'm a CAMP'R now! 

Super friendly, helpful staff and the Coaches/Trainers are fantastic!  They are supportive and inspirational!  The entire CAMP Team is excellent and I would highly recommend this fabulous facility to ANYONE... younger, older, experienced or green!  Enjoy and cheers to good health and happiness all around from Clarissa of South Tampa and Reeves Import Motorcars.
Equipment dated and ALWAYS INOPERABLE.  Cleanliness is definitely not top priority either.  I usually hit this location between workouts for a quick touch up or cardio session; I dread it.
Friendly staff, awesome hydro massage beds, big locker rooms...  Very nice planet fitness!

I see a lot of people having negative experiences due to Covid billing and management here BUT I had a great experience as a VISITOR. I got the day pass - which BTW is 24 hrs so because I went at 2pm my first day, I was able to come back the next morning for free! Never seen that before but $20 for two sessions? Hell yes!

Anyway, a bodybuilders gym for sure! If you're intimidated by heavy lifters and/or lots of women in scantily workout outfits, maybe not for you but I'm down with it. LOTS of equipment variety and availability. I went midday and it was spacious. I went Saturday morning at 8am and by the time I left after 9am it was pretty busy. I think you would def want to avoid "peak" hours.

But there's some really cool machines! Unique things, I'll post pics of what I tried the second day.

They've also got supplements for sale at cheaper than online so I snagged some RAW Nutrition. Stoked not to pay shipping and save 5 bucks.

Would love to be a member but just visiting!

I've now been a member for three months and updating  my review. This is still the best gym I've been a member of--and I've been a member of most in the area. But there are items that need to be addressed.

At busy times, forget about getting a weight machine. It's amazing how many men will work on the machine for 30 seconds or so, then take a three minute break and play on their phones--while staying on the machine. I don't know what can be done about that, but stay away from the gym in the afternoon/early evening if you don't want that experience.

Come to think of it, this may not be a "men" problem, but a millennial problem. Too many young people on their phones all the time holding up the machines. It does tend to lean more toward the "male" side though, probably because they more often use the machines.

Many lockers in the ladies locker room aren't working. I don't know if they're being reported to the staff, but one day I went through four lockers in a row and the lock just spins. I'd think it's an issue with the manufacturer for sure.

They are trying to address the difficulty with getting in their very popular classes, but I believe they've gone about it in the wrong way. It used to be you could register 25 hours in advance of a class. Some really popular classes would be full within 20 minutes of registration opening. But when class starts (25 hours later), no-shows and late cancellations meant you didn't get in and the registrant didn't show up. Very annoying. 

Starting May, there is a no-show / late cancellation policy that will result in your losing registration privileges for a while. I'm good with that.

What I'm not good with is now you can register 48 hours in advance for a class. This allows the "speculators" to suck up the spots not being sure they can even make the darned class. I know this because two hours before class starts, sure enough there are tons of cancellations. Problem is by that time, many people are waiting for these spots. If you're not on the waitlist, you have to keep checking the myiclubonline site or your app. 

A better way I think would've been to CUT the time you can register to 12 hours or less. By that time, people usually know if they'll be working late, out of town, kids sick, etc. Giving people MORE time to speculate was not a good idea. Giving them less time so it's closer to the class start means more people know for sure whether or not they can make it or "feel" like going. 

To make my point, on Friday morning at 8:30 a.m., as soon as the 48 hour window opened to register for the Sunday 8:30 a.m. Body Pump class, in less than a minute, 23 of the 44 spots were taken.

I cannot stress how crowded this gym is after a normal work day. It's like ants crawling around a picnic. Also, the classes are extremely crowded. People don't like waiting to put their class equipment away, so they're walking through classes and it borders on dangerous. I won't even take the spots near the weights or step equipment storage because people walk close to your mat and actually get in your way.

There are kinks to work out and I'm confident The Edge will do just that. It's a great gym, a very reasonable cost, and for the most part clean. I hope they can sort out the machine hogs, the overcrowded classes and the class registration process (which they are attempting to do).

I used a 5 day guest pass and visited Fitness Connection on a Saturday.  The gym is very clean and organized, practicing CDC guidelines.

I participated in an exercise class and it was loads of fun.  Saw some old friends from a previous gym we went to, in pre-covid times.

Membership fees are comparable.  This gym has a pool, but is not open at this time

What a fantastic gym!! I was in Nashville from out of town and acquired a 14-day guest pass with a friend who lives locally. I'm so glad I decided to try this facility over any other because this YMCA really is first-rate! Everything was literally spot on. Some of the great things I tried out included:

-Fitness Classes: They feature Les Mills group exercise classes and have some really friendly and fun instructors
-Fitness Equipment: I checked out some of the cardio and nautilus equipment. All the machines were new looking and clean
-Pool: What a nice, huge, and well maintained pool. 
-Lobby: Free coffee for members. How great is that?!?!! Love it.

Since this Y is so huge, I wasn't really able to try out everything, but there really are tons of other amenities.

As I finish this review, I'd like to send a final shout out to the staff. They were all super knowledgeable and amazing!

Review in one word: Underwhelmed.

For the super-premium monthly rates you get decidedly less than a super-premium selection of free weights and resistance machines, and a very, very sub-par selection of cardio equipment. 

The few classes that I tried were OK, meaning average at best.  You'll get a better spin/cardio experience at Soul Cycle a block away.  My neighbor says the yoga classes are ok but nothing special.  

Credit is due to the overall training of the staff, from those manning the welcome desks, the sales offices, to the trainers and managers roaming the facility and the gym/fitness center floor.  Note that the male managers are always dressed in a suit and tie, or a slim fitting dress (women).  If you ask someone, anyone, 'do you have such and such a free weight/weight machine...?' the standard response is  'have you talked to one of our personal trainers, ... to figure out how to ... accomplish what you want?'

After following through with the 'talk to a trainer' response once or twice, no, I don't want to talk to a trainer, which is always a means to lead in to signing up for the personal training services.  I just want to go in and exercise without having to pay someone to watch over me and give me a 'personalized' workout program.  And to suggest I use Lifetime's vitamin supplements or energy gels.

I half suspect Lifetime purposely has a funky selection of fitness equipment in order to steer you to use a personal trainer and the resulting additional fees associated with same.  I've heard others say this and I tend to believe it.

On a positive note, it's a new and a nice physical facility (you walk in and think I used to go down these stairs to buy socks, underwear and dress shirts when Macy's had a sale). Yes the locker room and shower facilities are nice and new.  And there is the factor of being the newest, loudest, and most promoted fitness center in the immediate area - "Yea, I joined Lifetime, ..." this is known locally as cocktail party/happy hour bragging rights when trying to impress others.

I tried other Lifetime facilities in NJ and NY, and they're no different. In fact for a lesser monthly rate you could get a bigger facility and with more offerings, an outdoor pool, squash courts, etc.
Way better than most PFs. Very happy staff and the space is just immense. Feels very roomy and never stuffy. Plenty of machines to use and always clean

They call this a Signature gym and charge more. For what? They get 12 channels when they are all working. Its dirty and the workers are worthless and uniformed. I have never seen a group of people care less about their jobs. Before you get a membership check around at Crunch, etc.

Not a bad gym, but they closed at 9 pm because of snow when it was not supposed to get bad till after midnight on 1/26/2015 and then closed on the 27th when all the roads were clear. They did this last year also so Sunday was my rest day . Monday they closed early so I couldn't go, and Tuesday closed for no reason. 3 days off doesn't help me stay motivated.

Very nice athletic center. The equipment was new and very good. The treadmills weren't Woodway but close to it. There was plenty of space, all the lifting and cardio equipment that is up to date eight modern workouts. There is also a nice area to do your own boot camp workout. The yoga room is very nice and on par with nice yoga studios. 

Bottom line...great place for a workout. This center is new with very good equipment for someone looking to lift, do cardio or do their own boot camp.
What a great gym, friendly staff and very clean. The membership is very fair and the class options are great. I really enjoy all the equipment. This gym gives back to the service folks with events.

I have trained here for over 10 years with Jake. What can I say? I LOVE THIS GYM AND THE PEOPLE!! Has everything you need, it's clean, well-appointed bathrooms, and almost always open. Would not go anywhere else in NOLA

I prefer this location over the Nampa location. More equipment and more areas to workout. Both tanning beds are always available when I want to tan. Could use more leg machines for hamstrings. I will be sure not to go after 9 am on Friday since they block off part of the gym for a group class ( they have a group fitness room, but another class was going on). That was annoying.

I recently stayed at the MAC for a business trip. I loved the main lobby and dinning area on the 4th floor. "Old School" beauty. The lobby is just beautiful with it's oak paneling and decorated ceiling. 

The rooms are basic. Very basic....which isn't a bad thing if that is what you are expecting, which I was. I need a clean, safe place with a comfortable bed and a hot shower. This fit the bill exactly. 

If you are expecting a fancy room, then this isn't the place for you. If you are looking for a cool, old school type place with great service and a great location....then this is your place.

I have been a member at Sports West off and on since 1993. I used to work at Harrahs Reno Health Club doing massage, so I can appreciate a large club like SWAC. When I came to Reno to get a BS in Medical Sciences from UNR I remember the building, that now  is the nicest gym in town,  was a Raley's Supermarket. The owner Dee Dee and her family take good care of the place. They hire excellent teachers like Sara who teach multiple styles of fitness classes, like power yoga. I loved the pool, hot tub, steam & sauna. A bonus is that the place is open 24/7. Everyone from the cleaning crew Carmen to the sales staff manager Eric Van Kirk are always friendly & helpful. The spa massage offer to new members is a nice "touch". World class expert Tai Chi / Qi Gong instructor Reza ( Master Nejad ) keeps me coming to the place, even if things like the showers are closed due to the Governor's Mandate.

This is brand new location that opened on 10/22/2019.  It is obviously very clean and has plenty of amenities.  There are separate cardio, lifting, and resistance machine areas.  In addition, there is a cycling studio, cardio theater, group exercise studio, and burn zone.  They also offer hydro massage chairs, tanning, and red light therapy machines.  This location follows the same pricing structure as other locations with the notable exception of the $10/mo plan.  Prices range from $20-50/mo plus fees.  Different plans get you into the specialty rooms noted above.  The lack of the $10 plan and my single experience (so far) is the reason for the 4 stars.

The studio was kick ass awesome! The decor was very inspiring and savvy! Loved that even the floor had motivational words! 

Amy was great!!! She was very patient and attentive to all of the class!! This was my first time at the studio! I took the Full Body class - in retrospect, I probably should have taken an intro class or one less demanding! A lot of core work, muscle shaking and Lamaze like breathing on my part! 

I had a love/hate experience with the class! Not sure if it's the right niche for me, maybe because I was so intimidated at first. However I will be back for a few more classes!

This is a great gym! I've been coming here since October 2017; and I'm down 40 lbs since! I will say this is not your traditional gym. You won't come in and see a lot of treadmills and machines. This gym is geared a lot towards personal trainings and bootcamps. I must say, the bootcamps work. Again, i am down 40lbs! It is nothing to be scared of, it is challenging, but you can go at your own pace. The trainers are professional and helpful. They give you MANY tips on how to make improvements in your workout/diet. I would recommend it to anybody.

I'm so happy that we have found My Gym! Our daughter loves the Gymsters class which is for her age group.  I love watching my daughter learn to wait her turn, learn how to do the obstacles, and socialize with other kids.  The staff members are welcoming and caring for all the kids.  They have great attitudes and are very friendly! I'll be recommending My Gym to my friends!

First I'll say that I definitely get a good work out here.  I just moved into center city from the suburbs and I've regularly attended spin classes 4-5 days a week for the past year.  I didn't want to join a gym right away down here with the nice weather approaching so when I heard about this place I thought it would be perfect.
The room is very small for the amount of bikes, so you are kind of on top of each other, which kind of grosses me out when everyone is sweating profusely and breathing heavily.  The bikes are also very different than any other spin bike I've ever seen.  This isn't a bad thing.  I do like the power meter on there, because usually I'm just guessing at my speed and resistance level.  
The online reservation system is nice too, but I've had a hard time getting a spot in a lot of the classes even signing up a week in advance.  I guess that's a testament to how well this place is doing, but its a little frustrating.  
All in all, I think its a great class, just wish the studio was bigger and there were more classes available.

This place is pure cardio, go-go-go! Split between half hour of treadmill and half hour of weight floor/water rowers, the coaches will guide you through a workout that is as hard as you'll push. This is not a gym you can walk in at any time, they work exclusively through classes scheduled throughout the day.

Pros:
Energetic, friendly coaches
Clean
Targeted heart rate workout 

Negatives:
Not good if you don't like orange lights or really loud music
Only one shower
Pricey

This gym is a great place to get a membership if you live in the CWE area. There's a private lot for gym members, but there's almost always street parking too. 

Hell, I have a gym in my apartment complex, but I got a membership here for the classes.  Unlimited use of the gym and unlimited classes for $27/mo including taxes.  They give you several options for your membership, but it's only $60 to cancel your membership, which I think is a great deal, so you might as well get the two year contract (depending on your circumstances, of course).

The only qualm I have is I wish they had more classes!

Terrible experience this morning - Devin signed me up really close to class time and then forced me to watch videos before arriving and THEN wouldn't let me into the class!!! Orange theory just put a terrible taste in my mouth and I will never be back thanks to the rudeness of the staff here at this location.

Its not the best AF I have been to, but it is managable.  I think (hope) they are updating the space because the carpet has been ripped up in the back, but maybe they are going for a more industerial look?

This AF is also one of the more smaller facilities that I have been to.  But the machines are kept in good order and when I go it is never that packed. 

Overall no real complaints.  Check it out, you will be glad you did.

I did research and it's true NJ Division of Consumer Affairs  Consumer Fraud Act 56:8-42 i. States a health club contract shall not obligate the buyer to renew the contract. As I stated I full-filled my initial contract term. 

I had to respond to Gary L response to my reveiw. Gary must work for Retro. Joe P you never confirmed that I fulfilled my first year membership and haven't been to your gym in years yet the membership automatically renewed despite it being a month to month. ABC financial has the worst customer reveiws online yet you do business with them. Also interesting that a $17.00 past due amount mysteriously went to over $200 in a few weeks with a collection agency.

There's a reason why this is $10. If you want to do primarily cardio, you may be in luck. I wouldn't put too much into their weight training machines, they're not very good. Free weights, Smith Machine, pull ups and pull downs. That's it. The staff is mainly kids and people who haven't the slightest idea about fitness. They're just there for the check. So don't expect much. They don't smile, they don't even greet you, too busy playing on their electronic devices. So that's Planet fitness. A big ass building with some equipment that may or may not get you fit. If you're knowledgeable about your fitness level and what you should be doing, you MIGHT be successful. If not and you need guidance, pay $20 more and go somewhere else where the employees are professionals and actually know what they're talking about.

Great gym!!! Clean. Friendly, hardworking staff. The equipment is kept in good condition (no need to race to get to the "good" treadmills, and there are plenty). No fluff or frills, just great value for your buck. Only $19.99 a month for unlimited tanning (not that I need that ;), use of massage chairs, AND you can bring a friend! Can't beat that with a stick!!

I love this gym! It's old school! Nuff said. If clean and sanitary is what your looking for than go to a hospital but if a REAL gym is what you want and want real results than this is the place.....no high pressure for personal training sessions. In fact the staff is very polite and friendly they are also knowledgable about exercises and equipment.

Due to an injury, I was looking for a gym out of town where I could swim.  The facilities at this Y are top notch!  The staff are warm and kind, the pool is delightful, if not huge, and the fitness center is well maintained.  The women's locker room isn't the most stylish place, but they kindly have partitioned changing areas, hair dryers, showers with changing areas attached, and plentiful lockers (BYOLock).  Plus they have one of those awesome "suit spinners," in which you put your bathing garments and it spins the majority of the water out!  This is a huge win for someone that swims every day, and is always hoping that the bathing suit is dry by the next wearing!

So the new name is elevate Health & Performance and that is very accurate. Hector continues his vision for supporting clients by providing an expansive approach to achieving physical excellence through personal training but also on-site professional physical therapy and nutrition guidance with qualified nutritionists. 

The environment is sharp, efficient, and accessible. 

Hector and his team have created a unique and effective approach to personal training. It's like nothing I've experienced before. I'm guided, pushed, and healed at every session. Really extraordinary.

The staff there is great I signed up with Daniel he got me a great deal when signing up. Every time I walk in the gym the front desk staff greets me but they are not why I am giving this place 2 stars. THIS GYM IS FILTHY! when you go to the gym you sweat, some people spit. And at this gym no one is cleaning shi*t. All of your body fluid gets left on machines, under the machines is just dusty and hair. When you go to clean the machines there are never paper towels being refilled, the spray bottle doesn't even work it's pretty bad lol. And don't get me started on the dammm pool. Swimming is a great exercise id like to take part in but I refuse to go in that pool. It's literally yellow and brown and got dirty looking. Bubbles sitting on the top. But here is why I even gave the gym 2 stars I heard they got a new cleaning team from Daniel because he also thought the gym had very low standards. So I hope cooperate is gonna take measures into someone's damm hands and fix that damn pool/gym.

This is a great 24 Hour Fitness location. The staff is super friendly, two stories of workout space, basketball courts and an outdoor pool. I had my first free personal training consultation yesterday and it was an awesome workout!

Also, they have the TRX machines at the front which are an awesome workout. 

I really like the setup of this 24 hour fitness too, the cardio equipment is upstairs, the weight section faces the front and the machines are in another section on the first floor, which is much better than those gyms where everything faces a mirror. 

I need to check out some of their weekly classes. That's the next thing on my workout to-do list!
Powerhouse Gym lacks customer service and energetic atmosphere. The staff look like they hate working there. This was the first time I've ever walked into a gym and then immediately walked out.

Obsessed w/ this place!! I'm not even a member but with the black card membership that my friends have then I can go as a free guest while I'm home for break. The hydro-massages are BOMB I haven't seen it anywhere else but I live for it. Also like that there aren't creepy old people that just sit and watch you work out like some of the other gyms I've been to in the area...
My Gym is a very special place and my daughter loved it!  We are so excited they are back.
Very disappointed in the customer service at the new Waters and Florida location in Seminole Heights! Sales staff is only partially enabled! I guess I'll stay at Crunch.

Elmwood Fitness in Harahan is the nicest gym in the New Orleans area. This club is huge, featuring a dizzying array of cardio equipment, two weight rooms (one I have never entered), indoor track, racquetball courts, indoor and outdoor pools, and more (lots of available services to choose from, such as personal trainers and nutritionists). There is a wide variety of classes (four studios worth!), including yoga classes Monday-Friday evenings.

It is more than just a health club- this club features computers with internet access, televisions, a Café, and outdoor snack bar. It costs slightly more to be a member of this gym as your primary location, and requires spending $10 monthly at the Café or snack bar. 

I prefer the weight machines at this gym (in comparison to the other Elmwood gyms). I typically use the weight room or the elliptical machines.

If you are primarily a member of Elmwood at Heritage Plaza or Downtown, you can use the Harahan club on the weekends. This is a very worthwhile benefit.

A few years ago we had a terrible experience here and since then I've been taking my mom to UMC. When we found out mom had to have surgery and were referred to Banner... well, really what can you do? 

We were positive we wanted "our" doctor and he does his work at Banner. The only, negative issue was that we had to call between 2 and 4, the day before surgery for a surgery time confirmation. Who would have thought they would change the time but they did. The new time just did not work and our surgery coordinate switched us to a time that did work after I talked to her. 

We had a stellar experience here. We checked in early, the Nurse came out to talk to us, and explained how to get to nuclear medicine. We took a short trip to the cafeteria and arrived at nuclear medicine early. 

We were taken in and processed. We arrived back to the surgical area early and were again taken in and processed. Alot of people come "at you" at once. They ask alot of questions, some repetitive but there's a need for that and they each seemed to genuinely pay attention. 

All in all, a very, very positive experience. Banner - what a turn around. Keep up the fantastic work. The staff we met were absolutely incredible. 

Thank you. 

Our nurse was magnificent. I have no idea how to spell her name so I'll call her Me Knock She! She knows who she is!

I'm going to STRONGLY disagree with the first review.

Not only was I a member of this location but I am also a trainer at this location. 

This location was built in the early 90's....while the equipment sometimes may be on the fritz, there is, unfortunately a "process" involved with getting machines repaired. Trust me, as a trainer I am on the butts of maintenance to get things fixed asap. There are over 3,000 people that go in and out of that single location daily, not including employees and kids in the "Kidz Klub".

As far as the training staff, they do hire "new" people, and unfortunately they may be inexperienced, however you can request a more "seasoned" trainer when you sign up. Every trainer, before being hired at La Fitness is interviewed, tested and must show proff of certification in the field. (FYI, there are other gyms that will hire without a certification and let them acquire it later.) The trainer who was texting and not paying attention, I find that odd, since we have a strict no cell phone policy at our location.... but perhaps that particular trainer was breaking rules that day. All trainers are concerned about the welfare and safety of their clients. I can promise you that.

We recently hired some new managers and things seem to be heading up.... so come on back and check it out!

P.S. Sorry, you've had such a tough time Leslie!

where do I begin? This place is shit wrapped in golden foil, meaning that at first glance, it looks great but once you see that inside is shit, you realize that you were scammed.

None of the trainers here are actual fighters, think of them as personal trainers that know some combinations. Two of the trainers are legit. Ray boxes for the army and Jay has a purple belt in jiu jitsu. But the other trainers are tools, they found a job where they can look tough for the college girls. This gym is a spectacle, a small room where they blast Robin Thicke and Rise Against, pretty gay for a boxing gym.  I wonder what GSP or Anderson Silva would have to say about boxing INC ?

If you're a great big pussy that wants to do aerobics on a heavy bag, come here. If you're a bro in need of some ho's, join this gym, But if you really want to train with the best, check out Undisputed or APEX.  Boxing INC is a bad joke.

The following review is based on a week long pass. The selection of weight equipment is great. However, several machines are dirty and rusty. It is also very crowded most of the time. Here is a breakdown of this gym (scale from 1=lowest,5=highest):

Weight equipment selection:  4/5
Cardio equipment :3/5
Locker room:3/5
Facility cleanliness:1/5 

The membership prices to join constantly change. I was quoted two different prices in only a seven day period. Due to the above listed reasons I opted not to join.

Not worth it to go as an adult or if you have kids u see 5. Never been here and they wouldn't let us do most of the area. Our 3 year old would play in the kids area so we would go play with her and had multiple snotty kids tell us only kids under 7 aloud. We told them thank you and ignored them the first time then the second kid same thing I'm mad now and state excuse me it also stated for parents to watch there kids. The 3 and 4th kid I told to leave is alone now. The 4th was pushy trying to push us out. Then ran to tell on us. No staff ever asked us to leave the area. Then they have this gymnastic area that apparently only accepts campers. No one was in there. At all just the staff member playing on there phone waiting for payed campers to decide to come to the place. Then we tried to go to the big jumping area with all the trampoline and told that we couldn't be there either. It was a complete waist of time and staff and the kids there were all very rude. It was 30$ for an hour .... seriously.... what we could do we could go to micdonalds play house and get an icream for the the crap this place was.

Very welcoming staff and environment! We tried the beginner's course with Coach John. I got a brief idea of what Jiu Jitsu is! We were told to do what we can and do our best, since it was our first time trying this. Coach John was very supportive, and every person in attendance has a learning attitude. I'm someone who never would see myself trying this sport out, but the environment made it possible to be curious, try and even learn something new! Thanks to all Paragon staff!

This PF is good overall. They have all the usual amenities and the staff is very nice and attentive to everybody's needs. 

One of the best features that I noticed was the spacious shower stalls. There are private locked changing areas attached to each shower, so there's plenty of room for your gym bag and you don't have to worry about anyone meddling with your stuff.

There are two reasons why I docked a star from my review. 1) The stretching area is pretty small and tucked in a corner so it was almost claustrophobic. 2) The shower heads are sooo funky. Very odd water pressure, sort of haphazard spraying, and it's difficult to make the water cold without turning it off completely. They definitely need an update. On the plus side though, the water gets very hot, if that's your thing. 

Bottom line: If I'm in town again, I'll likely be back.

I've been a Sweat member for a couple of years now and when I moved to South Philly last year, this became my new location. I really like this one, the cardio room is upstairs and has exposed brick and high ceilings and great industrial fans. There are tons of machines and each is equipped with a personal tv. I have never once had to wait, and sometimes mid-day am the only person up there. The recumbent bikes are lined up by the windows so you can get some people watching in while you work out. The place is spotless and the staff is super friendly. Plus if you sign up through Global Fit it ends up costing around $10 a week, which I think is totally reasonable, especially when I think about all the ridiculous things I spend way more than $10 a week on.

So the new name is elevate Health & Performance and that is very accurate. Hector continues his vision for supporting clients by providing an expansive or holistic approach to achieving physical excellence through personal training but also on-site professional physical therapy and nutrition guidance with qualified dieticians. 

The environment is sharp, efficient, and accessible. 

Hector and his team have created a unique and effective approach to personal training. It's like nothing I've experienced before. I'm guided, pushed, and healed at every session. Really extraordinary.
The best exercise! It's super fun and everyone is friendly! You don't have to worry about what you look like....just come and you will be fine!

Five stars for the gym... but not star worthy for their i inability to customer service beyond sign up.  I spent four weeks trying to cancel my membership but was unable to reach a human via the 5 different phone numbers and also email.  

So yeah, sign up is easy and fun and the gym is great.  But having to document failed attempts at contacting customer service in order to show my bank the lengths I'm willing to go to try and contact these people so my bank could stop all future payments... waste of my time.  Go with chuz fitness, at least there they'll look you in the eye and not treat you like a plague when you're ready to cancel.

This gym has a very odd layout. I signed on for a year at the gym given a decent discount they give to my employer. The gym has multiple levels and some rather outdated workout equipment. The Wi-Fi connection in the cardio areas is terrible, and if it is busy, and you will likely not have a Wi-Fi signal while working out. Also, they get about five channels on the cardio TVs, so if you do not like CNN or ESPN, you're out of luck.

I joined Dragon Gym almost a year and a half ago at the encouragement of a friend to try kettlebells. Since that time, through the phenomenal guidance of their instructors, I have seen steady increases in my strength while simultaneously experiencing a loss of 30 pounds of body weight. The team at Dragon Gym is dedicated to the improvement of all its students and takes great pains to provide individual attention and encouragement. The other students are also extremely supportive and friendly. I highly recommend you stop by and give them a try.

If you patronize Medford Fitness because they're local, don't expect any gratitude from their their Podunk, Arkansas business office. My 18yo son, preparing for graduation, stopped going for several months. Free money for Medford Fitness. When I asked to be let out of the contract based on his college bound status, "No can do." OK. It's a contract. But wait... I don't recall renewing for 2019. "Oh, it's automatic" they said. Gee thanks. The termination process? Not so automatic. "Mandatory two months notice. In writing. We'll get back to you and let you know when your termination is accepted." Another month's fee collected. Two more months go by. FREE AT LAST! But wait... the assholes also collected the next year's annual maintenance fee along with our final month's membership fee. I asked for a waiver on the unethical, unfriendly, and probably illegal $39 tap on my credit card. NO CAN DO. All I can say is, good riddance Medford Fitness. You suck.
I am dissapointed that i have to pay 160 to switch to S Tampa La fitness, been a member for many years not sure why such a high fee to switch over. I will be cancelling and joining another gym.
It is better but men's locker room is dirty. Floors have gum on them. The owner must not care as there is not management of the staff. nobody is overseeing the place.

I've always really enjoyed the Y growing up as a kid. I think they offer great programs for all ages and promote healthy lifestyles for all. This facility is very nice located in the Athenaeum downtown. 

The classes they offer (upstairs at least) are in these awesome old rooms with gorgeous windows overlooking Michigan Street. Yes, sometimes I'm staring at the window!!! But hey, it's a beautiful old building getting put to great use like it was back in the day.

And if you really want to come, try out the Zumba, Pilates, cycling, and yoga classes. I've been to all four-I teach on Monday nights-and I have to say the instructors are great and there is a definite camaraderie between the instructors, staff, and members.
Allison's classes are the best. High energy, aerobic punch the heck outta them classes that will leave you feeling dead, but in a good way.

I have been coming for a couple of months to this location (was at a different location for a couple of years) - Great place!  I love the fact that I can come anytime I want.  Also, the crowd is great: Everyone comes to work out and not chit-chat or show off!  They have plenty of machines and a good selection of free weights.  See you there, 3-5 times a week!

20 bucks a month is awesome, but recently it has been getting pretty busy at the usual peak hours... I guess everybody found out about it. Nothing fancy, but the equipment is the newest stuff. Staff do just sit behind the desk or workout themselves, but I've never experienced them being rude. Wish they had an erg.

My kids have been coming to summer camp here for years. It's great for the activities and ban on electronics. No watching movies and playing games all day like other camps. It's a little more pricey than other camps but worth the $ and they have a great leader in training program that my oldest participates in.

This is the best gym in the area but I cannot give it 5 stars. The "workers" sit behind the desk and joke around and horse play. The only time they work is when Romeo who is the owner, is there. It is a hang out for the crew that works there and their friends. The weights are hardly ever racked,  and there is no enforcement of any rules. I don't mind the chalk on the floor, it is a gym, there should be chalk but members spill water or whatever on the floor and it will stay there for hours ( it happened tonight and I said something to they young guys that spilled the drink and they just looked at me).
The upside is the amount of equipment and weights they have. They even have a room that you can "CrossFit" in with a Rogue pull up rig and bumpers, but they are not a CrossFit affiliate nor do they claim to be. 
If you don't mind a few too many punks and people that don't follow gym etiquette, this gym is pretty good. 
I worked out here for a year and I did not renew my contract.

The honeymoon period is over. 

I still love the spin classes and think the world of Russ, Utley and Jackie. I've learned that you don't need a fancy facility to get a good work out if you have phenomenal instructors. 

Otherwise my experience is pretty much average, to slightly below average.

1) This gym is a test gym for a new class pass system. Everyone needs to sign up for each class online and then receives a ticket when they get to the gym. The ticket then gets turned into the instructor for entry. It's a pain. People with certain memberships can't sign up online and can't get into classes. I feel like it's a hall pass or something. 

2) One of the spin classes I attended on a weekly basis has been canceled and nothing has been put in its place.  Having a class at that time was one of the reasons I signed up for the gym in the first place. 

3) I've had an unresolved billing issue that probably will never get resolved. It's ultimately not a lot of money at stake and it's really not even worth my time to follow up anymore, but out of principle this should have been resolved. 

As I mentioned initially, I'm thoroughly enjoying the spin classes but this gym just doesn't warrant the previous 4-star review.

Thank you so much to Paul, Clariz, Jesse and every Chuze Fitness employee at the kolb & 22nd location! I've worked out at so many different gyms my since the mid 90's! None were as welcoming and as comfortable as Chuze! Thank you to SilverSneakers for my gratuitous membership! I look forward to my workout tomorrow! What I find your best quality to be is the energy from everyone! especially the wonderful staff but also the other fellow gym members! Im soo happy i decided to choose Chuze! it was the smartest, best choice! see you all tomorrow!!(:

                                                                Super Satisfied Chuze Member,
                                                                Juan C.
One of the best Planet Fitness's I've ever been to. Very clean and the equipment is in great shape.

I really like this Anytime a lot. My fiance and I signed up for the convenient location because it's around the corner from our house (and of course, the convenient hours). The owner is always really friendly and welcoming; he usually has free samples of items for members to try out... I've even gotten Epsom salt and Starbucks during my last few visits here. I know a lot of gyms get super crowded around prime time, after work hours, but this one doesn't get too bad. Even though it's small, there's all the essential equipment you'd need for arms/legs/glutes/abs/cardio/etc. They even recently got a TRX machine. I've never had to wait too long for my turn on a machine, so the other members here are courteous enough. I don't do personal training but I have noticed that there is a personal trainer here as well as a tanning room. 

The restrooms and equipment are very clean. I've come here on a weekend before and witnessed someone wiping down each machine. All in all, a great place to get in a good workout.

This is a nice clean place. Good equipment as well. Very nice locker rooms. BUT don't get sucked into the personal training game you won't get out. And it's not worth the money. You have to work around their schedule, not yours. So go for the gym and the equipment and it's all good

I have been a member of this Y for almost a year. It is a very expensive gym but given that, the facilities are great and there are always tons of staff around that are willing to be of assistance. The pool is great, if somewhat crowded, and the locker room facilities with the bathing suit wringer are a nice touch. I generally stick to classes for my workouts and I would give them a B in general. There are LOTS of class options but the cycling classes are not great (as a former SPINNING instructor). Other than that, the yoga and group fitness classes are great. It is always packed, and parking can be a problem, but they always have attendants out in the parking lot to help direct traffic to open spots. It makes me very happy to see people of all ages using the track and working out however I find that sometimes people just let their kids run free instead of actually watching them or sending them to the Kids Zone. It can be very frustrating to be running or walking laps on the track and just have little kids playing all over the place or playing on the gym equipment. One last suggestion would be to add curtains or coverings to the windows in the yoga room, it can be very distracting to have everyone on the track looking in and maybe it would help with some of the noise from the fitness room/basketball court.

Overall, its a great facility. It is a bit expensive for some of the issues it has but I am thankful it is there and I think its a wonderful asset for the community.

I've been a member here ever since August first opened a little over a year ago, it's a friendly, convenient, and well equipped gym. There are around 10 cardio machines and nearly all weight machines you could need as well as free weights and a boxing bag. The most convenient part of the gym is the 24 hour access, which gives members access to the gym via a hotel style key. No check in desks, sales people harassing you, or over crowding. There are designated parking spaces for PFT in the rear and normally easy to find space on the street. August also sells Beverly supplements and there is a vending machine. Overall a really easy comfortable and friendly place to work out.

la fitness is so difficult to cancel your membership .read the fine print you must mail in a cancelation form you cannot cancel by stopping in at the gym. i have been fighting with my credit card company for months over this.

I've been to many gyms over my years. Yeah, I know, you can tell, thanks for the compliment. This is a solid quality gym. 

Things that make this gym better than many others that I've put up with in the past:
- Clean! (Well, it's new, so this may be an easier accomplishment)
- Working equipment and a great variety of equipment
- Friendly staff that actually says hi to you/answers your questions
- A maintenance staff that seems to stay on top of broken machines (they don't stay broken for too long)
- GREAT hours (open early, open late)
- Lots of space; there's about 4-5 different spots you can check out to do your stretching/warm up/whatever the hell else you want to do
- Good spaces for classes
- Clean, big locker rooms and a lot of locker space throughout the gym to lock up yo stuff
- Affordable monthly rate!

Downsides:
- No pool
- Is that the only downside I can think of?

I recommend this gym over the other neighborhood ones in a heartbeat.

The staff and patrons are nice enough, and the facility is clean, but it really isn't worth the $60 I pay per month. The cardio equipment is usually occupied during peak hours, and there are virtually no duplicates of weight machines. Other than that, it is pretty-much what you'd expect in terms of a gym, just again, a bit overpriced.

I was skeptical of this gym and CrossFit in general when I joined, as I wasn't convinced that they would want to or know how to handle a completely out of shape novice. A year after joining, I'm reminded that this is the exact gym that I need. 

What sets this gym apart is the trainers. Hands on, seasoned and professional trainers, each with different areas of expertise, are enormously committed to the progress of the members.  Since each class is capped at 10 people (my class is usually about half that), the attention by trainers is unsurpassed by any other gym in the area. I feel much safer knowing that the risk of injury is reduced with this level of attention.   

The owner, Rob, really strives to make this a welcoming community.  Successes and gains are recognized and celebrated by all.  A grueling workout quickly becomes a group effort, rather than an individual ordeal.  It makes it more fun, and it makes you work that much harder and progress that much faster. 

I can't speak highly enough for this gym and the trainers. The workouts are harder than you can imagine, but the trainers will give their all to anyone willing to put forth genuine effort.  Hard work is rewarded ten-fold.

Very fun place! Many games to play from basketball to laser tag.perfect place for kids or even adults since they have food and a bar.I would definitely go again.Something to keep in mind is how how it gets in there. Five minutes in and everyone was hot, they could use better air conditioning in my opinion. But overall, a good time for sure.

Too...crowded...
Not...enough...room...

Seriously, be prepared to waste your time trying to find a machine/weight that's free to use. Even during lunch time it's packed. 

On several occasions I've walked in, tried to find a machine, then walked right out, because there's absolutely NO ROOM, and there's no point in wasting my time waiting in line. Throw your workout plans out the window. Or invest in home equipment. Especially since 99% of people here don't wear masks. Talk about a COVID nightmare in the making...

I left this Crunch 2 years ago for Youfit for this very reason, but now the Youfit closed down so I was transferred here. I can't wait until a new gym opens up nearby so I can stop coming here. Good riddance.

All I can say is it's clean but a little eerie in the back alley in the gym.. came in twice to look at the place once by myself and the ones with a buddy.. yesterday when I came in for two years the price was $500 with Nick as assistant general manager.. today I went in and they bumped it up to $600 and it was a different trainer there manager.. the guy today told me unlimited personal training sessions.. when I go talk to some people at Schnucks next door they tell me that its not unlimited physical fitness training sessions and as it says in the paper that they take out $30 a year for their income they actually took out twice that without telling the people I was talking to.. so to put this easily it seems like this place to face to me because the Gal that I was also talking to at the grocery store said that the fitness trainers that run the place each new day can make different prices and that was not a plus for me.

Great neighborhood and atmosphere!! My family and friends enjoy spending time here because it is comfortable whether you are climbing or visiting/waiting. 

We bought a package deal and so far it has been totally worth it. It's nice that clean shoes are available so that we don't have to buy a pair.

Lounge is on a bus route, easy/free parking, and bike rack in front. 

Some beverages and snacks are available for purchase and water is provided. Tables are up front for waiting or eating, etc. We sometimes bring our own lunch and eat after climbing. Other times we go across the street to St. Roch Market for lunch.

My daughter and her bff attended a summer day camp and really enjoyed it. The staff is kind and helpful and we will keep coming back!

PS. Bathroom is clean, cute and gender neutral.

10 tv's. A projector tv. Coffee maker -free. Refrigerator.multiple showers. Lots of free weights and treadmills.plenty of parking. Dining area ?! Microwave, vending machines. #1 club in the world. 

2200 members!!! 

Lots of lockers.Tanning of course.
You can even rent their own anytime limousine!

I finally willed myself to the pool here this past week. After taking a 4 month break from swimming, I decided to get back into a swimming routine.

First, they may say that the pool is 80 degrees-but it certainly isn't when you get in. The positive is that you get moving pretty quickly and you don't want to stop for the first few laps.

I liked pushing myself with a 25 meter distance pool too. Later on in the night, you can also switch over to the 25 yard side, when that area is empty.So going last Thursday and Friday led to some good workouts and I really enjoy how clean the pool is. The weekly hours are pretty good for my schedule too-I just wish that they had the pool open later on the weekend.

Great workout.  The trainers give modifications for all levels to make every move doable. Super energetic staff that will motivate you to be better. Great energy and attitudes with trainers who truly want to see you get better.

This is a small gym as far as gyms go but I like it. 

pros - All cardio machines have their own tvs, there aren't that many members so there isn't a wait for cardio machines. It's 24 hours. It's cheap. There is a parking garage but I think this past winter there have been a few cars that were broken into so there are cops that stand around the gym/ parking lot at night.  

cons- sometimes it smells in the gym, sometimes it smells in the girls locker room, sometimes it's hot in the gym, sometimes there is weird condensation on the windows, some of the tvs don't work right.
There are ellipticals but a few of them make noise or wobble so I can only use a couple of them. No classes at all.  There is not a single clean mat to do sit ups. I wish they would get some clean mats.


EDIT 2/2015 
I will be leaving this gym, the cardio equipment is constantly breaking down and no one repairs it quickly. Many of the TVs don't work at any given time. 
as you see above since the day I joined 2 of the 4 ellipticals without arms wobble and over the next 3 THREE years they have not fixed them. 
most treadmills don't have a smooth belt
the recline bikes at any given time 1-2 of the 4 don't work 
1 of 2 step machines is constantly breaking down 
the elliptical tracks are NEVER being cleaned inside and 2 of the 4 without arms wobble and shake. 
I would tell someone but they took down their suggestion box a long time ago and the people working there don't look like they care to hear me complain. It's ok I am going to join center of Clayton.

Rachel's Yoga class Wednesday at noon was awesome! I'm just getting back into the swing of things and it was definitely challenging but I was able to keep up with the experienced class. She should get a raise!

A gym renovated back in the early 2000's, including a rock climbing wall, two full basketball courts, a full swimming pool and diving pool, three layers of cardio & exercise machines with views of campus, and the food carts just outside, its hard to beat this gym.  Classes and more available.

The costs aren't that bad, either, equivalent to a New York Sports Club or Bally's, actually. Even cheaper as a student (built into your school fees) or a staff member / alumni (varying discounts).

Gym gets crowded after 4p until close, also busy towards the early mornings. Students fill most of the structure, but there are also rooms you can sign up for classes, or run your own classes or practice dancing, etc.  Many lockers (get a lock).

Free towel service, and basketball games (half court) running a lot (some full court, too).

They sell smoothies, here, too, on the ground floor.
I love the new classes Crunch offers. They're only 30 minutes, but they work you hard!

This is my suburban gym for when I'm visiting family.  I mostly just go for the spin classes, but there is plenty of cardio and weight lifting equipment.  The locker room is nice.  There are separate studios for group exercise and yoga classes.  The staff is very friendly.

Positives:
-Aseptically clean!
-Open 24 hours
-A couple of the yoga instructors are really really good
-Friendly smiling staff (with one or 2 exceptions)

Negatives:
-Snarky front desk guy
-Dana the boring yoga instructor (literally fell asleep by accident in a few of his classes)
-Not enough floor room for mat work-outs
-Jesus does this place get busy between 10am-10pm. I try to only go outside that frame.
-The TVs are always defaulted to the news (like 3 different channels of it), The View, and some assorted sports programs. I find it hard to believe that customers pick these channels... do the employees come up and set these every day? Why not some travel channel, food network, discovery channel, etc? I HATE watching the news.

Second planet fitness I have been to and not only is the staff nicer here but it's not as hot. Mainly due to no skylight windows and also a couple of BigAss fans. I don't know about others but I like the layout better here also. 

Just like most fitness centers they have a bunch of TVs that you can tune in to with your own headphones. Unfortunately none were playing the cubs game so I followed it on my .

The lower temp is definitely a big plus when working out

Hands down Philly's best rock gym. They're doing everything right here -- great problems, spot on rating, color coded routes (such a small thing but so aesthetically pleasing!), sweet tunes, sparkly clean bathrooms, and vibes that make you want to come back for more.
