Not to mention their student rate is affordable (and so appreciated!). Really, truly, thrilled that Philly finally has an excellent Rock gym!

I can't begin to describe how great this place is. From the coaches to the facilities and to the workouts, everyone there cares about your health. I was the guy who was intimidated by working out next to stronger people. NapTown's "You Do You" mantra is preached early on to encourage you to focus on your own fitness. The best part of this place is the sense of community and caring attitudes of the owners as well as your fellow fitness friends. Check it out! You won't regret it!

you know what I love? Hardworking small businesses who work hard to educate and help people. You know what I hate? #1 Yelp removing legitimate reviews from people who may not yelp a lot but are so impressed by a business that they do. #2 People that expect perfection when there isn't such a thing. The people who don't recognize hard work and dedication but prefer to cowardly write bad reviews instead of bringing their complaint to the business its self. #3 Reviewers who think they are paid to scrutinize every aspect of a business they couldn't possibly imaging what it takes to run and run well. I could care less about these long uneducated reviews, I rely on my own experience and I will say once again this is a 
Santa Barbara treasure and You and your kids will be well taken care of here. Believe it! 
 WELL DONE  to the owners and staff of Martial Arts Family Fitness!

I have a membership to Spectrum so I can work out AND take yoga classes, but in the last year, I have gotten to love the classes at SBYC so much that I can't stand gym yoga anymore!! This space is so perfect for yoga--a beautiful building with high ceilings, windows that open, quiet and peaceful. I have never had a bad class there. You can pretty much take any class and be sure that the teacher is going to be awesome. The prices are reasonable for this town, and you save if you buy a series or if you are a student. Believe me, it's worth every penny for the experience and for the improvement you feel in your physical health and mental space through the practice of good quality yoga.

Impressive! Food and service were both exceptional! Jimmy and team were so professional and attentive!
I had the fried tomato appetizer perfectly seasoned and hot to the table! The steak house salad was fresh and enough to share! Filet was out of this world! The creamed spinach was flavorful and the sweet potato mash was deliciously sweet--but not heavy! Creme brûlée to finish off! Yum! I cannot wait to go back!

Forgery and theft, not a good place to workout! Will steal your money and tell you that your on a contract when your not, and when you signed a month to month contract... they'll forge your signature on a different contract saying its a 1 year contract... Sneaky and illegal.... BBB will be getting a call :)

Although the club itself is not up to par on cleanliness, or hi tech machines, this LA FITNESS has a redeeming grace, their classes!  When compared to the neshaminy la fitness this fitness classes here are so much better and more intense! I am in good shape and the classes here definately work you out. The Neshaminy LA fitness's classes with the exception of a few are not great work out and are more for the older person, or beginner.

This gym should be renamed "the Dirty Sock Vault" since that's exactly what it smells like, probably because all the climbing shoes are on the front desk. The stuffiness and poor ventilhation only worsen the odor. But even more annoying is how their specials fail to mention that you need to be an experienced climber to participate. I saw a ladies' night special on their home page and thought that meant I could climb at a discounted rate. But when I got there, an unfriendly man at the desk told me that unless I have 'prior experience' I couldn't participate. That's *probably* something you want to mention on the actual ad, rather than making that info hard to find on another page in your site. He tried to persuade me into paying $50 - and waiting an hour and a half - to take a private course 'so I could learn how to climb and do the special', assumedly at a later date (?). No thanks...

I left and then called the manager, Paul, to explain this and our conversation went as follows. Me: "Do you agree that your website is misleading?" Paul: ..."Yes." Me: "Okay, thanks for wasting my time." Paul: "I'm at a loss as to how to help." Well, Paul, you could promise to improve your ads, but I guess that's too complex...or at least that's what Zach, the other manager, claims to be the case. According to him, 'rock climbing is a complex sport to explain on a website.' Because adding 'not available to beginners' on the actual ad is too complex to understand, I guess? 

Update: After being called six times, I noticed that the gym actually replied to my review but they clearly missed my point. There should be an FAQ page for the specials about who can use them, or just write ON THE AD that it's for advanced climbers. I was busy at work, glanced at the ad on your home page, and thought 'Cool, I'll stop in.' Your site wasn't put together well.

Keeping my same stars, but just wanted to point out some updates.

1. Tony, the owner, read this review and asked if it was one experience that triggered my bad review. I appreciate this and respect his coming to me and wanting to find out how to make his business better.

2. I have think the new trainers are better than the previous ones. I have seen them working with clients to try new and more efficient exercises.

There are still things I'd like to see added or changed, but all-in-all I am there for the convenience factor.

I went yesterday for a eyebrow, bikini, and full leg wax.  I hadn't seen any reviews here for waxing services, so I figured I'd give it a shot.  The room was a little dark, which I didn't think much of at the time.  Amanda was quick, and the situation was painless as it could be.  However, my top half of my legs weren't given much attention - and I was shocked when I was still charged for a full leg wax.  When I got home I realized there were spots that were missed - big ones, like my knees.  I called this morning to see if someone could fix this before I go on vacation tomorrow, and they said none of the waxers were going to be in until after 5.  The receptionist said she would call if someone could take me in.  After not hearing anything for 6 hours, I called again to see the status.  The receptionist said, "The person who did you isn't coming in today, and my manager won't call me back. I can put you with the other woman, but then she's not getting paid for a service she didn't screw up."

If I'm able to get in tonight, I'll revise the review appropriately.  In the meantime, I'm left feeling salty I'll have to shave my legs on vacation - in random spots!

Also - I've been here before for a massage and facial.  I had Mackenzie for the facial, and I loved her.  I don't remember who I had for the massage - and I'm not really a massage person, but I found it to be terrible.

Its a good steak house, but I feel that there's a very limited menu. It is a steak house, so yes there's a variety of steak and sizes, but thats it. Very traditional in style, price is on the high end, but that's expected for any steak house. Service is great, My ribeye was HUGE, and probably should have ordered a smaller one. My wife's filet was perfect. The seasoning is very basic, guessing just salt and pepper so the meal gets boring quick.... Overall a good steak house, just not somewhere I would frequent in New Orleans.

I'm a relatively new member of LA Fitness and have enjoyed my experience at this gym so far. My brother in law is a member here so he signed me up for a two week trial. I had to go in to register and had prepared myself for an awful sales pitch and a long waste of time. To my surprise, I was in and out within fifteen minutes. 

During my trial, LA Fitness emailed me deals that I could take advantage of online, but I eventually signed up in person. The entire process was painless and I am so appreciative of that. 

The main reason I joined this gym was because of the pool. To be honest, the window into the gym is a little creepy, but once you're in the pool it is fine.The pool is standard size and is never too crowded. 

The locker rooms are really nice, there's plenty of space and is equipped with showers and a sauna room. 

LA Fitness will be temporarily closed for two weeks for renovations soon, so I am excited to see what is in store!

I have Pf black card so I get to work out wherever I want and utilize massage chairs and tanning if I desire. I've visited a lot of clubs in my 10+ years of membership. I've visited this club a few times since it opened. Today my visit was while my car gets worked on at AAA across the street.
There are number of positives about this location
- Plenty of parking
- Nicely laid out a equipment
- The massage chairs are located in an area where you can look out over the trees.
- it's clean.
- From what I've seen there is a higher percentage of clientele wiping down the equipment when they're done versus some other clubs.
- It's located in a shopping center with Acme. 
if you needed to do food shopping it's only steps away. 
If your car is in for service at AAA all you have to do is walk across the street. (Caution it's 4 lane Baltimore Pike so take your time to decide when to safely cross)

If there weren't three clubs within 5 miles of my home I would probably work out here more often. But I can safely say you would enjoy your visit here
The Y is currently undergoing renovations but all services are still being offered. I find this impressive because they offer so many classes and even childcare while you workout.

Just moved to Tampa and this is our new home, sorta.  We come everyday and they have everything you could want in a full featured gym!  They staff are the best, and would recommend this place to everyone!!!

I feel like this place was more of a scam mill than a real gym. 90 percent of the people in the classes are newbs doing the challenge leaving what seems to be the other 10 percent as regular members. They are just turning and burning "new clients" every six weeks promising to "change their lives and bodies." A few people do have success with this very extreme, unsustainable lifestyle, while the others, like myself, find the rigidity of the program impossible at best, and downright harmful at worst, and will simply be out 500.00. The workouts themselves are great - you will never do the same work out twice, and you will always leave the class extremely exhausted. But if you don't keep up with at least five HOURS of HIGH INTENSITY work outs every week, and do the Facebook check ins (so ridiculous) and every single weekly weigh in, (or at least that's how it was when I did the program) you are automatically disqualified from getting your dough back. 

I think the workouts themselves are too intense to be done five days a week for any extended period of time for MOST people. The vast majority of people do not need to work out for five, intense hours per week to be healthy and would do just fine with more moderate intensity stuff, with a few high intensity work outs thrown in here and there. The key is to remain active; you don't have to feel like you're dying for an hour a day to see results. With such lengthy, intense work outs with inadequate rest periods, I saw a LOT of people get injuries and, conveniently for Psychosomatic, have to drop out of the plan (and thus be out their 500.00). I have been working out frequently and intensely for the last ten years, doing running, weight lifting, HIIT training, yoga, Pilates, kickboxing, you name it - and never once had an injury until I did Psychosomatic.

The other part of it is, the diet is ridiculous. You are getting very few calories to supplement these work outs - for a while I was eating like 900-1000 calories a day - and you are literally shamed if you deviate from the rigid plan in any way. I remember that in the Facebook group a person proudly posted a picture of their meal of ground turkey and vegetables, and one of the team leaders simply posted as a comment "Are those carrots?????????" Because carrots are not compliant with this diet - if that is not on the fast track to disordered eating I don't know what is. Fat is not compliant with this diet either, which is also extreme. So you can't eat a carrot or an egg yolk, but you CAN eat a highly processed Quest bar with fake sugar in it, and you can eat whey protein powder as well which an extremely processed food - makes sense. I followed this stuff religiously for about four weeks and missed a period, probably because my body was overworked and under-nourished. I would have liked to have joined the gym to take classes here and there, but because I did not complete the challenge I was disqualified. I got one shot, and I was done. I walked away 500.00 poorer with nothing to show for it except for five lost pounds which I immediately gained back when I started following my usual healthy, but sane, diet.

The most annoying part of this place was that members HAD to participate in social media or they could not join the challenge - yes, I am not exaggerating. I personally don't want to spam my friends with what is basically forced free advertising for Psychosomatic (Daily check ins! Posting about my non-scale victories! Who the heck wants to see that crap every day? Embarrassing) so I did what any reasonable person would do (LOL) - make a fake, temporary Facebook account (which is also not allowed). You also had to write a review of the gym after you were done. It's unethical and quite frankly slimy and pathetic of them to force the role of advertising onto their clients. Get over yourselves; can't you do business more respectably and let your clients' results speak for themselves?

My suggestion to Psychosomatic - stop with the scammy "SIX WEEK CHALLENGE!!!" These sorts of extreme things are not sustainable or healthy. Encourage healthy habits that are sustainable and realistic, and allow your clients to think long term. Don't shame them for eating a piece of cake on their birthday. Show them how to eat healthy while still allowing them to live their lives. We aren't runway models trying to get skinny for an upcoming fashion show - we are real people with families, and jobs, and struggles, who just want to be a healthier so we can live long, happy lives and feel good in our skin. I think Psychosomatic should be set up like a regular gym with classes that anyone can sign up for, not just challengers or people who have completed the challenge. Basically, if you don't have the extreme mentality you're kicked out of the club.

Use your brain - they are counting on you to fail so that they can turn a profit. They know darn well that when you fork over that 500.00 bucks you'll never see it again!

I like to work out while watching Jeopardy. It makes my time on the stairmaster go faster. I requested one of the trainers to change the Channel to 6 and he said he didn't know how to do it but would ask Steve. Both said OK, but Steve said he had to ask a young woman with straight blonde hair and glasses if  he could change the channel. Well, she must have been a BEE-ATCH because she said no. Huh? Nobody else was watching the TV stations that were on (I checked) and I thought I was supposed to be a customer. I later ran into the same trainer (who now works  at another LA Fitness Center) and he apologized to me for the incident, saying, "She's a real bee-atch." If you want to be customer-oriented, when someone asks for a channel to be turned on, just do it.

Laid-back,adult,clean,basic gym in good location with easy access and parking.You'll pay almost double over the "chain" gyms,but, for me they're not even an option.Gripes:the pool is tiny,basically useless,unless you take a class.The basketball court(reason I joined)has been taken over by baseball classes on weeknights and weekends-so don't be fooled by the photos of the above on their site.Management is unresponsive.

Yikes where do I begin. I have been an avid lifter since high school and this specific location is really dropping the ball. It's a shame since staff seemed friendly and knowledgeable but was just understaffed for daily cleaning and maintenance on the facility. There locker room has a high school locker room during football season smell to it, that sweaty mildew smell. The week I went here it had the smell three out of four day. So it's not cleaned daily. Other gym members I noticed have no regards to cleaning there sweat off machines after use, I'm not really about getting staff infection. Lack of equipment on the floor for the cable crossover machines and weights do not get put away. Simple disregards.

one thing i love about YMCA is the ability to visit other clubs for free. i am a Y member from greenfield MA and when i come down to PA for business, my first stop is the doylestown Y. great place to shake out the kinks after a five-hour drive.

my experience is limited to the women's locker room, showers, and the big cardio/nautilus/stretching room. 

locker rooms have all the stuff you'd expect--hair dryers, liquid soap in the showers, bags for wet bathing suits, scales, mirrors. lots of private dressing areas. no locks so bring one if you're worried about theft (i'm not). no towels, so pack one.

the big workout room is a greatest hits of fitness room equipment, and it can get very crowded. the machines are tight and when the place fills up, you're gonna smell the guy next to you on the elliptical or the row. treadmills are in the west-facing window so you might be both baked and blinded if you try running there on a late summer afternoon.

mats are provided but stretching space butts up against TRX space and ball work and often, there is simply not sufficient room for everybody to do their thing.

know that if the aerobic rooms are not being used by a class, you can use them to get it done -- stretch, do mat work, whatever. those rooms tend to be cooler and, obviously, quieter. i've retreated to them a few times and it was great having the space to myself after the relative chaos of the big room.

the staff here are super and the mission is admirable. i am grateful my MA membership lets me pop in now and then. for what i need, it's perfect.

This was EXACTLY what I was looking for in a yoga studio. Intimate, earthy digs? Check, A full and varied schedule? Check. They have SUP Yoga, Power flow, meditation and more.  Knowledgeable, nonjudgemental staff? Check!

They have 5$ Fridays, 15$ sessions, and affordable packages that will be worth your money. Where else can you exercise, heal your body, and improve your mind all at the same time? I will be going back often and getting a month pass as soon as I know I can fit it into my schedule once school starts. 

If you want to check this place out, you should! Go on Friday for $5 and sweat your butt off while getting mentally recharged. You can be any shape, size, or skill. No judgements here.

Not the best gym in NOLA. Classes are outdated and not a lot of people go to them. Customer service is not the best and the pole fitness lady that teaches there is a bit rude. Either way it has all the equipment, if you know what to do for a workout you will be fine.

You can change the name of a gym- But if you change nothing else- It's still the same gym. So to me; Get Fit is still Gold's Gym- They are owned by the same people and have the same workers. The only change is a new slap of paint- WOahh! Regardless of the name change- I still love this gym. Most importantly, it's clean. I always see the cleaning crew picking working no matter what time I come in. The Cardio Cinema is the only thing that keeps me sane. A good movie playing in a dark room can double my cardio time! The women's only room is also a big plus since though the general strength area is fully loaded, so are the regulars that inhabit it! Granted this is no LA fitness, and yes some of the machines may be out of order (ps. they have 4 more of the same machine someplace else!) it is still a nice large gym. For $10 a month with a 24 hours gym where I watch movies.... Yes please!

This LA Fitness location is just okay. Lately, I've noticed their customer service has gone downhill. I started coming to this location in 2009 shortly after my local Bally Total Fitness closed.

The machines are old and rusty. They seriously need to update their equipment. A lot of the machines have signs on them that say "scheduled for service" and it takes days for someone to actually fix them. Majority of the time people get off the machines and don't wipe them down, which is so gross. I don't want to work out on a machine that's covered in sweat. 
It gets very crowded between the hours of 4-6pm, as most gyms do, and I've found myself waiting for treadmills and ellipticals when I'm there on weekdays. Saturday and Sunday are their slower days. 

Employees at the front desk are miserable. When you walk up to the desk, you feel like you're inconveniencing them. They're too busy being on their personal cell phones texting. They have the easiest job. All they have to do is stand there and scan people's membership cards. They don't even greet customers. It's a shame.

I was looking for a cheap and decent gym for the longest time in the West End area. Unless you're looking to pay out your butt for a Y membership or another luxury gym, this Planet Fitness will suffice. I signed up for the Black membership and have been satisfied so far with the gym.

They do have 2 chair massagers, 3 hydro massage machines, and a couple tanning rooms. There is also a red light therapy machine which they call their "Total Body Enhancement" machine. I have used the hydro beds which are nice but have yet to try to get bronze yet.

Planet Fitness does not have any racks at all! Forget about barbell bench presses, squats, or deadlifts....unless you can get by doing dumb bell or smith machine versions of those. FYI, the free weights only go up to 75lbs. Oh, watch  out for the "Lunk" alarm in the free weight area. It's a PF staple but I have yet to hear it go off yet.

If you're a body builder, don't sign up. You'll hate it. I'm not a body builder but I do like to lift rather than use the cardio machines. If you just want to do cardio or just a casual gym goer...this is your place. 

Pros:
Large open spaces
Clean and new
11ty million cardio machines

Cons:
Free weights only go up to 75lbs
No racks, only smith machines
11ty million cardio machines

Love this gym ! The staff is great, friendly, and professional. The locker room is clean as is the bathroom and gym equipment. I  feel confident when working out ....not self-conscious at all. 
Oh and after your workout, treat yourself to one of the many delicious and healthy smoothies if you can.
Huge, clean, nice staff. Never a problem to get on a machine.

I agree. 

I downgraded my contract, which already cost me $40, only to find out month later that it had actually been UPgraded to a 24 month membership. I was certainly not informed of that change during the restructuring of my contract, given that I already knew I was moving 3 month later.  Why in the world would I sign that if I knew about it?

In the end, I signed the contract, so it is ultimately my fault. But it is unacceptable to have a sales rep change my membership in such a drastic way without informing me about it. And now it will cost me $150 to break the contract when I move, which the manager noted, was a huge favor.

This gym is the scum of the world, do not go there.
weights are too heavy. maybe we could make the 20 point weights a little lighter. that would help me a lot. also there's no popcorn or corn dogs/ most gyms have AT LEAST corn dogs.

Been going to this location for a while now and usually have a good experience.  Today was not the day hence the 4 not 5 star review.  Last year I had the premium membership and I think I used the massage tables twice and never the classes.  This year I dropped to the basic membership until I can really get into it.  Found out this time that they have a fitness evaluation and me being a big boy need all the help I can get.  I signed up for a session and my roommate had one as well.   I took the later evaluation since my time is more flexible.  I showed up early and checked in told the guy at the desk I was here for my 630 and I was a good 15 mins early, figured time to warm up.  About 625 saw the trainer looking around and figured this was my time, nope he had another person he was working with, so I walked away because I know that this was still the other persons time.  I can wait.  About 645 I went looking for what was going on.  It appears that he was still with the other person and got behind.  I get that but he didn't have the courtesy to say anything to me.  So my next evaluation is in 2 weeks because that is what is available.  I wonder if that one will be booked too.***UPDATE*** Dropped from a 4 to a 2 star for getting caught. The fitness manager called to see what the issue was and to see about how to handle my complaint.  She offered to see me at Thursday at 4pm...Ok but my roommate had her evaluation Thursday at 430pm, they were going to call her and ask her to come in later so they could get me in at 4.  Funny thing was that they had yet to say anything to her first.  That was not the right move.  She was not happy! And the Manager got caught.  She offered another time but when I said "Wait I was told you are booked for the week" She just said I will have my other clients move to take care of you.  No thanks I don't want that, so now I am at Platinum Fitness.

Super fun!  This place is often packed with sweaty dancing fools who want to get their calorie burn on while having a lot of fun.  The class prices are absurdly reasonable and there are multiple sessions per day.  There are folks of all shapes, sizes and abilities, so you don't have to worry about looking dumb or not catching on- the instructors will just encourage you to do what you can.  It's pretty much just a Zumba place, not a gym, so don't go expecting to shower afterwards or anything. Enjoy!

Pros....super close to home and they don't harass you about anything. 

Manager Dawn is very friendly, helpful and attentive. Answers questions without hovering, which I love in a gym. If she leaves, I will also be leaving. 

Cons....the air is like never on, seems very warm when working out. Some equipment seems like it's breaking. I do feel ripped off paying 20, when planet is WAY nicer for 10 a month. 

I only come here because it's close to home. Otherwise, I would stay at planet fitness.
Went here while we were in town for my bachelorette party.  Similar setup as Orange Theory, you'll leave sweating for sure.  High end gym with a smoothie bar and fully stocked bathroom.
